Pros:  Comfy bedding, big kitchen with microwave, stove, and fridge  Awesome patio area; private and soothing   Free parking and wifi, along with free breakfast   Excellent location (across road from bank, grocery store, laundromat, and 24 hr convenience store)  Cheap Lyft or Uber ride to Disneyland ($8 each way)   Nice and polite staff   Cons: Wifi was spotty at night   Fruit flies in room (from patio?)   Parking lot repaved during my stay; made Lyft pick ups tough (one driver went to front lot, one to back, one to side street, etc).   Noisy; this place has thin walls so you hear kids running and house keeping cleaning about early in the morning!   All in all, good for price, about a 3 star
Manager Response: Thanks so much for helpful feedback. We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay and the location of our hotel. Thank you so much for your patience during our parking lot updates. We will use all of your suggestions to better our hotel.

Summary Heading: Great location if you have transport
Summary: We stayed at hotel pepper tree for eight nights and was a really great hotel and good value. It is located close to freeway on ramps so as long as you have a rental car or other transport arrangements it is a perfect spot. They also give good discounted ticket prices for both Disneyland and Disney's California adventure theme parks as long as you intend to visit both parks. All staff I dealt with were more than happy to accommodate any request we made. Highly recommend.

My daughters and I along with my in-laws stayed at the Hotel Pepper Tree this past week for three nights. I chose the hotel based on the full kitchen and the landscape. We had a courtyard room and enjoyed sitting in it each morning. The fountain wasn't running so I asked the front desk employee to turn it on.  They did and it was nice to listen to the water running overnight. The next morning I noticed that the fountain was not draining so I found a maintenance person and showed him the situation. He turned off the fountain and said he would look at it later in the day. When we returned that night the fountain was off but not fixed. I didn't pursue it any further. My in-laws has a room across the hall from a family with dogs. They left them alone at times and the dogs barked. My

The bed was really nice and comfortable. The breakfast could be better. Very well located to visit theme parks at this area. It is a very quiet area, perfect for resting. Some restaurants close to this area

My boyfriend & I stayed here 4 nights for our Disney vacation. The room was very spacious and it was great having a kitchen in room! I would definitely stay here again. Hotel is located about 10 or so minutes from Disney. All around it was a great stay!

I truly enjoyed my stay at Hotel Pepper Tree! The front desk staff was very polite and courteous! They got us checked in and into our rooks in less than 15 min! There was some construction going on so the parking was limited during the day and the pool and grill area was inaccessible because of this. However, I would definitely visit Hotel Pepper Tree n the future and would Highly recommend to friends!

The rooms were full of bugs when we checked in and it was rather uncomforting. We didn't even go out on our patio so as to not bring in anymore bugs into our room. For the price I paid I expected more cleanliness.
Manager Response: We are so sorry for the issue you experienced. We do hope that you talked with the front desk staff immediately so that we could address the issue during your stay. Since we do have the garden patios and fountains, bugs may enter the rooms. We will look into your room immediately to make sure everything is meeting our standards. Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.

Summary: The room was in horrible condition and was very dirty. Felt disgusting after sleeping in the bed. Towels had stains on them. Flies were in the room. The overall condition of the room was terrible. I definitely will not be staying here again.
Manager Response: We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations and that you did not receive our best service. Most of our guests find our rooms extremely clean, but we will make sure to inspect your room immediately. We do hope that you talked with our management team during your stay.

Summary: You need a car to make the most of the area. Very limited restaurant choices close by that you can walk to, though if eating in, the grocery store across the road has a good selection. Rooms a good size, but needed a desk.

For the price this is a great hotel. My only concern was the smell of the room and the pillows were extremely uncomfortable. I ended up getting a candle to help cover the smell. The bed mattress was average but the pillows were extremely flat.
Manager Response: Thank you for your helpful feedback. We are looking into your room immediately. We hope you contacted the front desk so we could switch out your pillows. All of our rooms include both feather pillows and cotton pillows. We do hope you come back again to visit us.

Summary: Great location and staff were very helpful. Easy to access Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm and shopping outlets. Breakfast was reasonable, pool was great. Was good value for money and we had an enjoyable stay
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed you stay! Thanks for the great review.

Summary: My husband and I were looking for a homey place to spend our 3 year anniversary for the weekend. This was the perfect place! Located right in the center of everything. I was excited to see that my room was exactly the same as the pictures online. It was clean, cozy, and stayed true to it's theme. The king size bed was made and pillows were nice. Couch was perfect and the tv gave us something to do wen we had down time. Bathroom was spotless and I liked the shower. The only issues I had was the sliding door to our patio was hard to open and close (like it was stuck in place). Which was a bummer since we had the ground floor and the patio was a perfect place for coffee and tea for the morning.  The internet was good at first but for some reason wasn't working the last day we
Manager Response: Thank for you spending your anniversary with us! We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay. We will make sure to have maintenance look at the patio door immediately.

Summary: This place thought of everything. The kitchenette was equipped with pots, pans, dishes, silverware, toaster, full stove, microwave and fridge. The beds were super comfy and the staff was very helpful and courteous. I would feel very comfortable staying here with my family again.

Not perfect and shiny and new, but a lot of character in the decor. Staff was friendly and helpful. Nothing gross, no bedbugs. Would have been about perfect if the continental breakfast wasn't so lacking. Nice fusion restaurant nearby and a gas station to get coffee from.

Perfect location near the beach and theme parks, full kitchen, and great service! We will definitely be returning to this hotel. We were able to avoid disneyland traffic and visit the downtown L.A. and newport areas with ease.

Summary Heading: Not worth more then $125.00 per night, any night, with tax and $5.00 resort fee.
Summary: Customer Service was great, except for check-out, which took over 45 minutes. Room was good. Bathroom was small and shower/bathtub drained slowly. The bathroom did have narrow hallway/dressing area leading to it, with large closet, and amenities were good. Kitchen was good, but cooking supplies were horrible. Oven only worked on broil and yes I tried to get it fixed, but gave up, after forth attempt. Balcony could not be enjoyed, due to construction, right below mine, which was never mentioned, when I booked room. Breakfast was poor. Sunny Delight, boxed donuts, cake?, occasionally mini bagels and danishes, warm milk for your stale cereal, horrible condiments, etc. All which were poorly stocked. Took over five minutes at times, to get someone to clean table to eat at.

Amazing place to stay! Perfect for a family wanting a wonderful place to stay without the high price of other chain hotels. Free breakfast was good. It could have had some sort of meat available. Nonetheless, Hotel Pepper Tree is where my family and I will stay every time we visit the area in the future.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel and very nice staff
Summary: The staff takes pride in the hotel and are all very nice. The room was very clean and the kitchen was good size. I like how they had everything that I needed to cook with. I also didn't mind that they were doing construction because it wasn't loud and I was still able to sleep in and relax.

Loved the staff and the quality of the room. Was very quiet and comfortable , appreciated the accessories that came with the room like the living room set and. BAck patio  furniture . By far for the price of the room is the best hotel I ever been too.

This is a gem of a find.  I will definitely stay here again when I am in the area.  Quiet, good price, property is in excellent condition ...and the staff is really nice.   It is right between Disney and Knott's Berry Farm and just a few steps from Dad Miller Golf, the HS course for TIger Wood's:)

Terrible, stay anywhere else, no good. Customer service was non  existent. Wifi,......??? What wifi????Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere even a la quinta or comparable would be superb instead of staying here.
Manager Response: We are so sorry that we did not meet your expectations. We did have some issues with the WiFi during your stay but have since fixed our service throughout the hotel. Since we usually receive great comments regarding our customer service, we will make sure our front desk manager addresses your feedback with our staff.

Summary: this hotel was awesome! very cute! the staff was very accommodating and the stay was very nice would stay here again. wish the security deposit was less then $200. that would be even better. my family and i came to go to disneyland so that was hard to come up with but they accommodated as best they could and it worked out!

The front desk customer service was great.  The room is very outdated and old looking.  The popcorn ceiling needs to go!  The kitchen, bathrooms, floors, sofa coverings, and bed needs to be replaced as they looked REALLY OLD.  If this hotel received some sort of remodeling for the rooms, it would look SPECTACULAR.  It has a lot of potential.  The balcony was great with seating area.  The continental breakfast was something that we SKIPPED...it didn't look good.  In fact, we were the first people to walk in the restaurant next door and the first to walk out.  Others walked in after us and they immediately followed us out.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel. We are happy that you enjoyed our boutique charm and private balconies, but we are sorry that we did not meet your expectations in other ares of the hotel. We appreciate your helpful feedback and will use them to better our property and rooms. We are in the process of making upgrades throughout the hotel including beds, kitchens, bathrooms, etc. We hope you do come again to see the changes we are making.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for.
Summary: Compared to prices of other 'disney' hotels, this was great but we had a few disappointments along the way. In saying that, we understand it was never meant to be 5 star. Kids loved the pool and hotel lobby and furnishings were lovely as expected. Our disappointments were as follows... 5th bed and crockery not in room as ordered. Previous tenants toiletries left in bathroom and not properly cleaned. Noisy hallways and refrigerator. Poor kitchen utensils, pans and crockery. Bath plug broken. Breakfast is only edible if you don't mind eating just sugar!! Even after all this we still managed to enjoy our stay, mostly because it was reasonably priced and kids loved the pool.

Our stay was pleasant and nice.  The rooms are clean.  The rooms are spacious with the kitchen area available making home cook foods. The front desk attendants were courteous and helpful.  The rooms we have nice patios that you enjoy the California weather.

My partner and I were in desperate need of a place to get away from our professional and family lives. But, we were not looking to go out. We just wanted to be together and lounge in our room. Which required us to at least have a working kitchen and refrigerator that is big enough to hold a gallon of milk. Needless to say, this hotel provides it!!! Working stove/oven, average house size fridge with freezer, cabinets that are filled with dishes enough for two people, and utensils enough for two people. The rustic theme was really aesthetic and appreciated and we loved the view we had. There was a couple of hiccups in our stay like our dishes had some spots (weren't washed correctly) and some dishes were a little musty... maybe its because of the decor they had a funky smell, but

I called three times before booking to ask questions about the hotel and the area. I was never told the pool was broken and the parking lot under construction. I found out about the pool when we arrived and it was a huge disappointmentment. My kids were looking forward to a hotel with a pool. The parking lot was another inconvenience. Also the closet was full of dust and I had to clean it before putting our clothes in there.
Manager Response: We do apologize for the inconvenience of our upgrades during your stay. Because of the rainy weather we have been experiencing this winter, it has been hard to plan in advance for the outdoor maintenance and pool upgrades. Since you booked your reservation on the same day, we did not have had time to notify you prior to your arrival. We hope that you were able to talk with our general manager during your stay about these issues so we could help resolve them. We greatly appreciate your feedback/comments and will use them to better our hotel and guest communication.

Summary: The service and price was not bad.. however the inside of the room seemed old.. the bedding was old as well.. the kitchen cupboards did not close all the way and my biggest complaint is that the house keeping staff came and clean our room but left the dishes not washed..

No children channels cost was expensive for service breakfast in some restraunt outside building I won't be returning due to cost breakfast bathroom had granite but you can barely even touch knob to flush toilet due to overhang.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations during your stay. We do offer several children's TV channels including the Disney Channel. Our continental breakfast is located to the restaurant on property. Thank you again for offering your feedback. We will use it to better our hotel.

Summary: The day before we arrived they informed us the pool would be closed and the parking lot would be under construction. Construction noise all day and no pool to relax in. Ada room has no ada shower. Kitchen not qell stocked.
Manager Response: We apologize for the inconvenience of our updates during your stay. We appreciate your helpful feedback and will make sure our management team addresses your concerns.

Summary: Very relaxing environment great little get  away. Room service was great the front desk well they were ok nothing exciting I think they could have been a little more helpful overall it was a good stay .

I liked everything about the hotel except the breakfast.  I'm not a big fan of continental breakfast but most of the ones usually have waffles but you can make. They had nothing hot but toast. You could purchase hot breakfast if you wanted.  I just wish it would've told me on Booking.com it was continental breakfast, I probably would have stayed somewhere else.

Our rooms had a home feeling! Hot water, full kitchens, very good price. We had 3 rooms and all 3 rooms were very nice and clean. One room had a clogged toilet and a staff member came within 5 mins and fixed the problem. Staff was very friendly. Yes, I would recommend this hotel to a friend.

I booked this hotel because I saw pictures and descriptions of upgrades since we last stayed here. We have a daughter now so because I saw an upgraded kitchen I was excited. Check in was bad I know it can get busy with calls so they should have 2 people one for check in and one to answer phones and help check in if needed. The room.. only upgrade was how the bed was made. The kitchen still out dated and furniture looked like it had not seen a rag in ages. I had always like the mirrored doors before the bathroom and the extra storage. The balcony door was not aligned on the track so we had to fix it ourselves and cold air still was coming through. where are the upgrades I saw online. Also there was construction going on to repair their parking lot. The free breakfast ? Um unless

The Hotel Pepper Tree is a great value. It is beautifully decorated and tremendously charming.The suites are spacious clean and comfortable. It was the perfect choice for our week long stay and we cannot wait to come back!

This was our second time staying here. Even though it's a few miles away from Disneyland you can't beat free parking, free continental breakfast and free Wifi. Rooms are spacious and very clean. We will be returning again.

Excellent place to stay for Disney; super clean, really nice.  I would definitely stay here again.  The room was spacious, the kitchen was a little small but had everything I needed.  The location was quiet.

Quaint hotel with Spanish influence. BBQ by the pool was missing it's lid which makes for slower cooking because the heat isn't contained. It doesn't appear to have a sustainability or environmental awareness as partially used soaps were removed daily from the bathroom and towels replaced regardless of if hung on hooks. The kitchen had limited ware and could benefit from having a dish cloth and 2 towels for drying hands. The fountain on the patio seemed to inconsistently flow/stop and probably needs maintenance. Overall it's good value for money.

This hotel was overall FANTASTIC! The kitchen was cozy and had all the supplies we needed. The location was great for theme parks with a VERY Short drive to Knott's Berry Farm. I love the Spanish themed decor. The front desk staff was very friendly.  The only MINOR issues we encountered was trying to get the room cool enough and the beds were a little too firm. We will definitely stay here again!

Had everything we needed, except for a baking sheet. Great location! Easy to find stores and restaurants.  Short drive to Disneyland and local vibes. The Spanish theme was cute and we will definitely be back to try a first floor level suite!

I was not feeling well, I rested and sleep for hours very peaceful. I love that we can use the BBQ grill food was delicious.  I love the room and kitchen! they are newly remodel.  we also love the store across the street from the hotel.   Thank you!

Summary Heading: Good Hotel but need some improvements
Summary: Improvements - When guest carry lot of luggage please help them in carrying their luggage to their room. I didn't got any help, I have to get trolley myself, put luggage on it. Same happened during checkout.

This is the most unclean hotel in which I have ever stayed. The curtains do not seem to have seen any water at all. I did not feel like using the kitchen, there was dust all over the drawers and vessels. The appliances and interiors are very old including the bed, bedsheets and bedspread. Bathrooms are very narrow and the closet too was full of dust. All in all, it was a total let down for the money we paid. In one of the reviews, the hotel staff have mentioned that there is an ART shuttle one block away from the hotel to DisneyLand. However, the ART shuttle stop is 10mins walk from the hotel and they have a drop to Knotts Berry farm first and then to Disneyland. Hence driving to Disney or taking a cab/uber is advisable. I will never go back to Pepper Tree again. Breakfast was
Manager Response: We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations. We will check your room immediately for the issues that you mentioned. Most of our guests are very satisfied with the cleanliness of our rooms. We are in the process of making upgrades throughout the hotel includes all of our curtains. The ART is located just one block from the Hotel, but we do say that the fastest method to Disneyland is driving yourself. We again our sorry that you did not enjoy your stay and wish you would have notified us of your issues during your stay.

Summary: The room was fine, although the carpeting and the curtains could use some replacing. Everything else room wise was good. The kitchen was nice. The awful part was the wifi. It wouldn't even connect with some of my devices at times, and when it did it was terribly slow and spotty, despite the wifi showing a strong signal.   The front desk staff were always friendly.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. We did have some WiFi issues during your stay but have sense made the needed repairs. We are making upgrades throughout the hotel including our curtains this month. We do hope that you come again to see the updates.

Summary: Very comfy rooms. Restaurants and stores nearby... convenient to Disneyland. Free breakfast. Clean and spacious rooms. I would definitely go back. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Not as much parking but not a big deal. Overall everything was great.

When we stayed there, I thought the Pepper Tree was fine.  But we checked in so late and left early for Disney, so we didn't really see much other than the room, the front desk and the continental breakfast.  But I guess we left a little TOO early, as I discovered several days late that my daughter was missing her beloved UGG boots.  From the airport, I called the hotel, spoke to Taylor, and when my plane landed there was a message saying that my daughter's boots had been found.  The next day arrangements were made, and my daughter got her shoes back soon afterwards.    Taylor was great to deal with, and I would definitely stay there again.  She went above and beyond to make sure that we were taken care of, and it means a lot to my family.

My sweetheart and I really enjoyed our stay. Next time we'll stay the whole weekend! The bed was so comfy and the room was clean and had a private patio. It's a great place to escape and relax, and there's shopping, and a movie theatre near by.

This hotel needs updating.  The kitchen and baths have old cabinets and even older paint.  There are very few outlets for customers convenience, no ice and kitchen utensils are skimpy. The actual hotel did not appear as nice as the pictures on their websit
Manager Response: We are sorry that we did not quite meet your expectations. We are continuously making upgrades throughout our hotel and will use your comments to better our rooms. We are thankful for your helpful feedback and hope you will return to see our updates.

Summary: Good location for family visit.  Continental breakfast was so so.  We bought our own fruit for cereal and our own bagels.  The 'sweets and bagels' were not great.   Beds were great, glad we didn't need air or heat because it would have blown right down on us.  Room and bath was clean but could have been cleaner. Towels were adequate but thin.  Not sure I'd stay there again.

Everything was good for family of four, front desk very helpful and friendly. The room was spacious and  very clean , same as the beds, very comfortable.. Kitchen also clean and mostly with everything to prepare  a good meal. All convenience stores were close for all our needs. Breakfast was good but needs to improve in variety.

Our room was large, comfortably furnished, and had full kitchen.  We enjoyed our third floor balcony view.  The hotel had a nice looking pool, but the weather was a little cool while we were there.  We paid the extra to upgrade our continental breakfast to omlets, hash browns, horchata, and coffee--all of which were very good.  The large, modern Latino grocery store across the street was an interesting place that included a Mexican bakery.

Great location for Disneyland not walking distance but easy to get to. Great rooms very clean, friendly staff, spacious rooms, a lot of parking. Our whole experience made our Disneyland trip amazing the rooms made us feel like we were at home.

I liked everything about this hotel except the wifi sucked and the house keeping carts are so noisey. It sounds like someone throwing a metal cart down metal stairs. But besides those two things everything was cool! Bring some ear plugs 😂

This quaint hotel was very clean and secure.  The staff was very nice and helpful.  It was located just 10 minites from down town Anaheim.  Driving in this area was very easy.  Well marked streets.   The cost for a king bed and kitchen was very fairl.  Would absolutely stay again!

Summary Heading: Frequent Trips to Anaheim allow us to explore new hotels.
Summary: We frequent southern California about every 3-4 months and we find it rather difficult to find a decent hotel in the Anaheim area that is clean, comfortable and most of all affordable! This hotel had all of the above and we will definitely be staying here multiple times in the future. The front desk staff immediately hit it off with a very professional attitude and a willingness to ensure a pleasant stay. The rooms were very clean and beds were comfortable. AC/Heater was up to date and all amenities seemed taken care of or newer. I literally only had two gripes. The seals around the windows and doors were either non existent or very worn which allowed for air and light to escape easily. Anybody walking by was heard without any problem. And the breakfast was a small bite with

Was quite pleasantly surprised to find this hotel in this area.  I wanted a place to host a pre-event gathering to enjoy some appetizers and wine.  My guests were really impressed with hotel and the accommodations.  I really liked the look, I felt like I was in a Mexican Villa. The furnishings were simple and matched the whole look.  Loved the patio and fountain, the King size bed was very comfortable and most of all really liked the fact that room came with a kitchenette it came in very handy to do prep for the gathering.  I will definitely recommend this place.  The only issues I had was with the WIFI, I wanted to play some background music but it kept stopping and all I'd was the spinning circle.  Another concern was the breakfast, would be great if they could add oatmeal

We only stayed here for a night so we didn't have to drive home 2 hours after monster jam, but it was awesome! Super comfy bed, which is a plus for me and every room has a private balcony which we thought was awesome! We will totally stay here again.

Stayed here for a hockey tournament in Anaheim/Yorba Linda. The hotel was nice, the room was spacious but oddly layed out. The people at the front desk and cleaning crew were very very nice and helpful. Overall I was impressed, but I felt the price a little high.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with kids
Summary: I took my son to Disneyland 2 weeks ago, and we stayed here because of the kitchen and patio. The place was as cute as the pictures. I was happy with the kitchen-fully stocked. Front desk was very friendly.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! So happy that you enjoyed the full kitchen and boutique charm.

Summary: me and my wife come to the anahiem area a few times a year.  almost always stay here, the staff is always very helpful, the beds are comfy and clean, and if we choose to hit up a theme park we are right around the corner without being overcharged.

I really enjoyed my stay at the hotel. I loved that there was a kitchen in the room. It was a nice like a studio apartment. I will be staying here next time I'm in Anaheim!!! I was happy with the service I received.

Everyone we met at the hotel was wonderful.  Front desk employees were very nice and helpful.  The housekeeping was good.  I was disappointed in the breakfast, we were there for 8 days and I am pretty sure the fruit was also.  I did enjoy the fact that it was always nice and mellow in the evening.  Over all a nice stay.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the helpful feedback. So glad you enjoyed the hotel and staff. We are working on some changes to our continental breakfast. We hope you come back soon to them.

Summary: The Hotel Pepper Tree provides large clean suites with a kitchen that includes a stove top.  Rooms are clean, the TV is good and the beds comfortable.  The hotel is very attractive with tile, southwest art and pretty plants.  Breakfast is across the parking lot at a small restaurant.  It includes small donuts and pasties, yogurt, fruit, "juice" but no hot items.  You're better off picking up some food at the grocery across the street.  Traffic can be a little loud for me.  It's my place to stay when I'm in the area.
Manager Response: So glad that we are your top choice in Anaheim. Thanks for the helpful cmoments. We will use them to better our hotel.

Summary: I really enjoyed the vintage/Spanish style of the interior of the hotel.  room had plenty of space with a cute kitchen. bathroom design was nice and mirrors for everyone to use. definitely would go back.

Summary Heading: Loved it the first time and every time since.
Summary: Love the place clean and close to Disneyland. Room has everything that you would need for an extended stay in Anaheim. Target and Walmart are close bye. Easy freeway access. Staff is very friendly and always willing to help with suggestions for things to do around town.
Manager Response: We love to hear from our repeat guests! Thanks for being so loyal and the helpful feedback. Come back soon!

Summary: We spent 7 nights while in town. It was nice to have a kitchenette, although we only used the fridge and dishes. The room was nice, although the place is older, ample room and loved the balcony, only problem was the people below us were smoking..so we couldn't have the door open very much. Bed was comfortable, except for the pillows were too soft. The lighting in the bathroom area was really bad, and the fan didn't work well, so everything steamed up when we took a shower, and didn't clear up easily. Due to the lighting, it was really hard to put my makeup on correctly. My biggest disappointment was the continental breakfast, which wasn't more than a lot of carbs with doughnuts, toast, bagels, and some cereal. We only went the first day there, and ended up ordering off the hot
Manager Response: Thanks for your thoughtful and helpful feedback. We are sorry for the inconvenience of the other guests smoking. We will soon become a smoke-free hotel and prohibit smoking on all the patios and balconies. We will look into the issues you experience in your bathroom immediately. We are working on some major changes to our continental breakfast and will use your suggestions.

Summary: Really loved the decor and space in this hotel, the rooms are great, spacious and traditional decor - so that adds to the experience. It's very clean and the staff are lovely, easy going about late checkouts too. It's an $8-12 Uber ride to Disneyland. The breakfast isn't bad, I thought it was so-so but my partner thought it was great - but hey for what you pay for the hotel and considering it's free, it gets a thumbs up from me.

We stayed here for two nights and had a nice room with a comfortable bed and lovely bathroom and kitchen. There is a supermarket opposite and lots of restaurants nearby, which is convenient.  Unfortunately the front desk staff were not very helpful; we wanted to pay with a pre paid credit card (not as a security, to actually pay the bill) so we could save on international card fees. The front desk staff didn't listen and kept saying these weren't accepted, which I'm not sure is correct as we've paid with that card (Mastercard) everywhere else! The point isn't the fees, it's that the staff weren't really paying attention to what we were saying.  The wifi is not good, and breakfast is pretty bad. For the price, in my opinion it's not worth it.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the helpful feedback. We are so happy that you enjoyed the hotel and are so sorry for poor interaction you had with the front desk. We pride our self in our customer service and will make sure to use your comments to improve our staff.

Summary: great location ! It was in the middle of disneyland and all the places we wanted to eat. Very great service. And the room was nice and clean. Loved my stay there and would dedinetly come and stay here again when i come back to disney !

The room was larger than expected.  The patio area would have been nice, had the weather been cooperating, to make the room feel even larger.  The décor feels older and out of date, but the space more than made up for that.

Going to Anaheim multiple times a year we went threw alot of different  hotels. Well Hotel Pepper Tree changed all that. We love this Hotel and share our find with everyone  heading to the area. Thank you  all for the kindness and service. We love this Hotel.

Summary Heading: Good hotel especially for the family
Summary: In general, I recommend it. It has kitchen and the room is spacious, clean and nice. However, the breakfast is very simple as other people mentioned it in other review ... just white bread, a couple of pastries, cereals, coffee and orange juice, no egg or sausage/bacon. I still give them five stars as I don't think breakfast is a big deal but if they can improve. It will be awesome :-)

Great value for a spot with a kitchen not too far from Disneyland.  Neighborhood isn't the best but hey, it is Anaheim.  The front desk staff is always really pleasant to deal with.  The more updated rooms are clean, not fancy and get the job done.  We prefer a kitchen so we can save on meals vs. purchasing them at the park.  Do not plan your breakfast around their continental meal, it is old cereal, mini donuts, bagel, fruit, orange juice and coffee.  If you're a real light eater it might be good for you but for my family about to charge the Disneyland park its not enough to rely on.

Summary Heading: Very disappointed. Disturbing noises throughout our stay,  staff was not accommodating
Summary: Pros: Stove and fridge were in good condition. The balcony was convenient. T.V. quality was good. A/C was good. The interior is unique, we like the feeling of being in a home from home. Decent price for having a kitchen.  Cons: The wall and floor material are extremely thin and sensitive. You can feel and hear noise coming from all corners of the room. During the day we didn't mind, but past midnight it became very annoying and uncomfortable. When we were trying to watch T.V., my girlfriend and I kept having to turn and look around the room because it literally felt like people were walking around inside our room!  I had to get up countless times to make sure no one else was inside our room. In addition to that we kept hearing random thuds throughout the night. It sounded like
Manager Response: Thank for taking the time to review our hotel. We are happy the you enjoyed the full kitchen and private balcony. We are sorry for the noise issues you experienced. We are trying to figure out what was causing the noises in your room. Our housekeeping staff did not enter your room. We believe that your door was open slightly and the door shut when the housekeeping staff was cleaning the adjacent room. We would never walk into a room without knocking. We again are happy that you enjoyed our boutique charm and our sorry that you will not be back.

Summary Heading: Great staff, outdated room, very bad continental breakfast
Summary: Overall we really enjoyed our stay but would ask for a room in the renovated section next time. Our room was very dated, old appliances in kitchen, but clean, and staff were all wonderful. The continental breakfast provided was very poor and we only went down twice in our 8 day stay. We really enjoyed the quiet, residential neighborhood setting and that really makes up for any disappointments. I would recommend to freinds as long as they could get a renovated room and understood that the breakfast was not worth evening trying.

Hotel Peppertree is the only place I will stay when going to Disneyland. For the price, you can't get better. Full kitchen?! Are you kidding me! Amazing! The staff is ALWAYS friendly and willing to help in any way possible.

I found this place last minute before our trip. Front desk was extremely helpful and nice. Housekeeping need to pay attention to restocking room. Maint needs to make sure lights work and bulbs are good.

Stayed 12 nights from 17th January  so we were there when the 5 year drought broke. Easy place to find, near freeways for LAX, LA, very good parking. Staff were helpful and friendly.  Our room was large, lots of storage, lovely big balcony  and very quiet.  We tried the "free" breakfast and even paid next day but it was hopeless.  Much better off going to Subway or cooking your own.   The full kitchen was good may pay to take your own teaspoons.  Lots of eating places within 10 minute drive.  There is a Mexican supermarket across Lincoln,  Ralphs and Aldi are fairly close by.  Good location for Disneyland and knotts Berry Farm.  Good shopping at . Buena Park Downtown  and The Outlets at Orange.  Only grumble was our bathroom had a very strong damp smell.   Never tried the

Summary Heading: good with some concerns-- check bugs!
Summary: Customer service, especially at the front desk, was excellent-- very friendly and helpful. My primary complaint pertains to waking up after a good night's sleep, only to note that there was a dead tick and two small bugs crawling around by my head. I didn't receive any bites, however-- a good sign! So it's helpful that pets are allowed, though hopefully pest free.Also, it would be helpful if the toilet is cleaned every once in awhile-- there is a ring which marks the water line.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with family
Summary: Great location, close to Huntington Beach and Disney. We had a great time there with our family. Wifi wasn't working that well. The swimming pool was very clean. The room is comfortable and big. Overall great to stay,

Had a great experience at this hotel room was clean beds were comfortable at all the amenities we needed kids had a good time swimming close to everything we wanted to do and the staff was great  would  stay here again
Manager Response: So happy that you will be back! Thanks for the great review.

Summary: The location of the hotel is very good, the place is quiet and very nice people serving you in the hotel itself. The pool area looks very nice even though I didn't actually use it.  WiFi must be improved and the cleaning level has some place for improvement too.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your thoughtful and helpful feedback.  So glad you enjoyed the staff and location of the hotel. We will look into the WiFi signal from your room and make sure our housekeeping team sees your comments. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: This hotel was wonderful for many reasons. It was across the street from a grocery store making cooking in my kitchen easy and convenient. The hotel was clean and well taken care of, large rooms with a comfortable bed, staff were friendly and very helpful. Overall, a great place and great value for my money. Thank you for everything!

Summary Heading: Last stop on our world tour
Summary: We had a great stay at Hotel Pepper Tree. The staff were lovely and very helpful, especially when they looked after our luggage until we were to head to the airport on our last day. Our room was huge and we loved having a kitchen in our room. The facilities were excellent, our only issue was that we would bump the stove and turn on the gas when we tried to open the fridge. The continental breakfast  exceeded our expectations. The Hotel was close to the bus, supermarkets and other food outlets. To improve the service they could have a shuttle going to and from Disneyland and have a laundry service for guests to use.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the great review! So happy that you enjoyed your stay. We appreciate your helpful comments and feedback.

Summary: Room was spacious and clean.  The kitchen was great and the pool was nice.  The staff was friendly as well.  The drive to Disneyland was fast and easy and the hotel's free parking helped our vacation budget..

I was a little worried at booking but when we got there we were so pleasantly surprised. Boutique hotel to these guys means, personal customer service! Very hard to find and much appreciated! The hotel itself was very clean and charming! We used the pool and the BBQ for two days out of our stay and it was immaculate! Our room was great- comfortable and clean with lots of space and storage for a family of five. The large deck is a must with kitchen suites, so we loved that they had this. Overall it was a good experience for the value. We would return!

The only issue i had was 2 out of the 3 nights-when we returned to the hotel-it smelled of marijuana very badly in the halls. But everything else was great!! The room was comfortable and very spacious. Location was convenient for what we needed
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the feedback. We are so glad you enjoyed our rooms and the location of our hotel. We hope that you contacted the front desk about the smoke issue so we could address it immediately. We have a very strict non-smoking policy throughout the hotel for the comfort of all our guests. We do hope you come back again soon.

Summary: Nice place. Bad service. I planned to get my Disneyland tickets $15 off each as advertised. When I arrived I found out that is u didn't purchase of peppertree's website. you are not eligible to get the discount. The free breakfast is some free small bite size donuts and some chopped up fruit. I passed.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to review our hotel. We are sorry for the confusion you had about our Disneyland Ticket deal. We do state that it is only eligible for guests who book their room directly with our hotel but will make sure our front desk is communicating this best way possible to all our guests.

Summary: The front desk employees were very friendly and helpful. The room was nice and large. Plenty of space and the kitchen area and items provided was great. The bathroom could have been cleaner as I did find a couple of long hairs in the shower and on the wall.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the review. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay. We will make sure our housekeeping staff sees your comments immediately - we apologize that you did receive our best service. We do hope you come again soon!

Summary: Lovely little hotel with great location and beautiful rooms. The kitchenette is set up for a quick meal...never used tough, their continental breakfast great, staff was helpful. Enjoyed every bit of the hotel...even in January the kids jumped in the pool! I highly recommend this hotel for anyone going to Anaheim and the parks!

Love how its close to Disney. Love being greeted by the water fountains when you first walk in and then greeted with Great Customer Service. It has a very comfortable feel to it. It is a home away from home.

always a nice place to stay , are kids remember the goldfish in water fountain out front of hotel , the rooms are big , front desk staff is always helpful ,good memories for are trips to Disney land ,

We loved the Spanish hacienda decor, and the room was like a cute apartment. We cooked all our meals in our room and saved a ton of money by not having to purchase food at Disneyland. Warm and comfy rooms. Good heaters. Did not go to continental breakfast, as we had breakfast in our room. Good value.

I loved this hotel! didn't expect to get the amazingly big room I got, complete with a full kitchen and pots and pans, a couch and an overall spacious room. There was even complimentary boxed macaroni and cheese that you could cook, in the kitchen! Very friendly staff as well, willing to be flexible to fit your needs (ie check out time). Would definitely recommend

I have stayed in a lot of hotels in Anaheim,CA yet I 've never heard of this hidden jewel until recently. Thanks to Expedia.com for opening my eyes. This place will make you feel like you're not staying in a hotel. Will from the front desk was so accommodating and professional. This should have been rated 5 stars at least for me it is.  Cody V

Right in the heart of Anaheim.  Easy to get to anywhere you want to go.  Hotel was clean and rooms were big.  Would be perfect for an extended stay.  Like a mini apartment.  Front desk staff was veey nice and very helpful.  I would definitely stay there again.  Wish they would get softer sheets and a better continental breakfast...but overall a great experience.

Rooms are nice, older, but clean and spacious. Having a real kitchen is great with small kids. Bed was comfy, pool is nice. No charge for parking is a huge plus. Close to food and target right up the street. Had a great stay! Thanks!

Close to amusement parks, in a clean residential area. However, wifi was extremely slow...very frustrating. Continental breakfast was basic, so we bought groceries and made our own breakfast in the room. Plastic cutlery was needed from the continental breakfast, not enough in the room.
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed our convenient location.We are sorry that you had issues with the WiFi during your stay. We do not normally have any slow WiFi issues reported. We did check the WiFi connection from your room and found it working correctly. Thank again for the feedback. We will use them to better our hotel for our future guests. We hope to see you again!

Summary: It's quite and friendly place, highly recommended, rooms has kitchen with nice dsign but very small bathroom. The breakfast is basic. Free parking is available for guests. I like the place and recommended.

Excellent. Easy to get transport (bus at the door, Uber very reliable). Supermarket and Shops close hy. Excellent choice of restaurants and good food close by. Outlet shopping and movies only a bus ride away. Clean and tidy. Very helpful staff.

Summary Heading: Not as advertised in the pictures
Summary: For what it is it is a good value. The biggest issue I had with my stay is that they put me in a room that looks like it's going through renovations. The cabinets were sanded down and look like they needed to be replaced. The pictures in the advertisement were of much nicer kitchens. I did see construction was going on at the site while I was there I believe I just got stuck with one of the older rooms. Normally this would not be an issue for me, but the hotel was nowhere near capacity so they could have easily put me in one of the upgraded rooms but I feel since I paid for it in advance they knew I couldn't just check in somewhere else which I think is kind of shady practice.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to review our hotel. We are happy that you thought your stay was a good value. We are renovating rooms throughout the hotel but would never put a guest in a partially renovated room. Different room types have been updated before others so you may not have reserved a room type that has been upgraded yet. It is our goal to give the best experience possible for all of our guests and are sorry you felt otherwise. We do hope you come again. We would love to make sure you stay in one of our new rooms.

Summary Heading: What you should expect for the cost.
Summary: It is a decent place to stay for the money. This was my third time staying here on an annual business trip. It's not super fancy but it gets the job done. The bedding was particularly comfortable in my opinion.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review! We love to hear from our repeat guests!

Summary: This is one of the cutest, if not THE cutest hotel I've ever stayed at. Right off of Lincoln, HPT is pretty close to everything. Especially my favorite, Disneyland :). The staff were friendly and efficient, the rooms are huge and comfortable.   There's a nice kitchenette available to use if you wanna save a little money on going out to eat. The balconies are also very convenient and relaxing. There's tons of parking in the rear!  If I had one complaint, it's that the bathroom is a little tiny. Especially the toilet. There's almost no counter space but they do have a small spot in the hallway to store your things and there's plenty of closet space. I'm guessing this used to be an apartment complex of some kind? Either way, I would definitely stay here again.

The Hotel Peppertree was a nice hotel - I stayed there primarily because another family member was staying there.  I wouldn't have chosen the hotel otherwise.  Having said that, everyone was very nice there and the manager had just put a brand new bed into the room I was checking into.  It was very comfortable.  The hotel is old - it is clean and mostly well cared for but the noise from other rooms was very bad.  I am a light sleeper and even with ear plugs, the sound from the rooms around me was like a tank going through the hotel.  The rooms would be good for a family wanting a lower cost of a hotel with a real (but small) kitchen.  Full size refridge and small stove for cooking plus a microwave.  The baths are very small - they have put a small piece of furniture outside the
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your thoughtful feedback. Glad you found us to be a good fit for a family trip.

Summary: this is a nice place to stay, great if you want to do some cooking while on vacation since it has a full kitchen. however the beds are very firm,almost hard. I did like that they had a strict quiet time that they maintained so guest would not be disturbed after a certain hour.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! So glad you enjoyed the full kitchens and family atmosphere. We did just update our beds! Come back again to try out our new mattresses.

Summary: I'm a bit of a hotel snob and would have never stayed here if it wasn't for my family who had already booked their rooms here but I gave it a try and not only was the hotel clean, nice, Quant, beautiful but an excellent value. I really enjoyed my stay and will definitely return in the future. Beds were worn out but they were in process of changing them while I was there so I would rate this place a perfect 5 out of 5!

My wife and I went there for our honeymoon. It is a good location to get to places. They had set out a bottle of wine for us which is very appreciated. The room was tidy and the bathroom clean. The only thing I didn't like was the room smelled weird. I'm assuming all the rooms smelled like that. It smelled like going to my grandparents house after they haven't cleaned all month.
Manager Response: Congrats on your wedding and thank you for choosing Hotel Pepper Tree for your honeymoon! We will look into the smell of your room immediately. That is not an issue throughout the hotel. We wish you would have mentioned it during your stay so we could have changed your room. Thanks again for the helpful feedback.

Summary: The pool is not heated! Staff were nice, but bed was old. The hotel is old and show signs of ware. It is a good hotel if budget is a concern. There is no kitchen table. The first floor patios were nice. Continental breakfast was as described.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to review our hotel. We appreciate your helpful comments. Our pool is heated to about 80 degrees. We just did upgrade our mattresses throughout the hotel this lasts week and are continually making upgrades throughout the hotel. Thanks again for your comments. We will make sure to use them to better our hotel.

Summary: Found the toilet bowl in the room dirty soon after we checked in, the maids refused to clean saying it was rust. Front desk person tried to convince us to put up with it, but when I said it was highly inconvenient with kids, the guy changed rooms after about an hour of check-in. This was just a slight inconvenience encountered, but cant complain because the replaced room was awesome and would still go back when I visit the place because the people in there were understanding and very courteous.

It was great. Second time I've stayed there. Plan on going back for vacation. Next time. Staff, room was awesome. Close by to parks. Enjoyed market across the street very friendly people.as well, and great stuff

Summary Heading: Good place with a good kitchen
Summary: Pepper Tree is a good place to stay if you are visiting Disney Land. It is also close Knotts parks. It also has good kitchen. I felt the mattresses are not up to the mark. Had some issue with Wi-Fi initially, but was resolved.

+ves: Very good wifi. Reception desk are fireindly and helpful. Location is good (close to Disnelnad) <10 minutes drive.  -ves: Bathrooms are in poor condition, old. Room is way smaller than indicated on the booking site. Breakfast is poor.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to review out hotel. We appreciate your helpful feedback. All of our rooms are 450 square feet and a patio/balcony as mentioned on our website. We are in the process of updating our rooms (bathrooms included) and making changes with our continental breakfast. We do hope you come again to see the changes.

Summary: This place may be the best kept secret in Anaheim.  Although the GPS takes you around the freeway to get to it, there are easy surface street ways to get there in a few minutes.  It's not your run-of-the-mill chain hotel.  Great decor, easy in and out, nice restaurant in front where breakfast is served, very comfortable and friendly atmosphere.  Lots of stores and other commercial services s (banks, gas, pharm, etc.) nearby for whatever you need.  Management direct and helpful.

This hotel has antique furniture all over the place. Rooms have a small kitchen will all utensils. Very close to Disneyland. It definitely needs some updates, like power outlets near beds, larger sink in the bathroom, etc. Staff was very courteous and helpful.  Free breakfast was very decent.

It was our second visit to this hotel. Went last minute with no reservations, and they had a room available. It is a little on the pricey side,  but it is a beautiful place to stay. Love that they have a kitchen and a grocery store right across from it. Would recommend.

Great hotel, big rooms, good value, would definitely stay again. We like that there was a couch and a patio, it gave us lots of space to relax for 3 people. Had a kitchen which we didn't use but good to know for next time we stay there.

A rare find. My son and I needed to get away from where we were staying for a couple days and found your hotel on trivago. Price was right, although I think it would have been cheaper to call the hotel itself. The hotel was lovely. Had rustic charm and felt very safe.

The only issue was lack of clean washcloths for the multiple stay nights we have had for the last two visits.  We have reused our bath linens and when the room has been cleaned, the washcloths were removed but not reploaced.

We stayed two nights at the Pepper Tree.  The first night, the hotel guest above us was rather loud, but the second night, was great!  The rooms are clean and I love the fact that there's a kitchen.  The location is great because it is a very short drive to Disneyland.  Good access to the 5 freeway as well.  Parking was a bit cramped, but our car was very safe, as it's right up next to the hotel.  I wish we could have taken a dip in the pool, as it seemed so inviting, but it was a beautiful setting.

We spent Christmas at this hotel and felt very comfortable. The hotel makes you feel at a colonial era and is very nice. The terrace is one of the favorite areas.  We believe Hotel Pepper tree will be our first choice

Very disappointed with this hotel.  The overall feel was old and outdated.  Has kitchen but very minimum cooking wares.  Breakfast had only few selections.  Not worth for the price we paid for ($169/night).
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations. We are working on major changes to our continental breakfast and will use your comments to better our hotel.

Summary Heading: A good hotel with an attached Kitchen.
Summary: Location was great. A few mins drive to Disneyland. Room was average, thoungh the attached Kitchen in the room was very impressive.  Staff was very good. Ben & Chris were very friendly and accommodative.
Manager Response: Thanks for your helpful feedback! So glad you enjoyed the location of our hotel and the full kitchen. We will make sure our staff sees your positive comments. We hope you come back to our hotel in the future.

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. It was our first time traveling to Anaheim and we we're Glad we found this hotel, if we do go back to California peppertree hotel will always be our first choice ❤
Manager Response: Love to be your first choice in Anaheim! Thanks for the great review.

Summary: Although it is listed as a boutique hotel, the definition is just an excuse for the old shabby furniture, cracked and scratched walls and floor, outdated and poorly equipped kitchen, and broken heater( no heat for a day and a half). We stayed for two nights ( three days) and never saw a manager on duty. The breakfast was cheap... the cheapest it could be... The front desk people are not friendly, nor knowledgeable. They even don't have a luggage cart , which is available at any motel... Would not stay again.
Manager Response: Thank for taking the time to review our hotel. We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations and that you did not enjoy your stay. Since you were at the hotel on Christmas Day, our general manager was not available but our front desk manager was at the property. We do also have a luggage cart available. We will make sure to inspect your room immediately and will use your comments to better our hotel. Again, we are sorry that you did not enjoy your stay.

Summary: Stayed here for our 3 day Disney trip. Overall content with our stay. The bathroom and kitchen was out of date and the refrigerator was dirty but customer service was good and the location is relatively close to Disney land.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your helpful feedback. We are happy to hear that you received great costumer service during your stay and found our location convenient. We will make sure our housekeeping staff is notified about your comments. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: We only stayed one night but we recieved very friendly service at this retro but cool hotel. Spanish décor that may need some updating soon but it was very clean and roomy. Nice room design and small but neat kitchen. Only downside would be the cold, small pool and no hottub on a longer stay.
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed our boutique charm and customer service. We do not have a hot tub but our pool is heated. We will make sure our management team sees your comments and suggestions.

Summary Heading: A good and affordable place to stay if you are looking for a hotel with kitchen
Summary: Since it is one of the hotels with Kitchen its a good and affordable place to stay near the disneyland. The housekeeping was good and the room was clean. Also the proximity of the hotel to the disneyland resort is a positive
Manager Response: Thanks for our review and helpful feedback! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the full kitchen in your room.

Summary: Liked the close location to DL( 10 min drive), but this hotel needs some serious TLC. Stayed in #210 dec 23-26th. Walls are thin. Could hear maids cleaning upstairs and neighbors coughing and slamming dresser drawers. Hair in tub, dust bunnies on bathroom floor, peeling, cracked paint on bathroom walls and door. Visible rust in kitchen, bed skirts had visible pen marks on it. Curtains didn't have the rope pull to open so we had to drag it to open which will eventually either tear or damage top rail. The decor is really pretty with all the Mexican art, furniture, tile, wrought iron lighting. Please take better care of your hotel Peppertree because it could be 100% awesome. People notice the details and they're important to many. Staff is friendly and surprisingly the room service
Manager Response: Thank you for your thoughtful feedback about your stay. We will use your comments to better our hotel and staff. We are glad that you enjoyed our boutique charm and will inspect your room immediately to make sure it is meeting our standards. We are making upgrades throughout the hotel and changes to our continental breakfast. Again, we thank you for your review. We do hope you come back to our hotel in the future.

Summary: We only stayed for one night but for our next trip will definitely consider for a longer stay. Our courtyard room was clean, comfortable & spacious for our family of four. Kitchen was surprisingly complete with full size fridge, stove, oven, sink, microwave, plates, cups, etc. Everything we needed for a great stay.

I wouldn't have booked this hotel again if it wasn't worth it. I enjoy the style, location and convenience of having a kitchenette in the room. It's clean and comfortable. It's also spacious with a decent size balcony
Manager Response: We love to hear from our repeat guests! Thanks for coming back!

Summary Heading: Beautiful place very nice and quiet
Summary: The place was very clean ths rooms are also very open and the hotel itself Is beautiful. Hotel room also comes with most nessecities so no need to ask the front desk. The location was convenient and at night we slept peacfully. Good heating and cooling system.

Summary Heading: As compared to other hotels with kitchens....
Summary: Since I have food restrictions, I always have to cook for myself when traveling, therefore, I've stayed at almost every chain hotel that provides full kitchens.  When visiting Disney Parks, we chose Hotel Peppertree for its pricing, somewhat nearness to the parks, and the fact it had a full kitchen.  This review provides the Pros and Cons:  PROS: VERY nice employees in deed and presentation. Kitchen facilities Free internet Free parking Free breakfast Coat rack - It was so nice to be able to hang coats while visiting in the winter (as io laying on bed or hanging on back of chair. Heated bathroom floor tiles  CONS: No dishwasher.  Who wants to hand wash dishes while on vacation - leaving for the parks early and arriving home late..  Dirty refrigerator doors, dirty baseboards,
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your thorough review and helpful feedback. We are in the process of making updates and changes throughout the hotel including our continental breakfast and our rooms and beds. We will use our comments to better our property and staff. We do hope that you will come again. Thanks again for the time and thoughtfulness in writing your review.

Summary Heading: Unique and Great Place to Stay
Summary: This hotel was close to Disney, clean, had a unique atmosphere, and was affordable. The grounds were pretty, rooms clean, and the bed was comfortable. If I ever come back to California I would stay here again!

Very good value. Nice location. Bed was comfortable. Didn't really use the kitchen area, but it seemed well appointed. Could've used an informational packet or sheet in the room for the TV and heating/cooling system. Would stay there again.

We stayed for 3 nights at this place. Great location allowed us to go back and forth to Disneyland within a day. Working kitchen and very good house keeping. Only low point were the bed bugs in the sofa. Led to one sleepless night out of the three. Expect slightly better levels of hygiene and cleanliness.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. We are glad that you found our location convenient and enjoyed your full kitchen. We are looking into your comments about the sofa immediately and wish you would have reported any concerns immediately. We are very proactive in protecting our hotel against  any bed bugs and do not believe them to be an issue in your room or any others.

Summary: Our stay was excellent. Hotel staff was super friendly and helpful at all times. Room is spacious and very clean and well kept. Breakfast is ok. Great location if your main reason to be there is to visit Disneyland.

I live in a two-bed room on the ground floor, with a comfortable small yard, very convenient traffic, about 40min to LAX airport. I'll be back to this warm place.front desk service is very good. Also,there is a big parking lot.

If u have kids this is one of the best hotels to stay at. It has the space for them to be comfy. The front desk was friendly too. Theres always parking available for you.Oh theres also a super market right in front of hotel for any emergency you need

Our second stay and we will return if in OC again. This is a boutique hotel with excellent and helpful staff. Rooms are spacious and comfy. Close to Disneyland and conveniently located to get on the HWY

Great location and good customer service. Wifi signal could be weak at times. Breakfast was basic with hot beverages and some basic bread and pastries. Housekeeping was not consistent. We didn't get new towels in 2days of our stay

Pepper Tree is a beautiful, unique hotel! I enjoyed our King size studio immensely. It was beyond what I expected. It's too bad there's no shuttle to Disneyland, but I knew that when booking - and the buses are nearby. We had a minor issue with housekeeping taking our hanging towels and not replacing, but that's an honest mistake.Otherwise fantastic trip and enjoyable stay.

Everything was great, I Love the rustic style the hotel is great for the kids with flat screen tv, the small kitchen make me feel like at home the parking space was great I was able to park mi car very close to mi window room

My overall stay was great and was conveniently place across a super market a convenience store and pharmacy store and not that far from disneyland I would recommend to anyone traveling out to that area

Well equipped kitchenette and large room. Nice balcony but noisy neighbours. Can't blame the hotel for inconsiderate guests. Only 3.5 miles from Disneyland (1 freeway exit!). Would definitely return.:)

Summary Heading: Recommend and will return to Hotel Pepper Tree
Summary: Loved our 4 night stay. Staff is friendly and represent the hotel well. Daisy was our receptionist and she was fantastic and helped us get our stay extended for a great price. I truly believe people that are happy where they work make their customer feel the same. Thank you hotel pepper tree and staff. Marry Christmas from my family to yours. Look forward to visiting again in march2017.

The hotel was nice rooms quite large and well equipped. Loved the balcony. We were staying there to go to Disneyland and didn't realize how far away it was?! So although it was a nice place we won't be staying there again as it is miles from Disneyland.

Great off the main drag, easy to find and just minutes from Disneyland. Loved the kitchenette for late night snacks. The staff was very courteous and very knowledgeable. Would stay again hardly any street sounds.

The hotel property is just less than 10 mins drive to Disneyland and 5 mins drive to Knotts Berry Farm.24 hours 7-11 and coin laundry is just beside the property.Staff is very friendly and this hotel serves free breakfast

Pros: friendly, knowledgeable, courteous front staff.  Nice size room (had a king, twin bed and love seat).  Great places to eat within walking distance.   Cons: their toilet was right under a ledge that was really uncomfortable.  Lots of noise from upper floor guests-- I'm sure 95% of guests are on a Disneyland trip, so that was to be expected)

We loved this hotel! Some things are a bit outdated but everything was clean and comfy! We will definitely stay here again. Also, they don't take cash which was an unexpected inconvenience. But they are close to Disneyland, and have a great Mexican Seafood restaurant in front of the hotel!

We stay here often. Love the location and the nice staff. Always willing to help. Rooms are clean and in good repair.  Great place for a good price. We will definitely  stay here again when we go to Disneyland.

Although the location was a bit away from Disneyland we actually really enjoyed it. It is located across from a Mexican inspired supermarket so the food was different and yum. The local people were really friendly as were the staff at pepper tree.
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed our location! We are located right between Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm. Thanks for the helpful tips and feedback.

Summary: Never been to Anaheim before, the stay was great, the kitchen was major plus. Frozen pizzas were a possibility, the shrimp at the restaurant was boss.  Also, the pillows were perfect. Would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! Hope you can come back again soon.

Summary: Nice facilities. Only slight issue was a slow draining tub which drained fast enough for shower. Breakfast was all breads and cereals but hot food was available, good and cheap. there was some renovating happening which resulted in a ladder going up over our private patio wall. make sure you keep curtains closed for privacy here.

We stayed here and took day trips to Disney and Universal Studios. The hotel was quiet, conveniently located, and very professionally. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. We would stay here again for similar trips.

We had only some problems with the cleaning of the room and  mainly bathroom.   swipe the floor was not done, a lot of dust and some litter of the previous guests stayed under the beds for days. the wc has never been cleaned outside, that was the worst part.

I would have never seen this hotel it being so hidden from a major road behind a Mexican restaurant but its definitely a treasure! The grounds a so cool and the look of the place makes you feel like you are in another country. The King Patio suite is so cool i really liked it.  The only thing I would change is the amount of sound that comes in your front bedroom door. There was a baby crying in a room across the way and i couldn't sleep all night with the baby screaming, there needs to be better installation with the front doors of the rooms.

Very clean and tidy. People are very nice there and customer service is really good! Con of the whole hotel is the kitchen wasn't that nice. Very family friendly and safe place to be! Very convenient as there are shops all around the hotel

The staff is friendly and knowledgeable about the attractions. Any issues or requests were taken care of promptly. Rooms were clean but very out dated. Patio was nice, but didn't use it much. Would recommend for families on a budget.

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel with a haritage style feel
Summary: We stayed here in December. The room and the staff was very good.The room setup and kitchen were really good for family. Though some furniture was very old, like the chair present in the room was very bad.

The rooms look very nice. Everything you need. Great area. Mexican supermarket close by. Different restaurant close by. Nice comfy beds. Clean rooms and bathroom. Front desk greets you when come in and out of the hotel.

Daisy w/ frontdesk provided excellent service.  Due to work I stayed 3 days with my kids. I felt safe and the rooms were very clean. My stress level dropped. I enjoyed our stay. I will return soon. Next time I'll try the pool.

I absolutely loved our stay! It was just a 10min drive to Disneyland. Will definitely stay here again :) only problem was the room above us kept making a lot of noise but the beds were pretty comfy that we were able to ignore that and get our sleep.

We arrived on Sunday, 21 this past November, the rooms are big and spacious, we needed one rollaway bed which we got as soon as we registered, it was also very comfortable.  The other two queen size beds were nice and comfortable, we barely used the kitchen but it had a sink, microwave and refrigerator that could get you out of trouble any time, the breakfast is served at the restaurant just in front of the hotel tower, there was always fresh fruit, healthy cereal options, coffee, tea, donuts, butter and jelly, just enough to start your day.  The hotel is close to Anaheim Plaza, where you can find Walmart, TJ Maxx, Ross... Theme Parks are close by (Disneyland, Disney California Adventure and Knotts Berry Farm).  This hotel is a great option!  **The balcony could have had a

Summary Heading: Pleasant reasonably priced boutique style hotel
Summary: We stayed for one week, it is great to have the convenience of a kitchenette, and a complimentary continental breakfast.  It would be helpful to have more utensils in the kitchenette.  Did not have the opportunity to use the pool, the balcony size was nice.  Bed was reasonably comfortable.  Easy 10 minute drive to Disney and easy access to 5 Freeway.  I would recommend this to friends, and would stay here again, good value for the price.

Very outdated and old but the room was clean and quiet. The shower didn't get very hot at all which was disappointing because it was chilly during our visit. The free breakfast was pretty mediocre with not much to offer. I guess you get what you pay for.

The decor needs to be updated. The kitchen needs a good face lift!  But it was clean and linens were good.  The patio was nice to have. We needed a place with a kitchen and this was the only hotel within our price range.

This is my favorite place to stay when visiting Disneyland. It is always a pleasure to stay here. Very friendly staff. Great bang for your buck. I have stayed here for the last five years and will continue to in the future.

The hotel is so charming. The quality of the room was a surprise, we also loved the hotel style. The rooms didn't look like a hotel room, the private balcony and patio set was very cute. So glad we found them online, we hope to stay there again.

Room was comfortable, clean and affordable.  Room had a kitchen which was awesome.  Major grocery chain just around the corner.  It's a short 5 minute drive to Disney.  Close to everything.   It's not the four seasons but for the price it was great for us.  People will complain about Anthony when reviewing hotels.  For the most part we left in the morning and came back home late evening.  We were in the park all day.  The hotel was quiet and we each got a god night sleep.  We were on the bottom floor and had a nice private courtyard patio complete with chairs.  You get what you pay for in life.  We were pleasantly surprised with the price and hotel.  We will definitely be back.  Thanks Pepper Tree

Great value for the price.  Less then a 10 minute drive to Disneyland. We have a parking pass so it didn't matter to us that there was not a shuttle.  At $18/day it might to some, but there is no fee for parking at the hotel and there is at the hotels that are closer.  Very pleasant and accommodating staff everywhere.  The rooms are a bit "tired" but clean and large enough to be relaxing, especially with the patio.  Having a full size kitchen was nice.  A toaster would have been welcome, but you can always use the one available at the continental breakfast.  Will definitely stay here again on our next Disney trip

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for a short term stay
Summary: Hotel is clean and has a nice atmosphere to it. Parking could not be better since it is for free. Continental breakfast was in the resturant in front of the hotel. Also clean and service was okay there. If you like to use the WiFi be prepared for dropouts. Our neighbours liked to slam their doors in the middle of the night which awoke us daily.  Next time I would ask for a room on the upper floor...

This is the only place we stay at anymore. The price is always great, the employees are always very friendly and it's a short drive to both Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm. It's an older place and it shows here & there but every time we go, the rooms get better.  This time we were pleasantly surprised to find upgraded A/C units with a remote control.  Although it took us awhile to figure it out, it was nice once we did.  I don't think there is anywhere else where you can get a room near Disneyland at this price that has a full kitchen, including microwave, coffee maker, toaster, oven, and full size fridge. There is a convenience store right across the street and several fast food places in the area.  The pool can be a little noisy at night if you are one to go to bed early so

WiFi was not very good but it was good to disconnect for awhile.  Great Customer service at the front desk! Very nice room. We were out of our home due to fumigation and I wish we would have stayed here for the whole 3 nights.

I liked the hotel. BUT. The rooms need upgrading. The couch was very uncomfortable. Bed felt like I was sinking in the middle. The walls r very thin. Lots of noise in the morning.  When the maids r cleaning the rooms u can hear them banging and cleaning. The gardeners and garbage trucks also woke me up early. Bathrooms need more places to hang towels. The shower was terrible. No hot water barely. Also the xmas music in the hallways needs to go. People like to sleep in and with thin walls it's ridiculous.

The hotel is in an excellent location. The rooms are spacious and they have a kitchen in them, which is really convenient. There were restaurants a d stores nearby. Also the hotel is lterally 10 minutes away from the disney parks.

Not the most up to date decor or facility, but clean and comfortable. Staff was pleasant. Not much availabile  for restaurants or entertainment nearby but we were there to visit family in the area. We didn't use the kitchen except for morning coffee and cold beverages, but it might be handy for some.

Within first couple hrs found a water roach crawling around bathtub. Next morning after housekeeping serviced room, bedding skirt was dirty n appeared to have noticeable dried blood stains. House keeping came asap to replace but should have never had to to begin with.

Summary Heading: Wife inspected and approved,Bang for your buck
Summary: Great Safe place on a budget. Mexican grocery store across the street with lil restaurant inside,Good burritos. 3-5 mins from Disney and 30 miles from universal studios. Which took an hour on Veterans Day. Wife and kids liked the free continental breakfast.     There's a gated Pool, but not heated. Anaheim is hot anyways.   We never had/wanted sheets changed, just towel exchange. Everything was clean. Wife inspected and approved, b4 we could move stuff in.    Kitchenette was good. Always wash dishes b4 you use them, @ any hotel. I'm just sayin.     We definitely  will stay here again.     Thank you hotel staff for great 3 day veterans weekend.

Summary Heading: Clean, perfect for a Disney trip.. not too far from the park.
Summary: Hotel was clean, has a great atmosphere to it. Parking could be better. But since i areived early i didnt need to look hard for parking. Free breakfast was in the resturant in front of the hotel. Also clean and service was great there. I enjoyed my stay. Would stay again.
