The breakfast isn't anything special just cereal and muffins pretty much, but you can order hot food from the restaurant and it's not expensive. Overall a great stay and would do again. It great for a tip to disneyland or anywhere else nearby. The front desk was also extremely helpful!
Manager Response: So glad to hear that our front desk was so helpful! Thanks for the great tips and feedback.

Summary: I really liked this hotel the last time we stayed in it about 2 years ago and recommended it to everyone I knew that would be in the area. Things have gone down since the last time we stayed. Our shower was clogged and we told the front desk but it never got fixed. Same goes with the sliding door to the balcony. We opened it and couldn't get it to shut. You used to be able to upgrade the continental breakfast to warm breakfast but that is no longer an option. The staff is very nice and professional and the price you get for a full kitchen is amazing, but overall I cannot say this is my first choice when in the area anymore.

Summary Heading: Charming SouthWestern Oasis in the Heart of Southern California
Summary: This Hotel was charming like a trip to Mexico, with lot's of style, but very modestly priced.  The rooms themselves were nothing special, and the kitchen, extremely handy for those on a tight budget or have special dietary needs, was not very well equipped -- very basic.  The front desk people were great customer service oriented and friendly.  Overall a great value with style.

I loved the price! We had a great stay, very comfortable and very roomy. The employees were very helpful as well. The only this I wish was different was our view from the balcony! We didn't know we were going to be facing the parking lot
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! So glad you loved your stay. Come back again soon.

Summary: Room was a good size, great having a kitchen, love the private patios, close to highways for travel. Beds could use an upgrade but had bug covers on the mattresses.  Would stay at this hotel again next visit.
Manager Response: So glad you will be back! Thanks for the great review.

Summary: My husband and I stayed here while we spent the week at Disneyland for our honeymoon. The hotel itself is cute and inexpensive and had a kitchenette which was a plus for us since we were trying to save money. The beds were... So so. Bedding was your average scratchy motel comforter and rock hard mattress and the kitchen had very little amenities as far as dishes and pans. The walls are pretty thin so you can hear everything and they play music on the speakers that you can hear throughout the hotel into the evening which was quite obnoxious. Besides that, I would say worth the price.

Large rooms and was very clean. The hotel met all my needs and expectations. I would stay here again and recommend it. The front desk staff was very helpful and knowledgeable about the area. Housekeeping did an excellent job also. I would stay here again and would recommended it to someone staying in this area.

We had a good experience at this hotel the pricing was awesome the rooms where very cute and clean with a kitchen that was very convenient . Wish the pool had a hot tub but other than that there was no complaints.
Manager Response: Thanks for the helpful feedback! Hope you come back again soon.

Summary: With my last couple of visits I feel a lack of customer service with front desk staff. Simple things like eye contact and a friendly acknowledgement are lacking as well. This I attribute to what must be emerging as the culture in this particular establishment amongst employees. I've been staying at pepper tree for years and this surprises me.
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate the comments from our repeat guests. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will make sure to immediately address this with our front desk staff. We usually receive great comments regarding our staff and take your feedback very seriously.

Summary Heading: Not what it used to be
Summary: Second stay at pepper tree. The first 5 years ago was fantastic. But the hotel and in particular the restaurant have gone down hill dramatically since. The beds were soft and very uncomfortable. The restaurant breakfast was very poor and it was very very unclean!!
Manager Response: We are so sorry that we did not meet your expectations during this last stay. We hope you talked with the front desk manager during your stay. We will look into the beds into your room immediately. We are also sorry for the poor experience you had at the restaurant. We are working with them to improve their service.

Summary: Pepper Tree has upgraded their rooms to a QUIET air conditioner. The loud air conditioners was practically our only complaint with the place. They seem to have improved the decor and grounds as well. And a bonus...we just found out there is a Farell's Ice Cream Parlor only two miles away!
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you enjoyed the upgrades! Glad you found Farell's! There are some really great restaurants within a 5 minute drive of our hotel.

Summary: We brought a large church group and the hotel was amazing to us. Most hotels make you feel like an inconvenience but not this one. Each room was large and clean. Breakfast was great and the optional breakfast was also a great value
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the wonderful review! Glad you enjoyed your stay. We loved to have you and your group.

Summary Heading: A good value for the money.
Summary: As stated in previous reviews, if you're expecting a five-star hotel then you should book elsewhere.  We felt for the rate charged, it was fine for us.  The room was clean, beds were comfortable and it was nice having the use of the kitchenette.  The hotel has a pet friendly policy, which was great for us.  We did have a problem with a dog barking in one of the rooms that was close to ours, but this was handled within the hour by the front desk staff.  Seems the dog was left unattended which is against the hotels policy.  Other than that, we had a pleasant stay.  They were doing some remodelling at the facility, but workers didn't begin their day before 8 in the morning and were done by 5 in the evening.  Level of noise on their part was kept to a minimum.  Would definitely
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your stay and the kitchen! Thanks for the helpful feedback.

Summary: This hotel has a relaxed Mexican hacienda feel. There are large orange tiles throughout the hotel. The rooms are large with full kitchens and small bathroom that seemed outdated. I had a large balcony with a sliding glass door that looked onto a back parking lot. The bed and pillows were comfortable. The restaurant in the parking lot had a menu that was in Spanish with English subtitles. Mexican music playing.  The TV had soccer with Spanish speaking announcer. I wouldn't eat or stay there again. If you like that atmosphere, you will like the restaurant. The continental breakfast was so so. Overall, I wasn't impressed.

Staff was very friendly and informative. Had no issues checking in or out. Close to Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm. Store across the street. There is a Pizza place down the street that is AMAZING!  This Hotel has NO ice. Overall, Great stay!

3 miles to Disney, about 10 min drive door to door in the morning. Free parking at hotel. A grocery store just across street, great combination w/ the kitchen in the suite.  Very nice and helpful staff.  Large suite style room w/ full kitchen. Well decorated and furnished.  Very clean inside and out.  Separate (from beds) dressing area leading to the bathroom, very functional.  Strong WiFi signal inside room and in the parking lot, but not in the "lobby".   Small lobby area, included continental breakfast is good but just "continental".

My family and I were please by this little hotel. Rooms were clean. The Spanish look of the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location is convenient if you are communing to them parks.  Was cute. We would definitely  stay again! :0)

Perfect for our trip to Disney! We will happily return. We loved the personality of the hotel and cost. The breakfast wasn't much, but met our needs. The noise in the halls with dogs and kids did wake us up a few times but that was the only glitch.

It was a good stay for my family and I so close to a lot of places which was very convenient. I loved that it was like your own little apartment with a kitchen fridge and stove it was all convenient if we needed anything it was right there like pots pans and utilities.

Great location with very friendly hotel staff! The room was big and clean and the beds comfortable! The wifi dropped out all the time and the breakfast could do with some spreads with less sugar, maybe peanut butter? Overall we had a great stay with our toddler and would definitely stay again next time we are over! The pool was lovely on the hot summer days too!

Hotel was ok. Not quite what I expected.  Breakfast was not good at all. Ate there the first day only.  Air conditioner was noisy.  People were very nice.  Wifi was not very good.  The price was very reasonable for the amount of time we spent in the room.

I love the balcony , my kitchen , my room. The art that's on the walls down the halls and steps or fantastic and front dest is good people. The toilet set to low but everything and everybody is amazing, I will return next year

I would say one of the best hotels near Disney. Cheap and friendly. Clean hotel. Don't like the b-fast. Location is awesome Near convinent stores and groceries. No toothbrush and lotion in the bathroom.

Best hotel I've ever stayed at. Wifi and signal are wonky, but everything else was nice. Close to the store and a restaurant. Thirty minutes from the beach. Awesome patio. Cute little lizards everywhere. Really couldn't ask for a better place.
Manager Response: Wow! Love to hear that we are the best hotel you have ever stayed at! We will look into the WiFi signal from your room... we don't usually experienced any problems from most of our guests. Thanks again for the great review.

Summary: Outdated, clogged toilet, gross shower, tiny bathroom, old smelling and looking room very disappointed neighborhood is ghetto and feels unsafe. Rooms don't have insulation. Next time I'll pay the extra for a nicer hotel.
Manager Response: We are so sorry that we did not not meet your expectations and are sorry that you did not have the same experience that most of our guests have. We hope you were able to talk with our management team during your stay. We will also make sure to inspect your room immediately to make sure it is up to our standards.

Summary: If you're looking for something to just sleep and shower in, this hotel works just fine. Customer service was great and very nice. Don't expect too much with the continental breakfast or WiFi (had to use my data the entire time). My one problem was that there was no lotion available, I mean, no toothbrushes? That's fine, a lot of hotels are doing away with that and tooth paste. But almost every hotel still provides shampoo, conditioner and lotion! Also, if selecting 2 beds, one will be a queen sized bed and the other something smaller than a twin. Room comes with a good sized TV and a 3-seater sofa. Overall, I would come again if I didn't feel like splurging. Also, it's like 10-15 min away from Disneyland, definitely a plus!
Manager Response: We do hope you come again. So happy to hear that you enjoyed our customer service. We do have rooms with two queen beds (Queen Studio). You must have booked our Courtyard King Studio (king bed and twin bed) by mistake. Make sure to book directly with the hotel to ensure that you have the proper room type. Thanks for the helpful feedback. We will make sure to use it to better our hotel.

Summary: The only issue we had was the balcony lights stayed on all night. Even with blackout curtains it was still bright. Also the maintenance worker decided to blow leaves at 1030am. Other than that we are super satisfied with this hotel. It was the right price so we could splurge of  disneyland stuff.
Manager Response: Glad you enjoyed your stay at the right price! We will look into the balcony light issue to see if there is a way to help reduce an access light.

Summary: For the price you can't beat it. Full kitchen, perfect little studio for under $100 a night you can't beat it!  Breakfast was simple but good. Fruit, cereal, yogurt, bread and bagels. Just a few minutes from Disney. It's a little diamond in the rough. Neighborhood isn't the best, but you feel safe and comfortable. Beautiful rustic Spanish style hotel. Lovely little private patio if you are on bottom floor with a small fountain, but be warned, it's a little noisy if you are a light sleeper. Friendly staff. Hubby and i stayed for our anniversary and they left us a bottle of wine and chocolates one our first night! If you are on a budget but want a full kitchen and a quaint, warm, friendly place to stay. Hotel pepper tree is for you! Tip: bring slippers, floors are not carpeted.
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your stay and full kitchen. Thanks for the helpful feedback!

Summary: Rooms were spacious and clean. The coffee was never replenished and although we received new towels daily, we didn't receive washcloths and had to ask the front desk for both coffee and washcloths. The location is great. It's an easy drive to Disney. The pool is gorgeous and very clean. The continental breakfast is a joke.....don't waste your time....dried out breads and donuts. My biggest concern was the security. The back entrance door was left open each night we stayed there. I thought perhaps they closed it late, but we returned from Disney around mid-night each night and it was propped open. Front desk is not able to see people coming in and out of that door, so that was a bit  concerning. I don't think I would stay here again, there are other hotels around the same price
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your helpful feedback. We will be talking to the housekeeping department and the front desk regarding your comments. We take the security of our guests very seriously. We are also making improvements with our continental breakfast. We do hope that you would give us a second chance the next time you are in Anaheim.

Summary: Enjoyed our stay at the Pepper Tree.. Staff was awesome and we were very comfortable and the kids enjoyed the pool .. We will definitely continue staying at this hotel for our Anameim Disneuland trips.. Thank you for a pleasant experience!!
Manager Response: So happy you will be back during your next visit! Thanks for the great review.

Summary: The Disneyland hotels are very expensive. Hotel Pepper Tree is about a 10 minute drive away and costs about a third of the hotels on the Disney property. You don't get to ride the monorail into the park and you can't see the fireworks from your room, but if cost is a consideration, this is a decent alternative. The hotel isn't real appealing from the outside. It's just a multi-story building in the center of a parking lot. Don't let that fool you. The inside is nice. It's a Mexican motif. Our room (102) was very large, more of a studio apartment than the typical motel room. I wouldn't be surprised if this was once an apartment building that's been converted to a hotel. The room was comfortable and the amenities were what you need. My only real complaint is that other than one
Manager Response: Thanks for the helpful review. So glad you enjoyed your large room and stay. Make sure to talk to the front desk about local restaurants. There are so many choices within a 5 minute drive: In&Out, Farrell's Ice Cream, Claim Jumper, etc.

Summary: The location was fine.  It was enough away from Theme Parks to be peaceful but close enough for convenience.  Housekeeping never left washcloths or coffee and we constantly had to go to the front desk to ask for some.  The cleaning was adequate at best.  Breakfast was Little Debbie donuts for the most part and there was no one available even if you wanted to order a hot breakfast.  My family's consensus was not to return.  Our air conditioner was broken for the last two days and no one fixed it as we requested.
Manager Response: We are so sorry that you did not receive our best service. We are looking into your situation immediately with our front desk and housekeeping staff. We are also in the process of updating and working with the restaurant on our continental breakfast. We will make sure to use your feedback to better our hotel. Again, we are sorry that we did not meet your expectations.

Summary: I really like staying there ! Very authentic love the private patio and the whole set up of the rooms ! It truly makes you feel at home w everything provided and is close to everywhere .. The only problem was that they had very slow wifi
Manager Response: Love to be a home away from home! Thanks for the great review.

Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week. The website made it look picturesque and it most certainly was! The only issue we encountered was construction on the hotel. Other than that, wonderful stay!
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your stay! We did have a few small updates going on during your visit and are sorry for the inconvenience. We are getting our hotel ready for the busy summer season.

Summary: We really wanted to like this place. The kitchen facility and decor make it a quaint sort of home away from home. Unfortunately the unusable WiFi is a deal breaker for us. This is especially true because something about the building interferes with cell phone service. On top of that the Jack and Jill door between rooms is paper thin. We were forced to jam blankets and pillows in between the doors to drown out the sound of the drunks next door. It was a mixed experience that could have been memorable. In a good way.

Overall our experience was very good to excellent.  Maid service was just average this time, however. We were not supplied with coffee-making supplies except when we first got to the room; otherwise they were never replenished. Similarly, we only had washcloths and hand towels at check-in. For the remaining days of our stay we received hand towels on only 2 out of 4 days, and washcloths not at all. Bathroom sink had been updated/upgraded since our previous visits. The continental breakfast is a bit of a letdown ONLY when compared to most other hotels we've stayed in recently; hot items are extra ($5.99 minimum) - so no waffle maker, pancake maker, not meats provided, for example. Nonetheless, our stay was a good one - very clean rooms, reasonably comfortable beds, NEW air

Front desk was polite and helpful.  Our room was spacious and clean.  The kitchen has seen better days but we didn't use it.  We choose this hotel because of our budget.  I'd stay here again. The continental breakfast was not worth it.  Dried out bagels and muffins. There is not a good place to eat around the hotel.  The restaurant at the front of the hotel serves only Mexican seafood.

Hotel was perfect for our budget. I liked the feel of it being like a studio apartment, instead of just a room with beds. The front desk help was extremely nice and courteous at all times, and very helpful. This place is peaceful, beautiful, and think I really liked the patio. It was nice to be able to just sit outside, read and enjoy my morning or evening, not be cooped up in the room the whole time. Will definitely look into this place again on our next visit.

As a broke college student, I was looking for something affordable without compromising quality. This hotel is not only 10 minutes away from Disneyland, but also the cute Spanish style and excellent customer service made for an amazing stay. If I'm ever in this area again, this would be my first pick.
Manager Response: So happy we will be your first choice on your next visit! Thanks so much for the great review.

Summary: Perfect for a family staying for more than 3 days. Hotel was well surrounded by everything that I need. I recommend everyone that goes to Anaheim to stay here to not only enjoy your stay but relax as well.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the great recommendations! So glad you found our hotel convenient and relaxing.

Summary: We enjoyed the stay. The price was good. Room was clean, We did have a bad smell in the fridge, but once I notified the staff, hey took care of it immediately. The sheets could be upgraded. A bit rough on the skin.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the helpful feedback. We will talk to the housekeeping staff about the sheets. Come back again soon!

Summary: The hotel was great.  The beds were comfortable with good pillows.  The kitchen had a full sized refrigerator, stove and sink.  It was well equipped with silverware, dishes, cookware and utensils.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The bathroom had soap, shampoo and conditioner and was cleaner than any other we stayed at.  If we return to the area, we would definitely stay here again.  Thanks for a great stay!
Manager Response: So glad you will stay again! Thanks for the great review.

Summary: Parking & breakfast is not free. There is "resort fee"$5/day after i had already paid for entire stay online. Shower cold hot cold cold cannot have steady temp shower. Otherwise great place. Nice place
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. We are sorry that the third party you booked with did not mention the resort fee. Glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: Biggest plus is the location.  Breakfast is just about okay ,as it is limited in options and absolutely same without any change, so not good for a long stay. Room service is daily and kitchen is nice. Good eating and shopping options nearby. A superstore just opposite the hotel.  Subway and a couple of other outlets next to hotel. Laundry and salon next to hotel. An Indian store and an Indian restaurant around 1 mile from hotel.  Anaheim plaza with Walmart, Ross, Carters, Target etc around 2 miles away.  Overall, a very good choice in this budget.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the helpful feedback! So glad you enjoyed your stay and the convenient location of our hotel.

Summary Heading: Very hospitable people. Awesome facilities. Definitely would recommend it and will stay again
Summary: Beautiful hotel with very awesome service. Beds are very comfortable. Very roomy a very practical. Definitely would recommend it. It has to be one of the best hotels I've stayed at in a long time. Two thumbs up

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay for the price
Summary: This is a cute and comfortable Spanish style hotel Pros: large clean kitchen; clean bed; nice patio, tv and ac; no bugs Cons: 15 fee when checking in, toilet was slightly stained, tub had shampoo residue, bad smell when entering the room, and breakfast sucked

My wife and I arrived hours ahead of the scheduled check in, basically right after check out time.  While our room was not immediately available, we were in our room shortly thereafter.  We stepped out for a quick lunch and upon return, we were able to obtain our freshly cleaned room.  The location is perfect for the local amusement parks.

Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, mainly because it was affordable, it offered a kitchenette, and was in a centralized location in Orange Country. The reason we need a kitchenette was because we have a 10 month old baby, and needed to prepare his food - we are self professed snobs, and don't want to subject our child to the crappy store bought options. Anyway, on to the review of the hotel.   Pros: 1. Though the furniture and appliances are rather outdated, it all works and is well maintained and kept clean. 2. The staff are friendly when you check in, and our experience was that they responded quickly when we asked them to. The microwave needed fixing, which they sorted out in a timely manner, and when we needed more towels, they got delivered with a smile. There was also

Summary Heading: Love the uniqueness of each room.
Summary: Good service, close to Disneyland, and loved that there's a restaurant in the parking lot for convenience. Also, the fact that all the rooms have either a balcony or patio area is a huge plus! Definitely reccomend stay here!

Overall this hotel is a great value for the price. The staff is very friendly. The room was bigger than expected and the bed is comfy. The continental breakfast had a decent amount of choices.  My only complaint is there is traffic noise every now and then. Also you can hear other guests due to the thin walls. I would also have liked more fruit choices when it came to the continental breakfast.  But this won't stop me from staying here again. We had a great stay with them. Will definitely stay here again on our next trip.

The place was really friendly and clean ..really loved the area and the cleanliness of the place..there's a super market in frontthe and it has a lot of stores and places to go around it .may Knotts berry

Summary Heading: I love this hotel. Room was better than I expected. Very comfortable, love that private patio and kitchen.
Summary: Everything was great. This will be the only hotel i stay at in Anaheim from now on. Staff and front desk were extremely friendly and helpful. My only complaint is the wifi did not work in my room. I had practically zero wifi range in my room, and 99% of the time I was unable to connect. The staff did try to reset the router and try to help, although nothing was able to be fixed for me. Besides that, I still love this hotel.

Hotel pepper tree was a great find, the hotel staff where very helpful and we liked that they would print attractions tickets when needed. My kids loved the pool. When we come back will be staying again!

Summary Heading: Stay at the Hotel Pepper Tree
Summary: I enjoyed my stay and would stay there again. I do however think that forcing someone to write at least 200 characters to submit your review. I would remove this minimum otherwise people may not submit a review.

Good location in Anaheim and is about 5 miles from Disneyland.  Room comes kitchenette, refrigerator, oven and utensils.   Courteous staff and very good customer service. Continental breakfast can be improved though.  There is a convenience store opposite the hotel.

The staff are fantastic, and the facilities are great and very clean. The pool is lovely. Thank you for a great 9 night stay for our honeymoon room 125 was lovely especially loved the small courtyard garden we had

I'm glad I gave hotel pepper tree a try. I likely to go back every time I have to be in Anaheim. Keep up the good work. I'm Hoping to try the pool next time. Highly recommended for first time visit. Tnx

This is my second stay here and once again I am completely satisfied by everything.  The people at the desk were friendly and helpful.  I loved the Continental Breakfasts -- sipping my coffee and listening to the news.  I was impressed by the care that is taken with the maintenance and cleaning of the hotel.  I will be back!

The hotel front desk staff was amazing. We arrived way before check in but they were able to accommodate us. The room was just what I was expecting. Great size and the kitchen was such a great thing to have. I don't know if it was because we had an adjoining room next to us, but the walls seemed sort of thin and a lot of sound came from under the front door when anyone was in the hallway. Our room didn't get cleaned while we were there but this was because we would always come back around 2pm for my son's nap. I later read you can request an earlier maid service with the front desk so I will make sure to do this next time. Great location, great staff, great hotel. We will definitely be returning for our next trip to Anaheim.

The hotel was great. The only issue I Hamm has is that they didn't give me and regular coffee only decaf, but the front desk staff was good enough to bring me some to my room. The kitchen was a good size to work with and the had everything you needed to make a meal. I would definitely stay here again.

Wonderful location and perfect room for a couple. Didnt spend much time in the room but it was super clean very roomie and the patio area was lovely. Will definitely stay again and would recommend to others.

We had a very comfortable stay.   Facilities were good,   We did not use the kitchen but it was available   The king bed  and twin bed fit our needs.   We would return to this property.  I enjoyed the breakfast.

I have stayed at the Pepper Tree a couple times before this stay and found it enjoyable.  This time we were placed on the 3rd floor and it seemed exceptionally noisy compared to the other times we've stayed and those times we were on the 1st and 2nd floors.  The walls seemed paper thin this time compared to the first 2 times we've stayed here.  This is why I gave the sleep quality only a 4 this time. The rooms are always clean and having the full kitchen is very accomodating.

Overall stay at Hotel Hot Pepper was not satisfactory. Wifi was terrible and unable to connect most of the times. The front desk was not that helpful at all. Location is indeed convenient but the continential breakfast was horrible.

Not incredibly extravagant but had a neat extra feel for a hotel room. I wished eggs or pancakes were included in the continental breakfast without having to pay more, kind of disappointing. The pool was nice, although I wished there was a hot tub.

This hotel is great and convenient.It is spacious and it has kitchen and fridge.The continental breakfast is ok.It is better to do a side order for pancakes/sausages.Also there is a supermarket you can go walking called vallarta.You can also eat there the tacos and smoothie are really good.Overall I will stay again in this hotel.If you going to Disneyland is close to the parks.

I was happy with the attention that went into the website. It does a lot of hyping up what you actually end up getting when you do first check out the room in person. I was honestly disappointed that my friend and I weren't given a better room with a nice view. We had spent a nice amount of cash and it was our birthday weekend trip to Disneyland. Instead we got a crappy view from the back of the hotel parking lot. The room service is great with housekeeping but have a bad tendency to keep moving trash cans back into the closet or cabinet spaces so it makes locating them harder to find after they've gone in and cleaned. Leave the trash cans in a visible space please? The bed was fine. Nothing too great or too bad. The fridge was awesome. Contained a bunch of space for food and

Overall it was okay. Picture of room online can be deceiving . It looked a lot larger and when we first saw the room in person, it was pretty small. Wish they provided a little more food for breakfast .

Great hotel to stay at for Disneyland trip. Loved the kitchen in the room. I was able to make dinner for my son and didn't need to go out for dinner every night. Mattress was really firm and bedding was a rough. The pool was great. Will definitely consider staying there again.

Room wasn't bad, roll away bed was terrible as you could feel every spring and the continental breakfast was not really worth it. Not the greatest of locations but the staff was very friendly and  helpful.

Employees very nice great valie for price Hotel very cute love the style love the kitchen very useful and complete with big fridge and all the necessary  Surroundings very interesting lots of restaurants and shopping

It was a good hotel, we loved the decor and the layout of our room. The floors were dirty, you had to wear socks or sandals. The bed was hard and it seemed like it was missing the big, fluffy  comforter. But we slept good each night bc we made the best of it.

We stayed here for the weekend and absolutely loved it! It ended up being 3-4 of us and a dog. Our room was very spacious and loved that every room had huge balcony! The restaurant in front was delicious and I loved thevery fact it had a full kitchen! The room was very clean and comfortable. Definitely coming back!

Everything was great ! Thank you. Front front desk was very nice and helpful  .  Housekeeping do a very good job it was . Great little kitchent  . We will stay again very soon👍👍 close to Disneyland park we love it
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! So happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and our staff. Come back again soon!

Summary: we love this hotel. we have definitely made this our go to hotel whenever we are in the Anaheim area. we love the location and love having access to a kitchen it definitely makes it easier for my husband to stay on track. they should come up with some sort of reward program I think thatll be great for repeat customers

Put in a request and was told they would take care of it, never did. But the hotel room is spacious with big beds. Loved that they had a fridge In the room. Great hotel for the price listed, just wished they would have listened to our request.

This hotel is somewhat nondescript from the outside, which I would describe as an asset given the comfortably stylish "boutique" setting that lies within.  Everything from the pool to the patio outside the room lends a sense of privacy and warmth (it helps that the decor is Spanish Mission style ~ very California!), with just the right amount of detail.  There is a complimentary breakfast with fresh squeezed orange juice to supplement the organic feel of the place.    Disneyland is an easy drive.  There is a fine market/grocery store across the street and a Bank/ATM.  The neighborhood is residential and generally quiet.  The staff/reception will go out of their way to please.

Property is older hotel very close to Disneyland overall a good value for the money.  If I'm ever in the Anaheim area again I would stay at this hotel. Kitchens were outdated bathrooms are very cramped

Rooms where excellent expect on the 2nd floor, you could hear the shower sound or toilet flushing sound from the surrounding rooms, need to improve on it. Otherwise, overall stay and location were ideal.

My family and I decided to take advantage of Disneyland for two days. I was searching on line for an affordable hotel, came across this unique spot. I booked,very satisfied,with our stay. Grounds were filled with landscape, halls decorated with unique arts of all sorts..

Summary Heading: Amazing first stay in the USA
Summary: My 5 star rating says it all. Everything you need in one. We were lucky to have a very beautiful view of the pool and street (with trees) from where we were and the cars were far enough away to not cause noise issues at all. Great stay!

I absolutely loved it here!  It is minutes away from Disneyland and the place is nice and clean! Private balcony and clean swimming pool will definitely have me coming back! Staff was very friendly, didn't have a chance to check out the free continental breakfast.

Good, safe location with dining nearby.  The room was great, small kitchen, sitting area, separated bath area.  The best part was the great outdoor patio area with table and chairs, plants.  It was beautiful.

Stayed for 2 nights as part of a honeymoon trip to the USA and chose this hotel as it was well situated for Disneyland. The hotel staff are amazing and very helpful! Would highly recommend to anyone visiting the Anaheim area.

Really nice hotel got from groupon, really clean rooms, liked the dishes in the room, service was good, not far from Disneyland, liked the balconys, layout was nice. Maybe update the old movie posters, and the 200$ deposit was really high

Summary Heading: Clean, Quiet, and Excellent Customer Service
Summary: This hotel is a really nice and affordable option, not far from Disneyland. The room that we stayed in was very spacious. Could have asked for a little better in terms of the bed comfort (they mattress was quite stiff, and the comforter rough enough that we took off the bed), but we had no problem getting good sleep anyhow. The employees were really nice, check-in was smooth. This hotel is also located in a cool part of Anaheim, right across the street from a massive Mexican supermarket that had everything we could imagine. And just down the street is a really cool old bowling alley with a super-cheap little restaurant/cafe that was great for a quick bite. Not far from Disneyland, which was our intended destination. Overall, a great spot!

Very nice large room with a nice private patio. There were 4 adults in our room plenty of room for all great value. Liked the small hotel feel. Sign hard to see from the street. breakfast was ok typical hotel breakfast. Excellent inn

Long but nice walk from Disneyland. Hotel could be efficiency apartments.  Restaurant in parking lot for breakfast but we did not use. No laundry facilities on property but laundromat across the street.

The rooms were very clean, comfortable, and functional.  Attendants at the desk were friendly and very helpful.  The location is relatively close and convenient to Disneyland and the hotel rates are very reasonable compared to most hotels in the area.

Summary Heading: Very Nice for a godod price
Summary: Found the staff to be very accommodating.  They allowed us an early check in.  Beds were very comfortable, kitchen was clean with a full size refrigerator.  Room was quiet.  Free Parking and continental breakfast was a big plus.  The location was close to everywhere we wanted to go.

Overall a pleasant stay but there was one incident where hoses and extension cords were left unattended stretched across the parking lot. My grand daughter who is recovering from chemotherapy and has trouble walking tripped scrapping her knee. The desk staff seemed relatively unconcerned and no effort was made to rectify the problem. Several hour later when it was night the black house on the black top had not been removed. On the other hand we lost personal items at Disneyland. Disneyland located us through the hotel who called us and we were able to recover our items

This was the last hotel of our trip and base for Disneyland! The price was great and I had no expectations. So pleasantly surprised on arrival, really clean, roomy, great staff, room was spacious and comfortable - pool.....all within a $7ish uber fare from Disney!!!  Thanks Peppertree for great value & friendly service!!!
Manager Response: Thanks for your great recommendations and helpful feedback! So happy to give you a pleasant surprise.

Summary: Stay was great however either my room or the first floor has or had an electrical short as the lights would flicker on and off intermittently or would not light at all. I would hate to hear of a fire or injury to a customer as I look forward to staying here whenever I visit the southern Ca area.
Manager Response: So glad to hear that you will be back. We are so sorry for the light issue that happened in your room. We have since fixed the issue to make sure it will not happen again. Thanks for taking the time to review our hotel.

Summary: Wasnt to thrilled with the location of this Hotel from the theme patks. Decor and furniture in room could use and upgrade. The mirror in vanity area was cracked. Hotel staff wasnt very friendly, hardly said hello
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments. We will use them to better our hotel and front desk staff. We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations and did not have the same friendly experience that most of our guests have with us.

Summary: We staid two days in this hotel and everything was fine. The kitchen area needs to be renovated and the breakfast with a little more diversity of fruit and types of filling for the bread but it was ok.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that our hotel was perfect for your Disneyland trip. Thanks for the helpful feedback. We are updating our rooms and kitchens throughout the hotel.

Summary Heading: Front desk was super nice and helpful. Rooms were clean and spacious. Great location.
Summary: I would definitely come back and stay again :) clean friendly spacious  and accommodating. I didn't get in the pool but it looked nice. The location was great also. Seems like we were in the middle of a lot of what we wanted to do.
Manager Response: So happy you will be back! Thanks for the great and helpful review.

Summary: The hotel floor is very noisy when ,also the wall between the rooms make the voice transferred and make a lot of noise . breakfast is very poor . there is no safe in the room to keep your valuable things

Summary Heading: Great place for a good price
Summary: Great location - quiet and away from tourist area, but at the same time close to Disneyland (only 12 minutes away). Room was clean and room service was promptly. All staff was friendly and the booking process was smooth.

So I came here with my significant other in April for a 4 night stay. I encountered one issue at check-in. My debit card would not go through when the gentlemen at the front desk ran my card. He asked if I was traveling out of state, by the looks of my ID. I said yes, and tried to think about why my card was declined, as I didn't make any big purchases on the way here. I forgot to call the bank to let them know I was traveling, that was a huge mistake on my part. I had asked the gentlemen at the front desk if it was okay if he took my credit card information down, if we can still get our room and I will give the bank a call asap. He said that was fine and that check-out would be tomorrow at 11:15am. I was so thankful! I called the bank after settling into our room, to notify

Summary Heading: Depends on the room you get
Summary: My sister and I both stayed here with our boyfriends. Two separate rooms.  Her room was nice, clean, and functional for the most part. It looked way more updated with marble finishes and newer appliances.   My room was dirty (curtains had stains, pillow was dirty, and hair was in our bed when we pulled off covers first night). The kitchen appliances barely worked.  We payed close to same, both getting King suites but very different rooms.  The breakfast was below average, as well as swimming pool area. Luckly we stayed busy outside of hotel and it wasn't super hot forcing us to need the pool.

love this hotel little disappointed in taking out the couch WHY??? nice place to sit new chairs very uncomfortable took grand kids and family this time , usually get down stairs with family or king size bed by for the two of us . little disappointing that continental breakfast was moved out of the hotel not that it is that far to go  but it as nice inside of the hotel .

Facility is outdated, bathtub cracked, kitchen cabinets won't close, lights didn't work (except the one on the patio which wouldn't turn off), no hot water comes from kitchen sink, everything in room was outdated and could use some upgrades. Bed was comfortable though.

Summary Heading: Great place for a good price.
Summary: We have stayed at the pepper tree multiple  times   and have  never  had  any  problems .  Price and location is great . Close to disneyland but  not in the tourist  trap area. Always quiet and well taken care  of for an older hotel.

We've stayed at this hotel several times over the past 5+ years. Unfortunately it seems to have hone down hill. There was no screen on the slider to the patio; the air conditioner blew down on one of the beds making it virtually unusable, and the breakfast in the restaurant in front of the hotel was meager at best.

Summary Heading: Great temporary home away from home
Summary: We needed to move out of our house for 8 days while some work was being done.  I found Hotel Pepper Tree on Trip Advisor under Top 10 Pet friendly hotels in Orange County.  The location was convenient, the price reasonable and the fact that they were pet friendly was important to us.  The front desk personnel were very accommodating and housekeeping kept our room clean and was very efficient.  (I know others have said they had issues with Housekeeping, but we did not so not sure what their specific issues were).  There's a grocery store directly across the street for convenience.  The kitchenette has the basics covered. We enjoyed our second floor room looking out over the pool.  Also, across the street from the hotel there is a small strip mall that has an amazing Thai

Yes, it's true. I'm a three timer. I like Hotel Pepper Tree because it's not crowded in with many of the others by Disneyland but, it's just close enough. The room size is decent and it has a full kitchen. It's clean and it's a reasonable price. The breakfast is held in the restaurant in front. It's small bagels and bread, cold cereals and pastries. Not my type of breakfast but, you can order a hot breakfast at a cost. I'm the type that likes to eat where locals eat so that's what I often do. If you book your room from the hotel website there is a discount for Disney tickets. I get tickets from a local Safeway grocery store in the gift card section. Sometimes you can find 2 day park hopper passes for Disneyland and California adventure for $225. Those usually sell out fast and
Manager Response: Love to hear from our repeat guests!!! Thanks for the great tips and helpful feedback.  Can't wait to have you back again soon.

Summary: I really enjoyed staying at the hotel! My only downside to this was the complimentary breakfast. I wished there was more to than just toast or boxed donuts. Overall my boyfriend and I enjoyed our stay! Great service and comfortable bedrooms!

Overall I had an excellent experience staying at Hotel Pepper Tree. The staff and the housekeeper were extremely kind and hospitable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. And would certainly return.
Manager Response: Thanks for the recommendations and great review! So glad you will be coming back.

Summary: This is where to stay so as to not add extra costs to that trip to Disneyland. About a 15 minute drive into parking at Disneyland without traffic.   Kitchenettes in room and grocery store across the street allow you to keep your costs down.   The complementary breakfast at the restaurant in the parking lot is not worth the trouble.   The pool is not really for swimming laps, but may amuse small children.   The service seemed a little uneven, housekeeping forgot to replace hand towels, coffee packets, etc., but the extra pillows I asked for in the online reservation were there.
Manager Response: Glad we were able to save you money on your Disneyland trip! Love to hear that we are a great deal. Thanks for the very helpful feedback. We will make sure to show your comments to the housekeeping department and will work to improve the consistency in our service.

Summary: The smell when we got into the room. Smelled of old ladies getting ready for a funeral however nothinf febreeze couldn't fix so it didn't bother too much.   And the breakfast. Worst. Breakfast. EVER! Don't bother waking up for their breakfast. Go somewhere else. They had a few selected cereals, select pastries and out of the two toasters there only one worked and only one slot of that one worked! No protein unless you order and pay for it.   Overall I did enjoy the hotel itself. Our room was clean and neat and had no problems with the cleanliness of it. Staff was great and the whole place in general was nice. Will be coming back...just not to have their breakfast
Manager Response: So glad that you will be back and that you enjoyed the room with a full kitchen! Thanks so much for the helpful feedback. We will make sure to tell the restaurant about the toaster issues and will work with them on their service. Thanks again for the helpful comments and review.

Summary: A really lovely hotel. We had a nice big room with everything we needed l. The pool is a nice place to relax in the heat. Perfect base for visiting Disney as it was only a short drive away from the hotel.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you loved our boutique charm and our large rooms. Thanks for the great review.

Summary: Stayed here for our Disney trip and it was perfect! Nice quiet hotel that we could truly relax at after a long day at Disney. The kitchen was so helpful! Front desk staff was extremely helpful and friendly!
Manager Response: Love to hear that your stay was perfect!! Thanks for the great review. We will make sure our staff sees your kind comments.

Summary: This is a good place to stay if you are looking for something a little cheaper.  We had no issues with the room or the service although we found the breakfast options a bit limited for healthier options.
Manager Response: Thanks for the helpful feedback. Glad you enjoyed your room. We will suggest some healthier options for the continental breakfast to the restaurant.

Summary: Tнιѕ нoтel ιѕ a нιdden geм.... Tнe rooм waѕ very coмғorтaвle wιтн a loт oғ ѕpace .. Fronт deѕĸ ѕтaғғ waѕ pleaѕanт aт cнecĸ ιn & нoυѕeĸeepιng dιd a good joв . тнe only coмplaιnт waѕ тнe вeddιng ..ιт waѕ a вιт cool and тнere waѕn'т enoυgн вlanĸeтѕ and тнe aιr/нeaт υnιт dιd noт pυт oυт any warм aιr. Oтнer тнan тнaт мιnor glιтcн I нave noтнιng вυт good тнιngѕ,тo ѕay aвoυт тнιѕ place.

Time I had stayed here I was impressed with the room and especially the kitchen for the price it was very nice and very convenient to have a full size refrigerator and an actual cooking stove I would stay here again

Stayed there for six days. Hotel staff was phenomenal and maid service was fantastic! Beds were comfortable and the AC in the room was quiet. Only negative to this hotel was that my friend and I heard everything happening in the hotel rooms next door and across the hall- which wasn't too bad considering all hotels are like that. We were on the first floor and we had a cute little private patio that we didn't have the chance to take advantage of but looked very inviting and peaceful. Overall- great stay for a great price. Very clean and comfortable hotel. Would definitely come back again if I ever have the chance!
Manager Response: So glad that you will be back! Thanks for the great review and helpful comments. We are working to better sound proof the doors throughout the hotel. See you again soon!

Summary: Each room feels like a little apartment. There is a wall separating the bathroom/changing area from the living/bedroom area. This makes sharing the room with friends much easier because you can change in privacy. Having the kitchenette also helped us keep costs down. The only drawbacks we had were that the room smelled like gas. The hotel said they had a maintenance person look at the stove, but the smell never left. Also, the person above us was smoking and ashes kept falling on us when we were on the patio. The foliage was beautiful and the koi fish were lovely as well. The front desk personnel cannot be beat. We really enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: Happy to hear you enjoyed your large room, our boutique charm, and the friendly staff. Thanks for the great review. We will talk with our maintenance staff about your room and double check your stove. Thanks again for the great comments.

Summary: It was a good time minus the party above us on our second night. Everything was pretty clean and customer service was excellent. Not to far from Disneyland and the theme of the hotel was very nice. I would reccomend to another person.
Manager Response: Thanks for the recommendations! So glad you enjoyed your stay. We are sorry for the party noise you experienced. Our front desk staff works hard to stop any disturbances as soon as they are reported. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: My little home away from home...
Summary: I am in the Anaheim area for work monthly and I have found my new go to favorite place.  This property makes the most of what it has.  I love the layout of the rooms the convenience of the location. I don't like being stuck in Disney traffic the kitchen is what really sealed the deal.and the updated outlets  with USB is appreciated and noticed. I didn't get to the pool or the breakfast so can't comment on those because it was nice to be able to cook my own breakfast in the room! Staff is friendly, and for having a decent family Disney crowd it was relaxing and quiet. Market and shops across the street.  I will definitely be back! The only 2 things I don't have is the 11 a.m. check out and I wish they had sheers for the windows at the balcony so I could leave the curtains open
Manager Response: So happy to be your favorite place in Anaheim! Thanks for the helpful feedback. We will make sure to note them for our management team. Excited to see you again soon.

Summary: Ive stayed at the sister hotel (Lemon Tree) a few times and stumbled on a very good deal at the Pepper Tree! I had no clue what I was getting! I stumbled into a full King bedroom with a full kitchen and gas stove! Overall the hotel room was very clean!   Cons: The bed was not very comfortable (but not awful either) -A few stains on the curtains, again no big deal Im not that picky! -The towels were very thin! Bring your own!   Pros: A full kitchen ( which never happens for the price I paid)  -A full King sized bed a nice bathroom and full closet!  - Free parking - Free internet (enough to stream my shows on) - Free breakfast spread in the AM! - 5-10 minute drive to the parks! - Friendly staff!  - I love the spanish theme! -Under $70 a night for all of that  I would a million
Manager Response: So glad you will be back! We no longer own the Lemon Tree Hotel but are so glad you gave us a try at Hotel Pepper Tree. Thanks so much for the helpful feedback and suggestions. We make sure to use them to better our hotel.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay - Close to all amenities
Summary: We stayed in Anaheim just because we had not had the chance to see this suburb of LA. Not disappointed. The property is great, it's close to Disneyland (for those interested), close to Long Beach, close to all sorts of amenities and good restaurants.   The staff was very friendly, and helpful, the room was clean and pretty.   The only thing I found a little annoying was the fountain outside of our room which kept me awake. I am a very light sleeper so I'm sure it wouldn't really bother that many people. Having our own private patio was very nice also.

Great -patio on the ground floor with fountain and lush greenery.  Very nice southwestern theme.  Loved it and would recommend it for couples, families.  Kitchen was perfect for all meals or just coffee and snacks.
Manager Response: We love the Courtyard Studios the best too! Thanks for the recommendations. Come back again soon to enjoy our boutique charm!

Summary Heading: Meh....okay if you have lower standards
Summary: This place looks nothing like the photos.  The neighborhood is terrible, not really "close to Disneyland", and we even heard a staff member telling a guest she wouldn't recommend taking a jog in the area. The hotel could be cute if it was in a different neighborhood or better up-kept.  The bathroom was falling apart to the point where I wouldn't let my kids shower in there.  The sliding glass balcony door had a faulty lock and my three year old walked right out there.  The glass itself was shaky and thin and clearly not tempered, so be careful if you have little ones.  The coffee table in the room was disgustingly dirty/  My kids dumped some gold fish on there and were eating them which promptly me to check the cleanliness and there was caked-on sticky stuff all over it (no, it
Manager Response: We are so sorry that we did not meet your expectations. We are sorry that you did not receive our best room and have made sure to make the needed updates immediately. We are thankful for your comments and will make sure to better our staff and hotel because ot them. Again, we are sorry that you did not have the same experience that most of our guests do have. We are proud of and work hard our high Tripadvisor rankings.

Summary: Very nice place to stay, friendly staff, clean and interesting decor, close to Disney. Would have liked to have stayed longer. Breakfast not very good next door (mostly baked goods, cold cereal, no protein options but otherwise, no complaints!
Manager Response: So glad to hear that you stay was excellent! Thanks for the great review.

Summary: I'll start with the negatives, the area was pretty run-downed, the hotel itself is quite old.  Thin walls so noise level in the morning's were quite awful with kids running, carts moving across the paved hallways, etc.  Everything in the room felt ancient, stains on the drapes, couch, carpet.. The pool area had no hot tub, that was a bummer as well.  Now for the positives,  even though the kitchen was small and old, it was furnished with utensils and dining ware.  The patio was huge, even though the view sucked.  The best part was probably the staff, very helpful.
Manager Response: Glad you enjoyed our friendly staff but sorry that we did not meet the rest of your expectations. We are thankful for your helpful feedback. We will make sure that our management team sees your comments, and we will use them to better our hotel.

Summary: The rooms were clean, customer service polite, ok continental breakfast, pool was very clean and location was great. We went to Disneyland that is about 10 min away. There is also Knotts Berry Farm about 6 min away, within 46 min of LA and lots of beaches. Huntington beach was amazing. Overall great experience!
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you had a great experience during your stay. Thanks so much for the helpful tips!

Summary: Always clean and comfortable and affordable. I will continue to book my stays in Anaheim at this hotel. Staff is courteous and always willing to help. The bed is great. Wish the TV was larger or that they offered movies but not a deal breaker.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for being such a loyal guest! Thanks so much for the helpful feedback.

Summary: the location is good, near by the Disney. And there is a super market across the road, very convenient. The breakfast is poor. And the bathroom is a little small. the kitchen is good. And the swimming pool is very good.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the hotel. We are working with the restaurant to improve their continental breakfast service. Glad you enjoyed the other conveniences and amenities of our hotel.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel many times. Hosts are friendly and it is a Family friendly hotel. I have three kids and have no issues staying there. Nearby main attractions (Disney land). I will recommend this hotel for my family and friends.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the recommendations!!! Come back again soon.

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay in Anahiem!
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights end of  April. This was the end of our two week family of four vacation. We were greeted very well at check in. We unexpectedly arrived two hours early and were able to access our room. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions for Disney. Our room was larger and nicer then expected. Beds were very comfortable and our kids loved the pool.  Two things that could use some attention - Several times one of us very lightly bumped the buttons on the gas stove , turning it on. Very dangerous. Continental breakfast was alright. Provided enough for us to begin our day. We never noticed any staff in the breakfast area, checking if people were actual guests or maintaining the area.  We would recommend this hotel to others and
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the helpful feedback and recommendations. So glad you enjoyed your stay. Come back again soon!

Summary: Came here on a trip with my mother.   We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and the decor. We will come back if we ever are in the area. The breakfast was good but pretty standard of any regular continental breakfast.
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed our boutique charm! Thanks for the great review.

Summary Heading: Very good and clean hotel at an unbeatable rate
Summary: We stayed at Hotel Pepper Tree for 5 nights and had a really great time there. Very close to Disneyland, good location. I especially liked the decor of the rooms. The rooms are spacious, staff is helpful and polite. The breakfast is poor and boring, this is the only negative I can tell.

I love this hotel! Me and my family always stay here. I have 2 small children so the refrigerator is a big plus!! I love how they offer the continental breakfast, but i dislike the breakfast choices..

On my way to Anahiem, my car's clutch went out causing a major set back for us. Thanks to the great location, we had plenty of stores within walking distance to get what we needed. Going back to the car... It was not going to be ready within the time frame of our original stay. That being said I was able to talk to the front desk and they gave me a Hell of a deal to extent my stay past my original date of check out. The rooms are very clean and very spacious. Overall I had very pleasant stay and since I hold an annual pass for Disneyland, I am most definitely coming back!

Just 1 problem. There was a strange smell in our room when we opened the door. I checked around and found one of the knobs on the stove was turned on just slightly letting gas into the room. I shut it off and opened the patio door for awhile until in cleared. Very dangerous.

If you have a car this hotel offers close access for Dinseyland. Value for money wise the hotel is spacious, comfortable and very clean. It as an excellent Mexican feel which really suits the area. We were very happy with our stay.

Booked the hotel online. It looked really nice, and our experiences with other hotels in the area were wanting, to say the least.  The hotel is really cute.  The room was great, large, and spacious.  There was plenty of room for my family to spread out.  If we had been staying longer, the kitchen area would've been an even larger plus.  The only complaint was the fact that the front door is lacking a safety lock.  So it took all of 5 minutes for my 2 year old to figure out she could open the door and run down the hall.  Other than that, the hotel is great, and I will definitely stay here again.

The receptionists are very good but the housekeepings need more training.  I stayed in 3 days and I never receive any replacement replacement towels in my room.  The room is very spacious.  It is a nice place to stay.

The hotel was easy to find. It appears to be small on the outside but the room is very spacious and comfortable. I loved that it had a little living area. My daughter slept comfortably on the sofa. I loved the décor and ambience too, very cozy! I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the great review and recommendations! So glad that you will be back. Love to hear how comfortable and cozy your room was.

Summary: We were surprised at the beauty of the room and the feeling we were in a small apartment.  All staff was pleasant and accommodating and quick to assist us from getting directions to printing our boarding passes.   The only complaint is the small bathroom and lack of an electric outlet in the dressing area.  That made it difficult to dry hair or use appliances while someone else was showering. Other than that everything was perfect !

The room was very clean and comfortable! Really liked the full kitchen and lounge area inside and out. I was disappointed that the WiFi would say it connected but then wouldn't load anything on out devices. We also didn't care for the continental breakfast much. Other than that the place was great!

The Pepper Tree was quite adequate. We were in town for a funeral so we did not sit at the pool. the room was clean, the bed was on the soft side for my taste but overall the room was roomy and well stocked.   I would like to see a few more choices on the breakfast assortment.

Everything was great the price was fantastic the only complaint I had was that we could hear EVERYTHING that was happening in the hallway. Definitely will return to this hotel. Will advise you can get a way better deal if you book in advance.

We had a fabulous stay. Everything was excellent - customer service, housekeeping, bedding, continental breakfast. I love that we have enough towels for the day. Kitchen and fridge were clean. No complains at all. Will come back again.

The Hotel Pepper Tree was very close to the 2 1/2 day training that I attended in Anaheim. The hotel has a pleasant, rustic atmosphere, and was quiet and comfortable. There was a convenient continental breakfast which could be upgraded to a full breakfast for a low price. Overall my stay was very enjoyable and I would consider staying again when in the area.
Manager Response: So glad we were a good fit for your business trip. Thanks so much for the helpful review.

Summary: This was a great find for our vacation. The rooms are big with a kitchen. The staff was very helpful with any questions we had. Location is good for Disney and other attractions. This is not a 5 star hotel however it is clean and an awesome value.
Manager Response: Love to hear that we are a great value! Thanks so much for the review.

Summary: Everything was great! I just did not enjoy the breakfast we only went there our first morning to eat then ate out the rest of our 4 day at Denny's. But the room was Amazing I wish I had a better view but it's still great. Big patio. Short walking distance to parking lot. Will come back.

I will not hesitate to make reservations there the next time I go to Disneyland or any other park that is in the area.  A very comfortable place to stay and do cooking.  Lots of closet space, handy drawers and huge mirror doors.

First things first, the radiator was not working well, probably it was just our room, so we were quite cold when we were there last winter. The partially tiled floor made it even colder on our bare feet so we stayed in our boots most of the time we were in the hotel. That aside, this is one of the most value-for-money hotel we stayed at so far, the room is huge and spacious and the kitchenette was a bonus. The bathroom was clean and served its purpose. There's also a supermarket across the road which serves cheap and hot breakfasts, and makes up for the poor breakfast at the hotel. For the price, it would be unreasonable for us to complain so overall I would still say it was still a pleasant and great stay.

I enjoyed staying here. It was however a little difficult to find. I really like the apartment setting to this hotel. I would recommend this place to my friends and family I was expecting a fairly larger t.v
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your recommendations and helpful feedback. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: Really enjoyed our stay, close to Disneyland,  very close to supermarkets and some fast food places. Clean and great for families, pet friendly to small dogs,  Kitchenette great for beverages and heating up food, good sized fridge/freezer. Clean, friendly helpful staff, nice simple buffet continental breakfast  served at the restaurant at the hotel on site (didn't eat there but seemed popular and fantastic to have the option. Kids really loved the pool!!!

Clean facility with courteous customer service. We had a good time. Will come back and will recommend this hotel to our friends.  The house keeping was prompt. We liked the courtyard attached to the suit.

We love this lil gem of a place! Our pick every time we're in the area. Close to Disneyland and the beaches. Beautiful grounds, decor, pool and nice clean rooms. I love everything about this place. I've stayed in the king suite, it was a nice big room with an extra bed, beautiful back patio with a fountain and palms. I'd have to say that I like the ones with the kitchenettes, especially if I stay for a few days at a time.
Manager Response: Love to be your hidden gem! Thanks for being such loyal guests. We can't wait for you to be back again.

Summary Heading: One of the best places I have stayed
Summary: We had such an amazing time at this hotel. The rooms are amazing, large, clean, and comfy. We will definitely be returning to this hotel in the future. I highly recommend it! You also can't beat their amazing prices!!!!! Thank you Pepper Tree for making our vacation great!
Manager Response: WoW! thanks for the amazing review!

Summary Heading: Great value - love that it was clean!
Summary: The price point of the hotel made it a great value.  The front desk staff - something I absolutely consider the biggest selling point to a hotel - was on par with a more up scale property.    The rooms were nice size, impeccably clean.  The amenities were on par with the price - two small dings  if there is a coffee maker in the room - please upply filters.  And if dishwashing in the kitchen is my responsibility, provide a kitchen towel or drain rack.    the attitude of the staff was off the charts in being helpful and appreciatve of me as a guest.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the great review and helpful feedback! We love our staff too. We will make sure the housekeeping staff sees your comments. There are supposed to be kitchen towels in the room and the coffee packet works are a filter too.

Summary: Hotel Pepper Tree was a nice hotel that  served as our base of operations for our trip  to see the Cubs on opening night.  Our room was nice, but the bed and furniture were not the most comfortable and could use updating.  I did like the early Spanish style of the property.  The continental breakfast was underwhelming an we wound up eating out both mornings instead.  The wifi was good.  The location was OK, but there were not a lot of good eating options close to the hotel.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the helpful feedback. We are happy that you enjoyed our boutique charm. We will double check the bed and furniture in your room immediately. We are also working with the restaurant to improve their service.

Summary: Some rooms need a bit updating. Overall it is a good little place to stay. The breakfast quality and service at the restaurant needs a lot of improvement. The 2 times I've stayed housekeeping has not replenished the coffee, sugar and creamer basket.

Very good customer service! Very helpful staff. Local market. Was able to cook a full dinner. Very good price. Well worth it. Will be staying here again soon. Supplied me with an extra pan for cooking. Clean environment. Kitchen is well equipped

Would totally recommend this place and come back again ourselves. Way worth what we paid and more. Room was stocked with more then expected. Very clean, comfy and cozy. Can't wait to plan my next trip5

Very personal and profesional. Warm and friendly. The only place i will stay when im in Anahiem. I would recommend the pepper tree to any and everybody. Very origanal. Unique in style. The private balcony! Cherry on the shake!

I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. It was so nice to stay in a hotel that did not feel like a hotel. The room was spacious, clean and inviting. I really enjoyed the patio area. Also the staff was very friendly!

Our stay was beyond any expectation we had! This was our first trip to California and it was beyond our dreams! The staff was extremely helpful and kind! If we ever come back, this will be our hotel! Thank you for helping our dreams come true!

Close to Disneyland and the freeway. Friendly staff, clean rooms, and great service. Free wifi, and a supermarket across the street. Walmart within a 5 minute drive. Comfortable beds, and cozy interior of the rooms. Pool outside, towels at the front desk.

outdated, rooms and property not at all look like website pictures.needs face-lift. staff was great very friendly and professional. only reason why go back. kitchen needs better cleaning, better maintanance

Breakfast disappointed , everything else was very good. Nice pool with heated water.  Good location for visiting Disneyland. Nice kitchen in the room, very cheap food market accros the street.  Nice hotel.

Summary Heading: A good value property not too far from the theme parks
Summary: Hi, we arrived from New Zealand a little uncertain of what to expect in the USA. After a whirlwind through airports and shuttles the Pepper Tree was our first real meeting with people and feel for life here. I was very pleased !! The reception staff were very friendly and couldnt do enough to help us. Ric the manager was there also and was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel lobby is a Spanish/Mexican style. Not flashy or new , but was comfortable and inviting. That was our first impression. Then came the room......  But that was also like the lobby. A good size, very comfortable beds, a little old but all very functional. We are still touring USA And so far we have enjoyed the Pepper Tree more than our stay at Ballys Vegas.  Anyway the room has a small kitchen with most

We really enjoyed our stay.  The room was nice, cozy and similar to a mini-home away from home.  The kitchen was equipped very well and we liked the separate dressing and huge closet with mirrors.  The pool was nice and clean, staff was courteous and friendly.  The continental breakfast could use some slight improvement.  Also, we could hear all the noise from the elevator and people talking and rolling their luggage down the tile floor. Overall, it was a nice room for a great price.

Very nice and cozy hotel, close to places where we were going. Rooms were stocked with the supplies we needed. Freeway, stores and restaurants close by and very reasonable. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful.

The kitchen stove kept turning on leaking gas into the room. Very unsafe, this needs to be checked ASAP! the continental breakfast was very bad. The hotel room and service was great I would stay again.

We were very impressed with Hotel Peppertree and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting the area. We found it conveniently located for all of the activities we participated in. It seems like everywhere we went was a straight shot. Had we of known how well equipped the kitchen was we would have brought more groceries!
Manager Response: Glad you had a great birthday trip! Thanks for the great review. Can't wait to see you again soon!

Summary: Love this little gem. Booked mid-week during Spring Break and have absolutely no regrets. Everything was beyond perfect. Smelled great upon entry, roomy (just what I expected for a studio King, clean and comfortable (not like any of the negative reviews I read before booking here), quiet (except for the occasional door banging throughout the evening), WiFi worked perfectly, front desk (Dave) was refreshingly friendly and accommodating, pool was perfect and empty, everything worked and was available in the kitchen, check-in and check-out was a breeze.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your helpful review! So happy that you enjoyed everything about your stay.

Summary Heading: Decent stay for a decent price
Summary: Decent stay for a decent price.  The Continental breakfast was sub-par at most.  Cereal, basic white bread to toast, and mini powdered / glazed donuts from a bag, super tiny thinly sliced melon with the rind still on made for a difficult way to eat it.  Not worth it!  TV had analog channels and very grainy when trying to watch TV.    Hotel was cute from the outside, rooms were clean, but very dated... not sound proof as I realized after the start of my weekend stay.  Beds had some kind of plastic on the mattress which made for an uncomfortable sleep and a bit noisy when rolling over.  But over all, decent for about $100 a night.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to review our hotel. We will use your helpful feedback to improve the hotel. We are working with the hotel to improve their breakfast service. We will look into the TV issues you experience. Glad you found our hotel a good value for the price.

Summary: Had to ask for washcloths everyday . House keeper started in our room and we left for 2 hrs and the was still cleaning our room. Didn't clean 1 room then finish was cleaning 2 rooms at the same time. 1 person clean all the bathroom . Room didn't smell very clean, and vacuum wasn't done daily
Manager Response: We are sorry for the housekeeping issues you experienced. We will talk with the housekeeping department regarding cleaning times on your rooms. We usually receive great comments on our room cleanliness and take these issues very seriously.

Summary Heading: An excellent option in Orange County
Summary: It was a surprise the size of my room is very big, everything is according to the descriptions and the kitchen is very convenient to save money especially if you travel with your whole family and visiting Disneyland. The Customer Service was very good and in general the hotel is very confortable. Definitely I recommend you this hotel.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the recommendations! We love to hear that your stay was very comfortable. Thanks for the great review.

Summary: I know the Anaheim/Fullerton/Brea area very well and at first the area looked like it was going to get really sketchy but it's not. It was a nice getaway that actually FELT like a getaway. There's a lot of privacy to your rooms, a lot of space, the kitchen was the perfect size for my husband and I as a mini getaway. We went in on a Saturday and we didnt have to fight for parking, which is saying something if youre traveling in Anaheim.
Manager Response: So happy that you had a great getaway!! Thanks for the great review.

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely return in the future.  The room was perfect for our family and having the kitchenette was a plus!  The kids enjoyed the pool and the breakfast provided.  If you prefer a smaller boutique type hotel, this is definitely a place to consider.  Parking and location were also very convenient and the desk staff were extremely friendly.
Manager Response: So glad to hear that your whole family enjoyed the stay! Thanks so much for the great and helpful feedback. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Better than average stay, but hotel smelled of cleaning products most of the time we were there.  Good central location, wasn't for far off or hidden.   Front desk service was very nice, would consider staying here again if needed.  :)
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your stay and our convenient location. Thanks for the feedback about the smell. We will talk with the housekeeping department about your comments.

Summary: Very cozy hotel. Was real impressed with the Hotel and Customer Service. My only concern was the breakfast they offered was okay could have been better. Will definitely return and stay with them again.
Manager Response: So happy that you will be back! Thanks for the helpful review. We are working with the restaurant to improve their breakfast service.

Summary: The rooms  were clean every thing  we needed close to our entertainment 7-10 minutes from Mid eval times and plenty of shopping options and easy access back to freeway to go back home would consider staying again next time we visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed our hotel and our convenient location. Thanks for the great review!

Summary: Very beautiful and charming boutique hotel.  Well worth the money.  Pleasant and highly professional staff.   I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a bargain and hoping to stay in a nice hotel.
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed our boutique charm! Thanks so much for the great review.
