Summary: On the website it's says only 1mile away from Disneyland but actually it's almost 4miles. Not kool!!! Very deceiving for people not familiar with the area. Please correct the error. Spent too much money for parking
Manager Response: We are sorry for your confusion about our distance to the Disneyland Resort Area. We do say that we are 3.5 miles to Disneyland and 2 miles to Knott's Berry Farm. We are looking for what website gives the correct info but have not found it yet.

Summary Heading: Great "Base" if you have a rental car.
Summary: We stayed at the Pepper Tree during our recent family visit to the theme parks.  Location: It's about a 10 min drive to Disney and just a few minutes from Knott's.  Plan on a (minimum) 1 1/2 hour morning commute (each way) if you dare make the trip to Universal Studios. The Hotel has ample free parking for guests and convenient access to grocery and drug stores to stock up on needed items and to stock up on snacks for the theme parks.   Property: The hotel is decorated in a traditional SW theme with touches of Native American art.  The room was clean and had a new air conditioning unit installed (it appears that they are updating all the rooms from old thru-wall "window" units to the new ductless units).  The pool was well maintained, but has limited lounging space.  There is a
Manager Response: Thanks for the thorough and helpful review! So glad you enjoyed your stay. Hopw you come again.

Summary: The hotel room was fully stocked with a full size fridge, 4 burner stove, cooking equipment, eating utensils, plates, even a toaster and full sized coffee pot. It is definitely worth the cost and a great deal. The room was clean and huge and the pool was heated. If I ever go back to Anaheim, I will be a return customer.
Manager Response: So glad you will be back! we love to hear that we are a great deal. Thanks for the great review.

Summary: Different kind of room. Enjoyed the way the room was put together ... different kind of feel. The rooms do require shears along with the existing light stopping curtains. The people that looked after the spotless pool need to be congratulated ... minimal chemical ... with NO chemical odor. Do need lawn chairs for best tanning results :0)

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our stay at Peppercorn Hotel
Summary: A very good family hotel with good facilities for simple cooking ,good fridge facility and plenty of space.Ground floor room can be noisy if the folk above are inconsiderate .The restaurant let the hotel down. The place was not clean and the service dreadful.

I was really impressed with how comfortable the room was with having a family of 3.  Loved the kitchen.  Great customer service.  Close to Disney.  They don't have a shuttle which is the only down side but overall totally worth it to just drive to Disney and stay at this hotel.

We liked the hotel, especially the service and the proximity to Disney Land. The room was spacious and suited our needs perfectly. One thing I did not realize was that there were tiles with huge groove in-between and we had to be super careful preventing our my 15-month old from falling as he would wobble and easily fall, and the hits were super bad...and he just started walking, so that was a miss on our end when planning our stay.

This Hotel has got a good location, close enough to Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm though close but not at walking distance . As far as the pricing is concerned its a good value for money. Free Parking, complimentary wifi and continental breakfast are included in the package. It even gives you discount at Disneyland tickets. You can upgrade to hot Breakfast at an additional price of $5.99. Rooms appear to be old and require Deep Cleaning.They come with small kitchen but no dishwasher.  There is no onsite laundry or gym. As far as the staff is concerned its friendly and quickly respond to your needs. Pricewise none can beat this hotel. the only downfall is the cleanliness of the Room.

This hotel does not have a spa, laundry, or work-out facility. I would not recommend for long stays. The rooms are nice, but the beds arnt comfortable. The pool is ok and the staff is friendly. The continental breakfast was cereal, fruit, and pastries.

Air conditioner/fan nonfunctional, bed tilted, kitchen and bath old an worn out.  Breakfast really poor, all cold, plastic ware service, non-caring host (no greeting, Costco type cereal and bread,). Counter at checking was sticky with spilled juice at front desk

The Hotel appears to be very tidy and well kept.  The customer service was very friendly. Everything pretty much gets an A except the breakfast and cell service in the specific site.  The breakfast has extremely limited choices and seems to be rather thrown together with what was left over. The were no hot choices or proteins offered. No waffles, pancakes or even eggs of any type. No meat either.  The only toast offered was white and fruit was melons only. There was almost no cell service and you had to be connected to their WIFI to get a call to even come thru on your phone but then you still had to step outside to be able to hold a 2 way conversation or make a call. No enough service for even my txt messages to go thru. Due to the fact I need to be able to communicate with

Our family loved the hotel! Cute and cozy. Felt like we had our own Hacienda. Front desk staff was nice and helpful. Location was perfect. Ate at the continental breakfast at the restaurant right outside the hotel one morning, that was good. Other members of my family ordered off the menu and they enjoyed the meal. There's a grocery store right across the street that was handy. The pool was nice. Three mornings in a row around 8:30am there was a crying...no, screaming baby. So loud it sounded like someone had just left it in the hallway. So that was annoying but not the hotels fault. I would totally stay there again!

My partner and I were doing a two day Disney trip. This hotel was close enough to make a quick drive to and fro. Although not close enough to walk, we had to pay parking. But price wise, the hotels cost outweighed staying closer and walking. The overall appearance of the room was very gorgeous and rustic. If it were a studio apartment, I'd be living there! The bed was the only downfall. It was SO firm. But we also passed out because it was 1 in the morning after a full day of Disney, haha. Walking up hurt but maybe, maybe not because of the bed.   Overall, I'd stay there again. Wouldn't mind some protein options at the Continental Breakfast either.

Hotel Pepper Tree was great.  I had one small issue with the curtains, specifically.  I couldn't draw one side, and by the time I realized it was stuck, it was real late.  I was able to make do, and I let it go.  Was not a big deal.  I took the courtyard King room, and the full kitchen and amenties (working stove, fridge, plus cups and utensils)-- I had never seen such a thing for the price.  I will go back to Hotel Pepper Tree for sure.
Manager Response: So glad you will be back. We love to hear that our guests find us a great value for the money. Sorry about the curtain. We have fixed this issue. Thanks again for the great review.

Summary: Good location for theme parks and reasonable room rate, but cannot ask much on services and facilities...  Room is relatively large and comfortable beds.  Kitchen is minimal but definitely a plus for family stay.  Bathroom is old and small, but at least there is some space just outside of it for cloth change, etc.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review and the helpful feedback.

Summary: All of the staff there was very nice.Any question or concern I had was answered or dealt with very quickly.Pool was great for the kids.Wifi worked well for the kids.Kitchen was awesome to have for family meals.Parking was easy .We ended up staying till 12 noon for a late check out and it wasn't a problem for them.I asked the night before so it was a non issue.Front desk staff always said hello when we left for the day and returned in the evening.The Cleaning staff was always nice.If we needed something extra (towels,soap etc) it was no problem.Hotel was located near our relatives home so location was important to us.The grocery store across the street had a great selection with friendly staff.Also across the street was a laundry mat which made it nice since we stayed at the
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you had a great time! Thanks so much for the helpful review. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Great bedding. Nice little balcony. Could use more lamps in the living area and a mirror in the main room where there is natural light. Breakfast is just ok. Otherwise, a great place to stay at a good price.
Manager Response: Love to hear that we are a great place to stay at a good price! Thanks for the helpful review.

Summary Heading: Hotel great  -  resturant not so much
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Pepper Tree.  The package deal for Disney land is miss leading.  Wanted to order breakfast at the restaurant (not continental)  It was the worst service I have ever encountered..........  Would stay at the hotel but not the restaurant...

We are regular repeat customer, do yo Disneyland often. Hotel fits our needs, customer service always top notch. Decent pool, needs a hot tub! Love kitchen, free wifi and parking. Great value for money! Beds could be softer, needs a good breakfast.
Manager Response: We love our repeat guests!! Thanks for being so loyal to Hotel Pepper Tree. Thanks so much for the helpful feedback.

Summary: The Hotel was nice and I was very happy with it overall. I have only one complaint the drain in the bathtub was too slow and the water would back up in the tub. Other than that it was the best Hotel I have stayed at by Disneyland
Manager Response: Wow! Love to hear that we are the best Disneyland Hotel that you have stayed at. Thanks so much! We will look into the tub drain immediately. Thanks for the feedback.

Summary: The staff was fantastic and very helpful! The room was a great size and clean.  It was nice to have a bigger fridge then what is normally in a room.  We didn't use the stove, but it was nice to know it was there if we needed. My only issue with the room was it had an "old, musty" smell, but when you opened the large patio door it would clear up. We would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thanks for much for the great review. Can't wait for you to come back.  So glad you enjoyed the large room and full kitchen. We will look into the smell you experienced in your room immediately.

Summary: Beautiful hotel and property. We were right by the door so it was a little noisy, but not too bad.  Overall stay was great! Comfy bed and loved the patio!! Breakfast at the restaurant was so nice for our family!
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. Thanks for the review.

Summary: Well equipped rooms. An extra blanket inside wardrobe for cooler weather makes it perfect. Only disappointment is the continental breakfast which serves very cheap and unhealthy food, particularly the orange colored drink which is supposed to be orange juice. Toasters that turned up burnt toasts unless operated manually. All foods are sweet ! Although there was an optional upgraded breakfast for a nominal cost, there was no attendant to take orders!
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. So glad you enjoyed our hotel . We are working with the restaurant to improve their continental breakfast service.

Summary: After an early flight and a long day my husband and I fell asleep, while our 6 year old daughter unpacked everything for us including some important documents. Not seeing them unpacked and busy the next couple of days we forgot about them when we left. Housekeeping must have found them and the manager or owner called us promptly so that we could return. Unfortunately we were already far away when the message came through. We did get a hold of him and he sent our documents home. We are so very appreciative of this. The hotel was close enough for us to enjoy Disney and the rate was perfect. I was very impressed with the space, cleanliness and comfort of the room. The pool as warm and clean. We enjoyed the hotel and appreciate the integrity of the staff. Thank you.
Manager Response: So glad we were able to find your lost belongings. Thanks for the great review. Hope you can come back soon.

Summary: Doors are very thin that the noises from the hallway come into the room. The doors do not close all the way to the bottom that light comes in.  I was told I would be getting queen beds but looked like they were full size.  Great kitchen though
Manager Response: Thanks for the helpful feedback. We are glad that you enjoyed the full kitchen in the room. All of our rooms do have queen size beds. We are also updating the doors to help them be more sound proof and fix any small amount of light that may come in. We will use your comments to better our hotels.

Summary: The staff was so so friendly and helped us out a lot figuring we came last minute after spending a night in an awful hotel! I loved out room and there heated pool and everything was clean. The only thing I wish was different,  if they had a hottub that would be awesome There contenintal breakfast is fruit and cereal with an charge if you want like eggs or something cooked. Other then that, I will definetly be staying again!!!
Manager Response: Glad to hear that you will be back. Love that our staff was able to help you out in your difficult situation. Come back again soon.

Summary: the staff was great and the room was cozy and charming, however, the ONLY thing i was unhappy with was the carpet in our room was so dirty it turned our bear feet BLACK and the arms on the sitting chairs were also lack with dirt.
Manager Response: We are happy that you enjoyed the staff and charm of our hotel but are also very sorry for the condition of your carpet. We will make sure to wash them immediately. We pride ourselves in the cleanliness of our rooms and are sorry that we did not live up to that standard.

Summary: Pros: price is cheap full kitchen including fridge in the room staff are nice (although we had to ask to re activate our card keys several times)  Cons: terrible breakfast!  small swimming pool without hot tub location is far from Anaheim's center and not much good restaurants in that vicinity
Manager Response: Thanks for the helpful feedback. Glad you enjoyed the full kitchen and room. We are unsure why your key cards would keep giving you issues. We are working with the restaurant to improve their service and selection.

Summary: If the wifi was better and my phone service wouldn't get blocked I would think about going back. If I did, I would make sure that the microwave and especially the toilet are clean  not just sanitized the outside. What is the point of sanitizing the outside and cover of the bowl if the inside has built up scum and germs.
Manager Response: Thank you taking the time to review our hotel and giving us helpful feedback. We are looking into the room issues you mentioned. Our hotel usually receives great remarks about our cleanliness and our sorry that you did not find your room at our best. We will use your comments to better our hotel.

Summary: Hotel Pepper Tree offered us a very great price for a charming, Spanish-style hotel in a great loaction of anaheim that is not too busy, but close to everything. Cheaper than a chain hotel, but offered a kitchen in every room, couches, chairs, a TV, a comfortable bed, and lots of room to get ready in the bathroom area. However, there is a larger than normal space between the bottom of the door and the ground, so it can be very loud in the room when people are walking in the hallways. Also, we stayed in room 301 which is right by the elevator and end of the hallway. This meant that everyone had to walk past our room to get to the elevator, which was noisy, AND the elevator was EXTREMELY loud when coming up and going down which kept me up at night and woke me up very early. I
Manager Response: So glad you will stay with us again. Thanks so much for the helpful feedback about the room and staff. We are in the process of improving all the doors to make them more sound proof. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Nice place to stay with my family. AC was rattling but I fixed it with some paper towels. Great price for the room. Friendly and helpful front desk staff. Baseboard heater kept turning on but it was on low so it didn't get too hot. Breakfast was ok for being free
Manager Response: Glad that you and your family enjoyed your stay. We are looking into the noise from the AC. We have recently updated all of the AC units in the rooms and are unsure why there was a rattling noise. We will use your comments to better our hotel. Thanks.

Summary: Hotel is about a 5 minute drive to knottsberry farm without getting on the freeway, which was great! Rooms have the kitchen which is very convenient. There's lots of closet space and the rooms have private balconies. The kids had fun in the big heated pool. The only thing I would like more of was the continental breakfast, I had to buy my own scrambled eggs! It would be better if it was a full breakfast. Thank you!
Manager Response: Thanks for the great and helpful feedback. Glad you enjoyed our central location and big rooms. We are working with the restaurant to help them improve their service.

Summary: We stayed for spring break and what you read in reviews for February and March are true.  The remodel was done very cheaply.  Our room also had a number of spiders that decided to join us.  The ceiling had water stains and the electrical is questionable.  However, it was the best option for what we paid for and the pool is nice.  The free breakfast was gross and pretty much gone at 8:30.  The beds were fine and considering we were not in the room much, it served its purpose.
Manager Response: Happy to hear that you found our hotel to be a good value. We appreciate your thorough feedback and are looking into all the things mentioned. We are working with the restaurant to improve their breakfast service.

Summary: We enjoyed our stay at peppertree hotel. Great service, clean and affordable. Someday we will return. Great location and my kids enjoyed the pool. We enjoyed our kitchen with everything that came with it
Manager Response: Thanks for the great the review! So glad you enjoyed the pool and room. Come back again soon.

Summary: Great time as always close to Disneyland.  Staff was nice, little nosy at night from above people but it was spring break for some kids to be expected.  Had fun will definitely stay again.  We come every year and we always stay here.

I wish it had a.  Jacuzzi That would have been great and the  Continental breakfast was the worst I've ever had we actually didn't even eat in that room we went to order food and it took an hour and a half and we just walked out before we even got served and went across the street and bought our own breakfast food and cooked it in our room which was a plus to have the kitchen I would stay here again

Me and the family are really glad to have started at this hotel. It saved us greatly from the first hotel we stayed at. Our stay was far greater than expected. We would definitely stay there again if we visited the area.

The hotel took very good care of us, it was our anniversary and they even brought us a bottle of wine and some chocolate. It was very very nice, and the room was Wayne. I would suggest getting a room on the opposite side of the building away from the pool, as the kids can tend to get a little loud at the pool. Otherwise it was a great stay.

Summary Heading: Base for Disney and LA Trip
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Pepper Tree during our holiday in California.  We liked what we saw!  Nice, lovely king size bed in a very spacious room, balcony view over looking the pool and West Lincoln Avenue, it ticked the boxes for us!  Great staff too - upon check in, there was a problem with our card (forgot to advise our card supplier we were travelling abroad!), however the staff were patient whilst this was all sorted out! Staff were also very knowledgeable with regards to the local area, things to do etc.  The only minor niggles were that in our room, the walls were paper thin, so we could hear every conversation the guests next door were having!  Also, the breakfast (at the restaurant next door), was not really to our liking. However, I must stress that this is a

At night light shines in the room from balcony. Drapes do not completely shield the room. No hot tub however heated pool was delightful. There is street noise from Lincoln Ave. if your room faces street.

Summary Heading: Only place I stay In Anaheim.
Summary: We've stayed here a dozen times or so. We've always been treated well, found the hotel, although on the older side, always well cared fore.  It is obvious that they take pride in keeping their guests well cared fore.

Adorable and spacious room, lovely terricotta tile. Didn't use kitchen, but would have been nice if I had needed it. . Would have preferred not to be on ground floor as other floors had balcony. Receptionist could be friendlier and breakfast lacked oatmeal and orange juice.

It was great value for the price. I like the theme and the design of the whole hotel. Room kitchen are great! Breakfast was great. Overall I would recommend it. It will be nice if they provided with complementary razor/ tooth paste. It comes in handy when someone (like me) checked in late straight from airport or work. Otherwise no major drawbacks.

We loved the hotel pepper tree.  It was super cute.  The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable.  It was an easy Uber ride to and from Disney. I love how unique it is. We had just come off of a cruise and it was nice to have room to breath.  The patio was great to enjoy a morning cup of coffee before heading off to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: The Nicest Room in the Disneyland Area For The Price
Summary: As a Disneyland Annual Passholder, I have stayed at many hotels in this area.  It's how I get to the park before it opens.  I have experienced many Disney area rooms.  This was by far the nicest room I have ever stayed in for this area.  Not only was the room crystal clean, but it had the most amazing decor, sort of a Spanish Mexican tile look. What made it even more amazing was the fenced in patio, sort of a private garden of your very own.  The beds were also very comfortable.  I must also give credit to Andy, the Front Desk Clerk, who was so very friendly and helpful.  For the price, you really can't do better than the Pepper Tree Inn when staying in the Disneyland area.

We were really surprised at how nice Hotel Pepper Tree was.  We loved all the antique, old yet characteristic furnishing.  Everything was really really clean.  We felt like we were in a studio apartment, and not a hotel.  It was comfortable and relaxing.  The only thing that was weird was having to go over to a restaurant to get our breakfast, which was okay for what it was.

Great, Clean, cheaper then Disneyland Property Hotels and has a full kitchen and I mean a stove/oven and full size refrigerator. So instead of forced to go spend a lot of money on a restaurant or eat none healthy fast food you can bring some stuff and cook a nice meal yourself.

It was comfortable.  There was chipped paint in the bathroom. The parking was forever away. We had to carry luggage a far distance. The breakfast was poor, ran out of food really fast.  Not enough tables to sit at. The tables were all dirty,  we had to clean them before sitting down. Poor part of town.

Summary Heading: Wanted to leave a positive review, but
Summary: We stayed the weekend of March 11th. Everything was fine and besides ants in the shower we were happy with our stay. My problem is this, After returning home to Las Vegas, I realized I had left my sandals in the room.( brand new) I immediately called the hotel and gave them my room number, I was placed on hold for a brief time and was happy to hear that housekeeping had turned them in. Hooray!! I told the guy on the phone I'm happy to pay to have them mailed to me. he took my information and said I would receive a call back the next day with the cost. The call was never made six days passed, I was half hoping I would just find them in my mailbox! So I called back Saturday. I spoke to a new guy, who confirmed that he saw notes about the shoes and wasn't sure why I wasn't

Average, beds were awfulully firm noisy outside too much outdoor light at night shower water cool not hot The coffee filter still had coffee grinds in it from the last people people were nice cxxxxxcxxccccccccccccccccc
Manager Response: Sorry that we did not meet your expectations and you did not receive our best during your stay. We will look into the issues you experienced during your stay.

Summary: Hotel Pepper Tree  was amazing. The fact they also had kitchen utensils stocked was very convenient for my family. The customer service was also incredible. Every member of my family loved the hotel and we would come here every time we come to California.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you will be coming back! Thanks for the amazing review!

Summary Heading: The Pepper Tree is:  'My Home Away From Home'
Summary: I do a lot of work in the Orange County area and have been searching for a hotel that was fairly priced, in the center of the area I am often scheduled to be in, and that was in a safe and secure location. I found all of that and more at Hotel Pepper Tree. The room I love, and request on a regular basis, is spacious, clean, and very comfortable. The patio is situated in such a way that privacy is guaranteed and street noise is minimized. The front desk staff - both AM and PM shifts were friendly, personable and very professional. Check-in/check-out was quick and efficient. And as long as I have work in OC - Hotel Pepper Tree will always be my first choice!
Manager Response: Wow! We love being your home-away-from-home! Thanks for the great comments and helpful feedback. We will see you again soon and have your room waiting for you!

Summary: This Location Was Great Customers Service Was Awesome Quick&Easy Check In... The Only Thing That Bothered Me Was Getting Rushed Out The Room At Check Out Time... I Am A HouseKeeper So I Know How Hard The Job Can Be But I Don't Feel Like We Should Have Been Called 5 Times & Have The Door Knocked On 3 Times...
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your stay and room! We are sorry about the confusion with your check-out time. We probably did not communicate with the housekeeping staff properly about your pre-arranged late check-out. We will make sure to fix this.

Summary: Horrible breakfast.Kitchen and the dishes were not clean.Love the decors in the room and in the hotel.I would defnitely come back if they improve in the above areas.Good location,good decors and reasonable rates.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to review the hotel. We are happy that you enjoyed the room and our rates. We will work with the restaurant regarding the breakfast and dishes.

Summary: We've stayed here on several occasions and have always had a great experience. Rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. The kitchenette with stove, microwave and full size fridge is perfect if you don't want to the expense of eating out every night. Front desk staff were always polite and helpful - and the reason you're probably in Anaheim, Disneyland, is about a five minute drive away.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great tips and feeback! We love to hear from our repeat guests!

Summary Heading: Affordable and close to Disneyland and Knotts
Summary: This hotel was very affordable. We stayed in Rooms 114 and 116, which were adjoining patio rooms at the end of the hallway facing Lincoln Ave. The patios gave us privacy and more quiet from street noise (though we had noisy people above us). We liked the size of the rooms and kitchen but there is no table and dining chairs. The king bed in 116 was rather hard; there was also a twin bed on a rolling frame in there too. The 2 beds in 114 were softer and more comfortable and had a couch. The outside patio was pretty. As for the breakfast, they had Hostess donuts, bread choices, fruit, yogurt and cereal. Very limited for food and not impressed with choices included. For good food options, take a right out of the hotel and head toward Knotts Berry Farm. A lot more choices for food
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the helpful tips. We are glad you enjoyed your courtyard rooms.

Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week during our Anaheim trip. Location was awesome, lots of restaurants close by and only a 10 minute drive from Disneyland and a 5 minute drive from Knott's Berry Farm. Staff was super nice, front desk very helpful and they let us check out an hour later. Wifi was awesome, comfy bed and room. Decor was cute and very rustic. Some complaints I had were that the breakfast was pretty low quality - no eggs or meat at all, just cereal. breads, and yogurt. Our oven in the kitchen wasn't working but everything else was fine - they include all the kitchenware so that made our life easier. My biggest issue was the bathroom.. we were on the third floor and on the second day we noticed some ants in the bathroom. They were tiny and didn't bother us.. but
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. We are happy you enjoyed your room and the convenient location of our hotel. We will look into your room immediately to make sure the oven is working properly.

Summary: I feel in love with the hotel when we first arrived.  I was not expecting a nice hotel with the price we paid for 4 days. The staff was amazing and very helpful. The rooms were very big with a full kitchen with essentials included like pots, pans, etc.  I loved the patio area with the fountain and it was very quaint hotel.  My party only included 2 people yet there was abundant places to sleep with the king bed and the twin size bed.  I will definitely be staying at this place again.
Manager Response: WoW! so happy you loved your stay. Thanks for the amazing review!

Summary: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel.  Very accomodating, late check-in and late check-out no problem.  Breakfast in restaurant next door, very easy. Staff was very helpful and nice.  Will definitely stay here again. Now won't stay anywhere else.  Thank you!
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you won't stay anywhere else but with us. Love to be your home-away-from-home!

Summary: The incidentals charge is a bit high. Still haven't gotten my $200 back. It's been more than a week. It was still a good stay. I like the balconies. It's not a great view but it's nice to be able to sit outside.

It was a pleasure to stay here. Our in room refrigerator was freezing or food we brought it up to the front desk he said he would look into it in the end we were reimbursed $20 for the loss of our food.

The bed was very uncomfortable, as were the sheets. The room was noisy (road traffic on one side, elevator on the other) and there was an inch gap between the door and the room. I didn't feel safe - the room key has a list of "safety tips" on it and I wish there were a chain or second lock on the door. The continental breakfast was dismal. There are no restaurants nearby except strip mall cuisine.    On the positive side, the front desk staff was very helpful, parking was easy and the WiFi was good. The room was spacious and clean.  I would stay here again if it were a necessity but it would not be my first choice.

The architecture is cute. It gives the building a warm/friendly atmosphere. We were on the first floor and enjoyed the patio with the vines on the walls and the table and chairs. The Breakfast was nice. And, because it is held in the restaurant in the parking lot, rather than an assembly room as many hotels use, it was nice to have the option of a warm, complete breakfast for a minimal upcharge. The staff was pleasant. Welcoming. The room does show it's age. Bath room vanity had been replaced with a cheap one. The bottom of the door was ragged. The mattresses were well worn and provided little support. So, a satisfying nights rest was lacking. But, generally, it was a pleasant experience. Average with a Motel 6 experience with the addition of a building having character.

Birthday was very nice the location is very nice next to the freeway for everything the beds were not so comfortable but everything else was very nice the staff was very nice the room was very nice and roomy next time we go we will definitely stay there again

Summary Heading: Nice and good for that Price
Summary: Breakfest on Plastik is not nice!!! There were two set of Honey, one was so old, that it stocks on the Bottom...but every day it was on the Table. Use your Brain.... Overall it was a pleasent stay. It was quite even on the Roadside. You should talk to your Customers, that not everyone like to smell Pot all the time...

The hotel was clean , in a good location, and staff was great, only thing to look down on was the parking, the restaurant in front was not that great and very unfriendly.but the overall experience was a great one
Manager Response: Glad you had a great experience at Hotel Pepper Tree! We will make sure to let the restaurant see your comments.

Summary: We stayed the 8 nights during our holiday in California. Hotel was clean and nice. Rooms were spacious and little kitchen was nice even though we did not have a use for it. Refrigerator kept quit loud noise time to time and also at night which wasn't so nice. Free parking was great and there were lot of free space to park at the back of the hotel. Breakfast was also nice, but we would have appreciated a slightly wider range of choice, because now the breakfast was exactly the same all the time during our 8 days stay. I would  definitely stay in this hotel again in the future because it's good value and had a great location near the main freeways.

I have stayed here multiple times.  I never get tired of the style of the rooms.  I think it is a type of southwestern motif, with large tile floors and in some of the rooms, rugs on the walls.  Also, the front desk attendants have gone out of their way to accommodate the requests I have made, often at the last minute.  I will definitely be staying there again when I have business in the area.

Very large rooms. I enjoyed the decor and the atmosphere of the room. We were put next to the stairs/elevator which caused some noise but that is to be expected at a motel. Overall we enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your stay and our boutique charm! Thanks for the helpful review.

Summary: This is our go to place to stay when visiting Disneyland. The rooms are clean, quiet, and roomy. It is a short  easy drive to Disneyland and the room rates are very reasonable. There is a kitchen if you want to fix your own meals. We have stayed here many times and had a good experience every time.
Manager Response: We love to hear from our repeat guests! Thanks so much for the helpful feedback. Can't wait to have you back soon.

Summary: I was very upset with the overall cleanliness of the Pepper Tree Hotel. Our tub had dirt inside it and I found a cockroach in the tub that was alive. I will not be returning to this hotel and will not recommend it to anyone else traveling to that area.
Manager Response: We are so sorry that there was a definite issue with your tub and think the roach must have come up from the drain. We are looking into this issue immediately and are so sorry that you did not receive our best. We wish you would have notified us when you were staying at the hotel so we could have helped you then.

Summary: Pretty nice place overall. Had to reschedule my business trip halfway through and staff were accommodating in helping with accommodations. Good place to relax while not out working. Only thing is that the beds might have been a bit on the hard side, but that's REALLY nitpicking.
Manager Response: So glad you found our hotel relaxing... even while visiting Anaheim for business. Hope you can come back for a real vacation soon!

Summary Heading: Not bad of a place to stay
Summary: I had the courtyard king. I booked it as a courtyard king. When I checked in and gave me the room, it came out as the courtyard queen. No problem though, they changed it immediately. No hassle. Good size room. Has a kitchen, and a courtyard/balcony. It's a good size for a family of 3 (wife, daughter, and myself). Driving distance to Disneyland, 10 mins away.
Manager Response: Glad you enjoyed our Courtyard Studios... they are the best! Thanks for the review.

Summary: Stayed here for just one night on the way home from San Diego to NorCal (boyfriend wanted to stop and see Medieval Times). Called to reserve a room for 2 adults + a dog, and ended up booking their King Studio (or King Suite?) at their recommendation for $110/night.  What a surprise-for that price the room was huge. King bed, twin day bed in the corner, couch & coffee table, small kitchen w/ full amenities, huge closet, lots of mirrors and place to get ready. The patio was huge too, with it's own little fountain and sitting area out there (we were on the ground floor, the balconies on higher floors looked smaller). The room was definitely older, but it was clean and kind of went with the southwestern/Spanish feel of the whole property.  If you don't need to be right next to
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the great review! All of our rooms do include the full kitchen. We appreciate the helpful feedback.

Summary: Just me and my son stayed hes 2 i took him to Disney land and the room felt just like home i loved the big window and baloney. my son loved it he had so much room to run around and customer service is awesome. Deffently staying here again.
Manager Response: So glad you and your son loved our hotel! Loved to be a home-away-from-home for our guests.

Summary: Do not go to this Hotel! They are rude and unfriendly. They have this rule that you can't leave your pets in the room alone at all, not even long enough to go to the front desk. If you're here on vacation or for work you can not take your pet everywhere you go. To make things worse they confused me with a prior guest. I had never stayed there before. I asked him to check his records. He insisted I had been there before and made problems. After he checked his records and found out I was telling the truth , instead of apologizing told me to check out. He had some workers take all my belongings a put them in the parking lot. Never will I go back or recommend this place
Manager Response: We are sorry that we were not a good fit for your needs. Due to the issues that were occurring, we could no longer rent you a room. Since you were not leaving your room, we did remove your items. This is a very, very rare occurrence at our hotel. Again we are sorry for how things worked out during your stay.

Summary: Despite many bad reviews I had a great stay at the hotel and would come back any time. The room was large had a fully equipped kitchen with microwave and fridge and a living area with couch and TV made a great impression.  The bed was a little hard yet acceptable.
Manager Response: We are so happy to exceed your expectations! We do have mostly positive reviews and our guests especially love the full kitchens. Thanks for the helpful feedback.

Summary: Only complaint was that the door to outside slammed every time it closed and our door was right next to it. So we were woken up early every morning by other guests coming or going.  There were all new appliances and the room was clean. The tile in the living space was a new thing for me and I had to wear slippers due to the coldness but the settup was great.
Manager Response: Thanks for the helpful review - we will look into the door noise immediately! Glad you enjoyed the hotel and the price.

Summary: If you have no need for solid wi-fi or hot water, then this is a nice place to stay for a few days. If you need reliable wi-fi and would like to take a hot shower, this is not the place for you. Thankfully we had our own hotspot for internet connection and we were told to let the water run until it turned hot, which took 10 minutes. For a State in drought conditions, this seemed excessive and not acceptable. We will not return to this hotel.
Manager Response: We are very sorry that you did not receive our best. We did have a WiFi issue occur during your stay that has now been fixed. Again, we are sorry for the issues that you experience and do hope you come again to see that those issues are not normal.

Summary: Good rates if you don't want to pay the prices of hotels closer to Disneyland. The lobby and walkways have very nice tile work. People at the front desk are very helpful. We had a problem with a large party using the pool after closing-one side of the hotel faces the pool and the noise traveled well. But I called down to the front desk, and they fixed it right away. Unfortunately, I think the same party got really loud around 1:00 a.m. ,banging doors, unfortunately on our floor. Again, I could hear hotel staff telling them they had to be quiet. This was definitely not the hotel's fault, it was just unfortunate. Also, there is a lot of road noise, but that's just how the hotel is laid out.  The neighborhood is mixed use, lots of dental clinics. There is a Subway sandwich across
Manager Response: Love to hear that we are a great value! We are sorry for the noise issues of the group during your stay. We do work very hard to make sure our family friendly hotel is quiet after 10pm. Thanks for the feedback.

Summary: This was my first time staying here and I enjoyed my stay. Loved how it has a full kitchen complete with all necessary items to eat. I enjoyed the balcony it came with and had a a great nights sleep in their awesome bed.
Manager Response: So glad you stayed with us! Hope you come back soon.

Summary Heading: Good choice for value and location
Summary: This is a cute hotel. The staff is friendly. The maid service was great. It was a little noisy on the weekend. There were people partying in the parking lot. Overall it was a good experience. I would return to this hotel.
Manager Response: So happy you will be back! Love to hear that we are a great value. Thanks for the great review.

Summary: My bf & I enjoyed this place so much. Mexican food right in front. A market across the street to cook in the lovely kitchen they provide. We felt like home the balcony we loved. Very clean & spacious.
Manager Response: So happy you felt at home and loved our boutique hotel! Thanks for the review.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for visits to local theme parks
Summary: I have stayed here a few times in the last year or two however in the last 6 months or so this has become my favorite spot to stay. It is clean and my girlfriend says that it is "cute" unlike some of the cookie cutter budget hotels. In fact this last visit I found myself in a room that I was in last year and found that it had been remodeled. Beds have always been comfy but the new AC was great and the kitchen & bathroom area looked great. This will now be my goto spot for this area.
Manager Response: Love to hear that we are you "go-to" hotel in Anaheim. We really enjoy hearing from our repeat guests. Thanks so much for the helpful feedback. Glad you enjoy the room updates.

Summary: I was traveling for business and looking for a good rate on a room and I ended up needing to book outside the recommended hotels for the group. I found the Hotel Pepper Tree which was "close" to the meeting location. I have never stayed at a "Boutique" hotel before and was not sure what to expect on arrival. It is just a few minutes from the freeway - great location.   I got to the hotel very early and was able to check in early (for a reasonable fee). Angel at the front desk was really friendly and great to work with during the check in process.    I was thrilled when I opened the door and saw my room. It was huge! It was very clean, well laid out. The kitchen was amazing (granite countertops anyone?!) the fridge was already cold, and it had all of the essentials. The stove
Manager Response: Wow!! Thanks for the great review. So glad we exceeded your expectations for a boutique hotel. Can't wait for you to be back.

Summary: An older hotel that has been upgraded.  Kitchen had everything you would need including dishes and utensils, pots and pans.  Full size refrigerator was a plus. Lighting in the room was a downgrade, it was dim. The TV had lots of channels, but it was an older TV with terrible contrast to the point some channels were not viewable. Staff was excellent and helpful. A nicely upgraded basic hotel.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the helpful feedback. So glad you enjoyed the full kitchen and our helpful staff. We will look into the TV issues you were experiencing immediately. We hope you come back soon.

Summary: This was a wonderful and truly beautiful place to stay for our honeymoon! The room was exactly what we asked for, the pool was great, and the staff were truly exceptional. Thank you so much Hotel Peppertree!
Manager Response: So honored to have you stay with us on your honeymoon! Thanks for the review.

Summary: Visited Disneyland on this trip. The Peppertree Hotel was 10 minutes from the park. Very nice hotel. The beds  were excellent and the room was very clean. Wi-Fi was fast and easy to hook up. It was a very quite area with no noisy hotel guests. Will definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: So happy you will be back! Thanks for the great review.

Summary: Good place to go with family; Very friendly and prompt service by the team in front desk... Its about 15 minutes drive from Disneyland.. I took one start out mainly for the flooring & it feels old.. All other things we really liked & will stay again..
Manager Response: Glad to hear that you will stay again with your family! Thanks for the review.

Summary: This is our 3rd time in the hotel. Staffing is very friendly and the hotel and the rooms are clean. Kitchen and kitchen tools are very poor quality. The noise level in the hallway can be high.  Location is pretty good and it is nice to have a supermarket closeby.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for being a repeat guest! We appreciate your helpful feedback. We will look into your kitchen and make sure it is up to our standards.

Summary: We had a piece of the flooring connection part missing and it was VERY sharp underneath. The beds could be more comfortable. We did switch rooms for a more comfy bed. That being said for the price we will return as it really works foreally us perfectly. The staff is always so nice! Andy was great!

We loved the decor! The staff was wonderful and room was clean and beautiful. I had issues with how HARD the bed was, we stayed in the King Suite. The "breakfast" was terrible. They used pre-bought bulk food for the breakfast. I looked for hours for a hotel with breakfast and it was a key point on my search, I was very disappointed. Instead of OJ, it was Sunny D, cheap store bought danish that they unwrap and put out, tiny bagels, the fruit looked unripe and gross. Also they offer a "hot" breakfast for more money. None of the surveys or info said it was extra!

Warm welcome.close to disneyland and shopping centre .Easy to find.we enjoyed our stay.Service was good.calling taxi no problem.Bathroom needs upgrade.should be no smoking area inside and balcony area

Hotel pepper tree was a good find. Not many hotels provide a fully stocked kitchen which we used everyday. The staff were very nice and provided excellent customer service. Overall it was a nice stay for a good price.

Not bad at all. Decent price and not far from disneyland which is why I stayed here. The people working there were nice and attended us fast. Free wifi and complimentary breakfast. I'd say the overall experience was very good.

Summary Heading: Family Disney spur of the moment trip.
Summary: I found this hotel to be a nice atmosphere.  The staff was excellent and very friendly.  We did not have the breakfast, so I am unable to comment on that.  We really enjoyed the room and like the fact that we had a kitchen to prepare and keep snacks.  The hotel is not right next to Disneyland, but it was a close enough drive.  The beds were soft and the room was clean.  Overall it was a great place for the money.

Love this Hotel! We've stayed here twice, and both times we've had positive experiences. It's very comfortable and clean. Full Kitchen is a great added bonus. Continental breakfast was good. Just a short drive to Disneyland. Grounds are very well maintained.

Lots of space. Large closets. Full kitchen. Great for families. Property is clean. Hotel located in a busy street. Supermarket, 7-11 steps away. You can order full breakfast, that is a plus. Bathroom tub was peeling and cracked. Carpet not clean. Upholstery needs to be redone. I would stay again but I would check cleanliness of the room first.

My daughter and I absolutely Loved staying here!! The Spanish theme, huge pots, tile floors and amazing Staff!  I loved the pool and the separate bathroom area.  We had a spacious closet and drawers for make us feel right at home.  The full kitchen was incredible, everything at our fingertips, Soo convenient and cozy.  We just absolutely love it here!!

Summary Heading: I'd love to stay again with some updates
Summary: There were positives and negatives to our stay at The Pepper Tree. First the positives. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Gas stove and oven very useful with kids. Full size fridge. 24hr corner store and hispanic grocery store across the street. Fan in the bathroom. Balcony for each room with smoking allowed. Literally 10 minutes from disneyland parking garage. Full closet Now for the negative. It seemed a little dirty, dusty. The continental breakfast was pretty bad even when we tired to order the paid breakfast it took so long we had to cancel. Wish they had a hot tub and the pool was open later than disneyland.

We enjoyed our stay.  It was comfortable and clean.  The bathroom was quite small and dated but did the job and the halls were a bit noisy but overall we enjoyed the quaintness and spaciousness and friendly service.

Cute little hotel for families going to Disney or other attractions in the area.  My son and I stayed there for two nights and it was quiet and nice.  It is a few miles from Disney, but not a far drive and saves a lot of money with all the parking and other fees the places right next to Disney charge.  There is a full kitchen in the rooms and a lot of storage if you need it.

Only 15 min away from the Convention Center and an easy drive. Free parking was a plus. Did not take advantage of the breakfast, so cannot comment on that. I would stay here again if I return to the area.
Manager Response: So happy that we were a great fit for your trip to the Anaheim Convention Center. We do hope you come back to Anaheim soon.

Summary: It was great all the comforts of home and the best staff accommodating your every need. My great dane was treated like a king in a castle, they definitely are pet friendly. Thank you!! It was well enjoyed.
Manager Response: Glad your whole family enjoyed their stay! ;)

Summary Heading: Older hotel but great staff. Beware of outside smoking
Summary: This review is for room 315 that was rented for two days in February.  We visit Disneyland often- sometimes at the last minute and usually try and find a hotel at a good price via Trip Advisor. Location to the park isn't too important to us since we usually drive and have free parking included with our season passes.  This hotel seemed to fit the bill nicely- good price, free breakfast, not too far away and great reviews on TA.  Well, unfortunately, it wasn't a good fit for us for the primary reasons:  -Older hotel- poor window/door seals- you can hear everything outside and from the hallways  -Hard tile surfaces with huge grout lines seemed dirty  -Housekeeping failed to properly clean our bathroom- ceiling had 10-20 hairs on it and dust galore in the stall. In addition, the

The vibe was fantastic, the workers were great, I loved the scenery, and the hotel room was awesome. The breakfast the hotel provided wasn't that good but the sea food place right up front was great. Very close to Disney and highly recommended hotel.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the recommendations! So glad you enjoyed our hotel and staff. Thanks for the helpful feedback.

Summary: Building architecture is Colonial-Spanish; white stucco with black iron ornaments.  Floors are polished stone and the woodwork is dark-stained and rough-cut.   Lobby and corridors are decorated with antique tables, vases, and large earthen jars. Staff is very friendly and accommodating.   Rates are excellent, considering the location - near Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you enjoyed our boutique charm! Thanks for the great review. Come back again soon!

Summary: As we entered noticed the sliding door wide open. We realized why as the smell was pretty bad inside. We paid for the hotel but did not stay the night. We left immediately. The place is very old and not in a good area. We were looking for a clean place but this was not it

Its a quite like hotel, We have stayed there before and we will stay again. I wish they had a hot tub but I like that the pool is open late. The kitchen has all the basics, we always pack our food do to dietary needs and love having a full kitchen. The hotel is dated but not bad. I love the private patios. The breakfast is nice too.

This was my second time here in the hotel. It was really close to many amenities and It was a pleasure to stay for 4 nights here. I was there with my family and We had a great time in the area. Disneyland is only 2 miles away.

Very good wifi. Basic breakfast. Good size room.  I was in an older room.  The a/c was loud which made it hard to sleep.  The remodeled rooms have quiet a/c. I will stay here again.  Very nice and helpful staff and manager.

We had a room at the end of the hall by the outside stairs. Every time someone went up or down the stairs, the whole room would shake like it was an earthquake! Also, the beds are old and bouncy. Every time my husband rolled over, it woke me up. Please invest in newer beds with 'do-not-disturb' mattresses. The tile in the entire hotel is terra-cotta and very noisy if someone rolled their bag down the tile instead of the carpet runner. The fountains on the property run all night, so if you don't like the constant sound of running water, don't stay here or make sure you have earplugs with you. On the positive side, the grounds were nicely kept, and housekeeping was well done. We didn't get to use the pool, but it looked nice, too. The staff was helpful and courteous.

Everything was perfect. The staff was really nice. The room was very the hotel was really nice. The room was nice big and clean. I will book this hotel the next time I come to Anaheim. I would recommend this place to anyone

Room was ok, you get what you pay for. Front desk staff very friendly, excellent customer service. Great location, near anything you will need. ie, stores, shopping, restaurants knott's berry farm....

Summary Heading: You definitely get what you pay for...
Summary: When you arrive at the hotel it looks nice. Ponds around the premesis are gross and green. The rooms are average, beds aren't the greatest. AC unit turned on and off all night long seemed like It wasn't working right. One night I could hear someone going thru the trash clanking bottles looked out the sliding glass door and there was a guy going thru the garbage cans in the back. Called the front seat for almost an hour with no luck of reaching anyone. Then the next night our belligerently drunk neighbors were as loud as they could possibly be for hours after 2am so team no sleep for us. Other than this the hotel is average and the quiet hours don't mean anything here. Will be trying another hotel next time. Two starts for friendly workers.

But... The kitchen needed some work. I don't feel like all the utensils were there to make any real use of it. There were pots but no pans (we wanted to make pancakes for breakfast), and knives but no spatula. In addition only one burner on our stove top would ignite, at that point we wouldn't have been able to cook our planned breakfast anyway. This was the only issue I had though. The service was perfect, the employees really jumped for you whenever you needed something. The room was beautiful and accommodating and we were easily at home. I would love to stay there again but this time with proper expectations for the kitchen.

I cannot stop talking about how wonderful my experience with this hotel was.  The excellent service started even before confirming my reservations.  I called the front desk and spoke with Angel who answered all my questions and even checked the room for make sure the cable was working.  (Odd request, I know.)  The room rates are incredibly affordable.  The hotel is SO CUTE and extremely well maintained.  We cooked a full meal in the kitchen and it had everything we needed.  The pool was clean and family friendly.  The Uber ride from the hotel to Disneyland was only $8.  I cannot wait to have an excuse to say at Hotel Pepper Tree again.

Summary Heading: Great Place for a Great Price
Summary: Went here for Valentines Day and the customer service was amazing, they put out a box of chocolates and a balloon, the kitchen was great although I wish they had a larger average sized pan. All of the amenities were awesome and the Kind bedroom with outdoor private patio was absolutely fantastic. Would definitely come back again!

Sets the tone of being on vacation as soon as you step into the lobby. My 5 year old kept wanting to leave Disney to go back to the hotel. The restaurant has great food. It was our second visit and we will return.

good place to relax after Disneyland.we enjoyed a lot for 2 days. Best one is that it has kitcken having all untesil. i recommend this hotel highly. near drugstore,walmart as well. parking is free and many spaces.

As soon as we walked into the room we were impressed by the huge sliding glass doors and the beautiful plants in the patio (we were on the first floor). Love the layout, the tile, and the storage space.   I can't wait to come back again!

10 mins from Disneyland - cute hotel with excellent amenities at reasonable prices. Good size rooms with kitchen area. Excellent choice for a small family without breaking the bank. I will definitely consider staying here in the future.

The room was private, clean, spacious. The patio was great. The Spanish floor tiles are beautiful. The movie posters in the hallway totally interfere with the natural Spanish decor the hotel has. They looked tacky next to the beautiful vases and tile. Whoever put the movie posters up has no idea about design themes. The bed spread was too thin; but the rest of the room was great. We took are daughter to Knotts Berry Farm and were very close by. The only bummer was there was no jacuzzi. Staff was very nice.
Manager Response: Thanks for the helpful feedback! So glad you enjoyed your room and the friendly staff.

Summary Heading: Nice Spanish Themed Hotel in Buena Park/Anaheim Area
Summary: This hotel is quiet and located nicely between Knott's, Disneyland, and a large shopping area with plenty of restaurants, stores, and a large movie theatre.  Parking is free and the price is right.  The room was spacious and clean.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review! Glad you enjoyed our convenient location.

Summary: One night stay.  Reserved on line and was ready when I got there.   Not brand new but clean and maintained well.  Comfortable beds and home like feel. Would of liked to stay one more day and use the pool.
Manager Response: Hope you can come back again! Glad you enjoyed your quick stay.

Summary Heading: Quick trip to visit family in Anaheim
Summary: Had to make an unplanned trip to visit family in Anaheim. Found Hotel Pepper Tree on Tripadvisor at the last minute. What a find!  Clean rooms, very comfortable beds, private balconies, helpful & friendly staff, convenient location. Best of all reasonable price. What more could you ask for?  Highly recommended!

The Hotel was well kept and staff was very nice. The kitchen was in need of a remodel. I'm not sure how old the microwave was but it barely would heat anything. There was 2 forks, 3 knives, and 2 spoons in the drawer. Same amount of plates and glasses. We would stay there again but know what else we need to pack for using the kitchen.

We visit Disneyland every few months, and this is the best value in town. The surrounding area is not terrific, but it's only 10 minutes from the park, and there is plenty of free parking. Plus, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and I LOVE having a full kitchen. My son is disabled, and this kitchen is great for his special dietary needs. Also, the Wifi is significantly faster than the last time I visited.

Everything was perfect. Very clean and comfy. Love the decorations. Kitchen in the room had everything you need to cook. The outside of hotel is clean. Pool is clean and relaxing. Felt like being at home. Definitely would stay again.

I would definitely stay here again. I really liked the room. It's more like a mini-suite, with a couch, coffee table, big screen TV, kitchen, extra bed and the patio outside the huge sliding glass door was nice.

Stayed one night with wife and daughter. Place is clean and comfortable enough. Kitchen is nice if staying longer. double queen beds and nice enclosed patio outside sliding doors. Continental breakfast is ok.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. Happy that your stay was comfortable and that you enjoyed the full kitchen.

Summary: I don't know if our room was an example of the rest of the facility, but it needs maintainance work done by a professional. There is cracking around the bathtub, with what appears to be mold in it. There is paint on the tile that is starting to crack and flake off. The kitchen remodel was definitely not done by a carpenter.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations. We will have our maintenance staff review the room and make sure any issues are addressed immediately. We are updating our rooms and kitchens throughout the hotel. Again, we are sorry that room was not what you were expecting.

Summary: I really enjoyed the atmosphere, it was good experience. If I would return to that city, I would choose this hotel if the price is right. The bed was comfortable and I like the style of the room and patio. It was nice.
Manager Response: So glad you will be back on your next visit to Anaheim! Thanks for the great review.

Summary: Nice and Comfy Hotel.Everything was neat and tidy.Kitchen had the complete amenities.Very friendly staff.I would highly recommend this hotel to visitors visiting nearby Disney and other areas of Los Angeles.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the recommendations! We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay and room. Come back again soon.

Summary Heading: Best at the Expedia Rate. expensive in a pinch
Summary: At $79 a night through Expedia, it was an awesome deal with many amenities and cleaner than expected for the price.  Thanks to Snowzilla and two extra nights on the West coast, the first of which was at the Pepper Tree at $179!  Full pop, ouch!  I guess when they know they have you on a layover there is little choice but that's true most everywhere.  I was still grateful to be able to get a room at the same hotel on a days notice due to the storm.  As long as you book ahead you'll be fine.   The hard surfaces and high ceilings in the room made the first floor occupancy a bit noisy when the upstairs neighbors came home at night.  Try to stay on the top floor.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. Glad you enjoyed all of our amenities. Our rates are always best when you book directly and will vary depending on the dates. Thanks for the helpful feedback.

Summary: Very nice hotel rooms are awesome everything you need to enjoy a comfortable stay away from home with a loved one or family, very friendly staff and very accommodating would recommend to anyone looking for a nice local hotel for a quick getaway or lengthy one for whatever the occasion.
Manager Response: We love being called a gem. Thanks for the review. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: I love this place every one is so nice i used to stay alot back in the day so nice and quiet  i will come more offten i know there alot of hotels are not like pepper tree its so nice i will be back real soon
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind words! Come back soon.

Summary: My stay for 5 nights was great.  My room was a great size, bed was very comfortable, Bathroom had a good shower/tub, Room had good size kitchen. The front desk workers are Great, A+ and very helpful. Housekeeping was great too A+. Great Location very close to Disney Land, stores, restaurants and highway. The Hotel had plenty of parking. I would stay again,clean,economical & simple.
Manager Response: Thanks so such a great review! So happy to hear that your stay was great in every way possible.

Summary: My family are avid Disney guests and our favorite hotel to stay at is Hotel Pepper Tree! We love that it has a kitchen so we can cook our own meals and we love how clean it is. We will definitely be coming back to stay!
Manager Response: So glad that you will be back!! Thanks for the review.

Summary Heading: Nice place for an extended stay
Summary: I have always wanted to try this hotel and due to leaving early for our Disney trip we needed A last minute hotel. This hotel has a great old southwest feel, the decoration are so cute.  Rooms are spacious with a small kitchen to include dishes, stove, fridge, coffee pot and toaster. There is a nice sitting area and the bathroom in a separate part of the room.  Stairs are a bit scary on both ends of the hotel and the one elevator can be a wait at times. Staff was very friendly and we did not try the breakfast nor the pool.  The only draw back was the distance to Disneyland but if you are in town for a longer period to visit several locations I would recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thanks for your recommendations! We are glad that you were able to stay at our hotel. Thanks for the great and helpful feedback.

Summary: You can tell that this place has its own charm, over all. You can tell that it's very thoughtful when it comes to the design.  It's definitely on top of its star rating despite somethings that might be a big deal for some people.
Manager Response: So happy you found our boutique hotel charming! Thanks for the review.

Summary Heading: Mammoth Club Volleyball loves the Pepper Tree!
Summary: We love staying at the Pepper Tree. We wish there was a jacuzzi and a frying pan in the kitchens! We also miss the Queen Suites with the double pull out couches. They worked well for our team. We also love that Vallarta Market is right across the street!
Manager Response: Thanks so much, Mammoth Club Volleyball! We love your visits too. We are happy to hear your requests. We do have frying pans in all the rooms and will double check yours. We will see you again next year.

Summary Heading: Beautiful little place to stay at
Summary: This hotel is decorated very cute. After check in the front desk called to make sure everything was OK. They also wanted to make sure I knew how to use the air conditioning system. Very nice and friendly staff. The rooms are great. I will definitely be staying here in the future. Great location, great staff, and awesome pricing!
Manager Response: Love to hear that you will be back!! Thanks for the review.

Summary: the first time i went here was October of 2015 to go to universal studios and even with the drive the room was worth it for the money i saved being about 129$ and then just recently January of 2016 i went here and went to Disneyland and i wasnt disappointed but i have to say i liked my first room which was facing away from the parking lot of the hotel was nicer then the room facing towards the hotel parking i got here in january
Manager Response: So happy that you came back! We will make sure to put a note in your file of your room preference. Thanks for the review. We love to hear from our repeat guests.

Summary: My family really enjoyed our stay at the Pepper Tree. My only complaint is that they did not follow the "towel reuse" policy and replaced our towels even though they were hanging. Otherwise, excellent.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! So glad you enjoyed your stay. We will make sure to follow up with our housekeeping staff about the towels. Thanks.

Summary: Breakfast consisted of toast, dry bagels, little Debbie donuts, minimal fruit, cereal, and tang. Hotel is very old. Popcorn ceilings, old fridges, and stoves. No hot tub, pool was ok, but the water is not heated. I would not stay here again.
Manager Response: Thanks for the helpful feedback. We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations. Our pool is heated year round to the required temperature. We do provide a free continental breakfast and the restaurant also has many hot breakfast options.

Summary: Usually love staying here but our last visit wasn't too great. Wasn't notified of the not able to pay cash upon arrival policy so wasted our next morning running around looking for a bank and missed our dining with the characters experience. There was some garbage left over in our room from the last guests. And all of our drinks froze from the refrigerator on our last day so our kids were unable to drink their soymilk.
Manager Response: We are sorry that you did not get our best during your last stay. We hope that you talked with the front desk during your stay but will also try to speak with you directly regarding your experience. Again we are sorry for the inconveniences you experienced.

Summary: Very nice hotel although I think they advertise that they are closer to Disneyland than they actually are. The fridge in the room was so noisy that we had to disconnect it and the fountain below our room kept me awake too. Pity, because it was a really nice hotel with lovely staff. Probably won't stay again as too far from Disney and other amenities.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed our hotel and staff. We are located 3.5 miles away from the Disneyland Mickey and Friends Parking structure which is what we tell our guests and what is on our website. We do hope you try us again.

Summary: I needed a place to stay while attending the NAMM convention at the Convention Ctr. For me, it wasn't a problem that it was a few miles away, and the bang/buck was considerably better, as a result of not being next door. A good trade-off for me!
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! We love to hear that we are a great value. Glad you enjoyed your stay during NAMM.

Summary: Wifi was horrible. I was unable to connect and service desk guy couldnt figure it out. He was very helpful. Parking was okay. I didnt know there was parking in back. Breakfast was average. Room was great
Manager Response: We are sorry that you had issues with the WiFi. Have since fixed the issue that causes problems during your stay. We are happy that you enjoyed your room. Thanks for the helpful feedback.

Summary: The staff was amazing, helping out continuously, they even gave me hot cocoa because I was feeling sick. Will definitely return. Disney is 10 minutes away and getting around is quite easy.  Thanks for everything
Manager Response: Love to hear about the staff taking care of you during your stay! Thanks for the great review.

Summary Heading: Great little gem of a hotel!
Summary: The room felt like we were in our own private villa.  The patio was private with a lush garden scene and tranquil fountain.  The room was spacious with a little living room and kitchen.  Great Mexican restaurant in it's parking lot.  Located close enough to Disneyland / Convention center.

Everything was good. The only draw back was the noise of other's entering and leaving their rooms, doors slamming kept us up. The road noise was a problem too but that is not something the hotel has control over, just a heads up for those first timers like us. The property is nice and the staff very helpful and friendly.

The place was nice overall.  I needed wifi for business and the wifi was never really on.  It took 20 minutes to get a simple e-mail done.  Front Desk says - I'm sorry we know we have bad wifi.  The trip to the Anaheim Convention center by car is 20 minutes away and $11.00 by Uber do they quote that wrong.  The place is really nice for families and we did enjoy the stay overall.  I used $40.00 for personal hotspot to be able to have wifi.  The rates were higher then because of the convention, almost double the normal rates, so adding the extra Uber and Hotspot charges was not really in my budget this time.  We probably will not stay again and find accomodations directly at the convention center area.

Everything about this stay was fantastic. Loved the bed and all of the kitchen was such a delightful surprise so with the help of the Mexican market across the street, we made some quesadillas during our night in. It's located in a fantastic spot. The only problem is the parking but it's fine if you look around because it's all still close to the entrance. Anyways, I will be returning. Great stay for a perfect price!!
Manager Response: Love to hear that you had a great stay for a perfect price! Thanks so much for the great review. We do have lots of parking on both sides of the hotel.

Summary: We stayed at Pepper Tree because I had been there once before.  The interior is lovely, despite it being right on Lincoln Ave. (A busy street) So, a change not to my liking was serving the continental breakfast in the seafood restaurant next to the hotel.  Walking outdoors and around did not feel home like.  And it smells like a seafood restaurant.  Not good.  Will pass next time.

We stayed there for 2 weeks and i think we would recommend it to our friends and family. It is well centrally located near Disney, Knott farm and most malls in Anaheim. The rooms are cozy with good view of the street. I would however recommend that continental breakfast is changed to something fancy but not the same items all year round. The staff need also to be a little courteous being in  hospitality industry. Even with the drought notice, our beddings were not changed until after 1week. This can be improved. I will definitely visit next time and also recommend it
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the review. We are glad that you will recommend us to your friends and family. We are sorry that your sheets were not changed earlier. You must have had the "do not disturb" sign on the door when it was scheduled. All bedding is scheduled to be changed every 4 days unless a special request is made to the front desk.  Thanks also for the helpful comments about the continental breakfast. In addition to the standard items in the continental breakfast, there are several great breakfast meal options available for $5.99 at the restaurant.

Summary: I will always stay here when I visit Anaheim, nice quiet location, really close to Knott's Berry Farms and Buena park. I cannot wait to bring my daughter here for the experience, she's gonna love the turtles at the pool and everything being so centralized
Manager Response: Glad you will be back with your daughter! We love our "Spitting" turtles too. Thanks for the review.

Summary: The room was very nice and comfortable - so comfortable I bought my pillow! Thank you, Natalie, for making that arrangement. The continental breakfast at the little restaurant in the front is a great idea. A quick bite and we were on our way to Disneyland.
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your stay and your pillow!! Come back again soon.

Summary: This was a great hotel and close to the parks. The only thing I would change is that there is no spa everything else was great, but a hot tub would have made it better. The staff was friendly, but the breakfast was not much to brag about, I did order a burrito at the restaurant and it was delicious (but not free).
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your review and helpful feedback. Glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and our location to Disneyland.

Summary: Great place to stay if you are headed to Disneyland and other adjacent theme parks.   Pros include cost, comfort and customer service.   Cons include distance to Disneyland and breakfast amenities (not sure if restaurant is affiliated with Hotel Pepper Tree). Review of the restaurant that serves the breakfast: The people who maintain the breakfast facility seem like they all hide in the back kitchen and are not able to keep up with customer's who would like to order breakfast or when food needs to be replenished. When you are able to order breakfast, the food takes over 45 minutes to prepare and be served. Not a good option when you need to drive to the park to beat the crowd.   Overall - Hotel Pepper Tree is an excellent facility to stay in if you have a family visiting the
Manager Response: We love to be your home away from home! Thanks for the feedback. We will make sure that the restaurant sees your comments. We will work with them to better their customer service.

Summary: Awesome and amazing. better than the pictures give credit. Not the quality of a Marriot or Embassy suites but for under $90 or even $100 a night it is definitely above the rest. Great customer service, location, parking and room size w/ courtyard
Manager Response: Thanks for your amazing review! We appreciate the helpful and great feedback.

Summary: We travel to Anaheim about once a month January-May for volleyball tournaments. We appreciate the kitchen in the room, the proximity (across the street) to a grocery store, and other inexpensive meal options. We have utilized the pool area and enjoy that as well. We will stay at Peppertree each time we travel!
Manager Response: We love your repeat visits! Thanks for being such loyal customers to Hotel Pepper Tree. Can't wait to see you again soon.

Summary: I have stayed at the Hotel Pepper Tree several times a year over the past 5 years and can say that my experiences have been consistently good.  It may not be the newest or the fanciest hotel in the area, but it is clean, and comfortable.  A restaurant in the parking lot and a market across the street coupled with the kitchen in the room add convenience and  flexibility to my stays.  The staff has always been friendly and efficient.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments! We love to hear that we have been a consistently good choice your trips to Anaheim! Come back again soon.

Summary: My boyfriend and I like coming here because it's relatively close to Disneyland and it has a kitchen. The rooms are decent but our couch was broken and the wifi wasn't working. Wasn't a big deal for us and we will continue to visit.
Manager Response: We are glad that you will return. We are sorry for the WiFi issues that you experienced and have fixed the problems we were having and improved our service throughout the hotel. Thanks so much for the helpful feedback.
