Manager Response: Thank you, Thank you! Come back again soon.

Summary: It is a quite room, clean, and bigger room than expected.. Overall it is a nice place to stay to escape the crowds around Disneyland. Shopping options close by it is a short distance to drive to Disney. Only complain I had is the free wifi was very bad. My i phone wouldn't connect and when it did ran slow..but it wasn't the end of the world..
Manager Response: So happy you will return! We love to hear when guests enjoy our large rooms. We will look into the WiFi issues you were experiencing - that is not a normal issue. Thanks for the feedback.

Summary: This hotel was not too shabby at all. It was an inexpensive room for my weekend away with my husband, but didn't have any "frills". For the price, it was ok. I think next time we may try to stay somewhere else though.
Manager Response: Thanks for the feedback. Happy to hear that the price was right for your birthday getaway.

Summary Heading: Great stay ruined by a bad breakfast
Summary: everything was great about this hotel even without having a spa or hot tub except the so called continental breakfast- which insulted us with leftover cakes from the bakery with the attempt to upsell us a real breakfast for $5. Of course, with the family with me, we were forced to upgrade and when that came, it was mediocre at best, and we all left hungry.
Manager Response: We are very sorry for your poor experience at the restaurant. We just finalized a change of ownership which will mean a much better breakfast experience for our guests. We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed the hotel. We hope you come back again!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, wont find one nicer for this value.
Summary: Excellent hotel, wish we would've been able to stay a little longer, but we definitely will be back.  The room was very nice, not a Five star by any means, but still has that wow factor.  Hope to be back soon.
Manager Response: Wow! Thanks for the great review. We are excited for you to return!

Summary Heading: Will visit next time in Anaheim
Summary: We like almost everything about this hotel. Rooms are spacious, well furnished, beds comfortable and the hotel is generally quiet. Handy having the kitchen and the little courtyard was relaxing. But the continental breakfast was a real letdown. Plastic cutlery, hardly any choice. We'd still visit again, just not bother with breakfast.
Manager Response: Happy to hear that you will visit again.  You will be happy to know that our continental breakfast will be greatly improved during your next visit. We are making major changes with the adjoining restaurant. Thanks for your feedback.

Summary: This hotel is always a nice stay.My husband and I tend to go to the area quite a bit during the year, and we always stay at this hotel. It is quite, the staff is always pleasant, and the rooms are clean. Great for a quick get a way, or a long trip.
Manager Response: Thanks for the feedback! We always love to hear from our repeat guests. Can't wait for you to be back again.

Summary: I love this hotel, however; the only problem I did have is the door lock. My three and one year old could easily open the door and that was a problem for me. I believe the Hoyle doors need another bolted or a latch at the top of the door so little ones are not able to get out.

My fiancée and I stayed at this hotel for four nights on our Disneyland vacation. The reviews online were amazing, which is why I booked the hotel. The hotel is close to the park, approximately 1.7 miles away and is easy to find. It's also in a quiet area. Upon arrival, the staff was nice and we had an issue with our room having a king bed instead of the requested two queens but it was resolved immediately. The beds were decent. Everyone who writes reviews saying the beds were amazing because of the pillow tops are crazy. These beds have an egg crate on top - nothing special. The bathroom is tiny and barely has any room to fit. It was very nice to have a full kitchen though. The breakfast in the morning though is a joke. It's held at the restaurant in front of the hotel called
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to write a review. Glad you found our front desk staff nice and helpful. We are in the process of changing ownership of the restaurant on property and revamping our continental breakfast. We are using your feedback to better our hotel -thanks!

Summary Heading: Run down hotel disguised as environmental friendly
Summary: The hotel is uncleaned, but we were told that it is trying to be 'green'. That means they don't clean the room unless you tell them. I think it is an excuse to save money. Thr result is poor condition room. My wife and I did not sleep well because it felt like bed bugs or something were biting us all night. We booked for 5 nights but left after the 4th knowing that we would not get credit for the last night. The front desk staff was very helpful to help us picked the best room and gave us what the maid missed everyday.
Manager Response: We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations but are glad that to hear that the front desk did offer you great customer service. We do provide daily housekeeping service to all of your guests, but we do not change the sheets daily unless specifically asked. Most guests do give us good feedback about the cleanliness of our rooms and our housekeeping service. We are sorry that you did not have this experience. We are also sorry that you did not tell us of your early departure. We would have made sure to refund you immediately. Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.

Summary: I was pleasantly surprised when I got to the hotel...it was a charming rustic style place with a balcony to enjoy watching the night appear. The kitchen was adequately furnished and there was a market across the street.  All in all I had a very nice stay.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review! Happy to hear that you enjoyed our boutique style and that we exceeded your expectations.

Summary: Love almost everything.  Kitchen made easier w family The place was very nice only complaint is that the staff at front desk when arrived we extremely rude.   The rooms were clean and we'll maintained.  Pool was wonderful
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear that you will come back. We are so sorry for any issues you experienced with our front desk staff. While usually receive great comments regarding your customer service, we will make sure they see your comments and will try to improve our guest service. Thanks for your feedback.

Summary: Front desk very helpful, maids friendly. Breakfast was average, but you can upgrade for $5.00, you can't go wrong. The cost for a pet was a bit high, $25.00 per day X 3. There's a bakery, subway (sandwiches), market across the street, with a small strip mall next to the market.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great feedback. We are happy that you enjoyed our hotel and the convenience of the local area. Come back soon!

Summary: The staff was wonderful, & we got more than we expected in our room. Also woke up late, and asked to check out 30 minutes early. They generously gave us a bit over an hour without cost, or without anyone rushing us out. Very nice gesture!
Manager Response: So happy to hear about your wonderful experience. Thanks for the review!

Summary: We'd been guests at the Pepper Tree once before, and returned when we came to town for Star Wars Celebration.  The accommodations were nice again, and we had no major problems.  One gripe is that housekeeping threw out nearly-new bars of soap that we had left on the bathroom sink and replaced them with new ones... We don't really (nobody needs, in fact) a new bar of hand soap every day.... save yourselves some money and only replace them if asked or when a guest checks out.  Also note, don't plan on their "light continental breakfast" as your morning meal unless you routinely skip breakfast -- it's bad.... very bad. Even being free, we couldn't do it.
Manager Response: Thanks for coming back to our hotel again! We will make sure to talk to the housekeeping staff about the issue you had with the soap. We are making some big changes with the restaurant and our continental breakfast soon. Thanks for the feedback.

Summary: I really enjoyed the ambiance and Spanish feel of the property. It's always nice to stay in a place that has a kitchen in the room when you have kids! I do wish the bedding was a little heavier or there were more blankets available in the closet...it was a sheet and two thin blankets. LOTS of comfy pillows though! Also when we arrived a little after 2pm (check in is at 2pm which is great most hotels are later check in times) they put us in a room RIGHT next to a room they were remodeling and when my  husband went downstairs to talk to the front desk and ask when they would be done with construction because our kids need to take a nap after a long day at Disneyland the front desk made it seem like it wasn't that big of a deal and didn't even offer us another room.... Construction
Manager Response: Thanks for the feedback. We are glad that you will stay with us again. We are very sorry that the front desk did not do more to accommodate your situation. We are glad that overall your stay was great.

Summary Heading: Charming Hotel with an Amazing staff
Summary: I had a last minute window off of work and decided to take a spontaneous trip from Maui with my 5 year old little girl to visit Disneyland. We booked a room at the Hotel Pepper tree after seeing the positive reviews on TripAdvisor, the charming photos, the proximity to Disneyland and the unbeatable price. We were not disappointed. The hotel and room had personality & charm. But what makes the place is the staff and the little thoughtful touches. Silly little things like full ice trays in the freezer welcomed us from our late arrival. The front desk was never bothered; they were compassionate and understanding whenever we needed anything. The best part by far was the subtle attentiveness of the housekeeping staff. I travel a lot for work and am fortunate to get to stay in 5 star
Manager Response: Wow! Thanks for the great review. We will make sure to tell the housekeeping staff how much you enjoyed their detailed and thorough service. We are so happy you enjoyed your little get-away and our hotel.

Summary: Wonderful place....  I would stay again in a heartbeat when there.  I like that you allow smoking on the deck since the hotel is no smoking.  Parking lot lit well.  It was hard to find the front door after parking when dark.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you will stay with us again. Thanks for the great feedback. We will make sure to better light the front entrance.

Summary: I expected more. The grounds were littered with trash. Computer mouse, general garbage, shopping carts, and more. The room was very outdated. Like an old Mexican restaurant. There was a live cockroach in the room. I killed it with my sandal. No screen on the sliding door. Would not stay here again. Needs a big update.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are very sorry that we did not meet your expectations and will immediately look into all the issues you mentioned. Most of our guests enjoy our grounds and rooms, and we are sorry that you did not have the same experience.

Summary: Overall it was okay. I wasn't so excited about the room. The mirrors had parts where it was chipped off, has nasty brown spots, the walls were dirty in some spots... There was a door right by the beds that led immediately to another door- don't know if it was for the room next door... 😳 they claim to give free breakfast- but they only give toasted bread & cereal, & have a couple pastries... Not so great. If you wanted to upgrade to eggs, French toast, pancakes- you had to pay. Which was ridiculous. I've paid $30-$60 less for beautiful hotels in San Diego by the bay that had it all! That I was completely satisfied & worth every dime. But pepper tree- not so much.
Manager Response: Thanks for the feedback. We are sorry that we did not quite meet your expectations. We are currently working with the restaurant to better their service and the continental breakfast selections. We hope that you will come again the next time you visit Anaheim.

Summary: Nice clean hotel. Friendly and helpful. Love the full kitchen. Helped with saving money on eating out. Loved the home away from home feel! Not too far from Disney but far enough for the affordable stay.
Manager Response: We love being a home-away-from-home for our guests. Thanks so much for the feedback. Glad you found us clean, helpful, and friendly. Come back soon!

Summary: It's a cute place. Price was good. A little dated and our room had some stains on the drapes, carpet and sofa so it felt dirty. Private patios were nice. Parking was good. Lots of kids and families being so close to Disneyland

The staff at Hotel Pepper Tree were friendly and efficient.  The facilities are a bit dated, but very clean.  We didn't bother with the breakfast and made our own in the room.  We appreciated having kitchen facilities, however, there was very little counter surface to prep on and no table and chairs to sit at.  Also, very few utensils were included.  The location was good - close to the theme parks, shopping, and restaurants. We had a car so getting to these places wasn't a problem.  Over all a great stay and a good value.

We really enjoyed our stay! The breakfast was disappointing but everything else was great! The staff was great! Loved the pool! Having a balcony was so amazing to just sit and have coffee in the morning!

For the money, this is a fantastic place. Nice sized rooms, cute little private patio, and everything worked to my satisfaction. Much cheaper than comparable properties closer to the park, but  a short car trip got us there in a few minutes.

Stayed in this hotel for 3 days in a King bed and was very impressed. The Hotel has a great amount of charm that grows on you each night you stay there.  The Rooms were Clean , the amenities were great ,  the only thing I would mention here is that they don't provide lotion so bring some your self.   The Resort fees were only 3 dollars a day , and free Wi-Fi and breakfast are provided . You can upgrade to a hot breakfast for only 5 dollars.  The surrounding areas near the hotel provide access to a grocery store so you can stock up your kitchen, and very reasonably priced restaurants for lunch if needed.

I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. My room was comfy and spacious.  Also, having a small kitchen in the room makes my trip easier. The only con was the top blanket for the bedding was rough and the WiFi was slow.

Summary Heading: Stay at Pepper Tree for Disneyland
Summary: Pros This place is very near to disneyland We liked the reception people Rooms were good  Cons Bed was not very comfy Felt the room had little bit of dust, may be the carpet needed a change Should Have more options for breakfast

Summary Heading: Fine for a place to sleep
Summary: The cleaners took our tea towel and didn't give us new ones, the showers were often cold , breakfast was not good and neither was the breakfast staff , would not let the people we traveled with take 2 little pieces of cake out to their little girls and threw it in the garbage
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback regarding your stay. We will mention the missing towel to housekeeping staff and look into the shower in your room. We are currently working with the restaurant to greatly improve their service. Changes with the restaurant will be coming soon and we will be sure to announce them.

Summary: Clean and spacious bedroom. Breakfast was not worth waking up for, staff were unable to refill anything on time. Front desk staff were able to answer questions, but they were serious and not service with a welcoming smile.

Summary Heading: Nice gem for a good price
Summary: Hotel delivered exactly what it promised.  Clean rooms, useful kitchen space, quiet grounds, free wi-fi, free breakfast.  Definitely feel that I got good value for my money and would stay here again if in the area!

I will come back and visit Anahiem and stay at this hotel with my chlidren next time. love the kitchen they have, they have verything you need in the kitchen. Made me feel like at home. the only thing was the free breakfast, they told at 7 and there way nothing

The place was more enjoyable it was in the people was nice to you on the phone this is very professional thank you for everything enjoy love my stay   I will definitely recommend it and I will definitely go back I really enjoyed my stay in usually close to a lot of the places where you want to go

Hotel Pepper Tree was a great choice for a hotel close to Disneyland.  It was clean, quiet, friendly and reasonably priced.  The bed was a little hard for my liking, but the room was spacious and peaceful.

I was very skeptical at first glance on the site. The reviews were just ok. However, I am so glad I took my chances. It was wonderful. Desk staff was friendly and helpful. We brought our dog and they put us in a room near an exit door for convenience. The building is old but with the beautiful plants growing everywhere, it didn't matter. The inside was clean, rooms are spacious and kitchen was perfect. It's not in the best of areas but it is safe, quiet and had a wonderful spacious balcony. Great price. Excellent service and convenient location. I'd definitely stay again.
Manager Response: So happy you found us! We are excited to hear that we exceeded your expectations. Thanks for the great feedback.

Summary Heading: Great price, great room, quiet property
Summary: Pleasantly surprised that the room was exactly as advertised -- clean, full-service kitchen, quiet, spacious, comfy beds, Tuscany décor, private walled-in spacious patio with lovely fountain.  Friendly staff. Full-sized market across the street.  Handy restaurant on the property ($5 gives you a hot breakfast vs the continental one).  10 minute drive to Dland and the Convention Center.  I  live close enough in So Cal to go to DLand every week, but decided to stay in Anaheim while attending a 4-day Convention.  Glad I treated myself!  I am definitely staying here next time I am at the Convention Center!  Only two complaints or suggestions: 1. Wi-Fi was not the strongest signal. 2.  I should have asked for more coffee -- I was always running out.  The coffee maker was a 12-cup one,

The stay was excellent but the breakfast was the only thing that we didn't like compare to others hotels we have stayed in. But it was a good average stay ..............................................
Manager Response: Thanks for the review!  You will be happy to know that we are making big changes in the restaurant. We hope you return with your family soon.

Summary: Stayed 4 days at the Pepper Tree. Very cute Spanish style hotel. Rooms are larger than average and bathroom/hallway area is large. Plenty of room to get ready in the morning. Kitchen areas need some updating, but that full size fridge makes up for it, and is soooooo nice to have.   Continental breakfast was a joke. They might as well not have it at all. It was almost insulting how much it was lacking.  Nice and quiet hotel, no weird smells, and directly across the street from a grocery store which is nice.  Overall we'll probably be back for another stay.

Such a great value, what more could you want?  The only thing we found lacking was the size/quality of the TV, but it's not like we spent that much time watching it anyway.  We stayed in a first floor room which is better than the upper rooms because the patio is totally private, no one can see in.  We did hear some footsteps above us at night, I think they were probably kids running around, but we're seasoned travelers and always have our bluetooth speaker so we can put on a noise machine to drown out any noise.  The rooms are nice and spacious and our bathroom was HUGE with a really big closet too.  We didn't use the kitchen much but it was fully stocked.  We loved the decor, it made it feel like we were at a resort rather than just another sterile motel, we'll definitely be

I really liked the hotel. The room was comfortable, had plenty of space, and was clean. I only have 2 complaints. ALL of the outlets in the room are worn out. Most won't hold a plug. Had to but a box under my phone charger to hold it in the wall. Also the bathroom door had lose hinges because the woods inn the door frame was "stripped" out. Would not hold the screws. These are minor things but fixing them would make for a much nicer room.

I chose the hotel for some of the free amenities they provide like free breakfast. The breakfast was horrible, I stayed there for 5 days and had breakfast elsewhere. I also found dead cock roaches inside the lighting fixtures in the kitchen. Was disappointed in my stay.

Summary Heading: great stay without being cramped in to small room
Summary: Really loved it .....the decor wasn't the greatest but the price and the size of the room was great .we'll definitely stay here again when we have another cheer competition . We have a family of 4 and we didn't feel cramped at all.

A pleasant hotel in a good location.  It felt like a safe area to stay with restaurants near by.  The first floor room had a walled in secluded patio and a small fountain.  It was very relaxing.  The Spanish motif was a bit dated but it went with the theme of an old Spanish hotel.  The beds were a bit firm but we slept fine. Cable TV is mostly Sports and Kids shows. The room was very clean and the bathroom was fine and clean too. We didn't have any issues with noise. The continental breakfast is served in the restaurant out front in a side room for the guests.  The breakfast is a little lacking but works fine for a light meal before heading out.  Be aware of the early check out time of 10 AM.

Summary Heading: Not the Ritz, however, for a single-mom it sure felt like it!
Summary: I was pleasantly surprised on a solo R&R mini trip after a full day at Burke-Williams Spa!  I was there for 2 nights, I had a downstairs patio fountain room, very relaxing! I was drawn to the patio, because it was big, with a non-stop beautiful fountain, the sound of water was so relaxing day & night long! I felt safe, walked for an early take-out dinner at restaurant (very fresh tasty meal) in same parking lot as hotel! My only suggestions are to add air freshners because there was a bit of a funky odor, my smell senses are super strong: I always bring my own candles and my lavender sprays, most hotels have some sort of smell. The walls were a bit thin and heard kids running around upstairs that only lasted for a few minutes,very respectful customers! All in all this is going

Great size room and it has a full kitchen. Didn't expect that.  The continental breakfast was a little lacking but the option for hot food was there.  Would definitely stay again.  The hotel has great character.

This place is great for the price. Our room was way bigger than I expected. It had a full kitchen with dishes so we could save money and cook if we wanted to. The bed was comfortable and there was wifi in the room. The only downside is its a little run down, it could use an update/renovation but the place is clean and the staff is nice. Also, it's not as close to Disneyland as I had originally thought. Defiantly not within walking distance. You'll need a car or some form of transpiration if you plan on visiting Disneyland. But overall I would recommend it and stay here again.

This was our second time to stay at this hotel; it is a convenient location for our needs. Feel it is a good value. While we didn't need the full kitchen on this visit we might at another time. We will definitely stay here again.

Great place for the price. Would definitely return. Rooms have character. Liked the fridge. Breakfast was lacking but there was an option to upgrade to a hot breakfast for only $5. Xxxxxxxxxcxxxcccccx

Staff was very friendly and helpful! The room was comfortable and clean,great place to stay! Cool little restaurants close by! Great grocery store across the street! Will definitely stay again! Good bargain!

Really enjoyed the staff. Very nice and helpful. Enjoyed the hotel decor. Was very clean. Only downside was we were adjacent to the elevator, and it was a bit noisy. Otherwise, it was a very ice stay.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, convenient, clean, quiet
Summary: Nice room, functional kitchen with large refrigerator. We chose to eat out most of the time, but the convenience of cooking-in, if we wanted to, was great. Grocery store and laundromat across the street, ample parking, 10 minute drive to Disneyland.  Would stay here again.

Didn't have a kitchen,  everything else was great. I was here on business,  brought my wife,  and she was very pleased with the property. Would definitely make this hotel and must stay on business or pleasure.

Summary Heading: Great hotel with a decent price!
Summary: We stay stay at the Peppertree every time we visit Anaheim. It's ammentities and large rooms are a pleasant surprise. Front desk employees are exceptionally polite and helpful. I have recommended friends who also like this hotel. And a big plus is the close proximity to Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm! Will continue to stay there!

I booked the room on a special, which I didn't know at the time.  Great overall.  Got a room overlooking the pool, which I thought was great, but lots of party noise. When I asked to switch to a quieter room, I was promptly accommodated.

We LOVED staying at the Pepper Tree for our Disneyland vacation.  Close to Disney.  Hotel is GORGEOUS, loved the private courtyard and everything about our stay.  We told EVERYONE about your hotel!  HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!   Only thing I would change is a more plush bedsheet/comforter. ;)

I love this place. It feels like you're staying in a finca or pueblo hotel. The rooms are spacious, and the kitchen is well stocked - much, much better than Extended Stay America. I have stayed twice now, and will be back - the value is amazing.  Also - the restaurant next door delivers to your room, and the food's great - there is a Vallarta supermarket across the street for your day to day stuff (and some of the best carnitas I've ever had).  This place isn't The Ritz Carlton, but it's way better than the other budget hotel chains.

This hotel is centrally located in Southern California.  Easy access to lots of activities and attractions.  The hotel is very nice and the rooms are very spacious.  If you want a quiet room book one on the rear of the hotel.  If you want to over look the pool and soak in the busier front sights (The noise was not an issue for us, but you can hear people in the pool until 9pm) book on the front.     Due to the slightly old Kitchen and Bathroom fixtures and lack of a hot tub to compliment the pool, I cannot give the Pepper Tree a Five Star rating.  However if you include the fantastic service by the staff, these minor issues are quickly forgotten and I give it 6 out of 5 stars

we have stayed at the Pepper Tree twice in the last 3 months and have been very happy with our stays each time. the rooms are large the kitchens are great and everything is so clean. on top of that there is such great customer service at the front desk. we stay at the Pepper Tree Anaheim we go to Disneyland and we will continue to do so because it definitely feels like home when we're away from home.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but the bed was too hard
Summary: I arrived late and left early the next morning. So, the only thing I wanted really was a nice hotel where I could get a good night's sleep. However, I found the bed to be too hard unfortunately. I notice there wasn't any trash basket anywhere to be found either which was strange. The a/c unit was a little noisy too. But, the hotel was quiet otherwise and looked nice.

Have enjoyed visiting this hotel several times now. Its such a quaint, homey feel that makes you feel relaxed and comfortable with its mosaic designs and patio fountains. Its always so affordable! The staff is friendly and accomodating too. Just wish housekeeping would also clean the dishes when they clean your room, but aside from that - no complains at all. We'll be back.  :)

This is the cutest little treasure hotel.  Rooms are adorable.  Pool adorable.  Quiet.  Courtrooms on ground floor very relaxing.  I will be back.  Even if I was going some where eles in LA I'd travel to stay...

The room and kitchen is ok, but the wi-fi stopped working frequently. We had to re-connect again and again. The front desk guys are very friendly. The hotel is close to Disneyland, and it is a very nice place for family.

This is a return to this hotel but 5 years later.  The hotel dosen't look any different.  The staff is friendly and courtious. Not a bad drive to the theme park but I think next time we will stay closer. The pool was clean, warm and fun.  Our room had very comfy beds but the bathroom was horrible.  Warped wood cabinets.  Leaky bathtub fixtures.  Badly in need of an update.  I did not pay nearly as much for this hotel 5 years ago.  But you raised your prices but maybe updated the beds.  The continental breakfast needs an overhaul.  One in five people have a gluten sensitivity and you only offer fruit or yogurt for them.  What if they can't consume dairy either oh ya they get to pay $5 extra for eggs and bacon or sausage because we don't know if the commercial hash browns are

It is a good location near Disneyland. Very large rooms and comfy beds. The colonial look is fine, the only thing is the old curtains and ceiling give a bad look to the room, but generally good for the price.

The room was nice, the people were great! Only complaint was the bed was like a rock, no I take that back, a rock would be more comfortable, but everything else was very good! The rooms are very unique and old fashioned, but they were very clean!

What a wonderful place! I was a bit unsure when I booked it- would it be a winner or a disappointment. I booked it for the kitchenette to save money at Disneyland and of course for the pool for the kids. The parks are very close and very easy to get to from this hotel. The pool was heated and  always clean and its really a pretty little spot. I made & packed lunches & snacks, set the crockpot (brought my own) went to the park for the day & came back to dinner (dinnerware for 3- but I'm sure they'd give you more if you asked) and a swim before returning for fireworks. By the way- there was a grocery store right across the street & a Target on the way to Disneyland right before you get on the 5 (I didn't need to go but nice to know its there)! The hotel staff was simply wonderful;
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your review! We happy to hear that we exceeded your expectations. Plus, we love to hear how our Disney families use the full kitchens during their stay. We will make sure the restaurant sees your comments about your breakfast experience. We are currently working with them to update their continental breakfast selections.

Summary: Stayed for 1 night with ny husband and son last March 30. The rooms are in desperate need of an upgrade. I kept the door open because I could not stand the musty smell and the noisy AC. However, it was cheap for 1 night. For longer stays, I would choose another hotel or spend more. Some pluses though are the giant fridge, plates, and cutlery available. Also, there is a supermarket across the street where you can get drinks or snacks.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to review our hotel. We have been making many upgrades throughout the property since your stay in March. Plus, we are currently renovating all of our rooms. We are happy that you enjoyed the full kitchen and the convenience of the grocery store across the street.

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Pepper Tree
Summary: Reasonably priced. Very large rooms with extremely comfortable bed. Great to have a kitchenette. Parking very convenient. Front desk staff very pleasant and helpful. Will definitely recommend it to anyone going to Anaheim.
Manager Response: We love to hear that you will recommend us! Thanks for the review.

Summary: My family and I stayed at the Pepper Tree hotel during family trip to Disneyland and we were very pleased with our stay. The rooms were cozy and very clean! The two gentlemen that helped me at the front desk as well as the lady, were a all very polite and helpful. The was also like a 10 minute drive from the park. The rooms had a kitchenette and a decent sized fridge, and there were pots, pans, glassware, and utensils if needed. The only minor issue was that the bathroom was really small. But overall, the stay was comfortable!! Will be staying there again!!!
Manager Response: So excited to hear that you will be coming back! Make sure it is soon.

Summary: I would say that we may stay with you again. It was a good location to get to Disneyland. The problem with the breakfast they offer you is that we were told that we could not bring the food back to our room. So we didn't take advantage of this. We were disappointed about that. So we lost out on that benefit.

Summary Heading: Good times, safe, comfortable, friendly, home-like comfort
Summary: Reasonably priced. Comfortable. In room kitchens a plus. Market across the street made it convenient. Great stay. BBQ at the poolside with family!         Great stay. Reasonably priced. In room kitchens are a plus. Market across the street a big convenience. Continental breakfast was poor.

Great rooms great price great location. Rooms are very spacious and the full size fridge was great. The continental breakfast was good but for 5 dollars you get hot items and plenty of it. Will stay again.

We stayed one night and I would stay here again. The room was very big and I loved the layout. The kitchen was nice and so were the extra couches in the room. I would definitely stay here again on a trip to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Location great for Disney and Knotts Berry.
Summary: The hotel is very cosy and comfortable and close to amenities. The staff are excellent, thanks Vincent. Wi fi is poor in rooms furthest from front desk but good by pool and reception. The two things that would have made our family of five stay better would be a separate closed off area for changing and table/chairs for dining. We had to bring in the patio chairs or sit down on the beds to eat. Staff and food in the breakfast cafe were excellent and friendly.

This hotel is excellent for people who want to go to Disneyland/Knott's berry farm (10 min away from each). I wanted to find a hotel that gives a different experience than others and this one does it. It's a boutique hotel and I was intrigue by the decoration and every room has its own kitchen. The kitchen has all the essentials for cooking/eating, ideal for family who wants to save money during the trip. Shower head in the bathroom looks a bit old but not enough to bother us. The pool was excellent. Temperature control at night. The chlorine was a bit much but I guess it was due to the bad water system they have down there. Overall, a superb stay. We definitely will stay again if we come back to Anaheim

Their employees were willing to help all the time, Nice location, a lot of amenities around the Hotel. We came from another hotel that did not treat us well and We had to cancel them to come to Hotel Pepper Tree. After that bad experience and stress We were treated as We deserved. Thanks!

The staff was very friendly. Very helpful with directions to where we were going. The room seemed like it had been cleaned in a hurry there was dirty sock under the bed and hair in the bathroom sink. I would if liked to have had shampoo and conditioner in the bathroom as we forgot ours. Also would of liked the coffee restocked each day. But over all it was good for us and I felt safe there being we were three girls for a nice spring break

Stopped here for 3 nights last week. A lovely little Spanish style hotel with big rooms and a little kitchen and a very cute courtyard. Very good value for money and the breakfast was good too. Continental included or you could upgrade to a hot breakfast for $5. Only 10 min drive from Disney.

We went for a game was a really nice hotel. The swimming pool we used daily. It was awesome. The kids enjoyed it loved the elevator and stairs and quiet. Was a little out of way of our attractions but that was ok it was only 5 minutes away,

My boyfriend and I were attentions wondercon and needed a quick stay. We found the pepper tree and I loved it! So cute and spacious, my biggest issue was that we hardly got time to really enjoy it. I would love to come back and spend more time. Super affordable and close to Disneyland/convention center. Next time I have to stay in Anaheim will definitely book again!

Feels like home when we stay at Hotel Pepper Tree. The location is very close to southern CA attractions. Rates are affordable and staff are very friendly and accommodating. Love that there is a kitchen! Rooms are very clean and roomy.

We had a very bad experience as sofa in 203 was with nails projecting out and my sister in laws daughter got injured badly hitting nails while playing in the room and we had to spend 70 USD to consult a doctor.

I enjoyed  my stay in your facility. Magic's shuttle service  was excellent! The restaurant  was extremely  accommodating with great friendly  helpful service.The room was very comfortable. It was an excellent vacation!!

Would stay again when we are in the area. Stayed here when we went to disneyland.  Not that far from disneyland, worth it. We will stay again we visit California  again. Rooms are nice and clean. Housekeeping is quick and nice.

Awesome ambience..  Loved the fact that there was a private patio..  Price for the room was a steal. I went for a business trip and hadn't felt as rejuvenated as I did after one night there.  I would keep it as a preferential hotel when I visit there.

Summary Heading: It really is a very nice place to stay
Summary: I read mixed reviews and was nervous about staying there. It actually is a very nice place to stay and clean. Yes, it's kind of hard to find and the outside doesn't look like much. The hotel is like an old Mexican Hacienda with beautiful tiles, wall hangings,rugs and fountains, flowers. The room is larger than most hotel rooms. It has a full kitchen, but not many plates, dishes. Not really set up for anyone to cook a full meal. It should at least have a pitcher for water to put in fridge. The cabinets are old. The sofa is covered in generic slip cover, which is kind of cheesy. The bed was comfortable as well as pillows. The maid service was inconsistent with replacing the same number of towels each day. The towels are thick. The continental breakfast was actually quite good.

The staff was super friendly & accommodating.  The bed was very VERY comfortable and the bedding was nice. And the patio balcony was very enjoyable However, there needs to be better & brighter lighting in all areas, especially the bathroom & closet areas. As one reviewer mentioned, the kitchen walls looked a bit unfinished but maybe it was supposed to be rustic looking.  Also, the tile floors made it a bit noisy at times but overall not bad.  It's location is very good to many attractions & restaurants.  For the price, we would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Very quiant home away from home.
Summary: It was a hotel that modeled a nice home. The kitchen and bathroom were very detailed and efficient. Enjoyed the room style and the extra bed. Very quiet place to relax and such. Would recommend coming back.

Offer more discount to returning guest so they will encourage more to go back and stay in your hotel, for the breakfast offer more complimentary food, so there will be more choices. Like pancakes, apple juice, ect...

I loved how close the hotel was to Disneyland - made it super convenient for the price. However, the kitchen walls looked unfinished. Possibly going for a "rustic" look, but instead, it looked cheap and rundown. The room smelled of oranges when we first arrived, which I loved, but it was a little strong after spending a little too much time in the room. The woman working the front desk when we checked in was rather short with us, which set a negative tone for the trip. However, everyone else we interacted with were very kind and customer service focused, which made up for the initial negative interaction.   Overall, we were very happy with our stay, mostly due to the price, the comfortable bed, and the location.

Great boutique hotel, clean, comfortable and kitchen options were wonderful.  Continental breakfast is a no-go though, bring your own food! Hotel grounds were quaint, staff friendly, balconey options were very nice.

This hotel was very good. It is located close to Disneyland and knots Berry farm. The bed was very comfortable and love the kitchenette! Price was very reasonable. My daughter had a great time in the pool. Lastly free was breakfast was good but up grade for $5.00 as even better.

we found this hotel full of great accommodations that took care of all of our needs. The great kitchen the wonderful balcony the comfortable beds and the large room were great. The assortment of restaurants within walking distance was really beneficial. We will deathly stay at this hotel when visiting Los Angeles

I would absolutely stay here again. It's great if your on a budget with a fully equipped kitchen (except for a sponge to wash dishes ;p). Very spacious. Staff always helpful! About 15 minutes from Disney. The little restaurant in front also delicious!

We stay at the Hotel Pepper Tree often and are satisfied with the accommodations, however we love The Rotana Grill! 😝 What a find! Their food is delicious and the friendly staff made our experience most enjoyable! Thank you Fay for keep on keeping on! 😜

I loved our stay we will definitely be coming back... the staff and hotel mangers were awesome...I recommend this hotel to family and friends... there was a few stores right across the hotel and Disneyland was close by as well...

Summary Heading: Pricing is more agressive now than during a previous stay.
Summary: House keeping is marginal.  Pricing is dissapointing.  Heard front receptionist quoting less expensive rooms than my booking two month ahead.  Also have the impression that higher prices are charge by phone than on the internet.  Repeat customers should be rewarded for calling ahead to book, not beat out price wise by last minute internetr shopping.

Summary Heading: Great rate and close to Farrels!!
Summary: Would stay here again in the furture. Beds were worn and had a dip in the middle. Loud party at the restaurant across the way at 10 - 10:30 until I called office to complain. Breakfast not very good .

I remember our stay at this beautiful little motel in Anaheim when I was in California for a Business Convention in 2013.  It had an amazing room with a kitchenette so we could cook our meals if we chose to do so.  We were also privy to using the outdoor barbecue near the pool so we definately took the opportunity!  The room was very clean, laid out very well and had a lovely Spanish Charm influence with tile floors, open air bathroom concept (just like Mexico), Spanish decor and a beautiful main floor patio garden.  I remember the aroma from the bright flower bushes that draped over the private patio walls :0)  If I had enough time this trip last week to stay in Anaheim, I definately would have booked into the Pepper Tree!!  No questions asked as they are top notch when it

Summary Heading: Wonderful family VaCa that felt like home!!
Summary: When on a budget with a family this place is perfect!  You feel at home from the moment you walk into the front doors. Spanish charm- clean rooms- friendly staff!  Will stay here again!  Perfect stay thanks!

had  a great time. love the BBQ by the pool. rooms very clean. nice place to end the day from Disneyland. breakfeast could have been a little bit better but nice. love the decor and  homie feel of the rooms

Great value. Clean room. Not the newest remodel but clean and everything works fine. Close to Disney to drive to not walkable but very quick and easy to get to and from. Neighborhood is fine. Excellent stay

Was not expecting a whole lot, but I was pleasantly suprised by the decor and coziness of the hotel.  The front desk staff were friendly and professional, and the room was actually more than I expected. There were a few downsides - the sliding patio door in the room was single paned and did lock, but the seal wasn't very tight.  So it was a little noisier than normal.  And the kitchen felt a little aged.  But I would definitely stay here again.

Loved the convenience & coziness of this hotel! Good location for most SoCal tourist sites. The hotel size was perfect for giving a comfy get away feel. Staff was very friendly and extremely helpful!!

Don remember the name.. but the gentleman working when we arrived was friendly but better than that .. was very patient ..if he was frustrated , you'd never know because his tone was always welcoming and maintained ... great for you guys to hire someone like him ..

We stayed 5 nights. We kept our do not disturb sign on the door the entire time and cleaned the room ourselves . It was in the mid 90,s the entire time we were there so we kept the drapes closed. On the 2nd night we came home from Disneyland at 1 am to find the drapes open. I figured hotel staff had come in to check something. So I shut the curtain and forgot about it. On my way back to Northern California I got a voice mail stating I removed a large Palm tree and damaged the sliding door and that I will be charged. This was upsetting because we never went in the courtyard due to the heat and due to being at Disneyland most of the time. I pulled over on the side of Hwy 5 to call the hotel. I talked to the manager who tried to convince me I did this. First of all that would be

The customer service here was great..no problems checking in or anything like that. Didn't know about the 100$ deposit that would be put on my cars until check in though..didn't see anything about that. Didn't like where my room was this stay. I was in the back towards the side not facing the street. There was a random car there with a cover, a shopping cart, & I would've rather been at the front of the hotel or at least put in the center. May come again if I can pick my room. Room service was good, however trash was left on the floor I forgot to pick up myself. Two of the nights a sanitary band was put around the toilet seat, the third there wasn't. Overall very nice room for the price..kitchen was great.

I definitely despised the pillows, otherwise everything was fabulous!!! It was about a 10 minute drive to disney. The guys up at the front desk were real helpful and had great feedback and suggestions about things to do in the area. I would come back, with my own pillows.. haha!!

The only thing we found lacking was the breakfast. The room was very spacious with an excellent kitchen. The staff was very helpful and everything seemed quite clean. The run didn't have a desk, but it had sofas and a nice TV.

We booked one night at the hotel and were very pleased with the room and amenities available to us. It was a great place to relax after our busy day. We did not get a chance to use the pool, but it looked well kept too. Our only bummer was the breakfast selection was pretty slim, however we could've made anything we wanted for breakfast in our room had we brought our own.

Room was very clean. We were to the back so or was nice and quiet. We has breakfast in the dining area. The price was very reasonable for a full breakfast. Free continental breakfast with nice variety.

Very clean love the decor and very spacious. Very quiet hotel.  Would stay there again. The breakfast only consisted of cantaloupe, oranges and some kind of cake. Not much to choose from.  I wish there was a variety of food to choose from as we were heading to a competitor and didn't have time to pick up breakfast anywhere.

It was nice to have the kitchen.  The tub had cracks in it.  The beds are horrible to sleep on.  Carpet was coming up.  I would not stay here again. It did the job only cuz we are gone most of the day and the kids didn't care.

We stayed at HPT for a decent reviewed, less expensive option for a Disney trip. The hotel looks very mediocre, if not somewhat sketchy, on the outside. The inside is less sketchy, but definitely shows its age. Some of the amenities are actually nice, including a full kitchen (we didn't actually use it) with a fridge, stove, microwave, etc but it definitely seems like it's older.  Overall, for the price it is a nice hotel that has decent amenities and a solid location that is close to Disneyland.

So perfect! We saved so much being able to cook in our room.  We loved having a way to get out of the Disney part of town when we needed a break for our little ones. Everyone that worked here did all they could to make it a special experience for the kids and comfortable for the adults.

The hotel was nice considering the area it was in. The only problem I had was how long it took to check in. I had to sign all sorts of papers on their pet policy even though I didn't have a pet with me, as well as other things. I was prepaid and reserved so I expected a simple ID check, maybe a credit card for incidentals and my room keys and on my way. Instead it took about 45mins to check in. It might have been longer but I walked away once they handed me my room keys.

We were very happy with the various front desk clerks that helped us.  Even things as small as asking for Band-aids after all-day walking at Disneyland - they were great.  Housekeeping also were courteous and met our needs.  The room was clean and comfortable.  Only downsides were the kitchen wasn't truly 'stocked' if you wanted to cook anything the least bit complex and strangely units are unable to turn off their balcony light.  I would recommend this place - it's only about a 10 minute drive or so from Disney, plus if needed there are lots if amenities nearby (i.e. 7-11, grocery store, coin laundry, banking and a cheap nail salon!)  The pool area too was clean, quiet and a good mix of sun & shade.

Nice friendly hotel great location in between Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm. Also great community close to grocery stores and gas stations. The attached resurant has bad service and the food sucks!

Summary Heading: Anaheim visit...I'll probably book this hotel again
Summary: Cabinets in the kitchen doesn't close..although the room is spacious and clean. Place is so close to where I want to be. I called the front desk if I could check in early, the receptionist promised he will give me a call back but never did...I ended up driving there to see if I could check in 30 mins before check in time.

The hotel itself looks nice. The rooms (studio) appear larger on the foto. We took the queen studio with two queen beds for four people and it was very crowded. A standard two queen bed room in a double tree would have been the way better choice for abt the same price. The bed is terribly uncomfortable. The kitchen was nice although we didn't use it.

A quality hotel in every sense. Only complaint is the poor quality of the pillows. If they sprang for a higher quality pillow this would be a virtually perfect hotel. Great location, great price, beautiful and top notch service.

Me and my hubby went to Disneyland  for our 8th anniversary and we stayed in a pepper tree room... the room had a kitchen a beautiful patio.. nice kitchen ... Big bathroom area. I loved it!! And I would definitely  come back

Good: Check in and Check out; cleanliness, location, roominess. Neutral: Continental Breakfast was OK, service at Breakfast was excellent. Could be better: Noise from adjacent room was prominent and caused some lost sleep.  Furniture was dated.
Manager Response: Thanks for the feedback. Glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: This hotel was great! So much more than I expected! The accommodations were perfect for my family of 5.  Big room, awesome kitchen, great bathroom. Plenty of room to spare for a pack-n-play and stroller. I was so very pleased with my visit!!!!"
Manager Response: So happy that you and your family loved your stay! Glad to hear that your room was a great fit for all of you. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: customer service great , outside grounds poor , needs a revamp, that continental breakfast was a ripoff and to upgrade you had to pay , service at the Rottana restaruant shaby , had dirty cups and i think AM Pm Food concession had better presentation than what the hotel offered. but got to admit customer service was excellent :)
Manager Response: We are sorry that you experienced such poor service at the adjacent restaurant. We will make sure they see your comments. We are happy that you did receive excellent customer service at the hotel. We very much appreciate your feedback and comments. We will use them to better our hotel.

Summary Heading: Charming, and good location. Love the patio!
Summary: It is a pleasant property, and about what I expected for the price. However, I think a few things could have been better: (1)The exterior lights outside the lobby were not turned on after dark, and returning alone to the hotel after dark, it was disconcerting to enter the area in shadows, without lighting on the entrance to the lobby. (2) The leaves, and squished fruit all over the entrance walkways was unsightly, and dangerous...however it was clean on my checkout at 8:30 a.m. but in the afternoons and evenings it was filthy. There are no alarm clocks or clock radios, and the only way to tell time was the wall clock, not so convenient when it is still dark. Free WiFi is great, but very, very slow. I was in town for a family gathering, and only used the room for sleeping, and
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you found us charming. Thanks for the feedback regarding the exterior - we will make sure to improve those areas.

Summary: My friend and I much prefer having the continental breakfast in the small room at the hotel.  The lady at the restaurant was not hospitable and wanted to charge a dollar to put some coffee in a Styrofoam cup.  While a hot breakfast is preferred by some, it might be well to keep the little room open for others. Incidentally, we found a small roach nestled under one of the wall clothes racks.  He scampered off when we disturbed him.  Unfortunately for him, we cut his life short with a sounding whack of a shoe.

Clean comfortable bed.  One night stay after concert at local venue. Excellent value for the price. No complaints.  Front desk staff was nice. Brought extra clean towels. Kitchen was clean. No smoke smell even thought smoking allowed on the balcony. AC unit rocked!!  One of the hottest days of the year.

I was visiting from out of the country and was staying for 5 nights. The suite was very homey and suited all of my needs. The furniture was super comfy and there was plenty of privacy. The location was great too. The supermarket across the street made it very convenient as well!
Manager Response: So happy to make you feel at home! Thanks for the great review.

Summary: This hotel was excellent. The beef was comfortable and clean. The kitchen was a great addition to a standard hotel. The layout and decor was rustic and tasteful. My only complaint was that dish soap was not provided, although I did not ask and we were only there for 2 nights. Will definitely return again.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the review! So happy to hear you enjoyed your room and full kitchen. We do provide dish soap, sponge, etc in the kitchen under the sink. We are very sorry if somehow it was missed by our housekeeping staff. We appreciate the feedback.

Summary: It was a time for me and my husband to get away and not deal with anything. But, we did... the shower was very disturbing, the breakfast was disappointing, the bed was uncomfortable, and the area was horrible not q good place for kids..
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations. We will make sure to give your room a thorough inspection and make the updates where needed.

Summary: Great location...short drives to Disneyland , Knotts and other entertainment. The rooms are good sized and clean and the beds are comfortable. This is my fourth time to stay here and my family and I wouldn't think of staying any where else in Anaheim. Friendly service,great location, ..you can't beat the price.
Manager Response: Can't wait for your 5th visit. So happy to hear that we are you favorite place in Anaheim. Thanks for the helpful feedback.

Summary: My stay was very comfortable.  I enjoyed the rustic view and ease it took to get around the area. I would definitely stay there    again. I would have liked to stay longer to enjoy the balcony and surrounding

We had a great stay,bed was comfortably,staff were Pleasent and hotel was clean and well kept.Our only complaint was the taxi fare to Disneyland,as the hotel does not provide a shuttle.The taxi called often is a shuttle van where the driver offers you a flat rate to take you to your destination.We were charged a flat rate of $ 24 to downtown Disney,but the metered taxi charged us $ 17:20 to the same place so watch out for flat rate shuttles,could cost you more money than you should pay,but we would definitely stay there again.

Excelent value and a great room. Room was clean and well appointed. Did not have breakfast so I can not comment on that. This is my second stay and I will be returning next spring. A great value if you don't mind the short drive to Disneyland.

Conveniently located near Disney and Knotts. Really liked the grocery store and laundrymat across the street.  Overall very good stay. 6 people registered.  Not enough cutlery or glasses.  Had to request extra towels each day. Left a note for housekeeping with no results.

Prior to arrival I requested a crib when I arrived around 10pm there was no crib and I had toehold my sleeping child until someone came to my room. I was brought an old playpin with no proper sleeping attachment or bassinet so It was useless! We were very tired so we went straight to bed and beneath the sheets were fragments and a glass eyelash which made us feel the need to sleep on top of the bedding also one of my pillows has mascara stains and another dried crunchy bodily fluids it was beyond gross so we tossed them to floor. The fridge roared am Loudly throughout the night both days! The tub was stained and needed regrouting  and the shower head had green residue! The toilet was old and yellowish as well! I felt completely misled by what I saw online, our couch was useless

Poor location,the bed was ok ,the whole place needs to be upgraded...the pictures on the website make it look very nice but when you get in there it isn't what i expected.i wouldn't return i would find somewhere else..

Summary Heading: good value, but dont take cash or prepaid CC for deposits
Summary: I have stayed in this hotel a few times in the past couple of years. It's good value for what they offer. However due to recent change of management they dont accept prepaid credit cards nor cash for deposit any more so I had to cancel my reservation and go to somewhere else.

This hotel was amazing! I will be returning whenever I am in Anaheim! I loved how friendly the front desk is. Everything was explained perfectly at check in. I will be back! I stayed in the king suite which had a full kitchen and a nice flat screen tv. A wonderful bed and nice bathroom.

People above us and beside us very loud. Called at 10:30 pm to desk. Nothing was done. Noisy til 2am. Bathroom smelled of mold and had mold in grout. Very old. Breakfast was horrible.  Will never retrn

Summary Heading: Excellent stay at Hotel Pepper Tree
Summary: My favorite is the decorating!  It felt very welcoming when you entered the lobby.  And almost like stepping back in time.  I especially appreciated the tile flooring.  We would definitely stay again if we're in the area.
Manager Response: Thanks for the excellent review! Glad you felt very welcomed at our hotel. Come back soon.

Summary Heading: Perfect, no frills, comfy, clean place for the price
Summary: We never spend much time in a hotel room when we are on a trip away from home. however, I caught the bug and was sick the entire trip and was almost as comfortable in the hotel as I would have been at home. The kitchen was so convenient for making hot tea during the night and some hot cereal in the morning. everything worked and was clean. The place had a unique charm about it. Some updating might be an improvement and the breakfast wasn't really appealing. We opted for breakfast in our room instead. Location seemed nice and it sits back from the main road a bit and the trees are lovely.  we would definitely stay at Hotel Pepper Tree again. thanks!
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review and feedback! So sorry that you were sick on our trip but happy to hear that you were just as comfy with us as you would be at home.

Summary Heading: Hotel was nice but not breakfast
Summary: The people at the front desk were nice, kitchen, bathroom & balcony nice. The bed caved in when my husband was right next to me. Breakfast food & service horrible & cheap. They did not even have napkins when I was there. The cereal seems generic n didn't match their containers. There were no fruits left but later they filled it. Just seems so cheap n not a nice continental breakfast. Hotel should totally work on the breakfast.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback regarding the restaurant. We will work with them to improve the presentation and selections. We are happy that you did enjoy the hotel and all it's features.

Summary: My family and I have stayed at this hotel for the past six years and it is always, consistently a pleasure. The location is close to everything!!! The staff is kind and very helpful. Angel assured me the best possible rate, and the other staff accommodated my family with every need.  The Pepper Tree also assures the highest integrity and safety while we've visited. I am embarrassed to admit that while staying there I had misplaced some earrings and asked at the front desk about them. They were attentive to my concern and assured me that they would do their best to help.  Sure enough I found them.... The hotel has for 6 years consistently been respectful and courteous towards my family and I.  Thank You  and we will definitely return!!
Manager Response: Thank you for being such a loyal traveler to Hotel Pepper Tree! We so appreciate your feedback and compliments. We can't wait to see you all again.

Summary: Excellent customer service throughout. The front desk was very helpful after our grandchild dropped her hair beret to a room below from the balcony. They took the time to call us after they were able to get to the other room. The maid was very helpful as well.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. We love to hear when our staff went above and beyond for our guests!

Summary: We have stayed at Hotel Peppertree before and will again in the future. It is a very nice hotel. It is very reasonable and we really enjoyed our stay.the family loved the heated pool and it is not to far from disneyland and knotts. Over all a great stay.
Manager Response: So happy you enjoyed yourselves and found our hotel in a good location between Disneyland and Knotts.  We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: The facilities were nice and comfortable. We were here for Expo West and the location was really good and easy to get to.  However, we were assigned a key to the wrong room.  Oops!  Wouldn't have been cool to walk in on someone.  We caught it before hand and staff was gracious to correct the situation and take responsibility for the error.
Manager Response: We are happy that you enjoyed your stay and found it easy to get to and from the convention center! We are so sorry for the mistake with the keys and will work with the front desk more closely to make sure this mistake does not happen again. Thanks for the feedback.

Summary: Very good hotel with excellent room facilities. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.The hotel is a bit out of the way for all the major sights, so you'll need to to either organize transport or get some knowledge of the area.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! We strive for excellence and are happy that you found our hotel that way.  We do always recommend using a car to visit all the attractions in Southern California and are happy to give directions and recommendations at the front desk.

Summary: The hotel itself was charming, unique and quaint.  Unfortunately it does not make up for the neighborhood it is in.  Which obviously cannot be changed.  I would stay here again but it is not my first choice.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. We love to be called charming and quaint!

Summary: We have stayed at Hotel Peppertree before and will again in the future. It's a short drive to Disney and offers a great breakfast to start your day. But the main reason we love it, is its unique charm. The rooms are large with a Mexican village kind of feel. It really helps us feel like we are on Vacation...not in LA.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for coming back to our hotel! We love feedback from our repeat guests! Can't wait to see you again on your 3rd visit.

Summary Heading: I fell in love with hotel pepper tree
Summary: Best ever! I am making excesses to come back often. I would live there, if I could, it's amazingly comfortable, like no place else I've stayed before. I love hotel pepper tree. I wish there was weekly or monthly rates available.There's nothing else I would change.
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear that you love us so much! We love being a unique boutique hotel with a "home-away-from home" feel.

Summary: Bed linens had either not been changed or there was stains on sheets. Towel that was "clean" had either a stain or something that hadn't been washed off. Under the beds had items from previous stays. I picked out 5 items before we left. It just left me with a question on how well the rooms are cleaned. I thought we were getting a hot continental breakfast and it turns out each person has to pay $5 upgrade for a hot breakfast. On the other hand, staff was very friendly and helpful!
Manager Response: Thank you for the review. We are very sorry that you did not receive our best service and are looking into this situation very seriously. Most guests do make great comments regarding the cleanliness of the rooms. We are happy that did find our staff friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: I'm nice guy, but I really can't give 5 stars this time.
Summary: Good front desk service, bathroom is good, view is good from outside but I'm at 1 floor. There's a small window garden but a super high wall, so you can't see any thing from window.   There are a few noise from the room all night, the WiFi signal was awful, you have to sit near the door or you will out of WIFI.
Manager Response: Thanks for the feedback. We are happy that you enjoyed our Courtyard Studios. We will look into the WiFi signal in your room. We have currently updated our bandwidth to accommodate all of our guests needs.

Summary: I would definitely stay here again. It is very reasonable and we really enjoyed our stay. There is a grocery store that is conveniently across the street that made it easy for us when we needed something last minute.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great feedback! Come back again soon.

Summary Heading: If you want a Superman lll poster this is your place
Summary: The place is on the edge of charming, but misses the mark. Weird poorly framed movie posters all over the place for no reason. They actually have a Superman lll poster up. Absolutely strange.  They have a 10:00am checkout which is odd, and they offered to change it for us, and then didn't actually change it.
Manager Response: Thanks for the feedback. Most of our guests enjoy our old Hollywood charm. We sorry for the confusion regarding your check-out time. We offer a very early check-in time which means our check-out time is a little earlier.

Summary: Kudos to the excellent front desk staff, especially Vincent and Angel.  Angel showed genuine concern in helping me get a top floor room after Expedia failed to inform the hotel of my request when I paid for the room 2 months earlier and the hotel was full when I checked in.  Vincent really helped ease my worries at the last minute when I feared my flight back to DC would be canceled due to snow and I might need to stay an extra night.  He made a special reservation for me and held the room until I was sure my flight would leave on time.  These guys define excellent customer service.  This was not my first stay here and will not be my last.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that the staff went above and beyond to help you! We do truly want our guests to feel and be treated like they are visiting family. Hope we see you again soon.

Summary: We enjoyed our stay , 10 minutes from Disneyland , awesome grocery store across the road. The pool was clean and the staff very friendly !!!  Room service plus really neat restaurant on grounds too ! Target shopping is 4 blocks away, laundry mat next door .  We couldn't buy Disney tickets at the hotel, but you they would print them off for you.  Budget friendly
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! Come again soon.

Summary: Very good location, it took about 10 minutes for us to drive to Disneyland parks. There are restaurants, supermarkets just across the street from the hotel.Good money forvalue.这个酒店很适合家庭居住，厨房设施一应俱全，虽然酒店提供早餐，我们还是去附近的超市买有机牛奶鸡蛋来准备自己的早餐。开车去迪斯尼也非常方便，房间装修简单舒适，很推荐。
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you appreciated the value of our boutique hotel. Thanks for the great feedback.

Summary: I LOVE this place. In fact, I really didn't want to leave! It's nicely located to major attractions and highways. The landscaping is beautiful and the grounds are very clean and well maintained. The rooms are so nice and big and have so much to offer. I loved having the balcony to enjoy in the morning and evening. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Overall our stay was awesome.  Love that it felt like home and that we can bring our fur baby puppy. Would of wished the bedding was actually a comforter and not a blanket. Our refrigerator was broken.

I enjoyed my hotel experience. The staff was great and the manager fixed all the problems I had with the booking issues. I needed a roll away bed and the manager fixed the problem for me. Will stay here again in the future

Average to good hotel. Updates to kitchen, furnitures, and bathroom will help improve the rating.  Overall, we don't mind staying here again since it appears to be clean and staffs are friendly.  We initially chose this place due to its location.

The customer service received by hotel staff was great. The kitchen was smaller than experienced with other hotels. Bedding, furniture and other amenities were out dated. Smelled weird in hallways. Loved the patio, but wished we had a screen to allow for fresh air. Distance from Disney was perfect. 10 min drive. I probably would not return unless they remodeled and updated the rooms.

I was expecting a small room with small outdated Kitchen. To my surprise the room wad just great. It was spacious, the kitchen was great. The best part was the balcony. It was just a great surprise!! It was also very close to Disneyland !! Right across the street there is a big grocery store.

We loved the Pepper Tree Hotel. It was a great location, staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms are designed with a spanish theme and were really comfortable and spacious with a bed room area, a lounge and a kitchen. We were very happy.

will not stay here again will not recommend to anyone the staff was rude made my children feel very uncomfortable ...the shower drain in my kids room was clogged...the toilet with barely flush,need to be remodeled...
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time to review the hotel. We are sorry that you felt uncomfortable during your stay. Because of the noise complaints made regarding your group, we needed to follow up to ensure the comfort of all our hotel guests. Thank you again for your feedback. We will make sure to use this to help better our staff and hotel.

Summary: We chose to stay during our visit to Disney at this hotel mainly cause of the kids. Eating out all meals is not something the kids enjoy and we wanted to cook some meals atleast once a day. The hotel kitchen suite was well equipped and clean and well maintained. The stay was very pleasant and there was daily house keeping as well which was much appreciated. Free Wifi was available all the time as well. We will definitely stay again if we go to the area.

Summary Heading: Good hotel, can be great with little improvement
Summary: Nice hotel. This can be a great hotel With little improvement (Kitchen equipment and and update furniture)  Staffs was very friendly and helpful. Only drawback was the breakfast which  was a major disappointment.

The bunk bed was a very nice feature, especially when we were expecting a hide-a-bed. Wifi seemed a bit slow. We didn't feel cramped with two adults and two kids. The breakfast was a big disappointment.
Manager Response: Happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed the spaciousness of your room. We will make sure to share your comments about the continental breakfast with the restaurant and work with them to improve the selection. Thanks for the feedback.

Summary Heading: Don't even think about staying here!
Summary: January 13th I was in a wedding party and The bride Had asked the manager To set aside 10 rooms. She asked at that time if the party had to call in To reserve the rooms in their name She was told by the manager...no. She received a special rate  of $99 per night.  When we went to check in Not only did they not reserve the rooms at $99 but  they only had two left. Since I was coming from a distance I paid the $220 to stay there. The room kitchenette was dirty, The shower floor mat Was  frayed And was told we had to check out by 10 o'clock in the  morning. Overall this was the worst experience I ever had at any hotel.
Manager Response: We are very sorry for the confusion you experienced with your reservation. We are unsure which wedding party you are talking about since we do not have any on record for January 13th. Please contact us directly so we can investigate the details of the group booking to make sure you were given the correct room rate. We would love to help rectify this situation.

Summary: I was impressed. Driving up to the property o was not very hopeful based on the neighborhood and the looksnof the.surrounding hotels. I was proven wrong. The room was spotless and grounds were nice. the bedding left a bit to be desired but was in no way a deal breaker. The.continental breakfast was very poor. The $5 upgrade to the hot breakfast was totally worth it. Except they over charged my card. It wasn't by a whole lot and the final charge didnt go through for a couple days so I was having trouble finding the time to call and dispute it which is my fault however it is extremely frustrating when everthing else was so good.
Manager Response: We are happy that we impressed you with our rooms and hotel grounds! Thanks for all the feedback.  We are sorry for the inconvenience and confusion with the slight overcharge. We will work the front desk to make sure this issue does not happen again. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: I had to book a last minute hotel in the OC area, and was flexible with the exact city. The cheapest which was also dog friendly (I had a dog) was this one. Because it is not a chain hotel, I was hesitant, but booked it anyway. Our first impression wasn't the best, as the receptionist was not very capable of answering our questions or even properly calculating what we would need to pay, but once we got to our room, we were pleasantly surprised. You feel like you have been transported to an exotic island off the coast of Mexico. The beautiful tiles, the colors, the wood...it was a nice change to traditional chain hotels.  The breakfast wasn't bad, but didn't cater to gluten free or vegan patrons.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your helfpul feedback. So happy that you loved your room. We willuse your comments to make sure to improve our front desk staff. Come back soon!

Summary: I loved this place and staff!  when I arrived I had a problem with my credit card and I couldn't check in. The girl at the front desk was so patient and willing to help. Our room was  super clean  and the bed was so amazing. I just loved it. I had no problems and i had great sleep!!!
Manager Response: So happy to hear that your front desk staff were helpful and patient. Come back soon! Thank you for the great feedback.

Summary: Found this place through Yelp and I was surprised at the quality of the property. I went for Valentines Day and it was very romantic. The check in was easy and they even had little Valentine's goodies in every room The private garden patio was the best part. So very romantic. The kitchen had all of the supplies already in there. It even had a wine key. All in all a great place to stay.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you had a romantic stay during Valentine's weekend. Our courtyard studios with private fountains are the best! Thanks for the review. Come back soon!

Summary: This hotel was wonderful! I stayed on the first floor. As some reviews say, I heard some noise, but it was hardly enough to disturb me. The Courtyard rooms are very spacious, the staff was friendly, and the room was just overall great! WiFi was so/so, and I didn't get the chance to use the pool. I really loved the decor of the room, that was the best part. There was so much space! I highly recommend this hotel for any type of trip: family, business, couple getaway.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the wonderful review! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your room and stay. Come back soon.

Summary: I thought it was really cute when we got there. Its an older hotel made to look mission/Santa Fe style. But when we came back from dinner and found cockroaches running across the kitchen counter I was pretty grossed out. I stay in Anaheim a lot and have never had this problem.
Manager Response: We are so sorry for your experience. We wish you would have notified us immediately. This not a normal issue, and we are taking this review very seriously We work closely with our pest control vendor to investigate and solve this issue. Again, we are sorry for your experience and will use your feedback to better our hotel.

Summary: We enjoyed our stay very much!  Everyone was very helpful and friendly.  If we needed anything, everyone was there to help us.  We had a fun time at happy hour.  The staff at the restaurant were friendly and courteous.
Manager Response: Wow! We love the excellent review! We will make sure to pass on all the kind comments to the staff.

Summary Heading: Great room and grounds, yuck breakfast
