Summary: The room was large, nice and clean.  Excellent deal.  The maid service was polite but after we returned from a day outing they had made the bed but not cleaned.  The pool was a blast.  Kids had a great time and the water was wonderful.  The hotel itself was well worth the stay... The breakfast was terrible. We did not even bother our second morning. Also, location to events you cannot beat this place. Overall Worth it and we hope to return....

Try to have double beds in every room, we wanted double beds and you only had kings , the decor and atmosphere was beautiful, clean the yard and paint the parking lot some and it will be perfect, I love your spanish design the shelfs colors and pictures .

This hotel is in a great location, far enough away from Disneyland, but close enough to get there in about 15 minutes, on side streets so traffic was easy.  Front desk crew were great on all days we stayed.  Very helpful and friendly.  We paid considerably less per night than our friends who stayed near Disney.  The beds were comfortable, and plenty of room overall.  We'd stay again if we ever got back in the area.

Friendly, accommodating, staff. The room was very clean and the kitchen was wonderful. It could have used a few more utensils i.e., spatula, can opener. But, when we asked for these Items we were quickly accommodated. The kids loved the pool and the "spitting turtles" as they called them! Only wish they had lounge chairs for more comfort when sunbathing. Overall, great stay!

Our stay there is great.... Near to Disneyland and across the street there is a mexican market that you can buy what you need............................ Our stay there is great and we will come back...
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the review! We will be happy to have you return.

Summary Heading: If I return to Anaheim I'll return to Pepper Tree
Summary: I enjoyed my stay! Really turned me on to boutique hotels and the uniqueness of them. Loved the charm here. Only negative was the breakfast, which was particularly meager, but it was a small disappointment.

Nice quite location 13min from Anaheim CC/Disneyland and the noisy hotels..beautifully decorated rooms with full kitchen,free breakfast served at the restaurant with $5.00 upgrades ..pet friendly.....

I wish we had stayed for more than one night. What a waste of amenities on our part! There is a complete kitchen, including a full size fridge, tiny stove, oven, cooking supplies and dishes that we never got to utilize since we only stayed one night. We will definitely stay here again! :-D  My only suggestion to the hotel is to add a small bench at the vanity in the dressing area, as well as an electrical outlet for blow dryers, flat/curling irons etc. I wanted to apply make up in the dressing area while others showered in the separate bathroom, but there was no place to sit or outlets to do my hair stuff. :-(  Food is supplied by the restaurant next door. The Complimentary Breakfast included in the price of our room was not enough sustenance, but they do allow you to upgrade

We took our six year old to disneyland and the hotel was close to the parks. We were looking for a studio with a kitchenette and loved the room we were in! It's  a lovely quaint boutique type hotel with pleasant and hardworking staff. The rooms were clean and comfy and we enjoyed our stay. The quality of the continental breakfast was terrible but the price of a hot breakfast being so reasonable, we weren't very disappointed. The guy who took care of the breakfast place was working alone and it was a full room of people but he went the extra mile to make sure the service was excellent. There's carpeting in the hallways so we didn't hear thumping feet walking by in the night so we had a nice quiet and restful stay! We will definitely stay here again!

This hotel is for families!  The rooms are large with a full kitchen - yes, full size fridge, stove, oven, microwave, pans, plates, etc.  The rooms do include a "light" continental breakfast and for $5.00  you can upgrade and add pancakes with eggs, etc.  Do not expect anything fancy or luxurious.  There is a $3.00 per day "resort fee".  This is for the parking and horrible wi-fi.

Summary Heading: Not what it used to be!
Summary: There's no way I would have spent the ridiculous amount of money on this tiny room if I would have known that you remodeled and took out over half of the room. I will honestly never come back. What happened to the koi ponds and lovely atmosphere? Now it's in poor taste with trashy movie posters decorating the walls?? Never again. It's sad that this gem that our family loved is completely different.
Manager Response: We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations and are confused about your comments. Did you previously stay at our former property and think it was the same hotel? Most of our guests find our  500 sq ft courtyard studios with full kitchens very large and spacious. Again, we are sorry and hope that you will contact us directly so we can discuss the disappointment with your stay.

Summary: I found this hotel on Booking.com and will not return. It is very strange. It has a "Hotel California" vibe which lands squarely on the creepy side. It seems  they have recently painted a lot of poor quality cabinets and the kitchen backsplash. The smell of recent paint and varnish is overwhelming and you couldn't leave the large patio doors open as they had no screens. The room air conditioner was extremely loud which is difficult for sleeping or watching television. Some basic, practical items were missing: No dowel for the toilet paper holder, no alarm clock and just items like safety placards and typical hotel legalese posted on the door. I just think they are stretching things too far and this made us spend as much time as possible away from this hotel. They did leave a
Manager Response: We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations and that your were disappointed with your stay. Most of our guests love our Hotel California charm and quaintness. We will look into your room immediately to make sure we correct any issues found. Thank you for your feedback.

Summary: Great place to stay! I loved the hotel. friendly  and informative staff. Good Breakfast and the all food at the restaurant. The room was really good, huge and clean.  I found the hotel very reasonably priced

Very nice hotel, friendly staff. Room is very large and kitchen really full equiped. Wifi is poor and the air conditioned is the only thing really bad. Makes so much noise it is nearly impossible to sleep when it's on.

Absolutely loved our stay here! Perfect hotel for my family of 4, very affordable and comfortable. Loved the heated pool, it was sparkling clean. Close enough to Disney parks. The staff were very friendly and helpful, we will definitely be coming back. Thank you Hotel Pepper Tree for making our stay comfortable and memorable, we can't wait to come back.

It is one of my favorite hotels, the customer service is always very good! The hotel just needs updating, but I love the feel, atmosphere, what is available, the comfort of home feeling. The availability of room accommodations. Just simply a comfortable feeling to know you are in a clean bed.

This is truly lodging for a sophisticated traveler. The Pepper Tree is well kept with an air of another time or place. Hard to find lodging like this. If you are into being pampered in a Ritz Carlton style, go to the Ritz. This is a hotel that suites the person who feels as if they wish to really be living where they travel, but with the simple comforts of a hotel . FYI - You are also in the middle of an area with great Middle Eastern Cuisine. The Rotana Grille's felafels and dips were really good too. I hope this place keeps reasonable rates, since I like that about it too.

Absolutely loved our stay at Hotel Pepper Tree and if we ever return to Anaheim would not think of using anyone else. This hotel has friendly Management and great friendly and informative staff. I was so impressed at how well kept and clean this hotel was.  The pool was sparkling clean, it was a little on the cold side but when I mentioned it to a pool maintenance guy he turned up the heat and when we went in the pool about an hour later it was still refreshing but nice. The kitchen was handy for making the odd meal. I found the hotel very reasonably priced especially for a family of 4 like mine on a budget.  Thank you Hotel Pepper Tree for making our stay comfortable, enjoyable, and memorable. Of the 3 hotels we stayed at on our vacation Hotel Pepper Tree was the best hands

We stayed here to visit Disneyland so were sad we didnt get much time in and around the hotel as it was truly beautiful and had so much character. The staff were so helpful. If you are heading to Disney its very close but car or cab is really your only option as the bus isnt really practical. Will definitely stay again if we ever visit Anaheim again. thankyou to all the staff who made this stop a breeze.

We had a wonderful stay, every single employee had a smile and was extremely helpful. Room was very clean felt as if we were home. The over all attention that we were given by the staff was wonderful, never have we been treated as if we were family.Would recommend this Hotel to anyone traveling to Anaheim.

I have been travelling since I was 2 years old, for 43 years and your hotel has the best customer service and wonderful charm. A few suggestions would be to improve the wi-fi as it was too slow, clean up the water fountains and improve the breakfast items. As well, our room 320 needs a check in terms of the  bathtub drainage and to see if the oven works (did not appear to be working I attempted to use it.   The stove top worked well though). I also wishes you had a fitness room.   Overall, the location was excellent and made our trip plans easier to execute. I also enjoyed being amongst the people of Anaheim.  Thanks!

the room was average, the fountain did not work, the fridge made scary noises all night, the free breakfast was horrifying.... but the maids do an excellent job of cleaning the rooms.  bathroom very clean, nice towels and bedding.

Hotel is marketed as a boutique hotel but it should just be called a budget hotel. Our bathroom had rusted bars in the shower. The kitchen only had one outlet so you had to move the coffee maker in front of the microwave to use it. No dish towels. Pool area very nice, friendly, helpful staff. No transport to Disney, have to drive.

In all my years of travel this property exceeded my expectations on every level.                     I would highly recommend pepper tree as a place to stay for family and friends, outstanding !  100% satisfaction guaranteed ..:)

Summary Heading: budget hotel with all basic amneties. kitchen was the highlight
Summary: good kitchen, clean rooms, good pool...excellent             close to disneyland. Kitchen had all the utensils,chopping board,knives,fridge,washing liquid and scrub!! budget hotel with all basic amneties. kitchen was the highlight

this is my second time at Pepper Tree, I plan on returning soon. It is close to local attractions. I found the staff to be very helpful. I used the kitchen, it was nice to have the option to go out or stay in to eat...  Look forward to my return visit...

Good location, convenient to Disney and knotts, comfortable rooms, great price. Would recommend it to friends and family. Did not try breakfast, but heard it was ok. Overall we had a great time in the area

Found this hotel and instantly feel in love with it. Stay for the night for a local getaway. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was so cozy and quaint perfect escape. Only 10 minutes from Downtown Disney driving.

Summary Heading: Overall it is a very good choise
Summary: It is a good choise for families traveling with kids. The kitchen in the room is the reason why we keep coming to this hotel when we like to visit Disney Park and around. Grocery stores like Ralph's are very close and open 24 hours.
Manager Response: Thanks for being loyal guests. We especially love to hear your feedback. Come back soon!

Summary: Very good hotel to stay. We like the kitchen. It's a good deal also. I,'m trying to submit this review, it can,'t go thru because of short sentences. Please fix the form Powered by TripAdvisor Hotel Pepper Tree You're almost finished. Please update the areas marked in red before submitting

It's a nice hotel & all its good access to the main highway to travel around that area. Also the kitchen helps a lot also if your staying for a couple days helps a out a lot with budgets but wish they would be really careful with there fowarding emails that are sent for customer after we book our rooms!

Stayed here before and will keep on coming back.  The rates are great and it's driving distance to Disneyland.   Rooms and service are top notch.  Front desk was very helpful.  The continental breakfast was a little disappointing, not enough food.

Im not much of a fan for leaving reviews, but they deserve a good word.  The staff were very kind, welcoming and helpful. The room was cozy and clean with a cute little private patio. The free breakfast was basic but fresh. The warm upgrade meal was worth the $4-5. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Thank you Hotel Pepper Tree staff for a great stay, hope to see you soon :)

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel for such a good price!!
Summary: I found this by mistake usually I go to Hotwire or Expedia. But I was glad this popped up on booking.com and after reviewing all the reviews and amenities I was convinced. Then when I arrived I was surprised it was beautiful me and my family were delighted to stay here. It's evrything you need from dish soap to spoons extra bed couch and even a balcony. Absolutely would recommend and definitely coming back. Well worth the price.
Manager Response: So happy you found us and that we exceeded your expectations! Hope you will be back soon.

Summary Heading: Good stay at the Hotel Pepper Tree
Summary: Overall, the hotel was good, but you need to have a car, and we did not. The price was right. Rooms were very comfortable, clean and spacious. Nice to have a full kitchen in my room.  Front desk staff was friendly and always willing to help, if not very knowledgeable. Rooms were loud from street noise. Be very careful in the bathrooms. In my room (#124), all safety grab bars were installed incorrectly and were completely useless. In my friend's room (#123) there were no safety grab bars at all. The tile floors in bathroom and kitchen are beautiful, but slippery when wet. Hotel is in a mostly residential neighborhood on a busy street with strip malls. We found only 3 restaurants within walking distance, and they were good diners/inexpensive restaurants. Not a lot of neighborhood

Summary Heading: First timers at the Peppertree- we will be back!
Summary: The blankets the first night were unacceptable.  Thanks to a very caring clerk the blankets were exchanged for very nice (looked new!) blankets.  We were very comfortable in our large room, parking was ample, and everything was excellent.  We will definitely stay at the Peppertree Inn again.
Manager Response: So excited that you will be back! Glad the front desk was able to quickly and kindly solve your issue.

Summary: We usually stay at the Budget Hotels around Anaheim when we visit So. Cal. The Pepper Tree Exceeded our Expectations. We Loved the Rustic Mexican decor. The room was Clean and spacious. The pool area cute and quiet. The kitchen area came in handy. Loved the Location. The staff was friendly and helpful. Surprisingly their toiletry's, soap/shampoo, were very goo Best of all, Our Roku streaming device worked with their WiFi.
Manager Response: So happy you choose us! Thanks for the great review. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Great hotel and great people running it. This is my 5th year staying there. The location is not far from the convention center. The grounds are great and the decor is perfect.Parking is on site and free. I like the third floor best but all the rooms are the same. Nice pool light up at night.  A+
Manager Response: We love our repeat guests! Thanks for the great feedback! See you next year!

Summary: I was very pleasantly surprised with the property.  With the exception of our room. It being cleaned on our second day, everything else was wonderful.  The breakfast, on the other hand, left a lot to be desired.
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that we exceeded you expectations! Thanks for the review.

Summary: The rooms are fully equipped with everything you need for a good weekend getaway . Everything was very clean and organized.the hotel is very accessible to restaurant and places to go have fun. A few minutes away from Disneyland and the anaheim convention center.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great feedback! We are happy that you had a comfortable and enjoyable getaway.

Summary: Check in was quick. The place is rustic & old looking if u like that sorta thing. I stayed for only 1 night though. Its spacious & comfy for a night stay. I guess the place is made to be family friendly place. Though i do not appreciate being awaken by a barking dog which goes on & on for close to an hr. I was alarm to go out until the barking subsides.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. We are happy that you enjoyed your stay. We are sorry for the dog issue but happy that it was resolved. We are dog friendly but with strict requirements. Dogs are not to be left alone in the rooms to prevent any issues of this kind. Thanks for the feedback.

Summary: Nice to have a kitchen.  I recommend this  Hotel  The room, services, parking, breakfast and convenience to Disney Parks week all a plus and made our visit to Anaheim very enjoyable.  We would definitely stay with you on future trips.
Manager Response: We are excited for your to return. Thanks for the great feedback.

Summary Heading: Fair amenities at a reasonable price
Summary: Service was friendly and efficient. Room was a bit dated in terms of decor, but everything was functional and clean. Close walking distance to food options and under eighteen dollar taxi ride to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Happy to hear that you found the price to be right for your stay. There is the ART shuttle one block from the hotel that will take you to Disneyland for $5 round trip. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Very nice facility - clean, quiet and centrally located. Kitchen was an added bonus, although we mostly eat out while on vacation. I highly recommend this facility to anyone traveling to the Anaheim area.
Manager Response: Thank you for recommending us! We hope to have you back soon for many more stays.

Summary: I loved the styling of this place but it really could of been better quality with some thought. The kitchen was handy but the plates were chipped the oven needed a tray there was no teatowel. The maid service was very minimum with no real cleaning just replacing towels soaps and making beds. Was very easy to get to Disneyland and knottsberry though we had a rental car they don't have shuttles.  Overall it was sufficient don't rely on the free breakfast though the pictures looked good it did not supply anything I would call decent. Though you could buy breakfast.  If they had a bit more inspiration it could be worth going back to.

The hotel was great. The staff was very accommodating. Our room stayed clean. The bed was comfortable. My only issue was the continental breakfast. I shouldn't expect much out of a "free" breakfast, but the options were limited to fruit, doughnuts, & toast. The doughnuts were always stale and on one occasion even had mold on them.

If you are looking to go to Disneyland or Anaheim and want a quality hotel for a good price this is the place.  Also surrounded by excellent restaurants, grocery store and fast food.  The kitchen is nice addition to have with fridge, stove and sink.  The Bathroom is large and very nice with a dressing area.  If you want to get out of the Disneyland hotels that are cookie cutter this is the place to stay.

Summary Heading: This was one of the nicest and most pleasurable hotels that I have ever visited.  Thank you.
Summary: It was our pleasure to be able to stay in your beautiful hotel.  It was like a breath of freash air, the air conditioning was fantastic.  The heating worked perfectly.  The beds were so soft and comfortable.

I went for a conference at the convention center. This was the perfect hotel because it was just far enough away from the hustle and bustle but still very close! 15 mins from the convention center and 10 from disney!    Amazing king suite room for the price! Lots of character and love the patio!  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Contintental bfast sucks but everything else outweighs that little down.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Glad you found us! Thanks for the great review. We are currently working with the restaurant to improve the continental breakfast selection. They do include hot items for a small additional fee. Come again soon!

Summary: This is a good hotel for location to attractions.  It is well priced compared to other hotels in the area.  The only complaints are the bedding and the bathroom is very outdated.  The tub drains extremely slow and the shower spray is just ok.  Have stayed here twice now for a week at a time and had the same issue in different rooms.  Does have a full kitchen to cook meals and there is a store across the street.  Free parking is a plus.
Manager Response: Thanks for being such a loyal guest! We appreciate your feedback. We have been updating our bedding throughout the hotel. We will make sure to have maintenance check the bathroom in your room. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: The desk clerks and the housekeeping staff were all very nice. The hotel is an older place and, as such, there are things about the facility that could be better and more modern, however, for the price i was happy with the accommodations and the staff were all very friendly and hospitable. I would stay again.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you saw the value in our accommodations! Thanks for the feedback.

Summary: I was in town for the convention...sadly I couldn't spend more time in the hotel...the only thing I would suggest is a shuttle service into Disney convention area. Hallways paved  with cool tiles and room included an outdoor sitting area.fully equipted kitchen with spacious studio feel
Manager Response: Please come again so you can enjoy our hotel more! The ART shuttle is located a block from the hotel which does provide transportation to and from the resort area.Thanks for the review.

Summary: Excellent location close to Disney and I-5. Parking lot free and accesible. Big room, excellent kitchen and coffee break just in front of in a good restaurant. Front desk support is excellent and gives all the directions.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great feedback! Glad you have a very pleasant experience.

Summary Heading: Great place to base your trips to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel looks great and is just across the road from a grocery store that has just about everything you may need while on holidays.  I loved the gardens and the paintings and furniture.  The beds were comfortable and large.  My only negative comments is that baggage wheels from other guests rolling over the tiles in the corridors created quite a bit of noise at check-in and check-out times.
Manager Response: Happy to hear we were a good location for your trip to LA. Thanks so much for the feedback. We will look into the noise issue in the hallways.

Summary: Everything in this hotel is very good, I like the style, deco, and room setting. The front service is exceptional. They are very helpful and friendly.  However, the location is in the main road, quite noise to me.  Also some of the appliances is quite out dated.  WiFi is not the greatest also.
Manager Response: Thanks for the feedback! We are happy that you found us very good!

Summary: The hotel definitely has a rustic look. The bed was good, kitchen serviceable, TV a little touchy in response to the remote. We liked having a full-size refrigerator. Free breakfast was just so-so, but the upgrade to a full breakfast was reasonably priced.

Wifi was not stable.  Don't have a printer at the computer station, and it runs very slow. No fitness facilities and laundry service in the hotel ( though there s coin laundry across the street, it's a good one).  The oven needs to be cleaned. The oven in my room was broken and dirty.

Pictures online are better than the property was in person. Property is a little old and outdated but was clean.  First front desk clerk must of been new, she tried to double charge us but Devon at the front desk was very helpful later on.

Overall it was great.  I have no issues for the price.  I like the location.  It was a surprise though that I was upgraded with a kitchen, nice but if I knew before we arrived  i could have planned it differently with our food stuff.  Anyway, I liked the hotel very much.

The hotel offers competitive prices for only being 10 minutes away from Disneyland and the surrounding area is quiet. However we had made a few observations, the first being that there seems to be permeanent tenets that where. It tidy and brought the overall look of the hotel down. The kitchen was ok but all the doors did not close all the way. Cosmetically the hotel has a rustic feel. The bed could be more comfortable but that is a personal preference. The main issue we had was we found two cockroaches in the bathroom. We found them on are last day and when I brought it up to the front desk the man just seem not to care so much. Hopefully they fix that issue. The hotel has a lot of potential but when a small problem (two cockroaches) go in noticed then I can only wonder what

Everything was good except i couldn't really sleep due to the noise outside in the corridor and the light that can come through the door.the bed was a bit uncomfortable and hard to sleep in.it was ok.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. We will make sure to check the bed and other concerns in your room. Most of our guests enjoy our comfortable memory foam topped beds. We will use this feedback to our out hotel - thanks!

Summary: This had to be the worst room we stayed in compared to the other two I've stayed in. We were at the end of the first floor room 126. The hallway itself smelled like the bathroom had flooded. Our room felt damp and smaller than the king suite courtyards we had stayed in before. There was a large stain on the bathroom tub and there was no hot water one of the days we stayed there.   All these issues weren't all too bad. Afterall the room was just a place to sleep since we spent most of our time in Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for being such a loyal guest and for your helpful feedback. We are sorry that during this stay you did not find us at our best. We will definitely go through the room mentioned and make sure to improve on the concerns mentioned. We do hope that you will come again.

Summary: Nice place little away from our place we wer going but other then the pool closed it was a nice stay. Good customer services.need to work on breakfasts a lilttle better . very out going workers. Would come back again.
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind comments! Come back again soon.

Summary: Hotel gets this travelling, single mom's vote.   Plane hopping and hotel swapping can be challenging enough alone, but try doing it with a toddler in tow.... not because my son acts up, he's great.... but, I have to really research, and pray, to get safe, clean accomodations wherever we go.   A newcomer to California, I figured Disneyland would be an awesome treat for him (after putting up with the blistering heat of Texas last summer).  Online review sites would have you believe that if you are coming to visit The Mouse, and not spending $400-500/night to stay on the resort, then you are preparing to live in dirty conditions, with the possibility of seeing vagrants & hookers in action.  I decided to book The Hotel Pepper Tree because it had solid reviews, the guest pictures on
Manager Response: Wow! Thanks for the informative review. We will make sure to pass on your comments to all who are coming with kids. Thanks!

Summary: The studio is great for its price. My family enjoy the stay here. The kitchen is nice and have all the necessary utensils. The free breakfast doesn't have good quality. You had to pay $5 to get warm breakfast.

Summary Heading: Unexpectedly great base on the low price
Summary: The hotel was definitely quiet and beautiful. So far I am satisfied and this hotel definitely took a part of the fun and blissful part of our trip. Some shortcomings were that the bathub didn't hold water well when I was taking a bath.It would've been nice if the kitchen had some thongs for the grill at the pool and more containers to and bigger bowls. The pool should be heated. We were alittle far from the places we wanted to go in LA takes 1-2 hours to drive but it's ok. For those who are planning to stay at the King size room selection. They provide dish soap and sponge, basic cooking utensils, shampoo, soap, no lotions, towels, dvd players, coffee maker, tea bags and coffee. Huge wardrobe. Flat screen tv. All rooms have a nice view balcony. Market and laundry is right across
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! So happy to hear you enjoyed the value of our accommodations. Come again soon.

Summary: rooms spacious, clean...bathroom, kitchen could use upgrade...old cabinets, furniture, fixtures great value.  not too many restaurants in area.  breakfast was in nearby restaurant which allowed you to get anything you wanted.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the review! We love it when guests see our hotel as a great value. Hope to see you again.

Summary: Have stayed here MANY times and was very disappointed this stay!  The sheets were dirty with the previous guests blood, as was evident by the blood on the mattress cover sheet matching the blood on the top sheet.  The mattress on the couch bed was beyond disgusting!  It was dirty, ripped, torn, and had numerous springs hanging out of it - from different sides.  After my trip I contacted one of the email addresses associated with the site as an owner.  My perspective was not one of a complaint, but as a concern.  Have no idea if they received the email or not... if they care or are concerned or not.  I have always felt good about this establishment, until this last visit.  it was disgusting and that will be a very hard feeling to shake.
Manager Response: Thank you for your loyalty. We so greatly appreciate your feedback even when it is hard to hear sometimes. We have tried to reach out to you regarding this situation but feel free to call us direct. We have investigated your room and the housekeeping staff responsible. We are so sorry that we disappointed you on this last stay.

Summary: Clean and quiet hotel. Staff were welcoming and helpful. Only drawback is that it's quiet far from attractions and any restaurants which is not ideal if you are cabbing it everywhere. But otherwise nice hotel.

The only problem with the rooms is the air circulation. The bed closest to the cooler did not get air while the other bed was freezing cold. I happened to be closest to the cooler and I was sweating, tossing, and turning with only 3 hours sleep.

Old, so some things could really use replacing. Kitchen counter was pealing and can NOT be made sanitary. Slight odor of age in the room, maybe carpet needs cleaning? paint? Furniture was a little beat up but was all wood so that could be fixed easily. On the other hand the bed was one of the most comfortable I have encountered in a hotel and it was also great that they had both memory foam and fluffy pillows. Grounds were clean. The Continental Breakfast could be healthier. The yogurt was artificially sweetened (a migraine trigger for my daughter in law). Also, there were no whole grain options, just white bread, doughnuts, and the like. I would have been happy with a plain unsweetened yogurt and add my own fruit, with a piece of whole grain toast. I did not partake of the

Overall, the hotel was decent.  No real complaints on anyone at the hotel or the amenities.  However, saw very obvious maintenaince/housekeeping issues that could have been addressed.  Blanket and Shower Curtain were both needed of replacement, as they both had rips/holes/tears in them.

We stayed on New Years eve just overnight. Room was good and as expected. The bath didn't have a plug so I asked at reception and they said they didn't carry them! Would have been nice to take a bath after a long day in the parks. Good hotel and good location but breakfast absolutely terrible!

We loved this hotel.  The room was very nice--a great place to stay all week.  It was our little home!  Everything was very clean and the maid service was nice to have.   The grocery store across the street was great--very colorful and had everything we needed and more.  We could make dinner in the room--very economical.  The front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful.  The pool was nice and the guest computer was fine.  I was happy to have all these things at my ready.  The distance to Disneyland wasn't too far--easy to get to.  We highly recommend this hotel to all families!
Manager Response: Thanks for the great feedback! So happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We love being a "home away from home" for so many guests.

Summary: I picked this place because the website looked great. With the descriptions and pictures shown. But when I got there I realized I was fooled. This place has potential, many great antique pieces that could be used better. Overall the place felt worn & out dated. I don't feel like it was worth the prices they charge even with a discount. They should be embarrassed by what they call a continental breakfast. Between the watered down luke warm Tang served as Orange juice substitute to the stale tasteless pastries they served, it was pathetic. We eleven upgraded to a hot breakfast the egg whites were undercooked and the $8 biscuits and gravy consisted of 4 flat hard pancake thin generic refrigerator dough pieces with a gravy that tastes like flour & a single breakfast sausage link
Manager Response: Thanks for the feedback. We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations and that you found the continental breakfast wanting. We are working with the restaurant to improve the continental breakfast selection. Most guests do enjoy there stay with us, but we are sorry that we were not a good fit for you and your family.

Summary: My friend  and I loved the pepper tree. It was a very hospitable, cozy and lovely  hotel. The front desk people were very helpful and nice.   The only aspect I  was not completely satisfied with was the continental breakfast. There were not many choices available to us for breakfast, and the choices that were available were not that healthy or able to fill us up.  In general though, really enjoyed my stay here.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you had a great stay! Keep recommending your friends. We are working with the restaurant to improve the continental breakfast selections. Thanks for the feedback.

Summary: Very pleased with the hotel and my stay.  The hotel was clean and comfortable with lots of space in my room. I enjoyed the breakfast and restaurant in close proximity and that they delivered. East to find and check in to.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! Please come back soon.

Summary: This was just what we needed, Traveling with 8 people the kitchen came in hand with some of our meals. The pool was great for the kids, but the "free breakfast " was very poor. The rooms were nice and big and the balconies were also nice.
Manager Response: Happy to hear that we made your stay with such a large group easy and enjoyable. We will use your feedback about the restaurant and will work on improving their breakfast selections. Thanks for staying with us!

Summary Heading: I loved my stay at Pepper Tree
Summary: I loved the style and character of the hotel. The staff was friendly. My children loved the complementary continental breakfast. I loved the option to upgrade to a warm meal for only $5.00. The food was delicious.
Manager Response: So happy that you and your family loved your stay! Hope you stay again soon. Thanks!

Summary: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Peppertree. After long days at Disneyland it was very welcoming and comfortable.  The beds were great! Our room was cleaned and made up each day. (5 days)  The front desk people were very courteous and helpful.  There was a nice grocery store across the street which was very handy since we had a full kitchen in our room.  We would stay there again.
Manager Response: We do hope you stay again soon! Thanks for the great feedback and review.

Summary: Disappointed. I did not feel comfortable walking barefoot on the carpet, the room appeared I'll prepared in cleanliness.  I feel like there could have been more care into the outside area as well. Probably will not choose Pepper Tree in the future.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We will make sure to look into your room immediately. We do routinely wash our carpets, and most guests give our rooms high ratings in cleanliness. We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations.

Summary Heading: Good stay but multiple bug bites
Summary: My husband and I were pleased with the hotel. However, on our last day, we noticed we both had 6-10 insect bites. We didn't stay in our hotel the whole trip, but it was odd. Otherwise, the hotel was a nice stay.
Manager Response: Happy to hear that you did enjoy your stay. We will make sure to deep clean your room just as a safeguard. Thanks for the feedback.

Summary: Our stay at the Hotel Pepper Tree was good and we'd stay here again on our next trip to Anaheim.  It is just blocks away from Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm, and the Anaheim Convention Center.  Each room comes with a balcony/patio with a table and chairs.  In a corner of the room there is a kitchenette which included a full size refrigerator, a stove, microwave, pots, pans, and utensils to cook a small meal. They also included soaps for clean up too.  The decor could use a little refresh - it seemed a bit dark and tired. There is a continental breakfast included with your room which is served at the little restaurant in front of the hotel.  We plan to skip the continental breakfast next time: dry donuts, cold cereal, toast, and coffee was below average. This setting near
Manager Response: Thanks for the review and the positive feedback. We are currently working with the restaurant to improve the continental breakfast selections. We will see you again soon!

Summary: Check in and out was easy, room was roomier than expected. The bed was extremely comfortable. The kitchen had enough of the basics to make an excellent meal. The only complaint was that we could not figure out how to get the outside light to turn off. Other than that the stay was perect for what we were expecting.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the review. We are glad that you had a great stay during New Year's. Our patio lights do stay on all night but the blackout curtains should do the trick to darken the room for you. We hope to see you again.

Summary: The hotel was as pictured on the website we booked from.  Check in, although early, was available and easy.  Hotel was comfortable and staff was friendly.  Only issue was when calling after checkout, when we left an expensive toothbrush and phone charger in the room,we were told that they weren't there and neither the front desk nor housekeeping had them.  There was nowhere else they could be, since we went directly from there to our next hotel and didn't have the items at our next stop. Very dissatisfied with the fact that the hotel denied finding or having the items.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review, Margo! We are sorry that we could not locate your items. I again talked with the front desk manager regarding your situation. We do hope that you will stay with us again despite this mistake.

Summary: all the things were very good for a little family : If we go back to anaheim we will take the Hotel Pepper Tree again because Disneyland, malls are very near.  The personnal of the hotel is very good too.
Manager Response: So happy that your family enjoyed your stay!

Summary Heading: Excepted for the noise and breakfast it is good
Summary: There was noise at night and the breakfast is under average.But if the hotel would need to be refurbished (grounf tile floor) it is convivial and nice. In th average it was easy to use and the service was quite pleasant.

The front desk staff was helpful.  Nice pool but the weather was too cold to use it.  Nice patios.  Room was good, a little tired looking.  Could freshen up window coverings and bedding.  Bathrooms need complete renovation.

My friends and I enjoyed our stay. The accomodations were more than adequate and really close to Disneyland, which is a plus. My only complaint is that the water from the kitchen sink was not clean. We told the front desk, and they said it may have just been the pipes in the morning. Regardless, the stay was great. They didn't mind us checking in late because we were at Disney. Definitely will come back. :)

we were suppose to have a garden suite and we had no view. The room my kids were in had a gas lead and they had to call the front desk to come turn the gas off. When my grandson plugged in his phone charger the TV would turn off. If the front desk gentlemen wouldn't have been so nice we would have been upset.  I would have thought they would have tried to compensate me for all the issues.
Manager Response: We are very sorry that we did not meet your expectations and that you were disappointed. You were in one of our Courtyard Studios that do have their own private patios with fountain. We will look into the TV issue immediately. We are glad that the front desk staff was courteous and helpful.

Summary: And like home, there are a few things which need improvement but overall the stay was great. We had poor weather so we ditched Disney and stayed in our room and cooked and watched TV and it was great. Spacious with all we needed. The appliances, heater, and facilities in general are rustic and dated but if you're savvy it's not an issues. You must light a pilot to work the oven, manually turn things in the micro, etc, but the price and atmosphere work. The buffet breakfast can be upgraded for 5 bucks to a hot meal and is worth it. Friendly front desk and close to the park.

The bathtub and the toilets were not neat and didn't look clean (we changed our room once but the second toilet had scratches on it and looked like a dirty one. The rooms only positive point was its largeness. The bed was terrible. The blankets were so shabby and unclean. The wifi was awful and required multiple logins during a day; the Internet speed was very slow. The room was very cold and we spent two really uncomfortable nights feeling the real cold coming through the slots between the windows. Annoying sounds of movement and walking were heard throughout the night. This is not a 4-star hotel.
Manager Response: We are very sorry that our hotel did not meet your expectations. We do only advertise as a 3-star hotel, not a 4 star. We will look into your room immediately to correct any issues that are there. Most of our guests do enjoy their stay with us and the value they receive. Again, we are sorry that you were disappointed.

Summary: Great hotel to stay at in Anaheim! I loved it because it was quaint and unique. I like going to a place where it doesn't feel like every commercial hotel. It had personality and excellent service! I highly recommend this place and I know I will be staying here again!

Summary Heading: Not bad but needs updating in places.
Summary: The Pepper Tree is a unique boutique hotel.  It is an interesting place with great character.  However, it is in need of updating in places.  The room was well done (on the second floor) but the poor bathroom is in desperate need of updating.  Old style toilets, fawcets, and the shower was a bit sketchy.  It really needs a clean, or replacing.  Our little girl opened the fridge and closed it saying it "smelled funny". ;)  That being said though the room was good.  We slept well and the price was incredible.  Parking wasn't bad, but make sure you don't park in the restaurant spot or they might tow you! For staying on a budget it was good.   Close to Disney (Driving) so that was good also.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. We appreciate the feedback and will make sure your room is looked into immediately by maintenance staff. We hope that you will give us another chance on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: Everything was very nice with the exception of the bathroom.. 1 - the exhaust fan desperately needed a good vacuuming for more efficient operation 2 - the drain really needed a vinegar and baki g soda treatment, the odor was a. But foul. 3 - a deep cleaning of the baseboards and corners would help in making the room feel more appealing.

If you're looking for a hotel with a kitchen on a budget, then this is the hotel. Location was not bad, close to freeway and target. Nothing fancy, it was nice they had a patio where you can sit and relax. Walls are super thin you can hear EVERYTHING.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. Glad that you had a good stay and we hope that you will return.

Summary: Very good hotel, close to disneyland, grocerie shop and very family friendly. I will stay again when I go to LA. Very comfortable beds. Hotel staff was very friendly. Very good hotel, close to disneyland, grocerie shop and very family friendly. I will stay again when I go to LA. Very comfortable beds. Hotel staff was very friendly.

this is a nice play to stay if go to to Disney, not far from the park, not very expensive and rather confortable... rooms have plenty of space and the pool was fine b ut duirng winter some heating would be appreciated

Would like to keep this hotel a secret. Rick the manager Deven front desk and Angel front desk were super helpful. We truly enjoyed our stay and if back in town would choose this hotel.  We only booked one night and decided to stay for the week.

Cozy and near where my conference. Kitchen in my room needs updated esp wall around stove needs paint and microwave smells if turned too high heat. I could here guests above me clonking around.  Overall, staff very friendly and accommodating. They let me check out late at 11:30 am instead of 10:00 am...,........  .....,

Amazing, great price for a night. Loved the mini kitchen. Love it. It was clean, comfortable, great amenities, everything in the kitchen. Pots,pans, ect. Good sleep. It was quite, best part.will go back again.

Hotel staff was fantastic and very service oriented.  Restaraunt Rotana grill in front of hotel property is excellent. Outstanding food, great rates, and clean, well kept suites. Stayed  in a king suite on the bottom floor, courtyard sweet- with its own private little balcony and gothic water fountain.  This place was phenomenal- the opposite from the scary motels located in and around same general area.  Pool was beautiful, clean and heated.  The grounds were very well maintained.  Will return for a weekend getaway soon.

Repeat customers. Love it. Stayed here before and will stay again. Elevator is scary and drops. That could be fixed. Maybe more comfortable pillows. Overall like it and location is ideal for Anaheim..

Great stay. Stayed for comfortable 7 nights and nothing to complain. House keeping, front desk were all excellent. Breakfast was only thing that can be improved but there are paid options.                Will definitely recommend this place and will use it again myself.

I really like it! The supermarket is across the road. The kitchen is very useful. The environment is very beautiful. I do recommend it! The traffic is very convenient even though I have no cars. Public transportation is good!

We love hotel pepper tree, it has a home away from home feel for us. I love how we can still cook full meals, pack our lunches and keep milk cold for the kids. Well worth it! We have 2 small children and they love it too

Summary Heading: Will stay again in this hotel
Summary: This hotel is superb location for anaheim area, I drop my family member in Disneyland and visiting my busines partner in irvinne and costa mesa.  kitchen have a complete equipment..................thx pepper tree you save our lunch cost in Disneyland

We were there only for one night. Hotel is well kept and has character. hotel is close to Lincoln Street with high traffic, parking is limited. Room is spacious, having a kitchenette is really convenient. Close to Dineyland (less than 10 minutes drive) and reasonable room rate is a plus. Will return.

Summary Heading: A Gem Off The Beaten Path
Summary: A vintage facility, but well maintained. Surprised at the size of the room and that it was actually a suite with kitchen. Best of all. It gave us access to the back way into the Disney parking garage.

For the money this was a great hotel. It was a less than 10 min drive to Disneyland. The kitchen was a great plus. There is a Vallarta supermarket across the street. We stayed 4 nights so it was great that there was a Wal-Mart, Target and a supermarket so close. We are definitely coming back.

I can honestly say the hotel was cute, quaint and served its primary purpose. The room was clean, bedding was nice...the downside-maintenance-the rooms need upgrading. When I'm in a hotel, I like to feel secure. The sliding backdoor was rickety and any criminal with a kitchen butter knife could easily break in. I don't like that the hotel door did not offer the extra security lock. The room was overly warm at times, and then overly cold at times...I could not control the air quality. The dated air conditioning unit mounted on the wall was no help and takes the room down to motel quality. If they upgraded the heating/cooling system-I'd really appreciate it. We booked our room for 6 people, 3 adults, 3 kids. I love the size of the room, the extra hideaway bed-all perfect-but for

Older building but nicely remodeled. Location is great-close enough to Disney and Knott's but far enough away to avoid congestion. Nice full kitchen and large rooms with balcony. Nice pool area too!  Staff was very friendly and has restaurant on premise, grocery store across the street.

We really liked this hotel, it had a great feel and look to it. Very homey and comfy. The balcony area was a plus. The kitchen was great, and the location was excellent as well. Great service. We will definitely come back and we've already recommended it to several people

Good location, close to Knotts Berry Farm and away from Beach Blvd. Maintained grounds, nice rooms, room need minor paint repair in kitchen and bathroom. Friendly staff at hotel lobby check in. Convenient parking in rear of hotel.

The Stay was nice but the water pressure and temperature in the kitchen was low and not hot. I would have liked lotion included with the bath kit. Bedding was wonderful. Small fixes/paint more kitchen  utensile.

I was very excited about the place when we arrived.  It was very clean, the decor was very nice and the front desk person was friendly.  Unfortunately, they failed on every level beyond this.  We were cold in the room (it was an uncommonly cold southern California night) so I called the front desk and he said he would bring a space heater.  No space heater ever arrived.  Then the main reason for my bad review occurred at 5 or 6 am.  We were woken up at least a dozen times by maids rolling large garbage cans through the tile hall and speaking loudly in spanish.  I am a fairly heavy sleeper and so is my girlfriend but due to the tile floors it basically sounded like they were breaking dishes right outside of our door.  They kept rolling the garbage cans back and forth, back and
Manager Response: We are so sorry that you experienced noise during your stay. We are trying to figure out what would have woken you up that early since our housekeeping staff does not start their work day until after 8am. Did you contact the front desk during the issue? Again, we are sorry but hope that you will come again since you did like everything else about our hotel.

Summary Heading: Excellent play to live during visit ti Disenyland
Summary: Great place within just a short 8 minute drive of Disneyland. Room was spacious . Bathroom was clean. Kitchen was average. Plenty of parking. Front desk was helpful.  Overall a good service. We would return to this place.

Summary Heading: Love the uniqueness Great Cust Service
Summary: We love a unique hotel, a spacious room and great customer service.  If you like the same, this is a great property.  Front desk was very friendly and went out of their way.  We rented two rooms that were adjoining and loved the space.  Also, the courtyard with fountain is worth the extra cost to have the outdoor room and sound of water. Hotel is older and could use some renovation, but, our room was clean and that is most important to us.  Housekeeping didn't wash our dishes which we have never experienced before but it wouldn't defer us from staying again. Super easy to get to Disneyland, drive down Lincoln to Manchester and take the bridge into the Disney parking lot. We did not try the restaurant with provided breakfast so can't rate that service.

Great place within just a short 8 minute drive of Disneyland. We were gone early and returning late to attend Disneyland during our stay but the hotel had everything that we required. Had a small kitchenette to prepare your own breakfast if required. Front desk staff were quite helpful and even granted us a late checkout. Cleaning staff could have been a bit more attentive but overall the place was definitely well worth the price. Wifi was unreliable.

Got to the hotel a several hours early and was way tired from driving over night. Customer service helped us check in early! The bedroom was amazing! I wasn't expecting it to be much but it was fantastic. It was clean and we'll kept. The WiFi was great. Only negative side was the continental breakfast. It was okay for a super quick meal but not enough to fill you up. Great stay will definitely come back.

Was very pleased!  After reading reviews was extremely nervous but it turned out to be a great place. We will definitely stay there again.  Extremely clean not at all like the negative reviews I read.  It is old but kept up very nice.  Loved the atmosphere and rooms are very roomy.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that we exceeded your expectations! We hope that you will be back soon.

Summary Heading: Location is OK but Wifi & Kitchen is bad
Summary: We went here for Disnyland. It's about 8min driving to Disnyland's parking. But everthing in kitchen is dirty. We have to buy water outside. Wifi is never been connected. If these can be improved, the hotel will be better.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. We have been working with the housekeeping staff very closely to make sure our rooms are meeting our cleanliness standards. We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations this last stay but hope you will come back again on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: Stayed for the night and was surprised how nice the room was. The décor is a little outdated, but the king sized bed was nice. Great for the price and the location, only 10 minutes or so from Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review! So happy to hear that you were pleasantly surprised by our little hotel.

Summary: Good customer service. The kitchen was dirty and not well stocked with decent pots, pans and cutlery. The staff were friendly. Continental breakfast was not good. They had nice melon but the doughnuts were hard and the yoghurt was very sour.
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our staff but so sorry that you did not find our rooms as clean as they should be. We are currently working very closely with our housekeeping staff to make sure these issues do not happen again. We hope you give us another try on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: This property has a very Hispanic decor and feeling.  The rooms were clean, the beds good and the living areas larger than normal.  The price was also a great value.   Could use a few more plate, utensils, hangers in the closet - but all and all I would stay here again.  We had two rooms and it is close to Disneyland.    The free breakfast leaves a lot to desire but the $5 upgrade was also a lot of food and a good value.

I very with the hotel but was disappointed that the pool was under construction  and we were not told until a few days before we were to arrive. We were looking forward to a dip in the pool between disney days.

I'm glad we found this hotel. We will make it our go to place whenever visiting Orange County. The rooms are very comfortable and lovely. Great restaurant on premises, too. Friendly staff. Bathroom floors are even heated! Enclosed patios on ground floor give a sense of privacy and personal space.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that we will be your new "home-away-from-home"! Thanks for the review.

Summary: The hotel was nice, rooms were spacious and clean.   Road is noisy, but not so bad we couldn't sleep.  Wifi is very good.   Continental breakfast is a poor excuse as a breakfast. About a 12 minute drive to Disneyland, not bad.
Manager Response: Thanks for the feedback! We are currently working with the restaurant to improve their continental breakfast selections.

Summary Heading: Great Price, Could Use Some Work
Summary: There is a lot to like about The Peppertree Hotel. The staff was friendly, the décor is cute, and the price is unbeatable. Unfortunately, a few aspects prevented this from being a great stay.   The Pros: You get a lot for what you pay. Being in Anaheim with a kitchenette, big screen TV and king bed all for ~$75 is really a steal.  The décor of the hotel is very cute with a Spanish vibe that I enjoyed. I stayed on the ground floor and because of this had a beautiful and private porch perfect for a morning coffee. The furniture in the room itself was nice as well. The bed was comfortable and had plenty of cooking items I was able to put to good use. The staff was friendly and accommodating both over the phone and in person.   The Cons: While upon first glance the room appears
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your review. We apologize for the issues you found and are working very closely with our housekeeping staff to make sure they are meeting our cleanliness standards. We are excited for you to come back. Thanks so much for the helpful and positive feedback.

Summary Heading: Great stay at a great price
Summary: Staff very friendly, room was much larger than anticipated. Balcony view was nice and relaxing. Had no issues with the room. Air conditioner worked well. Would recommend to friends....................
Manager Response: Please keep recommending us! Thanks for the kind review. Come back soon.

Summary: The rooms are beautiful in a rustic way, the staff is all very friendly. The continental breakfast was quite nice, as you can upgrade to get a full hot breakfast if you'd like. I would love to stay here again if the opportunity arises!
Manager Response: We do hope you get the chance to come back to Anaheim and Hotel Pepper Tree soon! Thanks for the wonderful review.

Summary: Great place, great location, great service, great price! We stayed 5 days first and then twice overnight. Perfect in both cases. Only the wi-fi might require an upgrade! I highly recommend this hotel!

Excellent! Staff was very friendly and willing to help with all questions! Great area to be in only a few minutes from knotts Berry Farm and Disneyland. Also taking the metro to L.A was a great experience.

This is an excellent hotel in the Disney area. If you aren't planning to walk to Disneyland, you can't do better for the price. A full service kitchen in your room (including full size fridge and stove/oven) was a welcome surprise. I highly recommend this hotel.

I felt so comfortable staying at this hotel.  It is the best value I have had in years! The staff was quick to respond to my needs and it was easy access to stores and food shopping.  I will come back to stay.

Very nice hotel great location for a great price. Very clean        Althought the kttle should be cleaned and the microwave had a very bad odour. But overall the hotel was amazing. The room was very clean the bathroom was very clean

We enjoyed our two night stay and would stay again. Our room was spacious with a full kitchen, nice private patio, and a large closet. Only negitive was that the AC unit was a little noisy. The restaurant where you eat your free breakfast was nice.

From outside the neighborhood looked kind of skethy but once we got in our room we were pleasantly surprised. The food we got for the price we paid was excellent. The complimentary breakfast was less than part but overall was a good stay.

Good location to highways, restaurants and Honda and Verizon Centers.  Hotel old and dated. Definitely needs remodeling.  Queen beds outdated.  Continental breakfast very poor although Rotana Grill a great find for lunch and dinner.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review. We are in the process of updating many areas throughout the property. We hope you will return in the future to see our updates.

Summary: We stayed three day with a family of four.  The room was spacious and clean.  Having a dedicated sitting area with a sofa was a bonus.  The front desk staff were great with a special thank you to Vincent who was able to pull up and print our return flight boarding passes for us.  It was a quick drive (without freeways) to Disney and there is a full service grocery across the street. The building is nicely decorated with a Spanish/Mediterranean style.  There was no party noise from other rooms and I felt safe walking out to the car.  No bugs.  No mold.  The room was clean.  If I could change anything it would be to increase the hours of the swimming pool (our kiddo only got a 10min swim once during our stay) as the pool isn't open till 9am and closes at 9pm.  However it is heated
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the review. Glad to hear that everything was enjoyable. We will make sure Vincent sees your kind comments.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel...Very Nice!!! Feels like home..
Summary: The hotel room is great has a full kitchen,Bed and refrigerator are nice.  it felt warm and welcoming, a MUCH better feel than a bigger hotel chain. Good place good price,Everything was great Loved it! plan to go back!

The staff was quite friendly, our rooms were ready when we arrived, and everything was clean.  The rooms are a bit dated, but quite comfortable and roomy.   Our room overlooked the dumpsters and a rather ugly garage building. During the early morning hours someone was rummaging through the trash and it woke me up - this happened on two different nights while we were there. Other than this, the place is quite decent. The decor is very nice with a Mexican style theme - unique and nicely done.  Having the full kitchen is very convenient for families.  We've stayed here before and would stay again.

Our room was spacious- it included a small sitting area, full kitchen, kitchenette table, and a rather large closet (for a hotel). Everything seemed immaculately clean and I liked the decor which was cute/funky Mexican. The sheets were ok- maybe just a touch on the scratchy side. They did provide 4 nice pillows for our King size bed. The tub and sink in the bathroom were definitely showing their age- large chips, cracks in the caulking. There was quite a lot of road noise- but we used a white noise phone app, and that helped. You could also flip on the AC- which ran quite loudly. The restaurant where you eat your free breakfast is nice. You can upgrade to a hot meal for $5 each. We appreciated that they included fresh melon in the free selections. However, my son had some cold

Summary Heading: Nice hotel and base for theme parks
Summary: We stayed here in May 2013, based only 10 mins from Disney and 20 mins from the other theme parks/attractions. Nice room v comfortable can be a little noisy with it being on a main road but that didn't really bother us. Pool v quiet and we had it to ourselves most of the time we used it. Supermarket across street has all you need also a bank and other shops too. All in all a nice place to stay and base yourself in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind review! We hope you come again to see all of the updates and renovations with have added since May 2013.

Summary Heading: A "South of the Border" looking hotel.
Summary: I looked at over a hundred hotels, from Anaheim, CA and beyond, for our December Holiday  Getaway of 2014.  Hotel Pepper Tree was the most interesting choice for us, along with being the best value.   But, there were also other reasons for staging from this location.  Both Disneyland and Knott’s Berry Farm were 10 miles or less.  AAA has an office about 6 blocks away, along with a Super Walmart in that same area (in case you forgot or needed something).  Across the road from the Hotel Pepper Tree, is a grocery store that not only has reasonable prices for food, but also has a well-stocked refrigerated beer aisle.   As part of the hotel package, a continental breakfast is provided at the Rotana Café , which is 30 feet away from the hotel’s front door.  The continental breakfast
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the great and thorough review! We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. Can't wait to have you back!

Summary: Nice, cute room. The four of us were able to co-exist and there were few issues with the the kids and their arguing. There is enough space to watch,TV, play on your phone, either on the patio or on one of the beds. A sunny pool patio is always nice. My husband and I spent most of our time together on the private patio, talking and having cocktails. The kids really liked the water fountain we had on the patio.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you enjoyed your Courtyard Studio! Hope you come back soon.

Summary: Great location if you're going to Disney as its about a 10min drive to. Very friendly & helpful guys at the front desk. Housekeeping need to improve though. Also, kitchen utensils need replacement. Also, the breakfast isn't appealing; I think most people just upgrade to the paid one. I get the rustic, quaint appeal, but a bit of upgrade needs to be done, especially in the general areas e.g. corridors. Overall, not too bad, but could be much better

Great ambiance, even little defects (the paint was peeling on one section of our bathroom) seemed to add to the effect. Very cozy. I would stay here again. The only downside is the lack of options in the continental breakfast. I've had much better elsewhere.

Very nice older hotel. Spacious rooms. Nice, comfortable beds. Could use a little more sound proofing but that may not be possible. A patio to be outside relaxing after a long day having fun in So California. Not too far from Portillo's for a great Chicago Italian beef sandwich. Close to Knott's Berry Farm as well as Disneyland.

Very convenient location, close to Disneyland and a lot of places in Los Angeles area, loved that rustic accent, will definitely book with this hotel in my next trip to LA, the whole family enjoyed our stay

Nice, clean place to stay.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The room was spacious and had a patio to sit on after a long day at Disneyland.  With the stove and refrigerator in the room, I didn't eat out each meal.

Have stay in varies hotels in DisnEyland area as we are annual passport holders loved Pepper Tree Hotel it's away from area so it's quiet and traffic was calm and close enough not to have to get on the horrible L.A. freeways

We stayed here in November just before Thanksgiving and we had a great time! The Staff was very welcoming, friendly, and helpful. The hotel is just a 5 to 10 minute drive to Disneyland park. Very easy to get to the park and back. There is a great supermarket just across the street were you can find anything you need. The room that we stayed in was very cute and spacious, just perfect for two adults and three kids. The room was very clean, but the attention to detail and consistency seems to be lacking a little. our blankest had bleach stains on them, some bathroom towels looked old and a little warned out, and the kitchen towel would be missing one day and appear the next. (this did not stop us from having a great time :) and we did not let the front desk know because it really
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you will be back! Thanks for the feedback. We will make sure to work with the housekeeping staff on the details.

Summary: Many upgrades have been completed since my last stay. Feels more like home than a hotel; great amenities. The kitchen makes meals cost effect when traveling with children; also makes it easier to stick to diet restrictions while traveling. Very close to Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm, shopping etc. great location very quiet area.

Only an overnight stay but was impressed that it actually looked like what was advertised! Older facility but that can be a good thing. Loved the decor and it felt comfy and cozy not snooty! Staff greeted us as we entered and got us checked in quickly. It was pouring and still the floors were kept dry,safe and clean. The elevator is older and inside is wooden. I loved it. Just be ready for a quick "Bump" at first but it's quick. The only minor issue was the card keys. They didn't want to work and we had to try several times each time we entered the room to get them to work. Not really an inconvenience. The room and dressing area were seperate as well as the bathroom area. Showers a bit small but since it's an older building it's expected. LOVE,LOVE,LOVE the soaps and shampoo

Its very close to disneyland, a movie theater, several places to eat near by.  The hotel felt warm and welcoming, a MUCH better feel than the static feel of a bigger hotel chain. Loved it! plan to go back!

Good place good price. Grounds are nice and staff is great. Always stay there when in the area. Pool area looks nice and was about to be upgraded when we left. A bar or cantina would be a nice addition.

Had to buy hangers from local store because there was only one in the room; asked for add'l hangers but they never came.  Also, had to continually ask for replacement linens (towels, hand towels, wash cloths).  Terrible continental breakfast.

Summary Heading: Great Place, returning customer BUT needs maintenace
Summary: Great Place and for the money cant complain. The hotel goes the extra mile for customer service and keeping their reception open etc trying to assist and ensure a great stay  BUT We had a bathroom problem, toilet flooded twice and needed some extra TLC to ensure it filled up again for next flush. Made this aware to customer service after we cleaned up ourselves but nothing was done about it on both occasions.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for being a repeat guest. We truly value your feedback and loyalty to our hotel. We are sorry that we did not send maintenance into your room. Front desk assumed the problem had been fixed. We hope to see you back soon!

Summary: Good distance from Disneyland! Good value compared to Disneyland neighborhood hotels! Two queens and a gold out sofa in suite, so kids each had there own bed! Kitchenette and fridge help allow us to keep food costs down! Dated room and decor, but don't care for the value! Breakfast is not good, my only real complaint. We want a cheap, easy stay, and this works great for us. Friendly staff interactions! Free wifi and parking!
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us again! So happy to hear that we are your preferred hotel when visiting Anaheim. We are working with the restaurant to improve the continental breakfast. Thanks for the helpful feedback.

Summary: Good choice for a quick stay near the Disneyland resort. Everything was great my only qualms are the bedding, which is really poor. Holey blankets galore, not very comfortable. Besides that everything else was great, would stay again, but would probably bring a blanket.  Large kitchen, cute balcony (not much to see though), and large spacious room. Wifi was really slow, better off on mobile data.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. We are happy to hear that you will stay with us again. We will definitely look into the poor bedding you encountered. Thanks for the helpful feedback.

Summary: Found previous person's  underware in a drawer which made me gross out, stove and oven was dirty, when i turned it on a horrible smell came out. So housekeeping could of been better, alot better. Breakfasts not good, stale donuts, frozen butter. Front desk was nice, patio was cute.
Manager Response: We are so sorry for the mistake made by the housekeeping department. We will make sure that the normal cleaning procedures are being followed to ensure that this won't happen again. We do receive many positive compliments about our hotel's cleanliness. Thanks for the feedback. We hope that you will give us another chance again in the future.

Summary: Very good priced choice. Bed, kitchen and refrigerator are nice. Bathroom is average. Some facilities are dated. Convenient to visit Disneyland (about 10 minutes driving). The resort fee is not very reasonable.

The hotel average is good but it needs more work on Room Service/Cleaning. the available stuff in the kitchen are more than enough with nice balcony The location is very good, near of touristic places. The price is very reasonable.

Rustic, few rooms, different, nice!!! Not too expensive and nice. It has a small Kitchenette that is awesome for self cooking, the hotel offers continental breakfast and it has a pool. It has a great location with amusement parks not too far. Only thing we did not like was check out time is 10am. After a long day of walking around at the amusement parks we wanted to wake up late. I would still go back.

I love Hotel Pepper Tree and whenever I'm making reservations in Anaheim, I go to this place.  The value is wonderful.  You get a full kitchen which is a big plus when going on a mini-vacay.  I love love love the decor.  The hotel is very quiet and quite the find.  Close to Knotts and Disney!  Can't ask for more!!

Summary Heading: Nice little gem of a hotel
Summary: If you are looking for a hotel with a nice little kitchen and great anemities, look no further. With affordable cost and being close to all the attractions in Anaheim, you can't go wrong with this hotel. The pool is heated too, always a plus! The nice laminate floors give you a nice sense of clean. Having a full size refrigerator is also great. Front desk staff is super friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay here again. I recommend this place for fellow travelers that need a kitchen while they are traveling.

We had a great stay in this comfortable hotel, we loved the water features and gardens. The kitchen facilities were adequate and front desk staff wonderful. Only negatives were no public transport to Disneyland and dreadful breakfast of stale pastries and cordial, in our 5 day stay only went once!

I wanted to do a little shout out to the wonderful staff at Hotel Pepper Tree.  They were courteous and went above and beyond to help. Never have I been somewhere where the front desk staff went to such lengths to help out (I had work issues that needed to be addressed).  I would rank them excellent and the hotel very good. Our beds were wonky so I did not rate the hotel "excellent" overall.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments! We will make sure the front desk sees them. We will also looking into the bed from your room immediately. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: I was very surprised with how great this room was! The bed was comfortable, the pillows were amazing, the kitchen was nice, and the room had a lot of open space. The only thing I didn't like was the shower and the shampoo and conditioner. They were extremely small and dried out my hair. Other than that, I would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Hidden Gem with Old California Feel
Summary: Spent 4 days here while visiting relatives nearby and loved the place. Nice, spacious rooms with full small kitchens, balconies, and an old California ambiance.   The staff we're caring and service was excellent.  It is in a nice, safe section of town and has easy access to all the local attractions.   Hint - the old elevator makes a deep rumbling sound that can be felt in rooms 202, 204, 302, 304.  It was enough to cause us to ask for another room.  The staff was very accommodating as they had assured us that it was a "quite" room when we checked in...
Manager Response: Thanks for the review! Hope to see you on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: We stayed four nights in a room with two queen beds and small kitchen. The room was spacious, clean and had a very comfy sofa. The kitchen had pretty much everything you could need with pots and pans, dish soap, utensils, ect all provided. There was a full stove and oven, microwave, and full size fridge/freezer as well.  The "light" continental breakfast we very light. It consisted of three pastries, toast, OJ, three cereal selections, melon, milk and yogurt. However you could upgrade to a hot breakfast for as little as $5 with generous option of eggs and pancakes, french toast, and a breakfast burrito. It was plentiful, hot, good and less expensive then any of the breakfast chains. The main selling point for us was the price for the location and amenities. The hotel is located

They wouldn't take my bank card they have taken last two times so I had to pay $200 cash out of my Disneyland money which caused us to watch are spending really put a damper on our trip also the breakfast was terrible not sure I'll be back

I will definitely stay again! The bed is very comfortable and clean! Only thing would be the chairs and couch which need some maintenance or replacing. Still my daughter was happy as was I and just about 10-15 minutes from Disneyland.

Adorable property, good customer service, but breakfast was terrible, not even real cream for the coffee, and the "orange juice" tasted like watered down sunny d.  The ketchup even tasted bad. Server said it wasn't even what the bottled said but was refilled with a different brand.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review and congratulations on your marriage! So happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the hotel for your honeymoon. We will make sure to notifying the restaurant regarding your comments. Come back for you anniversary!

Summary Heading: Amazing Hotel... Great place to getaway
Summary: The hotel grounds and staff were excellent. The rooms were great. kitchenette and patio made it feel like being at home. The only negatives were the cable and the wifi both were on the brinks the entire weekend so that was pretty annoying the tv kept going in and out and we were unable to connect our tablets. The continental breakfast was cheap no orange juice only tang. If you wanted real oj they charge 4.00 per glass. it consisted of various sweet breads and cereals.
