Location is excellent for those traveling to local attractions. All in all it was a great place and i would recommend.

Our stay was absolutely fantastic. I couldn't have asked for a better experience, especially for what we paid. The rooms were quite clean, the desk people were helpful and friendly, the bed was oh-so comfy, the kitchen was awesome and made me wish I had time to cook in it and we were crazy close to Disneyland, the purpose of our trip. It was awesome, and I only regret that we did not get a chance to try the pool.   The breakfast buffet might be a little iffy for some people; there were two kinds of cereal, watermelon, mini powdered donuts, bread for toast and-get this-Halloween sugar cookies and BLUE colored pumpkin bread!! It was strange for sure, but not unlikable. However, I wanted something a little more substantial, so for $5 I got the upgrade, which for me was 2 strips

Excellent. Good Service, good location, good price. Really value for the money. The upgrade for breakfast is really nice and good price. It is a great spot for Disneyland, shopping, and food. Excellent.

We really liked our stay at the Peppertree. The room was really nice and we loved the furniture and decorations in Spanish-Mexican style, We definately want to recommend this place to visitors of Dinseyland as it's only a short drive away. Big supermarket right next to the hotel but location is very calm.

I stayed with my friends (5 people total) at Hotel Peppertree in a room with 2 queen sized beds. We brought a twin air mattress and there was plenty of space to lay it out. The hotel is only a few minutes to Disneyland, but isolated from other hotels common for Disney-goers, so traffic wasn't a problem at all. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful with mosaic tiles, fountains, and pretty landscaping. Check-in and check-out were both very quick with friendly service both times. This is the perfect place to stay for larger groups and families because of the full kitchen (full-sized refrigerator!) and space. The reasons I deducted one star: the beds were too soft - half of us woke up with neck and back aches both days we stayed there. The continental breakfast left much to be

My girlfriend and I really enjoyed the room. It's in close distance to Disneyland and you can even buy tickets at the front desk! We thoroughly enjoyed everything and would recommend it to any other couple or family!

WHile this hotel was close to our destination and the bed was comfortable, the room itself was lacking.  The kitchen had chipped counters and peeling shelves.  The bathroom tub had rust and mold as well as not much counter space. The walls were dirty and the headboard was sticky.  We were there 6 days.  On day 1 we used the kitchen towel to clean up some water and left it on top of the microwave.  On day 6 the towel was in the same spot-housekeeping had never moved or replaced it.  Will not stay here again nor recommend it.

This was a great spot, we arrived from Australia and it was wonderful to be emerged in the mexican neighbourhood. Staff were great and the rooms perfect. Taxi to Disneyland was not too much so all in all a great stay
Manager Response: We love having Aussie guests! Thanks for the kind review and choosing Hotel Pepper Tree.

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for part of our honeymoon while we went to Disneyland. Pretty nice hotel. They have everything you need in the kitchen. I think we only used spoons for leftovers, but they have pots, pans, plates, cups, etc. The bed was comfortable aside from one of the main blankets that seemed to be very scratchy. Because it was our honeymoon they upgraded us to a private suit for free so we had a private patio. It was nice. Another bummer was that they don't have a spa. Was really looking forward to it only to find it nonexistent.
Manager Response: Congrats on your wedding! We are so happy that you chose to stay with us on your honeymoon. Hope you will come back again.

Summary: Great value! The location near Disneyland was great, a 5 min drive. The king courtyard studio was very nice & spacious!  The bathroom was small, the wifi was slow, & the continental wasn't good. Pool was heated : ) Overall, great value!

Summary Heading: Inexpensive and close to Disney and Knotts Berry Farm
Summary: Hotel is rustic, cute, mostly clean, but needs some TLC. Cobwebs on ceiling, dust ruffles hanging off beds. Towels small and rough. Beds VERY comfortable. Sofa bed very UNcomfortable. No table and chairs inside conducive to work, and tiny table on patio not conducive to work either. Very noisy above us. Continental breakfast could use some updating like bagels or individual yogurt cups rather than a big bowl of yogurt (at least I think that's what it was.) Paid $5 for eggs and hash browns, and my daughter and her friends had pancakes and burritos, all of which were VERY worth the money. Fast and friendly service in restaurant. The bathroom in the restaurant had no toilet paper or paper towels which they addressed promptly when informed. I paid under $100 for the 4 of us, and you
Manager Response: Thanks for the detailed review. We do hope that you return on your next trip up to Anaheim. We are sorry about the sofa bed and will double check that and the entire room. We strive to make sure our rooms are as comfortable and clean as possible.  Thanks again for the feedback.

Summary: Your Review       Not much around and the breakfast was at a separate restaurant which wasn't open the first day. The next day they charged 5 dollars for hot food per person. It was cheaper to get breakfast elsewhere. The room was very unique and comfortable. The bathroom was a bit outdated but served it's purpose.

Overall this hotel is good for the value.  The wifi could be greatly improved as it tended to cut in amd out.  The noise between the floors is also an issue. If you are looking for a quiet stay i would highly recommend asking for a 3rd floor room as it get very noisy if you are on a lower floor.  The staff was very friendly and helpful :)

we have stayed here 2 times in less then 3 months and will come again! home away from home! love the full kitchen, comfy beds, room for the whole family, very close to Disney, staff is AMAZING! love it!

I have already recommended this hotel to some of my friends. Had a pleasant stay. I liked the way everything was close by like Knots Berry and Disney Land. Plus were we just a few miles from Long Beach and New Port. Don't pass up staying here.Thank you.....

Summary Heading: Just average. Good for the price.
Summary: This hotel was just okay.  Positives: The hotel was about five minutes away from Disneyland which we really liked. The rooms were clean.  Our room had a full kitchen.That might be a plus for big families.  Negatives: In my opinion, The room (specially the bathroom) needs to be remodeled. The tub looked really old.  New paint is needed for sure too.  The shower curtain was paper thin. Please replace them!! They are not that expensive!! It was hard to find a parking spot at night after coming back late from Disneyland. We found one after waiting for about five minutes.  It was good for the price. It was just okay. Nothing special.

Nice venue, rooms a little unclean in nooks & crannies. However bedding clean & beds comfy, towels changed regularly. Staff were really helpful. Would definately use again if visiting the area.  Great venue for family holiday.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you will be back! Thanks for the review. We will make sure to talk to the housekeeping staff about your room.

Summary: The room and Hotel itself I love the décor, however the room I was given was not cleaned. There was a dirty ashtray, dirty dishes and dirty bathroom. Once reported I was given a different room. The front desk gentleman was very accommodating. So, other than the room I really enjoyed this hotel!!! The décor is awesome!!!
Manager Response: Glad to hear that you enjoyed our unique style! We are sorry for the initial room mix up but happy to hear the front desk was quick and helpful to fix the situation.

Summary: the only bad thing is that I didn't know that they accept dogs, there was a laud dog!! we have to wake up early because of him ,great staff very helpful, also their breakfast is a joke, the good thing , they offer better breakfast for $ 5.00
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We will make sure to let the restaurant see your comments regarding the continental breakfast. We are working with them to increase the selection.

Summary: I found your hotel very clean and quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was nice and it made my stay very enjoyable. The hotel is also very centrally located to the amusement parks and other amenities in the area. I would highly recommend Peppertree to anyone traveling on business or families wanting easy access to the amusement parks.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We hope to see you again.

Summary: Perfect home away from home when staying overnight for a Disneyland visit. The front desk was very accommodating in relocating our room to suit our needs. There is plenty of room to be comfortable and having a kitchenette and patio provides just about all the comforts of home. I have stayed here several times and will return again.
Manager Response: Thank you for being such a loyal guest! We are so happy to hear your feedback. Come back soon!

Summary: We had our free housing fall through last minuete. This was our best value replacement. The staff was great and the room was clean but dated. Overall it was a great stay! And close to Disneyland. Great
Manager Response: We love to hear that the price is right for great accommodations! Thanks so much for staying with us, and we hope you come back.

Summary: Wonderful Hotel With Great Amenities. Lovely Rooms And Great Breakfast. Will Stay Again. Front Desk Extra Helpful And Will Always Go Out Of Their Way To Make The Guest Experience Extra, Extra Special!
Manager Response: So happy to hear that our front desk made your stay feel extra special! We love to help our guests celebrate special occasions. Hope to see you again.

Summary: This is the second time we have been to Hotel Peppertree and it will be our last! Our first time wasn't great, but the price was okay, so we decided to give them another shot, hoping our previous problems may have been a fluke. Unfortunately, it wasn't...  The front desk STILL has inexperienced and rude "20 somethings" who don't care about service or quality. They just want to get you checked in so they can get back to texting on their phones. Not professional at all!  The room we were given (206) was dingy and smelled musty. We opened the back slider to air it out! Bathroom had cracks in both the tub and sink. It was not safe to stand in the shower with all the cracks/holes. Management did nothing to resolve this issue when we called.   Our air conditioner broke in middle of
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  We are very concerned when our guests have issues at the hotel and take the time to make sure the issues are resolved. We did try to contact you regarding your situation but never heard back from you unfortunately.  We are sorry that you did not enjoy your stay and encountered a problem with your extended checkout time. Most of our guests and reviews reflect the helpful and pleasant customer service that we give our guests. Again, we are sorry that we did not meet your expectations.

Summary: The quaint, Old California feel to the hotel makes you feel at home. Good jumping-off place for all the attractions in the Anaheim area. The hotel staff were quickly responsive to our every request. Great location and reasonable prices make this a winner.
Manager Response: So happy to be labeled a winner! Thanks for the review. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Second stay at Pepper Tree, both stays were great except for breaksfast. We just tried it one time and that was enough.  The front desk was wonderful source of information.  We will always stay here in the future.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you will return for a third visit!! We are working with the restaurant to improve the free continental breakfast selection. Thanks for the feedback.

Summary Heading: Nice place but a bit rustic.
Summary: Our stay was pleasant although my wife returned from our trip with sinus issues from the air-conditioning. When we first turned it on there was the distinct odor of mildew. The odor did subside after running the unit for awhile with the sliding door open.  The look and feel of the hotel is rustic early Spanish style. The bed was a bit firm for our taste but the room was clean. This would be a good place for extended stay as the kitchen was very accommodating.  The continental breakfast served at the restaurant on the property was typical carb overload. They do have the option of upgrading for five dollars or ordering other items off the menu.  Over all for the price it was a descent option for us.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. We will check out the AC unit in your room immediately. We are happy to hear that you founds things clean and accommodating. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: We really liked this accommodation because it's different and unique from any other hotel. In fact it doesn't even feel like a hotel to us but it's with the same service as a hotel. You really felt at home in their studio. Staff was great and friendly and they were there when you needed them. Super that there is a grocery store and a laundry service just across the street!
Manager Response: So happy to hear that we were "a home away from home" for you and your family. We will make sure our staff sees your kind comments about their customer service.

Summary: I was referred by a friend, and very pleasantly surprised by Hotel Pepper Tree! It's close enough to the local theme parks to be convenient, but not too close to be surrounded by tourist traffic when you step outside. The parking is easy, and free- along with the wifi! And the staff was super friendly!
Manager Response: So happy to hear that we exceeded your expectations! Thanks for the kind words. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Location too far away from tourist spots and taxis too hard to get and have to wait too long for them to come. Great if you have transport. Very helpful and polite staff. Comfortable bed and good kitchen and bathroom amenities. Breakfast average. Supermarket and laundry facilities across the road.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. Happy to hear that you enjoyed the hotel and our amenities. We do always suggest renting a car when visiting the Anaheim/LA area. We are located next to an ART pickup between the Disneyland Resort and the Knott's Berry Farm area/attractions but driving yourself is faster.

Summary: Free breakfast not good.We had two rooms wish they could have been ajointing. Beds are comfortable. Great for familes. Parking is sometimes a pain. We have stayed many times and will return. Central location to all .
Manager Response: We love reviews from our loyal guests - thanks for the feedback and suggestions! We do have a few adjoining rooms and try our best to accommodate our multi-room families. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: The setting was very pleasant. My boyfriend and I loved the kitchen and patio. Adorable! Although the pots and pans were a bit dirty, and the complimentary breakfast was basically cereal and donuts. Other than that, we had an overall fun stay.

Staff was extremely friendly. Very helpful in directing us to different areas that we wanted to go. Room was comfortable and we only wished there were bars in the shower to help prevent falling. We will stay here again!

we stayed here with our son who is 5 and my parents who are in their 50's. We all enjoyed the Halloween decor, friendly customer service and rooms. They were spotless! Will stay again. Our only comment is that the shower drain was slow and the water backed up.

A great value for the price and location! Great for families, clean and comfortable for the price point! We have stayed several times and enjoy! Breakfast not great, wish it was a better selection or better food, but understand what I am getting when I stay there!

I was impressed by the in-room amenities. There really is a full kitchen in there. The closet is huge. The rooms a very homey and comfortable. The staff was extremely friendly. Our stay was just one night for a short Disneyland trip. I will surely be back here for a longer stay.

I have stayed here twice now and really enjoy it every time. The customer service and everyone that works there is extremely friendly and helpful. Close to a Starbucks, and a very short drive to Disneyland. Rooms are older and area around is a tad bit rough, but it is expected in Anaheim. Will come again soon!
Manager Response: So happy to hear from our returning guests! Thanks so much! We will make sure to pass on the kind words to the front desk.

Summary: We enjoyed our stay and found it great value for money.  The beds were comfortable and we all slept well.  The pool area was great, our children enjoyed it.  Our room felt clean and the style of the hotel was interesting.  Would have liked the breakfast to be a bit healthier with more variety in the fruit offered, sometimes it was only watermelon.  The Mexican supermarket across the road was great value, you can have a sit down dinner there for $20 for a family of five.  Would definately recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. We are happy to hear that you all slept so well during your trip. We will make sure to let the restaurant see your comments about the fruit selection. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Staff was very accommodating.  Hotel is older and rooms show their age, but are very clean and comfortable.  All and all, very good value for the money.  Very large room.  Love the enforcement of quiet hours!

We arrived earlier than expected and the staff was very welcoming and helped us with some trouble we had prior to arriving to the hotel. Room was spacious and clean. Definitely recommend especially with the price!

excellent hotel.  it fulfills all my requirements.  good location.  should include dishwashing detergent in the kitchen and wi-fi should be faster, but everything was very good. would strongly recommend it.

The place is older and the facility shows its wear a bit.  However, considering its location to Disneyland (3-4 miles) and the comparative price, it is a good value.  The staff was great and addressed our needs.  The room had what we needed for our stay.  A good value.

Everything was fine with the hotel. My only complaint is that the blanket on the bed was more like a curtain than a blanket. Other than that. Not a bad hotel for the money. Clean hotel, with a full kitchen.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the review. We are happy to hear that the price was right for our rooms. Glad that you enjoyed the full kitchen.

Summary: We arrived very late, around 12:00 AM, and the clerk was so welcoming and helpful! Our room was clean and the bed was so comfortable. We had a very enjoyable stay and will definitely stay here again .
Manager Response: Glad to hear your enjoyed your stay. Come back soon!

Summary: I have stayed two days at Pepper Tree Inn. Front desk was very kind and meticulous. Room has kitchen so it's good for our family. Especially, the breakfast was good and the restaurant was good. We had enjoyed staying at PepperTree In in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind and informative review. Happy to hear your enjoyed the continental breakfast and the restaurant on the property! Come back soon.

Summary Heading: Loved some parts..needed TLC in others
Summary: At first I was in love with this property..the halls and lobby are so old world mission and beautiful.  The room is spacious and we overlooked the pool..cool.  The first room the front door wouldn't shut fully to lock so we were moved, the 2nd room had the lights burned out in the bathroom and rips n the blanket on the bed. The kitchen is great and right across the street is a Lation Market so easy to stock the kitchen. The continental breakfast..ugh..better to stock up on breakfast supply's and cook in yourself.  Also, dont plan on printing off your boarding pass at the hotel business desk....No Printer...???   So maintenance, housekeeping and an IT guy showing some TLC could make this a fantastic spot.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us and thanks for the review! We will make sure to work with the housekeeping staff about those room issues. Happy to hear that you enjoyed the convenience of our full kitchens and the local market. We hope to see you again soon and are thankful for your helpful feedback.

Summary: clearly older but being updated is ongoing. Okay price, had the min. requirements for me & kids. Will return to see if more improvement, was easy from SNA & to Dland, should design more tuscan not SW.
Manager Response: Happy to hear you will coming back. We love having our Disney families stay with us.

Summary: Good hotel and great location   The hotel pepper tree is good location you have the supermarket and the restaurant are in front and you can find other restaurant just one block aways  The service is good
Manager Response: Love to hear that our hotel was conveniently located for your trip! We hope you will be back again soon.

Summary: Convenient to Disneyland, about an hour to Universal. Not many restaurants in the area, so check out apps when leaving the park. Continental breakfast was average, but you could order from menu at reasonable price.
Manager Response: Thanks for choosing us for your visit to the theme parks. We are also really close to Knott's Berry Farm. Next time talk with the front desk for the best local eating options... there are some great local finds close to the hotel.

Summary: Poor lighting when I came in, no sign lighting, past the hotel 3 times. Resort Fee in just another extra cost to my stay. Never stay again. Floors are so noisy that when someone rolls on the floor it will wake you up.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations and that you had difficulty finding our property. We are making sure to adjust our outdoor lighting with the current changes in sunset which should help any issues of finding our property.

Summary: The hotel staff were very friendly. The continental breakfast left something to be desired. Cut up fruit was always available however it had very little taste. This was disappointing since fruit is in season.I did use the BBQ by the pool and it worked very well. Overall a good hotel that needs just a little more improvement as mentioned.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you enjoyed our newly renovated pool area! We still are making many more updates throughout the property. We will mention your comments to the restaurant regarding the continental breakfast. We hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: Handicap/Special Needs People Need Not Stay Here!
Summary: Front desk was prompt in serving us and breakfast was good. This is a kind of nice, old hotel, with an antique kind of ambiance.  However, I was really not at all satisfied with the  "Handicap Room."  This room  is supposed to be wheel chair accessible, and have 2 Queen beds.  (1) It is really not a handicap room (2) Had a small King bed and a twin bed (3) There is a bathtub instead of a shower (4) a stationary shower head instead of a hand-held shower head (5) no shower chair to sit down in (6) a regular toilet height and not handicap height, making it really difficult to sit down & get up from the toilet--even using the handicap bar (6) no chair to sit on while in the dressing area to put on make up, blow dry/comb hair (7) had a small wash basin with no room to put toiletries

It's an average hotel in the anaheim area. But definitely good for the price. If you need to stay on a budget along with your family, this is a decent place. Sufficient space in the room for little ones to play.
Manager Response: Glad to hear we were a good hotel for the right price. We love having Disneyland families stay with us!

Summary: When we go to Disneyland, the Hotel Pepper Tree is close enough to go and relax in the late afternoon and return to the park for the evening. Comfortable and clean rooms at a reasonable rate. We will return again.
Manager Response: Thanks, Charles and Mark! Happy to hear that you will be back on your next visit to Anaheim!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Our stay at Pepper Tree was okay.  It had what i needed to prepare meals for my toddler.  Its very close to Disneyland.  The only two things i didn't like was the breakfast.  Its basically junk food, high sugar snack they are feeding you in the morning.  For three days i had only coffee, fruits, and a slice of toast.  If you want to have pancakes and eggs you'll need to pay more.   Another thing that i didn't like was the smell coming from the bathroom vent.  I can't figure out what it is, its a mixture of smoke and dead animals.   We had to turn on the ventilation all day and night.  Overall, its good for what you pay for and if you are not planing to stay in the hotel room for long.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to review our hotel. Happy to hear that the full kitchen was useful for your family. We are sorry about the bathroom issue. Did you report it to the front desk? We will look into your room immediately. We are also working with the restaurant to help improve their continental breakfast selections. We hope the you will come again on your next visit to Disneyland

Summary Heading: My home away from home when visiting the area
Summary: I've stayed at this charming hotel many times, both with my family, and on business. Their hospitality is consistently superb. The rooms are spacious, very clean, and extremely homey & comfortable. It feels great to come back to after a long stressful day of commuting throughout the LA area.  With Vallarta across the street and a great Mediterranean restaurant next door, quality meals are convenient, either on-site or back in the room watching the Giants play.  Thumbs up to the staff for always making me feel right at home.
Manager Response: Thanks for returning! So happy to be your home away from home.

Summary: Walls thin, roofing maintenance was very loud in a Saturday morning. Once that gets done, it is nice. The breakfast is across the parking lot and dietary restrictions aren't considered. Overall, okay.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for patience during the renovation process! Please come back again so to see the finished exterior.

Summary: good location.attractive décor. friendly staff. nice room. good rate.  free breakfast was awful. owner needs to eat there and check your competitions free breakfast. grounds in need of repair and maintenece
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to review our hotel. We have just finished some major renovations of the hotel grounds - parking lot and pool. We are also working with the restaurant to improve their continental breakfast. Happy to hear you that enjoyed your room and our friendly staff. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: It would of been nice if there was a hair dryer in the room. but I asked for one and it was brought up right a way. The dishes could of been washed for the next day we stayed three nights. Air could of been turned on before we checked in the room was very hot.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you will stay with us again! Thank you so much for your review and suggestions.

Summary Heading: Charming hotel for a short family vacation.
Summary: We stayed at the Pepper Tree hotel just one night but were satisfied with the accommodations. The front desk was prompt in serving each guest, had good suggestion on what to do nearby (Disneyland being our primary attraction) and polite. The room was very average of a hotel of this age, nothing over the top stood out but it felt clean and it was a good size with a small couch and kitchen. Perfect for a small family of four. My sister stayed a month before our visit and yes we will return.
Manager Response: So happy to hear you will return! Thank you for the great review.

Summary: We come here every year and have recommended it to others.  However, no cooking utensils in the kitchen- had to go buy.  Only 3 plates- family of 4.  Saddened that we had to purchase for "stocked" kitchen .
Manager Response: Thank you so much for be such loyal guests! We are so sorry that your room was not stocked properly. Did you notify the front desk? We will look into this immediately to make sure this issue is fixed. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: The breakfast was not kept stocked by staff. If you showed up between 8-10 the food area was not restocked. Staff at hotel was good and friendly. Wifi was somewhat slow and needs to be faster for the rate of people there.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing our hotel. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your room and our friendly staff.  We will notify the restaurant about the issues you experienced during breakfast. We have also fixed a small issue with our WiFi signal throughout the hotel. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We checked in late, exhausted and ready to go to sleep before a long day, and Vincent was great when we checked in! The room was over the top nice, we loved the kitchen area and the patio was very soothing. The fountain was almost empty as opposed to the full one in the pictures, but that's a minor thing with the drought. Our only issue, and a minor one at that, is that the light on the balcony couldn't be turned off. When I'm not on vacation I work the graveyard shift and use blackout blinds, tinting and another set of blinds on my windows, so sleeping with the light poking thru the blinds was tough. The curtains are very nice and with a little finagling I was able to get it dark enough. Great place to stay for your trip to the theme parks!
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you enjoyed your Courtyard King Studio! We will also make sure to tell Vincent of your kind comments. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Rooms are spacious and clean, breakfast upgrade is awesome as well as restaurant staff. Mattress is slightly uncomfortable and wifi would not work. Otherwise, great stay!   Close to disneyland and very quiet neighborhood.
Manager Response: Thanks for the helpful review! Glad you enjoyed the hotel and restaurant. We will look into the mattress from your room immediately. We are also in the process of upgrading our WiFi. We hope you come back soon!

Summary: Hotel Pepper tree is conveniently located for access to Disneyland and  Knotts Berry Farm.  The room is comfortable and well equipped. There is a nice pool. The continental breakfast needs more love from the restaurant.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that our found our hotel convenient and comfortable! We will let the restaurant know about your breakfast comments. Hope you will come back soon.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for your Disneyland Trip
Summary: This hotel was in a perfect location.  Minutes from Disneyland, and minutes from the Pirate Adventure Theater and Farrell's Ice Cream Parlour.  We will be staying at the Hotel Pepper Tree during our next So. Cal trip.
Manager Response: We are happy that you will be coming back! Glad that you enjoyed our convenient location. Thanks again for staying with us.

Summary: Great hotel & very clean, spacious, and nice room! Full kitchen with full size fridge was perfect! Loved the authentic hacienda style of the room and overall hotel. Great value for the price! Rotano grill had the best food so many options to choose from& great, friendly service!
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at Hotel Pepper Tree!  We love being able to provide great accommodations at a great price for our Disney families! We will let the restaurant see your kind comments. Thanks again!

Summary: We arrived very early before check in time and they were able to speed up the process and get the room ready. I wasn't expecting to see a fully equipped kitchen. All we needed was food! The kids enjoyed the pool, the room was pretty and the beds were large.
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind review! Happy to hear that you enjoyed your kitchen. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We chose the Hotel Pepper Tree because of the proximity to Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm.  The facilty is a bit old but the rooms were very clean and the onsite restaurant was handy and very reosanable. The service was very good from the housekeeping to the front desk. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family
Manager Response: Thanks for recommending us to your friends and family! Happy to hear that you received great service from the hotel staff.

Summary: Thank you for the hospitality. Loved the Halloween decor. You guys are always our first choice when staying close to Disneyland and other amusement parks in the area.  Complimentary breakfast could be better. I think the servers need help in the kitchen with repleneshing the food and beverages. Overall, adding the hot breakfast for a couple of dollars is the best deal.  Thank you.
Manager Response: We are so happy that we are your first choice when visiting Anaheim! So happy you enjoyed our spooky Halloween decor. We will let the restaurant know about your breakfast comments to help them improve their service. See you again soon!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: The front desk staff was very good, the room service was fine, and the location was a quick trip to Disneyland, but the hotel itself needs work. Most bathroom amenities were missing, such as a hair dryer. The rooms appeared to be very old and worn, and a screen on the balcony door would be helpful. But it was much cheaper than staying at Disneyland proper.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to review our hotel. We appreciate your helpful comments and suggestions. We are currently adding hairdryers to all the rooms and making other updates and renovations throughout the hotel. We will let the front desk staff know that you appreciated the customer service. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: This 'hotel' was not a good representation of American hospitality.
Summary: fridge would not close, shower was cold, noisy location and very questionable area, not safe for kids or families. Grotto grubby bed linen curtains and towels. Outdoor lightning stayed on all night AC located right above head. multiple non code compliant aspect to this place. Restaurant offering breakfast, cheapest crappy food available. All in all this was not a good experience, and not too cheap and not worth the effort.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations and will look into the issues that you found in your room immediately. Most of our guests do enjoy our family-friendly hotel. We will also send your comments to the restaurant to help improve the free continental breakfast.

Summary: We've stayed at Hotel Pepper Tree about a dozen times now and it is always an excellent experience. The staff is friendly, the rooms are huge, and the private patios and balconies elevate the hotel far above other hotels in the same price point.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us so many times (since 2010)! We love our repeat guests. Come back soon!

Summary Heading: A good stay for locals and people visiting anaheim
Summary: I am an avid visitor to the disneyland resort and I like visiting Orange County so the pepper tree is the place to go. I am not a paid reviewer and I heard the bad stories about trip advisor but this is a great place for a quick clean stay.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review! Hope to see on your next trip to the OC.

Summary: Blood on the shower curtain.. Fire alarm kept going off in our room, so they had to disable it.  Oven smelled like gas.  WiFi didn't work.  Breakfast was a joke, but the $5 upgrade each day was worth it.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are sorry that we did meet your expectations. We are currently upgrading our WiFi throughout the hotel. We will also look into the other issues you found in your room. Sorry again that you did not have the same enjoyable experience that most of our guests do have.

Summary: what a gem, this hotel is off the beaten path, yet not so far off that it can meet the needs of the single traveler like myself or the many families i met who where there. They have a kitchen, patio, nice size room.  One thing, was there was not a hair dryer in the room, although in the lobby all i had to do was ask for one.  The Lobby has a vintage regal look to it. I would stay there again.
Manager Response: So glad you found and enjoyed our "diamond in the rough". We are actually located right between the Disneyland Resort and Knott's Berry Farm. Sorry about the hairdryer not being in your room - it should have been there. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: good friendly service, good staff. Had a good selection of breakfast items available  .Rooms were very clean and tidy . staff able to help book tours and advise on ideal local shopping malls/ attractions etc.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. Happy to hear that our staff was able to help you book your  tours and give you helpful local info.

Summary: This was a great place. Had everything you need in the room. Kitchen came with all the dishes and amenities you needed. Great big rooms. Was a great getaway for the weekend to celebrate my birthday with friends.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that we helped make your birthday trip special! Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: This is a very cute hotel with a nice, full kitchen that included pots and pans, dishes, and a full size fridge! The bed was comfortable and there was tons of room in the closet for all our stuff. We stayed on the 1st floor so we had an enclosed patio area with some plants and a cute water feature. I liked the privacy we had out there while still being able to see the tops of palm trees.  The pool was very clean, though there wasn't a hot tub which was a bit of a letdown. The staff was super friendly and helpful, and the restaurant in the parking lot delivers room service which was great after a long day at Disneyland.  I just want to know what the deal is with the Arnold Schwarzenegger posters in the hallway?? What is that about? I am genuinely curious.  I would definitely stay
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to review our hotel. So happy to hear you enjoyed the Courtyard Studio! As for those Arnold pictures... hopefully, they will keep you thinking "I'll be back"!

Summary Heading: Excellent staff especially a staff member named angel
Summary: The staff was excellent and went out of there way for everything I needed. The manager took me to three different rooms to find me the quietest one. Then when I checked out a staff member named angel went way out of his way to help me get all my stuff to my car because it was only Me and my baby (and we had ALOT of stuff) he basically took everything and loaded everything into the car for me and refused a tip. Nice hotel, heated large pool, delicious connected restaurant, and like I said excellent customer service
Manager Response: So happy to hear that you and your baby enjoyed your stay at our hotel! We will make sure Angel see your kind comments.

Summary: This was the second time we have stayed at this hotel.  We once again really enjoyed our time here.  My husband, daughter and I were on a family vacation to Disneyland.  We like that this hotel is about a five minute drive to Disneyland.  Our room was a king sized bed and twin bed suite.  There were a couple of people slamming doors, but besides that the hotel seemed very quiet during our stay.  I was very surprised about the quiet in the hotel, especially since they seemed really busy!  We got back to our rooms very late each night and the rooms were cleaned up very nicely.  We definitely enjoyed our time here and can not wait to visit this hotel again!
Manager Response: Thanks so much for writing another review for us. We love our repeat guests and are excited for your next return!

Summary: we (family of four) stayed in this hotel in August. it is accessible to everything. the front desk staff were .super nice and friendly! they all should be given a good raise. we were well looked after from start to finish.they also assisted in arranging our tour to universal studio n lego land.the bed was comfortable and the pillows were awesome. the pool was really nice and great fun for the kids. a shout out to Angel who was especially great and helpful. i simply do not have anything negative to say about this Hotel
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel! We are so happy to hear that you were well taken care of by our front desk staff. We will make sure to pass on your kind comments to Angel and the rest of the staff. Hope you will be back soon!

Summary Heading: Hotel Conviniently Located Close To Disneyland
Summary: Our overall stay was okay, the king size bed was very comfortable. This hotel is recommended for families visiting Disneyland who have their cars to drive around since the hotel does not provide shuttle service. Across the street is a grocery store with all sort of ready to eat foods and a few stalls away is a small Chinese food restaurant with very reasonable price. The room we got had a small fridge, stove, microwave, kitchen sink, with all the utensils that come in handy for a longer stay. The hotel can use some renovations inside and out, there's also a pool that we were not able to use due to hectic schedule. When you book with Hotwire, it does not mention about the "resort fee" which is $3.00 per day plus tax, so factor that in you total cost of stay.

Summary Heading: Don't judge how the outside looks....what lies beneath is more important!
Summary: Yeah for sure this hotel is not a 5-star hotel. But for the price, you can't go wrong, knowing that around Disneyland, hotel prices are way too overpriced! The front desk is extremely polite, helpful and kind. The room is clean and spacious. It is within 3 miles to Disneyland. Accessible to everything. I will definitely stay here again when I'm in town :-)

Hotel is located in shady part of town.  Exterior and interior needs updating.  Service is ok.  Room is spacious but old, dingy, and falling apart. Bed was lumpy and TV had poor reception. Room had awkward layout and overlooked run down apartment parking lot.  Complimentary breakfast served at restaurant next door was so poor - even my children wouldn't eat it.  Only saving grace was this hotel was cheap, but so was everything else about the stay.  If you are looking for a comfortable stay for Disneyland, this is NOT the place.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are sorry that you were generally disappointed in  Anaheim and that our hotel was not a good fit for you. Boutique Spanish Style hotel is not for everyone but most of our guests do seem to appreciate the larger size of our rooms with full kitchen facilities.   All rooms had new beds in 2013 ,flat screen TVs were just fitted in July and our TV channel lineup is great!  We will, however, check into the reception in your particular room. We do offer a “ Fee light continental breakfast” with affordable full  menu upgrades.

Summary Heading: Far From Perfect But Met My Requirements
Summary: I am rating this property as "Good", nearly "Very Good" because it met all my requirements and I was satisfied with my stay.  I have stayed at Motel 6s, all the way up to 5 star Ritz-Carlton properties.  I am a Starwood Preferred Guest (SPG) lifetime Gold member.  When you add it up, I have a broad perspective on hotels and rooms.  For this trip, I had very specific requirements for six nights with my tween and teen children.  I was looking for:   1. Kitchen with full fridge/freezer, a stove and microwave  2. Two queen beds 3. Swimming Pool 4. Less than 15 minutes to Disney's parking structure 5. Free parking, Internet, continental breakfast 6. Around $100 per night (taxes and fees all-in)  The Building & Surrounding Area: The hotel looks like it was formerly an apartment that
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time to review our Hotel. We are happy that such an experienced traveler  as yourself had a good experience staying with us . Our front desk staff are also appreciative of your positive feedback! We are usually on top of our room linens and kitchen inventories but will take a closer look at your room. We usually inspect every room closely after each high occupancy season for this very reason. We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary Heading: Dated and quite a distance to Disneyland.
Summary: The size of the roomsis very good and having a full kitchen is handy as well, however room services just does the beds and not the kitchenette. We were atying in a wing away from the central entry and the internet was very flaky...manager advises they are trying to update, but it seemed to afflict rooms at the ends of both wings. Beds comfy, a veranday light stays on all night and can't be turned off, thanks for the heavy curtains, which block the fresh air however.   Bathroom dated. In all - average, but a nice arabic restaurant on-site.
Manager Response: Thank you Steve for your  review . We are happy that you liked our rooms and the comfort of  our beds. Our recent upgrades to our internet service have made it extremely fast and reliable. We did however find a local issue in your room area and have had that fixed. Most of our guests prefer to use their own transportation as we are conveniently located within 5-10 minutes of all of Anaheim’s major attractions

Summary Heading: Not worth the money or the time!!!!!
Summary: Now I stayed there with my wife for a few days to kind of change things around.  I guess they are fixing the place up from the previous owners.  Now when I got to my room it seemed cozy then I sat on the bed and the comforter smell was bad the sheets also smelled like rotten water.  I wanted to throw up.  Now I went to the bathroom and washed my face and the towels also had a bad rotten smell on them.  I went up to the front desk were a young man tried to help me but said that house keeping was gone and they were booked and there was nothing he could do.  Just a bad taste in my mouth.  I just think that is not worth the rate on any room they have.  I do travel a lot and I think MOTEL 6 has better smelling towel then Hotel Pepper Tree.  Not even one star to me but I have to give
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We usually receive great comments about the cleanliness of our rooms and our customer service.  The hotel has been under the same ownership for the past 10 years and the quality of our linens are monitored daily and replaced on a regular basis. We have investigated your comments and haven't been able to identify your stay.  We would appreciate if you contact us so we can investigate further.

Summary: The hotel staff made our stay a wonderful experience. They accommodated us in every possible way. The rooms and facility were clean and the pillows were yummy! We had problems with our reservations (no fault of theirs) through Diamond Resorts and management brought down our stress level by assisting us to solve the problem. Thank you so much!

What puzzles me most is the number of positive reviews for this property on different travel sites. Have those people ever stayed in a proper hotel before? While nothing bad happened during my stay, it’s hard to find anything positive to write about. It is advertised as a boutique hotel, but I can assure you there is nothing boutique to it and very little hotel too. Looks like a cheapo two story apartment block with reception. Stayed in what is described as King Suite, which looks like a studio apartment with one king bed, broken spare bed and kitchenette. A/C was window unit, way too noisy on a hot night. Whole place has a filthy appeal, covered with sticky grime. Blankets were full of holes.  Free breakfast was quite amusing, cereals being the only edible thing. The rest are
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Most of our guests are very satisfied with the boutique feel and standard of our accommodations. Our attention to detail when it comes to housekeeping and the comfort of our beds is well reviewed .We are sorry that we were not a good fit  for your expectations but we are only a 3 star hotel.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel in July with a great rate booked directly with the hotel. We had reserved a King Balcony room for our Anniversary get away. I chose this hotel for the kitchen and suite set up and of course the price. I knew this was a privately owned place and not a chain and I always find these little gems to have more character than the basic chain hotel rooms. When we arrived the staff was amazing and helpful. (I don't think in our entire 4 day day we had anyone who wasn't happy and helpful.) Knowing it was our anniversary, they upgraded us to a garden room. It had small patio outside with a fountain and a table with 2 chairs. When we got to the room, we had found that they had left us some Anniversary goodies with a small card. Off to a good start, right!! We liked

Summary Heading: I have nothing negative to say...
Summary: This hotel is not far from the Disneyland Resort, very easy to find and parking was not a problem.  The room was spacious, maybe a little outdated,..... but it was very very clean.  The bed was comfortable and the pillows were great! No weird smells (considering its pet friendly) and there were plenty of towels. Bathroom was spotless and water presser in the shower was great.  All rooms have a patio or balcony, and the A/C worked so good we woke up freezing! The free breakfast was standard, option to upgrade starting at $2.00.  Definitely will make this our "Anaheim Hotel of Choice" and will stay here again!

The room was clean. The Staff helpful and friendly. The setup is nice and well laid out. Loved the private porch and fountain. Nice pool area with BBQ. Enjoyed having a full kitchen. Would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, with a few issues.
Summary: We were looking for a place to stay in LA for a week with a kitchenette to save money on our trip. The room was very spacious and the kitchen was great. The patio was big and even though we overlooked the pool, noise was never a big issue. We had a few small issues. One of our glasses was cracked and when I cut my hand washing it, the front desk didn't have any band aids or other first aid available. There were a few issues with room cleaning (No replacement dish cloth after the first day, some garbage missed on the floor one day, hair in the bathtub on another, and one night, some spots of blood on the sheets), but overall, we were happy with our 9 day stay.

Summary Heading: There are good and bad points
Summary: The good points would be the fully equipped kitchen that comes with plates and pans and even dish soap to wash up. The room was cute too with a nice size balcony to relax on. the pool is very nice, appears to be remodel or new. The free breakfast is served in the restaurant in their parking lot but it was basically disgusting besides the coffee. They serve doughnuts that are halved and obviously frozen and defrosted. You can upgrade to a hot breakfast but that wasn't very well either.We stayed at the hotel to go to Disneyland and a shuttle does not stop to at this hotel. We had to walk down the street some and take a 30 minute bus ride. Staff was very friendly and helpful. One more thing, showers took FOREVER to get hot. So basically we all took luke warm showers.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad you enjoyed our new pool area. We have made many upgrades recently including the pool, flat screen TVs increased  internet service. Disneyland is an easy 10 minute drive from the hotel and our guests find this much more convenient than using shuttle services.The restaurant has also recently changed hands and had a major facelift. Rotana Grill has provides our light continental breakfast service and actually has the muffins baked specifically for the hotel on a daily basis. The breakfast includes choices of cereal, cut fruit, yogurt, muffins , toast , juices, coffee tea and hot chocolate. Rotana Grill also offers an upgrade to a delicious full hot breakfast for only $5.

Summary Heading: Hard to find a better deal!
Summary: Delightful, charming, clean, convenient, roomy, comfortable, with great customer service. I spent 15 days with my granddaughter who loved it there. The fully equipped kitchen met all of our needs. Free continental breakfast is served in the restaurant fronting the hotel daily. Your choice of muffins cereals, toast, oatmeal, fruits and beverages are satisfying.  If you are hungry for a hot breakfast the restaurant will offer a great $5.00 breakfast for hotel guest. Although there is no laundry facility in the hotel a coin operated operation is across the street. Another wonderful asset is the supermarket across the street. The customer service is outstanding.  My compliments to Angel who tried so hard to help me extend my stay however the hotel was Solded Out. I will truly return

This hotel is a hidden gem!  Three of us (adult daughter, 9-yr-old grandson, and I) spent two four-day stays at the Pepper Tree in June, and were constantly pleased by the service and the room!  The layout is that of a small apartment--a kitchenette that had a full-sized fridge and stove, plus a microwave (w/dishes, pots&pans, utensils, etc.), living area, very comfortable bed, dressing room and bath, all in an eclectic hacienda style.  The young men at the desk were intelligent, funny, and eager to help in any way possible, especially when we kept asking for more towels.  (Towels were big and thick, but we always need more for our hair, etc.) Every employee we met was smiling and friendly.  The hotel is clean, cute, and a short drive to Disneyland!  (We also used it as the

I stayed here with my 12 year old daughter for a week to see some family, go to Disney and attend VidCon. We stayed 7 nights in a two queen room on the second floor overlooking the pool. I was very pleased with this hotel! The service was friendly and efficient, the location made it easy to get to Disney, the convention center and the freeway. In addition, it has a new restaurant that shares the same parking lot that was quite good and it's across the street from a small market which is great since the rooms have full kitchens. Add a nice pool, large rooms and a really good price for the area and I was very happy with our choice.  Some have mentioned that the room furnishings and such are beginning to show some wear. That's fair, but the room was clean and I didn't find it

I requested a handy cap room and got this room yhat you could not even move a wheel chair in. No railings in the bath room. You couldn't get a chair in there any way.Just a cooktop.No patio chair or table.

Had a three night stay for six (3 adults and 3 children) in the Queen Suite.  There was enough room for all of us; room, kitchen, and bathroom were clean, and it was a very nice hotel--with all sorts of restaurants, stores, and things to do VERY close by.  LOVED the Spanish hacienda feel of it! Key points: LOVED the little patio with a water fountain that we had; kitchen is a FULL (though be it small) kitchen--with a large fridge, microwave, sink, and gas stove with oven; pool area, which they said was newly renovated, was very nice--with a BBQ available to use; the FREE breakfast (served in the restaurant next to the hotel) was pretty darn good.  This was the 2nd hotel we stayed in, of a 2 week (8 different hotel), cross Cali/Nevada trip, and it was #3 on our review list.  Only

Great place to stay to get an away from home feeling, but in a dirty part of town. Only downside was we found bugs crawling into open holes behind the toilet. Along with holes in our sheets/blankets and stains all over the couches. Looked like the room just needed to be updated and cared for...
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are surprised at your comments and would like to investigate further but cannot identify your stay . We are known for our clean and well kept rooms and are diligent with linen quality.  Please contact our manager so we can follow up.

Summary: My husband and I stayed here at hotel Peppertree for our Honeymoon. It was perfect....great location to all theme parks and Huntington Beach, the bed was comfy and room was clean!! We would stay here again come next year for our family vacation!!

It started when we got to the hotel early and we were just going to check our bags when we were told we could check in early. ( nice to hear that it would not be an extra charge.) Then the pool was ready to use we were excited. We loved the charm and warmth of the hotel and the staff were amazing. For the price I paid it way exceeded my expectations thank you for the memories.

We stayed at the Hot Pepper Hotel Memorial Day weekend. I exceeded our expectations. I loved the spacious rooms that included a full kitchen, bathroom and balcony. The decor was charming and relaxing.The staff went above and beyond. The breakfast was a nice way to start the day, cereal, fruit and oatmeal. The location was EXCELLENT. I would recommend this hotel to just about anyone, you will not be disappointed.

If you are renting a car and will be all over town and need a decent place to stay (sleep), this is the place!  Located about 10 minutes drive (maybe less, depending on traffic) from Disneyland, California Adventures, etc.  It is a Hacienda Style boutique hotel.  Although it is being remodeled it shows the "antiqueness" of it (in a positive way).  The rooms were cleaned and have a kitchenette.  The TV could be a flat screen TV and the chairs updated but then again, their prices are very reasonable.  Matress was a bit hard for me, but my husband liked it.  Again this is not a 5 star hotel nor resort. One thing I did notice that could have been better, our blanket had a hole and the a pice of the cabinet's cover in the bathroom was peeling.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response and we are glad that you enjoyed your stay. Good news ; we are getting new flat screen TVs and have just finished renovating our pool and BBQ areas. The restaurant has been totally remodeled and will be serving a great selection of American, Greek and healthy Mediterranean food. They will also be serving our guests a free light continental breakfast and a great selection of other hot items for those wanting a more hearty fare We will check into the coupler of other items you mentioned.

Summary: Hotel was in a great location. It is an older hotel but while we stayed there was a lot of renovation going on. Staff was very friendly & helpful. Their restaraunt was closed for remodeling but there were food places within walking distance. Brito's Taqueria is a tiny little place but has the best Mexican food!
Manager Response: The Good news is that the restaurant has been fully renovated and will be open for business next week serving yummy breakfast lunch and dinner . Our heated pool and BBQ area has also been renovated and will re open on Monday. We apologize for any inconvenience to our  guests. Unfortunately  our occupancy runs high all year and there is never a convenient time to carry our such works to keep a high standard of accommodation available to our guests.

Summary: This was rated as 3 stars  NO Way..  We  were  very disappointed. The only good thing was the staff they were nice. When we checked in the toilet was stopped up and ready to over-flow. The bathroom was a disaster. The faucet in the bathroom sink didn't work, the shower was of the old bath-tub shower combination and when you showered the bathtub started filling up with water. The woodwork was in bad shape through- out  the room even the elevator was old more like a 1950's unit.. I could not recommend this place.
Manager Response: Could you please contact us and confirm the room number so that we can further investigate. We have just finished renovating our pool area and restaurant and will be adding flat screenTVs to all our rooms next month. Our rooms are generally in good shape , clean and well reviewed by most guests.

Summary: I have considered reviewing this hotel since our stay in December... We we're mislead; thought it was close to Disneyland, but it's not.  No shuttle, very inconvenient, and unpleasant area.  Plus the rooms are odd.... Felt more like some old apartment building than a fun getaway ... Not a place I'd return to willingly.
Manager Response: Thank you for you review. We have had trouble identifying your stay with us and are sorry that we were not a good fit for you. Most of our guests love our rooms with great comments on cleanliness and decor. We have just finished  some great upgrades to our heated pool and BBQ area. The Restaurant has had a total make over and will be serving a  yummy mix of American, Greek and Healthy Mediterranean food.

Summary: My son and I stayed at Hotel Pepper Tree for 4 days in April 2014, and it was a great stay. The staff was very nice and accommodating. The rooms were nice and big and pleasant. We were close to Disneyland, Knott's, and Adventure land. Angel at the front desk was so helpful in planning our trips. A big thank you to all the staff for making our stay so enjoyable. I would definitely visit again in the future. I would also recommend this place, its was clean and staff was friendly and excellent.

To begin, the booking process on their website was easy to navigate, the price for the quality is great! I arrive late at night at 2am and the front desk agent Jesus explained things thoroughly and answered all of my questions. When i opened my room, it was decent size and the a/c was adjustable. It came equipped with a full kitchen, with refrigerator and also a closet with two huge mirror doors. The balcony had a beautiful view to the pool outside and the privacy of it was satisfying. Although I did not try the pool, i spoke to other guests who seemed pleased with the cleanliness of it. The breakfast was superb and it did not become crowded like other places I've visited. Disneyland and Knotts were within fifteen minutes of the place and taking Gilbert to Manchester avoided all

The AC doesn't quite handle a family of 3 cooking on a warm spring socal day, but the room has a full kitchen which certainly helps the Disneyland budget. Plenty of storage space in the room, massive closet and a nice sized balcony. Only a few miles from Disneyland, though take Gilbert (I believe) to Broadway to Manchester, much easier than dealing with the turn onto Lincoln.

Summary Heading: Satisfied Guest at Hotel Pepper Tree-Anaheim
Summary: My family & I stayed at the Hotel Pepper Tree on 3/22/14 and were surprised with the extras in our suite (full kitchen, oven, dishes, etc.).  It was great cooking a full breakfast for my family.   My grandsons totally enjoyed the pool Sunday morning-it was a real treat for them. The registration staff and their willingness to help us over exceeded our expectation.  This was a nice experience, and we plan to stay at this hotel again sometime in the near future.

b'fast buffet here is decent. we took a room with two queen beds as we were a family of four visiting disneyland. we spent 2 nights there. If you are looking for low budget and very functional arrangement then this works. Room was big and there was pantry w utensils, microwave etc.  For me beds were not as comfortable. They were spring beds and would make sound every once in a while. They did not have a restaurant service but are located near a mini market place which has a thai food place and subway. As i said very functional but then we were not looking for much.

The Hotel has an older Spanish decor and was maintained nicely. The Ac was somewhat noisy but the room was comfortable, quite and clean. The continental breakfast needs to be expanded but was least offered.

We found our stay at the Peppertree to be very enjoyable. The decor was unique and comfortable, and the staff were very accommodating for anything we needed. We had no problems with excessive noise. We would stay there again.

The rooms are very unique and large. The only downfall was the outdated bathroom. Bed was comfortable and clean. We stayed here for one night to go to a hockey game at the Honda Center. Very large deck with a bistro set. It was nice to have the kitchen to use if needed.

I've stayed at the Hotel Pepper Tree every year on business for the past 7 years and I consider it my home away from home.  The rooms are comfy with a full kitchen and I simply set myself up like I'm at home. Load the fridge up with organic fruit & veges from the nearby Sprouts store, set up my pc with the free internet and I'm set.  The staff are unbelievably friendly.....Vincent, Angel, Marcello, Jesus....all of them are gorgeous....led by the hotel manager Rick, who is a true gentlemen.  Close enough to all that Anaheim offers, the Hotel Pepper Tree is the perfect place to spend a great holiday or work trip in Orange County.

Summary Heading: good location if you're going to visit Disneyland
Summary: Nice hotel, big rooms with balcony. Twin rooms have 2 queen size beds. Cleaning of the rooms is good. Wi-fi sometimes is good and sometimes not!!! The breakfast is poor but ok if you don't use to eat huge breakfasts. Staff at the reception was really helpful and nice to us. Good location if you are going to visit Disneyland or Anaheim surrounding areas. There's a bowling just 200meters from the hotel (really nice).

We are staying here as I write this review. Room is  cute, festive, very nice, clean. The staff is very knowledgable and friendly.Really enjoying  the outside enclosed patio to sit with our pet and enjoy a glass of wine. 🍷 Would defiantly recommend this place to others. I plan to stay here again 👍😊

This hotel is perfect for traveling with young children. All of the amenities you need inside the room. Quick on & off freeway access to get to disneyland. Love staying here for our multiple night stay - over & over again!

My boyfriend and I were in the need of a place to live super quick and after hours of research the Hotel Pepper Tree was the most affordable and nice looking hotel for an extended stay. The hotel is super cute with a spanish style and homey feel. The room is spacious with a kitchen and sectioned off dressing area and bathroom. The staff was extremely helpful in meeting all of our needs during our transition between homes.  I also love how close it is to everything but that it is a little off the main road too. Overall, it was a lovely affordable quiet getaway. We are so grateful to find Hotel Pepper Tree and for all of their hospitality.

Booked this hotel for a weekend trip to Disneyland.  The hotel is not too far away from the parks - less than 10 minutes away.  We reserved through booking.com (rates were even lower than the hotel's manager special) for less than $80/night.  Our third floor room had 2 queen beds, a small seating area with coffee table and sofa, a full service kitchen, and a small bathroom/dressing area.  There was also a nice outdoor balcony with bistro chairs and table overlooking the pool area.  The beds were very comfortable.  Breakfast is certainly not the healthiest (prepackaged cereals and pastries, some fruit, yogurt, juice, instant oatmeal) but it was enough to keep us full until lunchtime at the park.  Right next to the hotel is a small strip mall with a Subway, Peruvian restaurant,

Hotel Pepper Tree is our favorite hotel to stay at when visiting the Disneyland Resort! Even after staying at a much "fancier" hotel down the street at twice the price, we still choose to go back to the Pepper Tree every time. The staff is very accommodating and always very friendly. During our last visit, I forgot my cell phone charger in the room after checking out, and they were so helpful in helping me find it, nearly an hour after I had already left. The rooms are fantastic-- very spacious and clean. Every room we've stayed in is equipped with a stove, full sized refrigerator, and microwave; plus cookware, utensils, and plates-- which is great if you want to save some money and cook for yourself. The beds are so comfortable, and hard to leave in the morning. The

Just this past weekend, we took our daughter to Disneyland for her birthday.  We got to the hotel to check in before heading to Downtown Disney.  I was very impressed with the check in process.  I had read prior reviews about the elevator being loud.  Before I even had a chance to ask about that, the front desk clerk asked if we were light sleepers and since we are moved us to a different room.  That was very courteous of the hotel!  The room was very clean and met our needs as a family.  The bed was very comfortable and the room was cozy.  The hotel was a ten minute, at most, drive to Disneyland, which was really nice for our vacation.  We will definitely stay here again!

We were in town for the NAMM show at the Anaheim Convention Center and stayed at Hotel Pepper Tree.  In reading the reviews and seeing the pictures, I knew it wasn't your run of the mill chain hotel, which we were happy with.  We can do that at home.  We enjoyed our stay there.  We were there for 4 nights.  Our room had a king size bed and a kitchen with a microwave, full size fridge, coffee maker and the basic items like cups, mugs, plates, and utensils as well as cleaning supplies for dishes.  We used that to our advantage to eat leftovers and save some cash on eating out too often.  The bathroom was very spacious with a huge closet and dresser inside and extra hangers if needed.  The only issue we found in there was that the tub "squeaked" when we were in it but that's not

My partner and I stayed at this hotel for nearly a week in late 2013. If you're looking for a "resort experience" this isn't it.  But we weren't looking for that.  Our "suite" had 2 queen beds, a small sofa, a pleasant enough terrace overlooking the hotel parking lot behind the building. The beds, sofa, and kitchen area are all in one room: more a studio situation than a suite IMHO.  Overall the staff were very helpful and pleasant. There were 2 days when we put the "please clean this room" sign on the door when leaving in the morning, but upon our late evening return we found unmade beds and a lack of fresh towels; the cleaning hadn't happened. Other than that problem, the hotel ticked all the boxes. The decor is reminiscent of the 1960s, very Spanish-colonial retro. We found

My daughter and I stayed in this hotel while we were visiting for a swim meet in Irvine this past August. We chose the hotel for the price and the full kitchen. It is a bit dated, but we enjoyed the charm and decor. We found the room to be clean, comfortable and everything was in working order. It was a bit noisy in the halls, but the air conditioner drowned out most of the noise. Internet was spotty at best.... Probably our biggest complaint. We used the pool one afternoon, it is in need of some repair, around the pool deck. The lounge chairs were comfy and the pool is secluded from parking lot. We cooked breakfast and dinner in the room and had everything we needed. I didn't love the neighborhood, but I think it is just older! not unsafe. Shopping was convenient. We drove to

We arrived soon after the 2pm checkin time and our rooms (2 for 6 of us) were ready. The rooms are almost like small apartments, in size, and could be used for an extended stay. One room had a king size bed and a very nice patio on the ground floor.  The room was clean. the kitchen was equipped with a full size refrigerator, small "stove" with an oven and 2 burners, and a sink.  There was a really nice fireplace, with a comfortable couch, cozy for two.  The heater and AC both worked (we had very cool nights and an 80 degree daytime temperature). The other room, on the 3rd floor, had a balcony, 2 queen beds and a similar kitchen (although the oven/stove was a full size unit).  There were 2 arm chairs, rather than a couch, and no fireplace.  This was great for the younger folks.

I did a lot of research prior to selecting a good hotel , I read thousands of comments on this website and I finally decided on this hotel due to the good reviews . Fortunately I was right , we found the hotel very comfortable, clean , well located, close to parks but had to go by car . We had a room on the first floor with a nice terrace, large , clean and nice room. loved it. We had a car so going out to eat at night or to buy something was no problem at all. The reception staff was very attentive and helpful . I send some shopping I did online a few days before my arrival and they kept my things until I reached the hotel. Rate included breakfast, which consisted of coffee, juice box , some fruit and some packaged muffins . Basic but clean and enough to get to the parks early

Summary Heading: No bugs, Nice Neighborhood, close to Disney
Summary: I saw no bugs, contrary to other reviews. The service was great. Its noisy during the day because the maid's cart rattles going across those lovely tiles in the foyer and near the elevator. So if you want to nap during the day, specify a room above x20. We stayed in 222.  The neighborhood was nice enough. We walked to a Vietnamese Pho restaurant, up the street. It was nice and cheap.  The Mexican grocery across the street was very handy.  We had some problems with the coffee pot, but it was quickly replaced.  The water was just barely warm enough for a shower.  I think this is a great family hotel, the fountains out front run all night and cover the traffic noise. This was a nice touch as well.

Summary Heading: Beware of rooms near the ancient elevator - Otherwise good.
Summary: I really wanted to like this hotel.  It was a reasonable price near Disneyland with free parking and reviews were middle of the road.  We arrived after a full day at Disney and parking was easy but a bit dark - a few more lights in the parking lot would be very welcome.    Front staff were nice and - JOY! - an elevator!  Or not.  We unfortunately got stuck in room 302 which is right on the elevator.  Every single time it moved in any direction our room started to vibrate and a extremely loud hum filled the room to the point   that we had to stop talking until the noise stopped.  The room was very large with a kitchenette and a large balcony.  The furniture is dated but nice and the bed was comfortable.  We were lucky and had a heater in our room - and as it was 45 that night it

When I originally booked the hotel I was impressed by the reviews, but when we actually arrived it was very different from the pictures.  We arrived after dark and were not happy with the neighborhood.  The place was hard to locate at night because there was no signage out front and very little in the way of lights, even the address sign was on the side street.  The only way we found it was when the GPS said "You have arrived at your destination".  There were several people just loitering around outside the building that did not look like guests and my wife and I were afraid of even getting out of the car to try and find the front desk.  When I finally did go inside (my wife waited in the car with the doors locked), the person at the front desk didn't even acknowledge my
Manager Response: I am sorry that you did not get to experience our hotel and that you were not happy with the Anaheim area. Our restaurant is temporarily closed while it is being renovated.

Summary: As the title says, the customer service here is great, unfortunately this hotel is dated and has a bug problem. My husband has killed a handful of roaches in just two days and found a huge spider on his shoe. After a day at the park we came in our room and it was freezing, due to the fact that there was no heater in our room and only and ac unit. The guy at the front desk got us a space heater and asked if we wanted to change rooms but we didn't.   The hotel is in a good location and is close to the parks. The free breakfast was only cereal and fruit. I've been to hotels where the free breakfast had eggs, bacon and waffles so we were kind of disappointed. The floors in our room were extremely sticky and were like that everyday we were here so I'm assuming they were never
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We will follow up immediately on your comments. We usually are complimented on the cleanliness and comfort of our accommodations and we take feedback very seriously. We do have regular pest control but will double check this room.

Summary: My wife and I stayed here prior to a trip to Disneyland, which is 10-15 minutes drive away. I kind of had the impression from the hotel's website that it was boutique - probably not quite the way I'd describe it, as it's a pretty big place.  The rooms are fine and plenty big enough and the kitchen is a great feature (there is a supermarket across the road, along with Subway, Thai, Chinese and Peruvian within two minutes' walk of the hotel). Reception was friendly and the continental breakfast on the ground floor filling.  The night we stayed there was a lot of commotion outside around midnight with some kind of Police stand off, which involved loud hailers, a helicopter and a felon up a tree - hence the poor rating for sleep quality. All part of the LA experience!  Overall,

The hotel was really great. Its not luxurious, but its cozy. Great place to relax without spending a lot of money.  Having a kitchenette was great so that you wouldn't have to eat out every night. I would definitely stay there again.

we went to Los Angeles for thanks giving and used this hotel as a base to visit friends and family from. it was ideally placed and well situated  but please get your sign light fixed, as the closed restaurant on the corner makes it very hard to find you. the rooms are very clean and with a very good maid service. having the kitchen area stops you from needing to eat out all the time and allows you to bring home the excess from your meals  ( we english find this aspect amazing) loads of closet space loads and mirrors and nice to have trays of ice ready in the freezers. but you really need a desk and chair to sit at for use of the great wifi connection.

We stayed one night for our visit to California Adventure & Disneyland. It wasn't a pleasant stay.  We stayed on the bottom floor. A cricket was found crawling around on the carpet.  The sliding door to the patio was left unlocked.  It was very noisy due to people walking around up stairs. We could also hear people talking. We could hear people walking up & down the hall way.  A gap was under the door (no weather stripping) cold air was coming in. We only got 3 hours of sleep. Pupic hair was on the walls of the shower. My brother also stayed in a room on the bottom floor and they checked out early.
Manager Response: Thank You for your review. I am sorry that noisy neighbors spoiled your stay.
