We were at near 100% occupancy for Thanksgiving and if we do get noise complaints this is the time when it will happen. We do generally remind guests to be respectful of others during their stay. We are usually complimented on the cleanliness and comfort of our rooms but will certainly investigate your comments further.

Summary Heading: Nice, nice. Not thrilling... but nice
Summary: **1st and foremost let me say thank you trip advisor.  Helped our family make this selection and for the most part, the reviews regarding this hotel are on point.**  CUSTOMER SERVICE - Natalie, you are awesome.  My husband booked this hotel a little earlier than we had wanted to (late booking, cheaper price vs. early booking... well you know) because we stayed during Halloween week.  While the price we got was good, we could have gotten a better deal.  We had to change our room upon arrival to make sure we got a fold out couch for the kids. Without our prompting, Natalie adjusted the rate with the current (that weeks) managers special.  That was nearly $100.00 off.  That is what putting the customer first is all about.  Thank you Natalie.  The rest of the staff was also very

We had to come to Anaheim for a birthday party...Only live 50 miles away but didn't want to drive home late at night...Saturday night  in Anaheim...thought we would be paying a fortune...We were given a  rate under what we expected and directly though the Hotel...Hotel is very clean and Quaint...Very much like a boutique Hotel you would find in Mexico or Europe, Our room 101 was on the first floor...and would be great for a small family....Kitchen, bath, dressing room and even a private patio....My only downfall with the room is it should be a HC room at least with bars around the bathtub...Breakfast was fine...Plenty of fresh fruit...juice, coffee..cerial and muffins.. AND BTW...YOU DON'T HAVE TO GET ON THE FREEWAY TO GET TO DISNEY LAND...I believe this hotel is rated a 3....I

This hotel is too far to Disney in my opinion.  Have to get on the freeway for a short distance to get there. Hotel looks old and dirty.  Sofa in the lobby is dirty, I wouldn't want to sit on it.  The beds/bedding is old.  Stains and just old.  Sofa had a cover on it and it was dirty and torn.  Bathroom very old.  No hair dryer, need to bring your own.  Breakfast is limited to oatmeal and cold cereal and not a very big variety.  Apples and oranges, bananas gone and not replenished.  I had to go ask for some cereal.  Hotel was cheap and I guess you get what you paid for.  I did not feel it was worth the cheap price.  I'd rather pay more.

This is still a favorite. This trip we got to stay on the first floor. The little fountain in the courtyard made the stay even more relaxing. The beds were very comfortable, we slept like rocks and woke up late. The front desk called to ask about late check out. They were very understanding and were extremely pleasant about it. This hotel has the best rooms and the best cutomer service I have ever experienced.   The price is extremely reasonable too.

Heidi408 needs to get over herself. I wonder if she changes her sheets at home every day....  If you're looking for Holiday Inn sterility, go there. If you want character and comfort, go here. We like character with our comfort.  We were here for the umpteenth time, and as always, had an excellent stay. For the first time, we had a room on the 3rd floor. That was nice, as sometimes, the little preciouses get all amped up about going to Disneyland, and run all over the place, which ain't all that great if you're on the floor below.  The room was clean, the bathroom was clean, and the kitchen area was clean. We don't do any cooking in any hotel room kitchen, anywhere, other than make coffee. That sorta goes against the whole notion of vacation.  I frankly do not see how the room

Summary Heading: No clean sheets the whole week!!!!
Summary: My husband and i stayed here from from monday September 23 to thursday september 26th. We were supposed to stay till saturday morning but it was such an unpleasant stay that we checked out early and found another hotel. At first glance this hotel has some charm to it. But as travelera we're not looking for decorations. We want comfort and cleanliness. This hotel lacked greatly in both categories. The bathroom is old poorly repaired with paint coatings, the tub pools water ....it never goes down the drain. I was so disgusted with the bathroom that i almost felt like id be better off not showering after a long day at Disneyland. The tile they have in the room is ridiculously big and dangerous. Plus ypu can tell it's not properly cleaned. The room and the hotel in general has an
Manager Response: I am sorry that our hotel was not a good fit in meeting your expectations. We pride ourselves on providing clean , comfortable and affordable accommodations with style. Most of our guests love the traditional tiled floors and the charm of the hotel. It is  common practice in many hotels not to change sheets daily. We do make up your  room and refresh towels daily. Our breakfast is monitored and is only designed to be a light continental breakfast.  We will however take a close look at your room to follow up on your comments.

Summary: On a road trip, we stayed in 12 different hotels in as many days. This is the one I would recommend for an extended stay with family. We booked last minute online and when we arrived were upgraded from a queen to king in a huge room on the ground floor (104) with daybed, sofa, and  full kitchen. The room was clean, included basic kitchen utensils for 2 persons, nice soap and a big comfortable bed with AC that worked. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was basic: cereal, juice, fruit, coffee/tea, but if you want something else you have a kitchen to cook it and countless restaurants.

It was the greatest ever.  The bed and room were very clean, the beds were soooo comfortable. I would greatly recommend it to anyone to stay there. It was just so relaxing and comfortable, and the staff went out of their way to help. The only thing I regret is not being able to stay longer, but the price, continental breakfast, and everything else was excellent. I truly recommend it to anyone.

I had a quiet room at the back. This was a full suite unit which i did not require but had fridge, stove, microwave, coffemaker, dishes, couch and T.V and also an outside deck. Room was very clean and comfortable. Check in was easy as was checkout. A small breakfast was included. They also had a computer in the lobby for free internet service. I did have a problem with it so i was quickly directed to another computer in one of the offices. Great service. Only complaint i had is we arrived quite late and there was not lighted sign in the street marking the entrance.  I believe it was fairly close to Disneyland and Knotts. (15 minutes at most to both). We were there on business.

I will never stay anyplace else!! It's an amazing hotel, elegant and so customer friendly! Plenty of parking.. Sparkling pool! Great value! I would recommend this hotel to everyone I know going to Southern California! Convenient to all entertainment, food & freeways

I can sum this hotel up this way: nice, quiet, clean, spacious room (with real fridge kitchen!) and  friendly personnel, great décor, and excellent rate! I will definitely stay here again the next time I visit SoCal!

Prior to arriving at Hotel Pepper Tree we were not expecting much as the price was cheap.  however we were very pleasantly surprised by the quality and standard of this facility.  The quaint spanish hacienda themed decor is appealing and very tastefully done.  The room was spacious with a full size kitchen, king bed, couch, dining table and private balcony overlooking the swimming pool.  Housekeeping was of a very high standard, there was a welcome 'goodies' bag on arrival and there was a huge amount of storage space making these rooms ideal for families.  Breakfast was basic and the inclusion of toast would have been welcome but there was enough to satisfy us.  There was ample parking any time we arrived and the older style air conditioning was not a problem as we just turned

We stayed at the Pepper tree hotel before and we came back again. The place is very nice for us and very spacious as we are a small family with young kids. The full kitchen is huge plus and the people there are friendly and helpful especially Chris whom I have dealt with in all my reservation(current and previous ones). I would definitely come back again and would recommend it to other people.  My recommendation to owner is to do some remodeling as some things need to be changed.

I reserved 2 queen beds, but the beds are clearly not queen sizes. It might be "queen size" according to the hotel, but it is definitely not queen size. Also, the cushions and decorative pillows on the couch are worn down - there are spots on the cushions and the decorative pillows. The layout of the bathroom is inconvenient. The flush tank hits the bathroom door all the time. The hallways and lobby are very hot. Waiting in the lobby is very miserable. There should be air conditioning throughout the hotel. There is a resort fee of $2 for parking, internet and breakfast. I think that is not reasonable. We had a hard time getting internet service and breakfast is terrible. Since we were charged $2 for those additional services, I think it should be better than  the other hotels.

We stayed here for 10 days and we enjoyed our stay at the Pepper Tree. We had a small issue checking in as we were given a room without an oven/hob. Apparently they have about 4 rooms that do not have a hob. However, when I told them that I specifically picked the hotel for the cooking facilities they moved us to a different room. This room was great with plenty of space, a nice kitchen area, large double bed, plus bunk bed for my daughter. The courtyard was decent, but beware of the balcony above as we had a few issues with rubbish dropping from above. I don't agree with other people about the area around the hotel, which I thought was fine and safe. All in all we enjoyed our stay.

Value for money, big room, nice closet and reasonable bath room. Best is have balcony. Opp shops and supermarket. A lot car park space. Fast foods and restaurants all walking distance. Only avail room service with Italian pizza delivery.

This hotel is located in not the best of neighborhoods and outside appearances were deceiving. The decor is interesting.  The front reception area is very old fashioned, but well maintained.  We were a bit worried when we were given our first room since the fire alarm system kept beeping(which meant that the battery needed to be replaced).  Someone from the front desk came up to check it out immediately.  She had NO idea what needed to be done and had no spare battery.  We told her we couldn't stay in a room that would continually beep with/or without the battery she removed.  Happily, we got another room. It was nicely decorated, had a full refrigerator and a small kitchenette.  The bed was comfortable with a choice of several different types of pillows available. My daughter

Summary Heading: Good value for a family Disney trip
Summary: We stayed at the Pepper Tree as part of a 5 day family trip to Disneyland.  We would certainly stay here again, but there were some issues.  Pros -  Less than 10 minutes from Disneyland (about 4 miles) Large Rooms Full Kitchen Very friendly staff Fairly inexpensive (95ish/night with 2 Adults and 1 Child)  Cons -  Rooms need maintenance.  The entire hotel is fairly worn. Pool was cold and in need of maintenance No Shuttle to Disneyland Not in a great area  Basically, a pretty decent low cost base for family trips to Disneyland.

My husband and I spent out Honeymoon at this hotel, and it was nice.  Sadly we were too busy to enjoy the little kitchenette or suite had, but the bed was comfortable, and overall look and space of the room was great.   We did have a mess in our bathroom one night, that may have been caused by housekeeping, but they were quick to clean it up.   We were close to Disneyland and a decent distance from LA. Our stay was lovely :)

My daughter and I had a reservation at the Hotel Peppertree August 2013. The hotel is definitely dated, but we were excited to try a new place away from the hustle and bustle of Disneyland. Our room was very lackluster, and looked very 'old' and worn out. We were horrified to find that the towels in the bathroom were stained with yellow marks, and the bed sheets had not been changed. There were several hairs on the bedding, and the bottom sheet was crinkled where the last person had slept. It appeared as though the maid just remade the bed without changing the sheets. The real kicker came when I pulled the mattress pad up to find reminents of bugs and other debris. It was very clear that the mattress and pad had not been cleaned in a very long time. The staff was very nice,
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am told that our head housekeeper inspected the room when you complained and could not agree with your findings.  We are sorry that our hotel was not a good fit for your expectation. Most of our guests are happy with the standard of our housekeeping and we do pride ourselves on providing clean and stylish yet affordable rooms .

Summary: My family travels to So. Cal from the Bay Area almost once a year.  We always stay here and my kids would not have it any other way.  Very close to Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm.  Super friendly staff.  Nice sized rooms with a patio and are very clean. There is a laundry across the street which is great. The kicker for me is the kitchen.  Just being able to prepare one meal a day in the room saves so much money.  Their internet is a little slow but I just bring my mobile hotspot and I am all good.

was a little worried when we saw the surrounding neighborhood.  however, when we got inside we were blown away. rooms are huge and very comfortable. lots of storage.  kitchen was fully stocked and comes in handy if you dont want to eat out all the time.  staff is very friendly and accommodating when you need help. it is a little further from disneyland then we thought but drive isnt bad. restrauant in the front parking lot is great.  would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Summary Heading: Great location for visit to Disney.
Summary: We needed a base close to Disney and this was ideal. Check in was fine, service was great. Room was large, clean and couldn't fault anything. Got breakfast which was great when you have a long day ahead at Disneyland. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again.

We stayed 3 days and I was very happy. The Internet was terrible, really bad. I liked having the fridge. I loved the little outdoor patio. We were on the ground floor so there were a lot of plants on the patio. The staff were so nice and helpful anytime we needed anything. The best thing was the sleep I got. I always take my own pillow, but this is the first time I didn't use it. Their pillows and mattress were soooo comfy. Better quality sheets would have made it heaven. I would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you like the ghetto
Summary: Stayed here for the 4th of July weekend. Had my car broken into in broad daylight 15 ft from the front door of the hotel in the first couple of hours. Spoke with the manager about looking into the security cameras which just happened to be pointed at a palm tree. They also had the nerve to say they didn't want to get involved by turning the footage over to the police, I had to do that myself. They claim this hasn't happened more than 2 times in the past 12 years but a quick look at the Anaheim police crime map showed 7 car thefts/ grand theft within one block just the weekend I stayed! Even the mexican restaurant had their TVs stolen! Had I checked prior I would have never stayed here, you get what you pay for.
Manager Response: We are sorry that this incident occurred on our property and for the stress this has obviously caused you .This is most unusual and we do have proper security systems in place that are available for any such incident. Unfortunately it is protocol to have the injured person deal with the authorities in these kind of matters. As a result we will be keeping a very close eye around the property.

Summary: When traveling to Disneyland, "you get what you pay for"  doesn't always apply.  But in this case, it's true.  Pros:  free parking, hot showers w/good pressure, full kitchenette, free Internet.  Cons:  dark lot in shady neighborhood, tubs don't drain, kitchen area isn't cleaned well, and Internet is very spotty.  As far as "free hot breakfast", the only thing hot is the coffee.  Packaged sweet rolls, cheap white bread, instant oatmeal.  Not worth the calories!!  One more thing-thinnest walls EVER in a hotel.  NOISY!!!!  Babies crying, children screaming, running up and down hallways, loud voices in the middle of the night.  Sure, Disneyland is a kid-magnet, but really?  Next time we'd pay a bit more for decent food, cleanliness, proximity to the park, and a semi-decent night's
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel! We apologize for not living up to your expectations but will look into your complaints very seriously. We do not offer or promote a hot buffet breakfast but only a free continental breakfast. The restaurant adjacent to the hotel does provide a hot buffet breakfast for $3.00 per person. We do think we are a great value for the money paid – free breakfast, free wifi, a large rooms with full kitchens. Sorry again that your stay was not what you were hoping for.

Summary: The rates are better here than newer places closer to Disney, but neighborhood was not the most comfortable, altho' we didn't have any safety issues. The concept is admirable...older motel amped up for today's family/traveler with kitchen/suite area, but needs more updating Pool looked nice. No laundry facilities. The kitchen area was adequate, as was the room. Beds not overly comfortable. Hole in the tub. Parking area was a little dark. Breakfast was breads to toast, cereals, fruit and yogurt in a small room with big TV for morning news. Biggest negative was that when we pulled the cover off of the AC wall unit toward the end of our stay because we were all having sinus issues, found out there was no filter and the inside was covered in mold/mildew. The Mexican Restaurant in

One of the best hotels on our road trip: only complaint is that the breakfast could be better, but it was OK. Under 10 minutes from Disney, and you'll spend more time than that in the parking queue anyway. Hotel looks great with old fashioned charm and rooms large and clean with a full kitchen. Staff helped retrieve our daughters dropped hairbrush from another room no problem!

Older hotel located in a residential area. So so continental breakfast if you like cereal and rolls. Rooms ok nice old world feel. Beds good but watch out for the air conditioning it is very loud. Pool area needs refurbishing lots of peeling paint. Had a good price so all in all ok if you are looking for an ok hotel.

Overall an ok hotel stay with no major issue.  We stayed here for 3 nights in one of the courtyard rooms and travelled to the Disney parks and Disney Downtown during the day.  Compared to other hotels in and around Disneyland this one is a little further away but still only a 10min drive.  Some of the downtown area you pass to get to the hotel looks a little dodgy and a group of large trees obscure the hotel sign as you drive along Lincoln Ave.  As we spent nearly all our waking hours at Disney the hotel was only used for sleeping, washing and eating the breakfast (which is included at $2 per day).  Breakfast consists of 4 choices of cereal, some pastries, toast and some fruit (we saw apples, oranges and bananas).  It's self serve in what looks like 2 converted hotel room...one

We stayed at Hotel Pepper Tree for 3 months and we have returned there the previous 2 years. Manager and staff very helpful. Had a minor prob with bed and refridge during our stay but was resolved by management!!  Overall, very nice, clean location, would stay there again. Very conveniently located.

Made to feel welcome. Excellent customer service with desk staff (? Leandra ? sp) who went out of her way to help us out by faxing personal information to SeaWorld when we were stuck in SanDiego having forgotten our SoCal City Passport. Appreciated the great kitchenette and would highly recommend it for families visiting Anaheim.

Nice hotel and accommodations!  Loved the balcony  Cons: Made us pay an extra $100.. For "hidden fees" ...  Lobby infested with nats it was very disgusting The lady at the reception didn't know what room we were in when I had my confirmation printed she still isn't sure.. So that was weird;  and sent us to the third floor and their elevators weren't working so we had to take the stairs with our heavy bags only to find out it was the wrong room. I asked one of the house keeping ladies to help us and she was just on her phone and walked away- didn't try to help at all. So we went back downstairs and another 30 minutes to set up our "room" .. It was frustrating how long it was taking! & the hallways smelled like cleaning products. And after we settled into our room. We went to
Manager Response: Thank You for your review. We are pleased that you were happy with our accommodations .We do have a few new front desk agents in training so we can only assume that this was what you experienced. The only extra fee that we have is a $2 per night resort fee which is well publicized.  We will further investigate your comments and will attempt to identify your stay with us. Thank You again for drawing our attention to these issues and we will see you next time.

Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights for our Disneyland trip. The front desk was very helpful. I liked how I had a sliding glass door to my own balcony. The drive to Disneyland was short and a very easy route. There was a restaurant located right outside from the hotel but we didn't get a chance to try it out. Overall it was a good stay for the price.

Stayed here for 3 days and I would certainly recommend this to everybody. The room was big and clean and the kitchen good enough to kook when too tired to go out. The pool is acceptable and my kids really enjoyed it, we even used the pool barbeque grill one night.  They offer a good choice breakfast and the staff is friendly and helpful. So good price, free breakfast, free parking, pool, good location and nice rooms, what else you can ask in an hotel? I'd stay again.

Stayed here for 5 days as part of a tour we did around the US. We chose here as its close to Disney (for those in the UK, by close, I mean one junction up a freeway close, not walking close!) Room was clean and very spacious. Breakfast was basic but adequate Staff were wonderfully friendly and helpful. The only downside was I found it a bit too noisy. I think the walls were possibly a bit thin and we could hear everything going on in the next rooms. Groups at the hotel seemed to be large families with kids who, as a young couple, we found this quite noisy at times. I'd stay again.

Stayed at the Peeper Tree for one week. Booked at short notice. Found it to be a nice well ran little Hotel with really friendly staff. The Hotel is set back from the road to provide a good nights sleep. Our room was at the front of the Hotel and included a large balcony, a kitchenette c/w microwave,a gas cooker, a decent sized fridge and a set of pans and utensils. This gives you way more options than a standard Hotel room. The amount of storage available for a hotel room was remarkable. A full continental Breakfast is included in the room rate. The Hotel has a reasonable sized pool area with a gas BBQ, two large gazebos, with tables and chairs bot inside and outside of the gazebos. No food apart from breakfast is served at the Hotel though it does have vending machines  on the

My family and I have stayed at Hotel Peppertree in the past but every time we stay there again, our visits get better.  This hotel is very clean, the staff are very friendly and courteous and the overall experience is great, especially with the great affordable prices.  I highly recommend Hotel Peppertree to all my friends and family when ever they plan a trip to Anaheim.  And I highly recommend it to you too!  :)

The building is behind a restaurant and back from the street, so the road noise is minimal.  To find it, look for the big blue and white sign.  The front entrance has one of those Mexican fountains.  Could use brighter lighting, though.  Kinda dark at night.  The whole building looks like it was transported from rural Mexico.  Very different from other hotels.  Friendly check-in.  Our room was large, with a kitchenette and a full size fridge.  Our huge balcony overlooked the pool. There is a BBQ grill out there.  Breakfast was adequate.  Across the street is a Carniceria (Mexican market).  The 10.00 a.m. check out is a little early, but the 2:00 p.m check in is early also.  We left at 10:30 a.m. with no problems.  I think a lot of people would like this place for the different

I was surprised by the kitchen and great closet in the suite! This turned out to be our little home just 10 minute away from Disneyland. It was great not to feel trapped in a small hotel room. Reception staff was always helpful and kind. Great experience.

This hotel represents good value as a hotel outside disneyland. The drive to Disneyland is about 15 minutes so it is not bad at all.  We had a King suites which is good. They also provide pots and pans for us to use the kitchen. Everything is clean and room smells great.  As a lot of reviewers said, this hotel is outdated but I can tell that all the staff is trying their best to make up for it. I really apperciate it.  They have a small breakfast every morning which is really solid. Orange juice, milk, cereal and some small bakery. Me and my girl really enjoyed it.  Overall, this hotel is a very good choice around disneyland. I will definitely recommand them to all the budget travellers.

Summary Heading: Great out of "Disney" hotel for the price.
Summary: Finding this hotel was a little difficult. The hotel itself is an older hotel with a Spanish theme design. For a room to sleep an shower this is a great hotel. The pool was warm and hit the spot after a long drive. Guest services was helpful with information on getting to Disney land. Their is no shuttle service or bus from the hotel to Disney. The closest thing is the ART system a good 10 minute walk to a golf coarse behind the hotel. Pending on your length of stay and plans the bus is not cheap and arrives once an hour. The room was very comfortable and great beds an soft pillows. Disney is about 5-10minute drive and 15$ a day to park. But if you don't mind the drive and parking its a great place to rest up.

I stayed here for a night during my childrens spring break the hotel is clean sheets room bathroom etc but it does need a make over the pool paint in and out is chipping and some of the rooms need new paint . The rooms are clean but dnt look like the ones on the web site they are a little older  and the kitchen area looks old its a nice place but i dnt think its worth the price. For the breakfast it says a buffet which you dnt get there a table with cereal ,muffin and coffe, and fruit it should say a continental breakfast. Then when you book third party be aware that there is a resort fee when you check in which is not said when you book ..Also the parking is very small so if you get there late you might be out of luck there no security in the parking and its out in the open the

I wasn't sure what to expect when I booked the hotel room because I am very picky, but I wanted a decent price.  So I booked here and hoped that it would be okay.  When we drove up, the hotel was really nice looking and my kids were in awe.  Check-in was easy and the lady at the front desk was very nice.  When we got into the room, I loved it!  We stayed in the Courtyard queen studio on the first floor and it had plenty of room for my family of five.  It was clean which is super important to me with three children.  It was an older looking hotel, but it gave it character and didn't bother me at all.  I will stay here whenever I need to have a hotel in Anaheim again.

The guy at the counter took $20 for roller bed and resort fees and never gave a receipt even After repeatedly asking him.  I think we were not supposed to be charged anyway. Other than that our stay was great.

Hotel Pepper Tree was very complete. The hotel had a good size kitchen and living area. The hotels location was close to verything Disney. We really enjoyed our stay here would definatly stay here again.

It was 11 pm. Hotels near Disneyland were full from a cheerleading convention. A quick web search led me to the Hotel Pepper Tree. I approached skeptically. It was a dark parking lot with no marked entrance that I could see, but once I found my way in, I entered a different world. A world with cute Spanish-style details and a kind staff.  My room was large, with a sitting area and a fully enclosed patio. Kitchenette, large bathroom. I couldn't open my bottle of wine, so the guys at the front desk helpfully tugged until the cork was loose. One more phone call to the front desk for the wifi password, and I was set.  The morning was a bit noisy because the kids in neighboring rooms were all wound up and ready to go to Disneyland. But the free breakfast soothed my soul, and soon I

Going on a fairly last minute family holiday to Disney, I had certain requirements for a hotel. I wanted a kitchen(ette), larger room, but the big 'must have' was a patio.  Nothing is worse, inmy experience, than travelling with a child, staying in a hotel room and basically having to go to sleep at 8 because there is no where for the parents to escape to. This hotel provided this in spades. There was a lovely walled in deck - extremely private, for us to enjoy a couple of cocktails later in the evening.  It definitely made the holiday more enjoyable for us.  The location of the hotel is fine, the price reasonable, and desk staff excellent.  However, the rooms are quite shabby and needing upkeep, the cleaning was not great, and basic repairs we asked for (patio table literally

Convenient location in Anaheim- close to Disneyland and the Convention Centre.  We were impressed with the large, clean rooms, comfortable beds and kitchen facilities.  Free parking and wifi were very much appreciated also.   The hotel staff are super lovely and will go out of their way to help you.  We loved our stay at Hotel Peppertree and will most definitely stay again next time we are in LA.

I was skeptical about staying in a private hotel that wasn't part of a huge national chain.  I even told the manager when I checked in that, if I wasn't happy with the room, I was going to turn around and find another place to stay.  She graciously said she wouldn't even charge my card until the next day to give me time to get comfortable.  Well, I called her within minutes of entering my room and told her that I was more than happy!  The room was comfortable and clean, which is really all I look for in a hotel room.  The free Continental breakfast offered a great selection and actually filled me up through the morning.  The staff was more than accommodating.  Is it a Hilton or Marriott?  No.  But you don't pay the crazy chain prices, either.

I've stayed here twice when visiting Disneyland.  It's a several-block drive from the Park, but no sweat if you're driving anyway.  This place is a steal.  For $75-85/night, you get a huge room nicely appointed with a deck, and full kitchen (bowls, utensils, etc.), and a decent breakfast.  If you can get a downstairs front room, you get a swell private patio, adobe-walled in and decorated with plants.  The decor is Mexican Weird--gigantic urns in the lobby, dark distressed wood everywhere (even in the elevator), lots of Mexican tile--which I like but it isn't Holiday Inn.  The place is a trifle shabby but nothing offensive and it's clean.  No hot tub.

I stay there one night.  The room is very good. Big and Clean. Staff is Great.   Bathroom is clean too.  Special decor and furnishings. My doctor like them very much. It is great worthy of the $. a great night.  I will stay there again.

Just stayed overnight. Saw good reviews and bad reviews on different travelsites. I figured I had a 50-50 shot. I don't rely on other peoples opinions. Thank goodness because for the price and size of the room I was pleasantly surprised. Every thing was clean and neat. Nice decor and furnishings. Clean bathroom(very important). All in all a great night.

I was a guest at this hotel. I stayed there for 4 days. The rooms are big and clean, my room was clean every day I got fresh towels everyday. Overall I have no complaints about this hotel I would gladly stay there again. Great hotel and great staff

I have another review on here about this Hotel, and sadly have to warn that what was once a great spot to stay has since gone down in it's desirability for me to stay at.  One thing after another seemed to go wrong with this place on this stay and after raving reviews by me previously, I would have thought this place would want to make sure to keep me happy.  First thing, ice cube tray had a nasty smell.  Took to front desk and was able to get a swapped out tray from another room. Hope they didn't put my tray in the freezer they got me one from.  Night two of our stay is when we found the real issues.  The microwave began to arc as I was popping popcorn.  Scared me enough to cancel my popping.  Went to set my alarm in the room to wake early for check out since check out is at
Manager Response: Thank You for reviewing our hotel. We have been carrying out many upgrades to the hotel over the past 6 mths and during upgrades to the restaurant  we have had to provide a "free" breakfast in the hotel. We scheduled the work for our slowest month being January but as you experienced there is never a convenient time in this business. We are sorry for that inconvenience. With most guests having alarm functions in their phones we rarely have request for alarm clocks, Guests can  request wake up calls from front desk. We are genuinely sorry that these issues compromised your stay and do hope to see you gain.

Summary Heading: Not what it used to be.
Summary: I really liked the Pepper Tree as a convenient location, near enough to Disneyland and always clean.  Yes, it's a bit run down, but I can say that the people at the front desk have always been friendly, polite, helpful and personable.  The beds have always been usable and the furnishings clean if a bit worn.  When we came for our most recent stay, we discovered that they are no longer doing breakfast with the restaurant next door.  This was one of the biggest value-adds of the property for us and was a big disappointment.  We also found that they were now charging a $2/day "resort" fee for an "inclusive" continental breakfast and WiFi.  A breakfast we were never up in time to eat, nor that had any of the decent protein that the old breakfast offered (I asked the desk staff what
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Our light continental  breakfast will be served in the hotel while the restaurant undergoes some upgrades. WIFI service has been upgraded recently and is now free, as is breakfast. We traditionally  charged for  both services but in keeping with our value for money policy we now charge a flat $2 resort fee which is way cheaper for our guests. We are sorry if this was not explained properly to you and do hope to see you again.

Summary: We got in late since Disneyland closed at midnight.  When I checked in I was quoted a different balance from my original bill. The rep was unable to explain the charges and just stated they were "new" resort fees being added as of the new year. When asked if what I just paid was the final price of our stay, which was more than what my balance was initially, he stated he didn't know and I would need to speak with the manager the following morning. Due to the holiday we had to book a smaller room the first night due to availability and a courtyard queen for the rest of our stay.  The next morning we told the same rep who helped us check in that we were leaving for the day and did we need to pack up all of our stuff since we would be in the courtyard queen for the week. He stated
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing our Hotel. We have followed up on your comments and do apologize for the inconvenience in changing your room. The Front Desk Agent concerned simply "dropped the ball" and has been reprimanded. We have also carried out a thorough deep clean on both rooms. Your comments about the room were quite disturbing to us as we usually receive very positive feedback on the cleanliness of our rooms and indeed our housekeeping department takes great pride in how they present the rooms. We do charge a $2 resort fee but no longer charge for WIFI or breakfast; this is a much better deal for our guests overall.

Summary: Really value for money studio room with kitchennette with 2 queen sized beds, also a balcony!  Ample space for my 1 year old to walk around while I cook.  It is a 5-10 minutes drive to Disneyland.  And the breakfast at the restaurant nearby is stocked up with more than enough.  The staffs are friendly too.  We arrived late at night and my husband had some problem with our rented car we just collected at the airport.  The guy at the reception actually went to the car to help my husband work on it.  They would also help you to print directions.  I have recommended this hotel to my family and friends and they too had rave reviews.  We will be there again!

Summary Heading: Great One Month Stay at Pepper Tree
Summary: We stay at Pepper Tree for exactly 1 month, and it had been a pleasant stay. We came from South East Asia, and found out about Pepper Tree hotel from Yelp. After doing comparison with other hotel, we decide Pepper Tree would be the most suitable for our needs. so  We booked the room by e-mail, 2 weeks before we arrive and The Reservation were handled directly by Deycy, the manager of Pepper Tree hotel. During our stay, Deycy the manager, Angel and Alee at the Front Desk, and other front desk staff were friendly and very helpful in accommodating our special needs. (special needs because we have plenty of important mail being send to Pepper Tree address, and we are happy with the help from Pepper Tree front desk in handling our important mails).  The House Cleaning Service also do

I am long overdue in writing this review, since we stayed here in Sept. 2011 to meet up with relatives who were coming down for a Disneyland trip. (I had to put 2012 as this wouldn't let me go back that far!)  The grounds are picturesque and very SoCal...that sort of California mission style with lots of adobe, lush succulent plants and pretty fountains.  Entry way is very dramatic with a high ceiling and dark wood accents.  The pool area is great (although I wish they had a Jacuzzi).  Plenty of seating and they offer gas grills for the convenience of their guests.  A unique pair of stone turtles perched poolside spit streams of water into the pool for added fun.  Location is nice, directly across from a supermarket and there is a restaurant adjacent to the hotel that has good

I stayed in the Pepper Tree Hotel for 4 nights. the bed is a little too soft and the fridge is a noisy one but overall you got what you pay for. Desk employees are very friendly and helpful and cleaning service is good. My advice for breakfast: skip it and go out, much better.

We enjoyed this hotel very much.  It's a nice, quiet, charming place reasonably close to Disneyland.  The staff is terrific.  Both the morning and evening front desk attendants were very nice and accommodating.  The hotel room has a small kitchen complete with microwave, refrigerator, pots, pans, utensils, etc.  Really great.  Beds were very comfortable and there's a nice buffet breakfast for only $3.00.  I didn't like being charged for Wi-Fi, but we are told come January the fee will be eliminated (and we appreciate the hotel staff letting us know that).  In any case, the Wi-Fi service was convenient and the connection was good.  They seem to be owners that care about their property and customers, and we appreciate that.

I just loved this hotel, was perfect for our family.Quiet, close to Disneyland, shopping, was a true home away from home. The staff was very helpful especially Lorrisa, I will be back. I loved having a kitchen, to not be forced to eat restaurant every meal was a relief. We were close enough to Disneyland that we came to the room for lunch, rest, shower  and went back, saved hundreds of dollars on that alone. I cant say enough good things about this place. Nice people in the area, everyone was nice and helpful. Grocery store right across the street. I saw no crime, and no questionable people in the area. I think i heard police sirens once the entire time we were there, thats better than were I live now.

Another trip to California, another stay at the Pepper Tree.   This time, we're here specifically to go to Disneyland and to DCA. As always, when we're in Anaheim, we stay here.  Since we made our reservations later than is customary, we wound up with a smaller room than usual. And that was fine.   Rather than the usual table near the kitchenette, there was a day bed. This was much better for our needs. We could put all the stuff we brought, plus the shopping results on the day bed. Also made it a lot easier to get everything packed up and ready to go.  This room doesn't have the standard room air conditioner in it. Rather, it has the 21st Century version of the old swamp coolers we had in the Midwest. The thing is a bit noisy, and most people in the delicate 21st Century aren't

I really appreciated this hotel, it was very comfortable, the layout of the hotel was charming, the rooms spacious, large refrigerators.  The staff was very helpful, they printed out maps for us.  Itwas clean.  The only thing I did not like was the discounted breakfast at the restaurant out front was really awful.  I realize it is a separate business but it was not good.

My husband and I, and a friend, stayed here in late October on our two day trip to the LA area.  When we booked, I asked for the courtyard with the fountain.  My friend requested a regular room.  We arrived after dark, and had no trouble finding the hotel, as I had read the reviews on missing the sign, so we were "on the lookout" for it.  I was impressed with the Spanish-style of the property,  It almost felt like being in a Spanish mission when you were inside.  I loved that decor. We were pleased with the size of our room and I loved the walled courtyard with the fountain, which gave you a private, quiet area to relax.  My friend's room upstairs had a balcony so she could also enjoy sitting outside. My only complaint was the cleaning solution used in the rooms.  In our first
Manager Response: We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us and thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  We will follow up on your comment regarding the cleaning solution .

Summary: I chose Peppertree because my family members had stayed there and enjoyed it. Having the kitchen and fridge was a plus. I was near the elevator so I could hear that during the night but it really wasnt that bad, Its really close to Disneyland but far enough away from all the traffic.

We were looking for a place to stay for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland. Overall, the hotel is clean and adequate. We had a two queen studio room, with a mini kitchen.  We did like having the mini kitchen, which saved us money on breakfast everyday and provided a place to make snacks. The odd thing was that there was no table and chairs to eat at in the room. On the patio there was a VERY small wire table and two chairs but nothing inside the place. This was a little odd. My husband wanted to do some work but there was no table to do work on. We had made breakfast but had to eat it at the coffee table or picnic style.  There isn't free wi-fi at this  hotel, but it is reasonably priced. At the time of our stay, it was $5 per device, per stay (not per day). The only problem was

Summary Heading: Nice place at a reasonable rate!
Summary: I chose the Peppertree because of the rate and then I read the reviews. I was very satisfied with my stay of 2 nights. The employees were very friendly and the room was clean and fresh. My room was on a corner near the traffic so it was a little noisy, but I couldn't beat the price for the quality. I will definitely come back!

Summary Heading: Stayed here before and will again
Summary: We've stayed here I believe three times now and still love the place. Love the decor of the hotel, the staff is super friendly, and it's always nice and quiet inside. We love having the kitchen on longer vacations for leftovers and if we're tired of going out to eat.  Only two minor complaints I have are the wifi is fairly unreliable, it comes and goes and at times can be great, othertimes you can't access anything. Also it could use better blankets for the beds. Both pretty minor though, if you want a great price with some great value, this is the place to stay in Anaheim

Let's be fair. Is this the best hotel in the Disneyland area? Absolutely not.. Is it the best value? You better believe it!.. Is it the newest hotel in the area? No Is it a dump? No way.  There is no doubt that the rooms could use a fresh coat of paint and a good carpet cleaning, but it was still by far the best place I have stayed in the Disneyland area for the price. The king suite was very large and comfortable and very nicely decorated. It was way better than the motel-xyz chains in the same price range.  The breakfast served at the restaurant next door was not bad for $3, and is optional since you have a full kitchen in your room. It was still better than the "continental" breakfast served at the other motel-xyz's.   The staff was friendly, helpful and polite. They resolved

A cosy little motel with a great feel to it.  The staff was friendly and extremely helpful.  The courtyard rooms are terrific with a private courtyard complete with fountain and bistro.  The room upstairs left their bathtub on and we ended up with a complete bathroom "shower".  The staff had us moved to another room very quickly and efficiently.  Highly recommended.

Just stayed for a week-end.  The hotel was a resonable price.  Location is 2 miles from Knotts Berry Farm and about 5 miles to Disneyland.  Laurice was GREAT!  She is a real asset to this location.,  The rooms were clean but really need an update.  No alarm clock between the beds.  No phone between the beds only a push button wall phone.  Microwave and kitchenette in the double queen room with full sized frige.  In the King room, table and 4 chairs, stove, refrig and microwave (didn't work).  Breakfast a the restaurant on the property was only $2.50.  It was a dirty place.  Walked in and on the floor was food covered with ants, stains on the floor.....didn't wait to eat there.  All in all the place was OK  just needs some major updating,  Also no ice machine!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and I am glad that you enjoyed the hotel. We do have a new restaurant operator (which is quite separate from the hotel operation) I will follow up on your comments about the restaurant.

Summary: 1st off I feel this hotel deserves 3.5 stars but that's not an option.  This was hotel number 3 of 4 on our U.S trip.   It was booked based on reviews on here, price and proximity to disneyland and the L.A Angels baseball stadium, both of which were visiting on our two day stop in Anaheim.   The rooms are ok, a tad dated in their decoration but its nice to have a full size fridge, which we took advantage of and a full kitchen, which we didn't.   Some issues with the room included:  Lack of safe, add to this the sliding door on the balcony is'nt mega secure if you ask me and therefore theres nowhere safe to put your stuff, however we did ask the reception to hold our passports when we went out, which they were happy to do.   old school noisy aircon system, which wasn't that

On August 28 of 2012 we had planned a family renion/vacation which included two little furry ones... I'll like to emphases these as it was the primary reason why we selected this particular hotel since they offered a private patio. Note that I called in two different occasions; the first time to figured out how far we were from our original destination and to make sure that we were in fact going to be given the private patio which was ideal for our pets. The second called was to confirmed.  When making my reservation I also added a comment as why and for what reason it was so important that we got the private patio...  The first night went by pretty smooth, the following morning my husband arrived at this property around 7:00 am to take the dogs with him to the beach as we had
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and I am sorry for your experience. Unfortunately the hotel has a strict policy, when on occasion, we allow a guest to bring a pet. We have zero tollerance to noise or disturbance , especially if we cannot contact the guest. I am sorry that you clashed with our manager : we usually get excellent feedback from our guests when it comes to Rick and Lupe. For the record I am one of the Australian owners and I am involved with the hotel on a daily basis. I am happy for you to contact me persoanlly to discuss our handling of this incident.

Summary Heading: Nice enough but some bad points
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights in late September. We were travelling around the west coast and made this hotel our base to explore LA.   The hotel- Firstly, this hotel is too far out if you want to explore Hollywood and the beaches. It is only around 33 miles to Hollywood but with LA traffic took us around an hour, although parking is not as expensive in Hollywood as you would expect and easy enough to find.  We arrived at the Pepper Tree around 8pm and were greeted by very friendly reception staff. The staff are a credit to this hotel. The hotel is a quaint rustic Spanish style that I loved.  The room- We were given 301 which faced the car park on the back of the hotel. The room was large, kingsize bed, sofa, kitchen, fridge, large wardrobes, desk etc. I would stay that if you are
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We will investigate the condition of this room immediately. I am quite surprised as we are usually complimented on how clean our rooms are and the convenience of having a kitchen. Just for the record we are not mainly extended stay but a mix of leisure, business and a small number of extended stay guests, usually on work assignments or relocating to the area; probably very similar to most other hotels.

Summary: We stayed this week at the Pepper Tree for two nights.  Staff was very friendly.  We had the bottom floor, and I must say that I LOVED IT! the rooms were so very nice and cozy, the enclosed patio was also very nice.  We payed a minimum fee for hot breakfast, which was not anything fancy but still delicious.  They also left a little goody bag in the bathroom which was an addition to the already included shampoos and soaps there.  There is a very nice grocery store across the street that sells delicious food, excellent if you are on a budget, the rooms have a small kitchenette that really does the job.  I cannot say enough good things about this place except that I wish we would have stayed here the previous years we visited Disney.  I think this is the place we will now stay at

The value for the money here is unbeatable. The rooms are beautiful and spacious, basically a studio apartment. The furniture is all rustic, yet very clean and well maintained, which gives character to the hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and helped guide us around Anaheim and LA.  It's a 5-minute drive away from Disney and Knott's, with many services/shops/restaurants around. It's a 40-minute drive away from LA and the parking is free and spacious. The hotel has a beautiful small restaurant with a tiny breakfast buffet and very friendly staff. In summary, this is one of the cutest hotels we've ever been to, and would DEFINITELY stay here again and again.

Unlike the Lemon Tree, the Pepper Tree was very nice. Clean, quiet and low prices.  The pool also needs to be resealed.  Large black spots on bottom.  Not inviting to swim in.  But other that that very nice.  Very friendly staff.  I will stay here again.  Hard to believe both hotels owned by same person.

We stayed at the Pepper Tree last month and I have been slow to report.  We arrived late at night, having made a major booking error, a day early, the wonderful man at the desk couldn't book us into the room we were going into the next day as they were full, he gave us an upgraded room instead.  We stayed for a weeks R & R on our way back to New Zealand, what a lovely base to have.  We used the Mexican supermarket across the road for our supplies, we washed our clothes in the launderette across the other road, the cheapest in the world I think!  We visited the beaches and shops, we avoided Disney, not our thing!  We relaxed by the pool and on our verandah.  When we had a late night flight we were kindly given a late checkout.  These people were very kind and helpful to a pair of
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to seeing you again one day when you get back to California.

Summary Heading: Don't let the exterior fool you!
Summary: I was a little leery when we drove in late in the evening as the property seemed a little tired. Entering the lobby, I was surprised to find that the hotel was done in a Spanish Mission-style and was quite attractive. The property is a little old, and does show some of its age, but it was well-maintained otherwise, and could easily be described as "quaint". Our room was good sized with a king bed. The mini-kitchen had a microwave, refrigerator and all the necessary plates, cups, glasses and cooking utensils. The bathroom was small - a family would find it hard to use - but it was fine for two people. Everything was clean and neat. air conditioning unit is in the wall, and is a little noisy. We had to turn it off because it would wake us when it cycled on and off. Fortunately,

I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews, therefore, I now have to give my own. This is 2.5 stars, not a 4.  It was old and outdated, making it feel dirty. Overall it was pretty clean. It had old dirty drapes and the bathtub a bit of painted over mold and mildew.  They went cheap all the way with furnishings. It wouldn't take much to update certain things to bring it to a 4 level. The pool was nice and so was the staff.  We will not recommend or be back.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and I am sorry that we did not meet your expectations of a 4 star hotel. We are a 3 star hotel and we do have a rustic spanish style that most of our guests find quite appealing compared to  more generic hotel styles. It was nice that you recognised the high standard that we maintain in keeping the hotel clean and presentable.

Summary: This property has a nice Spanish-style and the rooms have anything you would need for a long stay.  Unfortunately, some of the pots and pans weren't very clean.  The same goes for the shower which was had little, but still existent, stains.  The room itself was very nice.  We were there for an extended stay so the fridge and utilities were very useful.  The bed and room were very clean.  The staff was really helpful.  Free Wi-Fi.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Could you please let the front desk manager know your room number so that we can be sure to follow up on the pots.

Summary: We are a family of four and live in Seoul Korea. We planned to stay in Anaheim for 3 months or so and we literally read like thousands of reviews for longterm hotels with kitchens around Anaheim. Eventually we decided to stay with the Peppertree Hotel, cuz from the moment we contacted them via email, their service was outstanding. We constantly received all answers to our questions (and we really asked a lot), additionally they have awesome rates for extended stays.  We have been staying here for almost 2.5 months and unfortunately we have to leave this weekend. Since we contracted for 3 months, we expected a penalty for moving out earlier, since we actually blocked the room for the rest of the month. But once again, the management was outstanding and helped us out instantly.

The room I had this time didn't have a stove, but I really didn't need it. I did need the full size fridge, which came in extra handy. Jesus was awesome at the front desk. I will keep coming back. I really don't think you can go wrong staying here. The Vallarta supermarket across the street has excellent deals too.

Beautiful Spanish colonial styled  Fully supplied kitchenette Clean and large rooms but Property looks very aged than what is seen in the pictures, bed was old and not very comfortable had burn cigarette smoke  holes on the bedding but clean  room smells damp I would  stay at this place if they update .
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Could you please let me know which room you satyed in? We recently replace all of our beds and cannot identify your stay with us.

Summary: Beautiful Spanish colonial styled oasis that offers immaculate, homey comfort. Fully supplied kitchenette gave us home-cooked meal options. Swimming pool was clean and nice. A rare genuine, cool, restful gem with friendly service.

Clean and large rooms with a large closet. Our room had an outdoor seating with view to the pool which was very nice. It is an old, cosy hotel that we would stay at next time in Anaheim - and it is close to Disneyland :)

We want to win a free night. It was excellent. Pool was well maintained, BBQ worked as it should. Bit of a fly problem but nothing to bad. Locks messed up onc but the front office handled it right away.

Truly lovely place to stay. We arrived after midnight due to flight delays and it wasn't a problem. The room was clean and spacious, distance to Disneyland was perfect. The supermarket was fantastic, and we didn't have the cheap breakfast but did eat at the restaurant one morning. Staff were friendly and helpful and I would definitely stay again. My only regret: that we were not able to stay longer!

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our stay, it was very comfortable.
Summary: Clean, friendly, good service. I would stay here again.

Booked this hotel due to the high rating in Tripadvisor. But a bit shocked when I arrived. Maybe it is not up to my standard of 3 stars hotel.  The hotel is old but with authentic Spanish style.   The tile flooring is slippery.   Only plus side is the front desk staff is very helpful.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, would come back again!
Summary: If you're looking for a privately owned establishment, you will not be disappointed with Hotel Pepper Tree. It's located just a few miles from Disneyland and near many different dining options. Its location allows you to take a break from Disney's over-priced food choices. The check-in process was easy. Rick and his staff were very friendly and helpful. They always took the time to explain and give directions when asked. The room was wonderful. It has a kitchen, full-sized refrigerator, and a balcony (do not expect nice view though). The property also has a decent size heated swimming pool and free parking. One thing to note, let the front desk person know during check-in if you do not want the $2.50 breakfast deal or it will be included in your bill. We didn't ask and ended up

Summary Heading: Convenient and Friendly Place to Stay
Summary: Recently stayed at Hotel Pepper Tree on a part business par pleasure trip. The thing that stands out the most is the great service and friendly staff at the hotel. They were very willing help and exceeded our expectations. The hotel has full kitchens including full size refrigerator so that we could save money on going out to eat. We spend a day at Disneyland, it's just a quick 8-10 minute drive to the parking structure. A great place to stay with the family to save money, but still be near the park. We will definitely stay again if the opportunity arises.

Summary Heading: People who stay here, come back again and again and again!!  :-)  It's a home away from home!!
Summary: This was THE BEST place we have ever stayed. We were on a VERY tight budget, so having a kitchen to cook our meals saved tons and tons of money. (There are 2 grocery stores close by....one across the street, and a Ralph's (fry's) a block away!) OH....and  restaurant next door---THE BEST breakfast around... and VERY inexpensive!!  The room was amazingly comfortable, roomy, and the patio was so beautiful! The pool was fun for us after a salty day at the beach.  The manager, Rick, at the Pepper Tree was absolutely hands down, the nicest man we have ever met. He and the rest of the wonderful staff made our stay a dream. We searched for 2 months trying to find a place affordable and comfortable enough for 5 people...and this place fit both criteria.  It's so obvious that this is NOT

Summary Heading: Always our home.. away from home
Summary: My wife and I have been staying at this location for the past few years now every time we are in Los Angeles visiting family, or friends.  The staff are very friendly and helpful and the hotel is very appealing with it's amenities. A huge plus is the Kitchenette, and the Manager's special.  It can't be beat, even by the Web businesses that say they can get you a place inexpensively.  It has a small gym that normally is available but our most recent trip was being upgraded.  I look forward to seeing it our next trip with the upgrades.  Oh.. and get the family breakfast deal. It's the best deal in California.. let alone Los Angeles.  Parking is safe in either the front or rear of the hotel and unlike other area's in Anaheim, you don't pay extra for the pleasure of being within a

Summary Heading: You won't be sorry staying at the Peppertree
Summary: A great affordable hotel about an exit down the road from Disneyland. A little older but charming and clean. My family & I like this place so much when we booked our second trip back to Anaheim this is the only place we wanted to be. Best hotel Breakfast around (in the restaurant next door) were they serve real food (ie eggs). I just wish the Internet was included like some of the other hotels in the area rather than having to go down & get a code. Staff was helpful. Thanks Peppertee for another wonderful vacation! You can't go wrong staying here!!!

Summary Heading: excellent hotel and very close to disneyland -  go for it!
Summary: excellent staff and they helped us to carry our luggage. room has its own kitchen with all basic utensils. nice swimming pool and patio area just outside the room. fantastic room service and not so expensive. definitely live there next time and will recommend to others as well.. go for it

The Hotel pepper Tree has been one of the best hotels I have ever been on. We arrived at approximately ten in the evening from an eight hour flight, and where quite impressed when we arrived at a really welcoming place. The front desk gave us our key, told us where we would be, and we proceeded to move on. When we first arrived at our hotel room, we knew that we would fall in love with the hotel! The bathrooms were BEYOND clean. The kitchenette was a really nice touch, and it was clean. Beds were extremely comfortable, and no noise was heard from the outside. Would recommend this hotel to ANYONE.

Before we booked this hotel, we looked on Tripadvisor and the reviews looked pretty good....but it was kind of disappointing when we got there. The room was not very clean, floors and furniture all felt sticky. The room was spacious and had a little kitchen, but everything in it was dirty! We couldn't get the stove to work at first, but my husband fixed it. The bathroom is old and not very well maintained. The restaurant next door has the same problem as the hotel, everything was sticky, dirty and there were lots of flies in there... Do not get your (cheap) breakfast there, it was really bad food! Better go across the street to the market were they sell great rolls and pastries! Beds were comfy. The whole place could use some power-washing, outside AND inside! Location is good
Manager Response: I am sorry that our hotel did not meet your expectations . We certainly do take pride in keeping Hotel pepper Tree in tip top condition and most of our guests seem to apprecaite the charm and cleanliness of the hotel.

Summary: I loved this hotel, staff was friendly, even helped us carry up our luggage! You normally don't get that at a moderate hotel. They let us check in early at no additional charge. The hotel was really quaint; the full kitchens were a life saver when traveling with kids. Being able to keep all our drinks refrigerated before going to Disneyland was awesome. We were a pain as guests, yet the staff was extremely generous, even the cleaning staff was nice (and trust me, my mom...well that's another story). This is my new go to hotel!  I think there's a lot of stuff around...It's easy to get to Disneyland from here, there's a Laundromat across the street & a grocery store, bowling alley, & plenty of places to eat. Oh and a Target down the way!

We stayed here because it was close to family, we were in town for a funeral. Not sure this would be the best place to stay if you wanted to be close to Disneyland. It was perfect for us. Beautiful rooms, nice staff would definetly go back.

We booked this hotel to visit Knott's Berry Farm it is down the street from the adventure park. The park is not walking distance if you have small children. The room was cozy, kitchenette had a stove and full size refrigerator, the room had a nice balcony. The room was very clean!

Hotel Pepper Tree was a somewhat mature hotel centraly located in Anaheim California. It's location is ideal for visits to Disneyland and Knott"s Berry Farm.   Positives: Very affordable and good value for money Friendly helpful desk staff Older but clean (almost, see below) and comfortable rooms Full size kitchen with all utensils 10 minute drive to Disneyland Charming Mexican decor with several ponds and nice landscaping  Small pool Convenient grocery market across the street  Negatives: Decorative fountain in ground floor room not working Limited hot water during peak periods Cheap breakfast offered at attached restaurant barely edible. Urine smell in fold out couch in room

we enjoyed our stay, the room was nicely decorated, and the kitchen was such a blessing. the hotel is right across the street from a supermarket and it has its own restaurant. a bit old-ish, the fixtures are old, and you need to request a hair dryer, but all-in-all it was a good deal, and we were happy with what we got. oh- and clean, too! I wish the quiet hours were enforced, as our room was right above the pool, and people went in it at around 4 am, loud and all... other than that, we recommend it to anyone that doesn't want to pay a fortune but still wants to enjoy being away from home, and still feel comfortable

Summary Heading: First time here. Have been curious about this place.
Summary: Pro's- the room was big, clean and had all the in room amenities u could ask for. The kitchen and the balcony were impressive.  The breakfast was a great inclusion to the room. The fee was small. Hot and cold breakfast. Key needed to enter hotel after 10 pm. Vallarta supermarket across the street. Granted an 11 am check out w/o any problem. Rustic type setting.  Full.bar at restaurant. Free parking. Away from the disneyland area crowds and resort fees.  Cons- no jacuzzi and pool was cold (second weel of April). Had to get towels from front desk. Checked in @ 155 pm and waited 10 min for room key. The hallways: difficult to pull luggage cause of the slab of carpet in the center and on the sides cause of the cobblestone like tiles. The small ponds looked dirty. I could see how

Returned to this place after a couple of years, still maintained well - great place to stay if you want to be near Disneyland and have a studio suite. Almost same price as other motels which are 3 mins closer to Disneyland but totally a different experience than a motel stay.

Summary Heading: A boutique Hotel better than the corporate ones.
Summary: We found this hotel by accident and felt like we discovered a hidden gem. Our room had a balcony with a fountain, a full kitchen, and a huge bathroom. We loved the Mexican themes Decor as well.

Summary Heading: Great value felt very safe & snug.
Summary: We choose this Hotel because my mom lives 2 blocks away. We live in Pennsyvaina & came out for a death in the family. We searched by computer for all the hotels closeby.  The pictures looked very charming & the price was right.  Also the site had good reviews. My daughter & I were in the Studio, with the kitchen.  We had cute Patio, a sitting area inside & comfortable beds. We couldn't afford an expensive hotel, so for the price it was safe, clean & comfortable. Not at all "motel" like.  We used the wi-fi also.  We will look forward to going there again.

Where to start. First of all, it's less than 10 minutes to Disneyland which was our destination for the weekend. Totally reasonable prices.  That said the rooms were really cute. I love the old California feel to them. The fountain at the entrance, the pavers throughout the hotel and rooms. It was nice having the fridge, microwave, etc even tho we didn't really use them other than the fridge for our bottled water.  The rooms are large with plenty of drawer and closet space.    However, this place is NOISY! I mean really NOISY! There is no insulation anywhere. Between the rooms or between the floors. We were on the first floor with a patio room (which I loved). But late the first night  the people in the room above us started dragging furniture. The next night a family next door

After reading a ton of reviews for most all hotels near Disney, we settled on Hotel Pepper Tree and were not disappointed!  This hotel was a fantastic value.  If you want to spend $150+ per night at a hotel closer to Disney, in a small room, and be around all the mania, all the time, go for it.  Hotel Pepper Tree on the other hand is a nice, quiet retreat very close by and for a much better price.  We stayed 5 days in CA doing Disney, the beach and other things and were happy to return to the Pepper Tree each night.  The grounds and rooms are decorated in a rustic style, very pretty and nice for a change.   The room: VERY amply sized.  Our family of four stayed in the 2 queen room.  We LOVED having a kitchen.  It came with basic pots, pans, and dishes - worked well for us!  We

It's a bargain considering what we paid for. The room is cozy for my family of 3. we spent 6 nights in the King Studio Apartment with ensuite Kitchenette. The utensils and crockery were minimal but adequate. Did not use any of them except for the kettle, pot  and bowls. I brought my own. I always do. Full bottle of dishwashing liquid and a fat roll of kitchen towel also provided. They replenish promptly when it's used up. We had housekeeping almost daily except on days when we didn't need it. They tidy up the room nicely and sanitize the bathroom. Bed and pillow is Comfy. We Could hear footsteps and talking at the corridors at night. Not TT good for a light sleeper. But the roads outside are quiet all the time. It's a decent location. Plenty of Halal eateries nearby, mostly
This hotel is a good value.  Stayed in courtyard suite.  Handy kitchen.  Great supermarket with mexican food across the street.  I would sstay here again.  It is not perfect, but it is great value.

It was just okay for us. The thing is why stay here? If you are doing Disney...then NO! Stay closer!! More restaurants etc. nearer to Disney. If perhaps you want to use this as a home base  for the beaches and Knot's, visiting family etc. in area, then okay. Just okay. Staff was not anything special at all! Who needs a full frig. in room?? Clean enough. You can hear folks walking around upstairs.....What?!? Good size room. Just okay. Would not stay again! Gave them an average rating, but that is me being nice..... Bed was comfortable.

Summary Heading: Nice, charming hotel on a budget
Summary: Very pleasantly surprised. Nice, clean rooms (w/ kitchenette), had some old-fashioned charm, but has been kept up nice; convenient location. Also, roomy enough for 2 queen beds & a roll-away bed. Very nice staff!

We were pleasantly surprised to upon entering the room we pre purchased online at Pepper tree. The decor made us feel as if we were on vacation in another country! Loved the full Kitchen and the Water fountain and greenery on patio. 100% will book again! Super friendly staff too.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel on a budget. Breakfast for $5!
Summary: I can't stand it when people come on here after paying virtually nothing for a hotel room and then rip it to shreds on tripadvior because it's not what you "expected". I'll give it to you straight about this quaint hotel. This is not the Four Seasons in Beverly Hills but if your somewhat of a reasonable, open minded person, you'll be able to appreciate this hotel and most likely want to go back.   We have stayed here at least 6 or 7 times and have never had a problem with the room, security or staff at the hotel. In fact the staff is very friendly, the rooms are unique, clean and very large compared to your stand ROH hotel room. There is a small kitchen in each room which is helpful when you don't want to spend $60+ on dinner. BUT the best part about this hotel is that for $5

Summary Heading: Kitchen, Dishes, friendly staff- like a home
Summary: If you're looking for a clean cozy quaint place to stay with a kitchen - microwave, fridge, etc. and at a GREAT rate, this is your place.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and I'd definitely come back.

Summary Heading: Friendly Staff, Nice,Cozy, but Spacious Rooms,Reasonable Prices
Summary: The first night we checked in was a Monday night and unfortunately I didnt see a nametag, because the guy that was at the front desk was very helpful and pleasant.  The king size studio room was so big, Me and my husband were pleasantly surprised. I would also like to mention that one of the guests decided to leave their dog in their car with all the windows rolled up. I complained on Wed night and it was the same guy that helped us on Monday. Anyway, he could tell I was very upset, and he said he would take care of it. I went down to check a little bit later, and the dog was gone.  That meant alot that staff cared enough to take care of it.  I met the owner, I believe his name is Rick. VERY nice gentleman.  They were changing out mattresses and doing some construction, but the

Booked this hotel thru Expedia, read all the reviews and thought this would be a great place. Oh boy, was I wrong! When we arrived, we realized we were in the "hood" of Anaheim, very run down part of town.  Mattresses out on the patios, construction going on. But, thought I would at least check the room out. Another on boy!  Reserved a 1 bdrm apartment and it turned out to be just 2 rooms that adjoined. The smell of Lysol was over-bearing!  So, beware, if this is your only option, sleep in your car, in another part of town!

We stayed here over New Years Eve through Jan 3. 2012.  The kids loved the entrance with five fish ponds. The staff were all pleasant. There is a rustic Spanish style throughout the property.  The pool has shade covers, dinning tables and a gas BBQ.  The rooms are studio style. Two very comfortable queen beds, a small sofa that my tall 7 yo grandson slept on , and a complete kitchen with everything to prepare the meal.  The fridge is full size, the closet is huge, large hallway with a dressing chair, and counter with drawers.  There are complementary soaps,shampoos,and hair conditioners that smelt like mango orange  For six dollars the whole party of five ate a full buffet style breakfast on the property.  At the front desk are coupons for free bar drink per adult or children

I just returned from my "home away from home",The Hotel PepperTree and it was better than ever! I went to share my grandson's 1st X-Mas and stayed at the hotel for the 3rd time. I was elated to see the same outstanding staff (Deycy,Jesus, Chris, Rick, etc.) and they were wonderful, helpful, friendly and made me feel so welcome! I can't wait to return.

We stayed at the Hotel Pepper Tree for two nights while attending a funeral.  We were in need of accommodations for one couple and one single adult.  The one bedroom apartment fit our needs nicely and for a reaonable price.  The $6 breakfast for the three of us was ample and delicious.  Thank you for a very comfortable stay.
This "hotel" is not a hotel at all, it is very private and comfortable with all the amenities for a long stay . It was clean and the staff were very hospitable.

I usually stay at the Lemon Tree but this time decided to try their other hotel the Hotel Pepper Tree. We all loved it. The staff was friendly and all 5 of us ate for just $6 at the restaurant next door. The hotel was clean and there was a great Mexican Market across the street. We got a cheap lunch there as well. Disney was super close as well. I will definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Small and Sweet , but really needs to update rooms
Summary: We were looking for inexpensive hotels for easter weekend on 2011 and ended up in Pepper Tree as it was $160 for 2 nights with 2 queen beds. Our first impression as we walked in was "hmm nice, boutique hotel, fountains and all" .. we went to our room through a musty smelling foyer which had spanish-style decor - interesting!   But when we stepped in, we hoped that the musty smell would disappear, it did not :( . however we got used to it.  The shower was slow in getting the hot water out, the AC made sound so loud we turned off to get any sleep.   But really apart from that I think this was a decent place to sleep for cheap and spend more in disney!! Kitchen was small but good. The fridge was clean. If the hotel had updated its appliances and replaced carpets, it would make a
Great value for what you get. Large rooms, friendly staff and close to Disney. I will be coming back to Anaheim in a couple months and will probabley stay here again.

Summary Heading: Huge room in a small price
Summary: The hotel is located near Disneyland.  Rooms are clean and very large with full kitchen and plenty of room to spread out. The carpet was pretty worn. The A/C worked great. We got a free WIFI and used the laptop much of the late night. Parking lot is spacious, and not limited at all. We stayed for 6 nights at the hotel, and think it was one of the best hotels at the west side of usa, in this price.

Summary Heading: Could be perfect with a little extra TLC
Summary: Stayed on bottom floor as requested, room was nice and large 1 king and a twin. Large patio with ivy cover, fountain, plants, large kitchen.
