Pool area I didn't find too inviting wish there was a hottub.  Bad parts: within 10 minutes our socks were black...after taking them off our feet were constantly black. I had to keep a wet towel on the floor so we could clean our feet often as I have a 2 yr old. They could easily mop each room after each stay. Carpet were torn severely and red couch had white stains all over it. Bed blankets had holes and sheets had several holes and were ripped. The floors were the filthiest part and just grossed me out. The patio fountain was broken and filled with leaves and dirt, the really beatiful outdoor plants were covered in cigarette ashes. One

Staff was really nice and helpful when checking in, the rooms were huge and the rustic Mexican furniture was awesome. The inside of the hotel looks nothing like the outside and is a nice surprise. It is pretty close to Disneyland and the price was amazing for what you get. The restaurant was a little sketchy though and I will eat elsewhere next time we stay.

The hotel is located half way between Disneyland and Knott's.  There is not much around you except for a small grocery store and a Subway.  The grounds are well maintained and a nice pool area with a BBQ.  The rooms are quite large with fully stocked kitchens and plenty of room to spread out, not your ordinary size room.  The rooms are very clean and seem to be freshly painted.  The beds are comfortable however they could use some new bedspreads, they were quite worn.  The carpet was clean, you could walk around bare foot and feel good about it, however, it was pretty worn.  The A/C worked great but a little noisy.  The rooms in the front are a little noisy from the road noise but the ones in the back are quieter but overlook the parking lot.  The breakfast in the morning

Very cozy place and room. Heater is not warm enough as it does not heat the room enough.  Housekeeping threw my toothbrush away on my last night and hotel does not provide toothbrush.  Easy access to food and eateries and a big Mexican supermarket opposite the road.
It is located close to all major attractions in the OC. The rooms are very nice and all come with a balcony or patio. Also have a bar/resturant right next to hotel.

We stayed one night, but it was a great place to stay longer due to the kitchen, full size closet, large dressing room outside the bathroom with mirrors and a vanity to do my makeup. It was clean and well cared for and I loved the great decor of the hotel, it has a beautiful entrance with lovely water features with beautiful goldfish and greenery everywhere. The staff was very freindly. We will definetly recommend! And the price is a great value too.

Well let me start with  Pros. Service was good, staff was very polite and welcoming. They were very helpful. The location was safe, we had our laptop on the coffee table while gone and did not have any problems with it. It has a kitchen which was very handy. It has extra shelves in the bathroom which was very convenient. Cons. We felt it was not clean enough. You don't see trash anywhere, mirrors are clean, bedding clean but the over all felt dirty. Tiles were a little sticky, you should see your socks in 1 hour walking around the room, they are black !!!!! I had to wet a washcloth and it turned gray, it looked ok while was on the shelf when I got wet it was graaayyy !!. Grosss. May be we got bad towels but  for the whole week I kind of doubt it.

I am shocked by some of the bad reviews of this hotel as we found it to be really nice.   There were three of us in our party and we had a room on the ground floor with two queen beds. The room was really spacious witha nice seating area and plenty of cupboard space. We also had a lovely terrace that was very private and had large sliding doors making the room really light and airy. It was a lovely area to sit out in at night.   The beds were really comfy with lovely pillows and the room was very clean. We didnt use much of the kitchen facilities other than the kettle for making drinks which was fine. Plenty of cups and cutlery provided.   There is not really much around in the immediate area and you do need a car to get anywhere unless you are happy to use public transport.

It's a dark day when a college student steps into a hotel room and immediately longs for their dilapidated, dingy dorm room.  Although advertised as a 'Disneyland Neighborhood Hotel', be prepared for a 30-min freeway trip to actually get to the park. On the way there you can get a look at the actual Disney Neighborhood hotels, which are right around the park, not 30 mins away. As an added bonus, you have to pay for parking, or get a taxi; the Disney shuttles don't go out to Pepper Tree. It is also advised to brush up on your Korean if you plan on leaving Pepper Tree by foot, or it may give you some trouble figuring out what the buildings in the somewhat dodgy area around the hotel are advertising.  Don't let the photos on Hotel Pepper Tree's site fool you; they're outdated. The
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am sorry that the hotel was not a good fit for your expectations however  I would like to point out a few inconsistencies. Our housekeeping record does show that daily housekeeping was attempted. Housekeepers are not permitted to enter a room when "do not dosturb signs" are displayed by guests . Also your room was reported on check out by housekeeping that  it smelled of smoke. Smoking may have been ok in college dorms but is strictly prohibitted in the hotel . I hope that in the future you do respect this policy at other hotels. We do not market the hotel as a "Disneyland Neighborhood Hotel" and we do suggest on our website that guests have a vehicle.  Disneyland is 3.9 miles or a 9 minute drive from the hotel, not 30 minutes. We do not charge for parking. Yoour comments reflecting the area as Koren are misleading as  Anheiman is 75% hispanic. I am surprised at some of your other comments and will certainly look into them.

Summary Heading: Okay for the price but not the best place in the world
Summary: My Fiance and me stayed here on our Disneyland trip for 5 nights . We decided on this hotel because it came with a full kitchen !(gas stove , sink,fridge ,pots and pans , strainer,sliverware and 2 plates , two bowls and dish soap , one sponge , a new roll of paper towels*) When we entered the Hotel we noticed that it has a nice rustic southwestern feel and personally I loved the decor ! The hotel staff that we encountered was okay....They charge for breakfast which was fine but this was already booked into our bill and the guy at the desk wanted cash for breakfast which we gave him but later we figured out that he was just desperate for a tip...that was a little deceiving but he was friendly I'll give him that .The breakfast had a good variety but I couldn't eat it ...it didn't
Manager Response: Than you for your review. We do charge a small fee for a cooked breakfast but we do not double charge nor is it our policy to accept tipping. I am confused by your comments in this regard and it implies dishonesty at front desk which would be a first for the hotel.

Summary: While this place won't be the highlight of your stay in L.A, it offers simple lodgings - but nothing more. The air con and fridge both battled each other for the loudest appliance in the room. Even on it's lowest setting, the air con screams at you. The balcony light is on a timer, there is no way to turn it off yourself. If you are a light sleeper...this place is not for you. Staff were friendly enough and the room size plus the included parking were generous. Not the best place by a long shot...but not the worst either.

This is a very nice, well decorated hotel.  Feels like a home away from home.  The Spanish tile, and Southwestern decor is all very welcoming.  Each room has an oven, stove, microwave, full-size refrigerator and freezer, foyer, coffee table, chairs and our room even had a private patio with chairs and a table!  Also, the hotel is very close to Disneyland without being congested with surrounding madness.

really nice hotel, room large and clean and the well stocked kitchen came in handy---could do with losing the loud ticking clock---we hid it under a cushion each night!! the balacony was also nice to be able to sit on an evening.  the staff we met were friendly and quite helpful although were unable to help with any public transport information.  you do need a car to get to this hotel.  the only down side was it was very roudy one night but that was not the hotels fault rather the inconsiderate group coming in at 3am shouting and slamming doors.

After looking for a good hotel in Anaheim we decided on the Pepper Tree, checked through the reviews and decided this was the one....we certainly weren't disappointed, the rooms were large with a kitchen and dressing area off the bathroom. The rooms were exactly as we had seen in the photos. We had booked two standard rooms for our two families and were pleased with the size of them especially as we had three children with us.The hotel had a lot of character and charm! The children certainly enjoyed the small pool area. When next in Anaheim we will certainly use this hotel again!

I sold my home and was waiting for my new home to be ready to move in which took two weeks. During this time we stayed at The Pepper Tree and made it our home. The room had everything we needed already. The room was clean, nicely decorated, comfy beds and I loved the pillows! The pool area was clean and the kids really enjoyed it since the weather was so hot. The staff there were so friendly. I really like the way the Hotel looks too. Needless to say it was hard to leave. I recommend this place to anyone! NO BUGS OR DRUGS!!

Summary Heading: Service and Hotel was very good
Summary: Really appreciate the good service and how they took the time to answer our questions about travel to local sites.  Good service overall!

Summary Heading: Met our basic needs, but certainly nothing more
Summary: We needed two rooms to bring our whole family out for a long visit while we got our oldest settled in her university.  The rooms were adequate, bathrooms adequate.  But there were lots of tears and snags in the fabrics.  Had a hard time getting the housekeeper to really clean the rooms.  Towels were hit and miss - sometimes there were enough and sometimes not.  Really funky smell in our room - like mold.  Can't say it was terrible, but I would never stay there again.
quiet, nice atmosphere and friendly staff.  just the breakfast, if you can add some bacon on the menu.

Summary Heading: We'd love to come back again!
Summary: We had a wonderful stay at the Pepper Tree.  Our suite was clean and comfortable.  The staff was so helpful and eager to assist with directions and they recommended great places to visit.  The price was very affordable and we had a delicious and a very reasonably priced breakfast everyday.

This is a great little gem. The staff are very accomodating and friendly. As other reviews indicate, the staff were willing to talk me through driving directions when I was hopelessly lost. It isn't new and shiny like some hotels, but that is actually what I enjoyed about it. It has a comfortable feel that makes you feel immediatley at home. I loved the saltio tiles and the hacienda style decorations. Lower level rooms have very private courtyards, upper have balcony. It is tucked off the street, but that adds to the peacefulness. This may sound trivial, but I LOVED the shampoo and soap, YUMMY citrus scent. The entire facility was clean, comfortable, and safe. The only reason I am giving it a 4 instead of a 5 is the proximity to attractions and dining options. The beach,

Summary Heading: It was great we can't wait to go back!
Summary: The room was very cozy and clean. I would love to live there. It would make agreat little apartment. Also when we checked in the front desk clerk was so friendly. I would definitly refer my freinds to THE PEPPER TREE .

Summary Heading: We loved it and we'll be back!
Summary: Great hotel!  Beautiful, clean, spacious rooms and great for the children.   The price was the best we found to accommodate our large family.  This will be our hotel for future trips.  The Best we have stayed in the Anaheim area.
The staff were all very helpful and all of the facilities were excellent. My only recommendation would be to hire a car given the relative distance from attractions and the lack of public transport.

Summary Heading: We truly loved this gem, and will definitely come back!!!
Summary: This is a wonderful hotel with a tasteful Mexican flavor. The people at the front desk/reception were very friendly, polite, and helpful throughout our stay. The room was impeccably clean, and we loved the way it was decorated. The restaurant at the hotel offers a wonderful buffet breakfast for only 2.50!! We were really sad we had to leave this beautiful hotel. We had a terrific time here. We particularly recommend it to couples and families.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great stay... will definitly be back!
Summary: What a great little hotel, nice BIG room with everything needed for an easy stay. Great patio in the back to relax and kick the feet up.

Summary Heading: Brilliant theme hotel with good space usage and good staff.
Summary: We stayed one night at this hotel while visiting Disneyland on our way to San Diego from Las Vegas. The room 208 was a delight. The decor was nice, had everything one could need and the space usage was brilliant. Jesus at the front desk was super helpful - we lost our way to the hotel (thanks to direction from google maps) and he stayed up till 2:30 at night outside his work hours to help us reach the hotel safely. Superb customer service. We would visit again!

Summary Heading: Huge rooms, very clean, friendly staff.  We really enjoyed ourselves. :)
Summary: This was an excellent hotel for us since our daughter brought a friend on vacation with us.  They had their own room and we had our own room.  The kitchen in the room was perfect for late night snacks.  The room were very spacious, we did not feel crowded at all, there were five of us.  We will definately be back!

From the moment we arrived, everything was beyond our expectations. Jesus at the front desk went out of his way to make phone calls to restaurants, get us directions, etc. The room was super cool - vintage Spanish Colonial style. The details in this place will surprise you at every turn. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this little jewel!

When we drove up and saw the exterior I thought OMG, what have I done?!? Booked it largely on price and also on some of the reviews. Once inside we were quite pleased. It's definitely old and funky; those wanting something sparkly new and Disneyfied should stay away. The furnishings were on the shabby side but everything seemed pretty clean and the room was huge, with a kitchenette. Desk staff was very pleasant and helpful. I would stay there again. We had dinner at the Mexican restaurant next door and found it authentic.

We stayed with two adults and two boys aged 8 years and 10 years and loved it. The building is interesting and nicely decorated and furnished. The rooms are big and very well equipped and comfortable. We used it as a one night stay over and wished we had planned to stay longer. We would certainly recommend to others. The restaurant next door looks very basic but the Mexican food is very good.

I stayed at the Peppertree from June 14 through July 7 and had an absolutely wonderful experience there. I went to be with my daughter, her husband and family for the birth of their first child. From the time I placed the reservation per phone with Jesus and Rick, the manager, I was extremely satisfied. Then, once I arrived, it only got better! The staff (Deycy, Jesus, Chris and Matthew) was knowledgable, friendly and most helpful.  The suite was great, the pool was wonderful, the cleaning staff exceptional! Everything about the hotel was outstanding. I have stayed at many hotels in Anaheim these past 3 years, but the Peppertree is BY FAR the best in every way. I highly recommend it and I will stay there whenever I return. A huge thanks to Rick and his fantastic staff!     Ginni

Summary Heading: Not extravagent, but a nice hotel.
Summary: The hotel is not very visible.  We almost passed it up until I saw the restaurant.  The facade of the hotel isn't very appealing.  Needs to be freshened up with paint.  The hotel lobby was very nice, quaint, and homey.  I really liked the Mexican tile.  Once we got to our room I was rather surprised how nice the room was, considering the condition of the building.  Don't let the outside fool you.  We got 2 queen beds for my two kids and my husband and myself.  My husband thought the beds were too soft.  They were soft, but I didn't have problems sleeping.  The room was clean and the housekeepers did a wonderful job keeping our room made up.  I was pleasantly surprised when they washed our dirty dishes - I wasn't expecting that.  The hotel provided everything that we needed.  We

Our family was awoken at 6:30 by a strange man in the parking lot throwing rocks and tiles at our second story sliding glass door. We tried to call the front desk, but nobody was on duty at that time. We checked out shortly afterward. Overall it was a very scary experience which we wouldn't wish upon anyone.

Summary Heading: We loved this place & will definately stay again!
Summary: It is not fancy but it is very clean & very comfortable......homey is a great way to describe this place.  The staff at the front desk was very nice & helpful.  The breakfast option is affordable and better than any in-house continental at other hotels.  The only complaint we had was that there was a definate shortage of hot water in the mornings--we learned to shower at night after the first chilly morning shower!

When deciding our trip i thought as this was our 4th trip to anaheim we would stay away from the disney strip i read quite a few reviews and the reviews i read on this hotel seemed very good and also as i am australian the idea of australians owning the hotel gave me a sense that this hotel would have really good customer service.  On arriving i found the room to be quite spacious & clean what is not told to you is the very loud noise level above as we were on ground floor.  twice i complained of the noise level but it didnt seem to matter it seemed generally other guests really dont give a damn i would advise that maybe your staff should stay the night on the ground level and have a family above them and then maybe they would understand.  It was around 1.30am-2.00am every night

Found this hotel by checking ALL the sites for a good price near Disneyland.The place is old but redone in Spanish style and very clean,We even had a kitchenette for the price of just a room else where. The breakfast bufett in restraunt in the  parking lot was an additional $1.50 and it was good.Only 7 min drive back to Disneyland,
Great location and rates. Very friendly staff. Will return on our next vacation.

Summary Heading: Nice full kitchen and roomy room, value
Summary: Stayed here for a few days in June 2011 while visiting Disney and surrounding area.  The Hotel is close to Disney and also beaches.  Plenty of restaraunts and grocery around.  The breakfast deal at the restaraunt across the parking lot is a good deal.  Breakfast buffet for  $6/room/day.  We didn't use the swimming pool, but it looked inviting.  Hotel is quiet, clean and we loved the full kitchen.  On the negative side - our toilet kept getting clogged (but was fixed), and the beds are not too comfy (need replacing).  Otherwise it was a good value and we would stay again!!

Summary Heading: This place has a homey feel to it.
Summary: This place is as comfy as home.   The hotel is clean, well maintained and updated in a great Southwest style.   Big sunny rooms with comfortable beds and even kitchens.  The kitchen gave us an alternative to eating out all the time.  It's right around the corner from The Magic Kingdom. Actually, I heard it rumored that Mickey and Minnie use this hotel to get away from the crowds and spend some time together.

We were pleasantly surprised at the condition of this older hotel. It was very clean and well maintained (one exception to follow) While the decor is not what we would usually choose, Aztec theme and lots of very rustic furniture, the bed was very comfortable and the room didn't have any of the usual "older hotel smells". The room is actually more like a studio apartment with a fairly large balcony and a huge closet. Full kitchen with some dishes supplied. Ours was a king room that overlooked the pool...beautiful view at night but if it is warm the pool noise will wake you early. This was not a problem for us even though we arrived late and they let us into our room after hours by way of a lock box for the key. The best part for us was the breakfast voucher that was $2.50/

Myself, my husband and our 5 kids (aged 5-12) stayed at the Peppertree for 3 nights in December 2010.  We had 2 queen rooms next to each other, unfortunately not connecting.  We had several discussions with management via email regarding checkin, distances to attractions etc and on each occasion we received prompt replies with helpful information.  We arrived earlier than expected, and whilst we couldnt check in as our rooms were still being cleaned, staff were quick to offer us the option of leaving all our luggage in a safe area of the office so we did not have to lug them around with us.  The rooms were quite large, and very clean.  Bathrooms were also a very good size.   Breakfast was a real bonus for us.  As a large family meals can often be an expensive part of a holiday.

June 9th-12th. Me and my fiancee needed a place to stay for three nights that we could also get our Knotts Berry Farm tickets from. It was about 321 all together and we enjoyed the place very much. Had a very fun time. Easily 30 minutes from Knotts and not even 40 miles from Orange County Block. We never really went through the hotel since we weren't really in the hotel much except for saturday morning and evening. Our hotel room, 208 had a perfect view of the pool and there were cute little turtles spitting water into the pool. Very relaxing, felt like our own little apartment and vacation was in paradise!! We didn't see a Ice machine, and the front desk didn't have our park tickets when we showed up Thursday night, but we received them friday morning. Saturday morning we ate

This was another one of those gems I found.  I wanted to be somewhat near where my sister lives in Fullerton and we were going to be staying three nights so I wanted a place to stretch out a bit.  When I discovered this through an online search I was not only delighted with the locale but the price for getting a place that had a kitchen in it.  The owners of this property are originally from Australia, I think.  They noticed while traveling in the States the lack of affordable, nice places with kitchenettes.    This place is true to the pictures on the website.  Not only does each room have a balcony but they are nicely decorated  and have a full-sized refrigerator and small stove/oven with basic dishes.    The breakfast was basically $5 extra per ROOM per day for the restaurant

We recently stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Pepper Tree in Anaheim.  We have a family of 5, plus were traveling with 2 other people.  The desk reception staff was pleasant, informative, and very friendly.   We had no issues upon check in nor throughout our stay.  The hotel lobby is very attractive, decorated in a Southwest/Mexican feel decor.  Our room was actually 2 rooms combined.  The main room, which slept our 3 boys,  housed a sitting area and had a small kitchen complete with fridge and stove.  We never used these but they seemed to be able to accommodate very basic cooking needs. I wouldn't try to make a full dinner, necessarily, but certainly you could prepare some basics in it.  The attached room housed a bed, sitting area, kitchen without any appliances. The rooms were

We booked our stay on priceline, so you always take a chance. We are actually in the hotel right now, and I have to say, If I could change hotels, I probably would only because I hate misleading advertising. We have 1 more night here.  Over all its a O.K. hotel, if you're not picky. My biggest complaint is the bed situation. We have 2 small children and I got a room that claimed to have a sofa bed (would have been where the kids slept). Of course their excuse was that priceline missled us. So one child slept on the couch, and the other rolled onto the hard floor. :/ If I had known, I would have reserved a room with 2 queen beds! (they did give us the internet free, because of the bed situation, but that doesn't help my son from sleeping on the floor) And after reading the
Nice sized rooms clean not far from Disney Had a front room that was a little load
This place is quaint and homelike. It doesn't smell like a hotel!  The desk staff were very helpful. And more importantly they were nice.

Summary Heading: I loved this hotel, it was great for our large family.
Summary: We had great service. Everyone was friendly and helpful.  The housekeeping came every morning and did a good job.  I loved the room.  We had a one bedroom apartment.  I loved that it had two bathrooms. The beds were very comfortable.  We had two good sized sitting rooms.  Lots of room for a family.  If you are planning on driving to Disneyland it is in a great location.  It is close to a grocery store and other stores if needed.  I loved that it had a separate room with a bathroom and sitting room.  The pool was a little cold.  When you come during the off season it is to be expected.  They also have a great breakfast in the Azteca that is located in the parking lot.  It cost $6 per morning.  Very worth it.  We are already planning to come back in the fall.

Summary Heading: Unique experience with pros and cons
Summary: Travelled from New Zealand in April 2011 and stayed here with three children (15, 9 & 9) as part of a trip catching up with another family from Virginia, USA and spending time in the Anaheim area. The Hotel is a little worn on the outside and could be spruced up externally.  Internally it lives up to its billing as a Spanish/Mexican theme, without luxury.  We had an connecting room(s), both of which were very spacious and clean and there was a kitchenette in one of the rooms.  This is a great set-up for families and was good value for the $ paid, especially as it is difficult in the US to book accommodation anywhere for families of 5.  The Hotel is conveniently located mid-way between Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm, both about 10 minutes away by car. The location is best

Summary Heading: I, personal said that a will go back and stay again. And Im goin to tell my brothers to stay in july for vacation.
Summary: Maybe my husband and I will go back for next weekend, is very clean and comfortable.

The kids and I needed a mini vacay...so when I saw this hotel online w/the amenities they offered such as pool and full kitchen and the reasonable manager's rate special, I snapped it up right away! There were good and bad reviews on the property so I knew it might be a bit of a gamble. The location is not really in the best part of anaheim (but still close enough to disneyland) nor is the outside appearance of the property is exactly pleasing to the eye, but that's all I can really say that would be minuses about this place. Everything else was fantastic! A nice, rustic, southwestern theme the hotel has is great, helpful staff, and the rooms....FABULOUS!!! We had a 2 queen bed studio and it was spacious, extremely clean, beautifully decorated, stocked w/all the amenities we

We stayed at the Peppertree in March 2010  for a split of 4 days and three days. It's been a while, but I forgot to comment on it earlier. We found the whole experience wonderful. Kind of a rustic, non-typical place to stay away from 'traditional' hotels. Really charming. Amazing, friendly check-in service and staff - every interaction was a friendly "No problem, sir, right away, sir." I forgot something in the room after I left and they retrieved it for me in zero time. I was very impressed. Great value. Beds were incredibly comfortable. Breakfast at Azteca's is good.   We are going to Southern California there again within a few weeks and I asked the kids if we should stay at the Peppertree again, and they excitedly said "yeahhh!"    This stay secured my business. Definitely

The hotel was excellent in every way. My family of six felt very comfortable in one of the kitchenettes. This hotel pays attention to detail and has beyond excellent service! There were so many enexpected perks such the breakfast deal, the pool and bbq area, the spaceous rooms, its close to DisneyLand and Huntington beach.

Summary Heading: Friendly & helpful staff made our stay fantastic!
Summary: Our family stayed at the Peppertree and were very pleased! The staff was extremely helpful and friendly the room was more than expected! Our stay was quiet and relaxful. I could not be happier! I look forward to staying there again!

Summary Heading: Best place to stay for Disneyland visitors.
Summary: Went with my husband and three children had a great visit perfect room and staff was very nice...

I was really impressed by the pictures, but sorely disappointed when we arrived.   The front desk staff was outstanding though, very friendly and helpful.  The pool was nice as well. The killer thing for us was the bed.  IT SUCKED!  It was totally worn out, made noise whenever you moved an inch, and it hurt our backs.  My husband got a terrible backache from it - I just simply did not get any good sleep.  We were on the first floor, and heard the people above us walking around, and the kids running around (got kind of annoying).   The worst thing though, was the bed.

The hotel is easy to find and is just minutes from several amusement parks. The front desk staff were helpful - no complaints there. The rooms are spacious and colorful and the kitchenette is a life saver on the food budget. The breakfast next door was very inexpensive, and although it didn't have a great variety, it was warm and flavorful. The mattresses could use an upgrade, but were adequate. Given the price and location - this was a great place for our family to stay.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but needs better service
Summary: Like: Rate: Affordable price. Room: Old but nice and clean, kitchen & refrid. Unlike: Service:The girl at front desk was not friendly. Location: It's hard to find, not conveinent for driving (U-turns).

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay, not a great neighborhood
Summary: We liked our room very much. We had a full kitchen, nice patio and great bed. We were in an Executive Suite. There was an extra twin bed too. The room was pretty clean, but a dirty floor. There was no door on the part of the bathroom with the toilet and there was an open window space in the vanity area. Therefore, total privacy was unavailable. My other family members in a different room, had a door on their bathroom. Their room had a little bit of an odor but it wasn't too bad. For the price the rooms were great. The hotel is nice. They are a little understaffed. No one was at the desk when we arrived at 9:30pm to check in. Otherwise the desk appeared to be staffed at all other times. The TV was decent. No pay per view or menu, but it did have HBO.
this is a nice hotel....very nice staff...very large room...nice balcony....huge closet and full mirrors...clean bathrooms.

Summary Heading: not bad but wont stay again,  way over rated
Summary: I checked the reviews here on TripAdvisor and was excited about staying at the Pepper Tree.  First off I  have to tell you this is the first time I have left a review on Trip Advisor but I felt like it was really need this time.  The rating on this hotel is a four and I would not agree to this at all. When i see a four rating i think of Marriot and this is no where compared to that.   When I first walked in there was a smell that i could not place.  I needed a roll out bed which they had and were happy to bring to my room. When I opened it the sheets were full of rice.  There are certain things that the Pepper Tree was missing that i have come to expect with a hotel of this rating such as hairdryers, ice machines, maps of hotel, alarm clocks, hot tube and extra locks on the room

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for...
Summary: Stayed at hotel for 7 nights (2/18-2/25/11) with a friend and his 6 yr old daughter. Room was dirty. Curtains were dirty. Little girl walked around room with bare feet and soon enough, feet were covered with black dirt. Complained to front desk but was only told room was scheduled to be carpet cleaned the Monday after we left. Room needed deep carpet cleaning! There were also bugs in the bathroom. Made sure we did not come home with bedbugs. Hotel has a charm but needs to be updated. Hall carpet was torn and in need of replacement. Maybe they can charge more if they spruce up hotel. Rates are competitive but there are better deals out there.

Summary Heading: Diamond in the ruff. Thin walls but well worth the money!
Summary: Looked for a inexpensive hotel that had a kitchen and Pepper Tree came up so I thought I would try it. Pulled up and was immediately impressed with the hotel. Lots of green around the hotel, seemed clean, and just looked homey. The person at the front desk didn't seem peppy enough to be a customer service rep but oh well I guess. Went inside the room and it seemed clean but most of all it seemed really comfortable. not in the way the couch was soft and the bed heavenly but more like I was in a decent sized apartment and not a hotel.. Had it's own cute little patio (with patio set) and plants and I really liked that.. I will definitely stay here again. Only thing I was disappointed in was the walls were really thin so your experience could depend on who is above and beside you.

Summary Heading: cute, cozy, pleasant , wonderful little retreat after long days at Disney
Summary: it has a southwestern atmosphere, private balcony, pleasant staff, room was great sized with a separate dressing area with full sized mirrored closet doors that came in handy for me to get ready when the bathroom was in use =) Kitchen was great was able to keep munchies and milk for the little ones.  about a 10 min drive from the parks with Target and Walmart not far away either, had a great stay, and found our new place to stay on our trips down south =) oh and the goodie bag was a pleasant surprise too

Summary Heading: Hidden Gem if heading to Disneyland!
Summary: We booked the Pepper Tree based upon TripAdvisor reviews and were totally pleased.  The venue has a very nice southwestern feel to it - the rooms and kitchen area were good sized.  My kids loved the pool.  The family breakfast plan was a fantastic deal.  About a 10 minute EASY drive to Disneyland.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Will definitely stay there on our next trip to the area.

Summary Heading: Perfect Place to Rest after Disneyland
Summary: The service is friendly, the decor is great, the price was perfect and the proximity to Disneyland made it even better. We had a King sized room with a private balcony, sofa, and full kitchen. We loved the little bag of travel goodies in the bathroom. It is the extra touches that make us happy! We also ate at the restaurant next door for dinner and breakfast the next month.  We would stay here again, especially on our next trip to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Hotel Pepper Tree, a hidden secret
Summary: My husband and I with two teens went to Disneyland for a quick escape from the fast pace of life.  This was our second time staying at the Hotel Pepper Tree.  On our first visit, we were amazed at this hacienda looking hideaway.  The reception was friendly and the atmosphere was so welcoming.  Our rooms were clean and the pillows were divine.  The kitchen was filled with all the necessities and the pool was nice and warm for the kids.  I wish they had a jacuzzi for those of us with bad backs.  We enjoyed our breakfast in the morning.  Wow! what a spread of fruit, bacon and eggs and all the fixings.  Only a hop and a skip to Disneyland.  What a wonderful stay.

I stayed at Hotel Pepper Tree with my family for 2 weeks. Everything was good at this place. Cleaning was spotless, the beds very comfortable, main desk personal very helpfully with any of our questions/needs. Very quiet in nights and we felt very safe staying at Pepper Tree with everything. Noticed the security guards walking the parking lot area every night. No breakfast at the hotel but they offering cheap tickets to the restaurant Azteca in the parking lot that was all in order with a lot of food. I would love to recommend this hotel and probably we will stay there the next time we are at holiday in LA area!

In the past couple of months I have tried out a couple different hotels and this one was by the far the best. It had just what I wanted/needed with kitchen, seperate bathroom, and very clean. Although the walls are a little bit thin, I still slept great. It is a beautiful hotel and this is probably the one I'm going to go to from now on. It's not far from Disneyland but you have drive but that's not a problem for me. For the price it was amazing, and definitely worth it.

Summary Heading: You get a lot more than you bargained for
Summary: I came to Anaheim with my partner for a visit to Disneyland and we were looking for a budget option.   The reviews on TA made us choose Hotel Pepper Tree, and they were not wrong. Very large and nice rooms, good value for money breakfast and very friendly staff.   We'll certainly be back next time we go to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Excellent California vaca and/or Disneyland visit hotel
Summary: The hotel grounds were well lit & at night security officer seen walking grounds for a secure feeling.  The room was so spacious & well designed.  We stayed in the King Suite w/kitchenette.  We have found our California visiting hotel!  Great rates, they always have a great deal running to fit any budget! The breakfast at the resturant next door was a GREAT value, a family can eat for a total of $6!!!  Can't be beat!

Summary Heading: Disneyland - Motel / Anaheim area ( Great Value!)
Summary: Me & my wife , 4 year olds enjoy the Spacious room, living room area, kitchen area with a fully supply with everything a family going to Disneyland needs for a comfortable stay  with childrens.  Inexpensive $3.00 per person full buffet breakfast - coffee, milk, orange juice, tea, ham, potato, scramble eggs, pancakes, fruit, ceral.  Nice , Inexpensive motel for the price , recommend , Must have Vehicle .....

Summary Heading: Charming place to stay when you visit Disneyland.
Summary: Friendly, helpful, enthusiastic staff. Very cute decor. Close to Disneyland. And they even have little kitchens in the rooms.

I realize that the Pepper Tree is not the newest, fanciest, or equipped with the latest high tech gee-whiz gizmos. And that's fine with me. It could probably use a bit of a facelift, but please, don't change the overall look or feel. In fact, we are thinking about taking the idea of the fountain in front, and using it at our new house.  We have always enjoyed staying at the Pepper Tree. We have never had any sort of problems here, other than the occasional loud kid. The first time we ever used the heater was this trip. It took me all of three minutes to figure out how to work it. I suppose that's cuz I didn't come from a generation where everything was handed to us, but we had to actually learn stuff.  My only complaint about this hotel is the wi-fi policy. Having to have a

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you go to Anaheim
Summary: This place rocks. My sister knew this was the place to be because of the lion king poster in the lobby. The only bad parts were the neighborhood, the $5 for wifi, and the exercise room only being two treadmills and a stationary bike. Other than that it was terrific, we got it for half the posted value on hotels.com and it was awesome having the kitchenette.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay near Disney
Summary: We picked this hotel because it was close to Disney and had a fridge and queen beds. The beds were very comfortable and the array of pillows they have in the room meant that all of us got good night sleeps. And I am very picky about pillows. There was a hodgepodge of dishes. I missed having a glass in the bathroom and there was no place to put soap in the shower. We couldn't get the internet to work in our first room so the staff was able to move us to a different room where it worked. We didn't cook anything so can't speak about the stove. There were some noisy kids but if you turned the air conditioner on you didn't hear them too much.

Although the service was very good I would definitely not stay here again. The place is old and gross. There are tears in the carpet floor. The tub.has been painted over. Thre is a terrible smell coming from the room from god knows where. It's old and musty. I left without showering the next day because it grossed me out so much.
Manager Response: Could you please contact me with your stay deatils as I have spoken to front desk and we cannot identify your stay .

Summary: The hotel seems like it is in an outdated area but it was pretty good especially for the price. Our room had Spanish rugs hung up on the walls and the rooms were dimmer than I would have preferred. However, everything was clean and quiet, which mattered the most to me on this trip.  They do have a $5 charge for WIFI on each device and the connection times out more frequently than I would have liked. But it did get the job done.  Parking is free but may be limited depending on how late you get back from your adventures. It was fairly easy to get a spot before 10pm but after 11, you should start looking in their back lot.  If you are looking to visit Knott's Berry Farm or any of the Disneyland parks, this place is very convenient and good for the wallet.

The Hotel Pepper Tree was a wonderful value for our family.  We travel with teenage kids, so having the 1 bedroom was great.  They had 2 beds in the living room with a TV and a bedroom for us.  Gave the kids some privacy, and space.  Very clean, staff was wonderful, and was a short drive to theme parks and attractions.  Would definatly stay again.  Thanks Hotel Peppertree.  Very comfortable bed.

I stayed in the PepperTree for 5 nights in December with my girlfriend. The purpose of our trip was to tour LA / Hollywood, visit the Beach, and stop in at Disney Land.  Things I look for in a hotel: - Location - Value - Quiet - Staff - Extras - No problems  Location: PepperTree is not situated close enough to be able to walk to any major location. But if you have a vehicle with you, it is a convenient drive to most places. We were able to drive to all of our intended destinations quickly and easily from the hotel. Satisfied.  Value: Through the internet, we were able to reserve a 5 night stay for half off the normal price. Very satisfied.  Quiet: We did not visually notice many children in the hotel during our stay. However, they were definitely heard. Noise from the hallway
Manager Response: Thank you for your very detailed review. On the odd occassion that heating is needed in the rooms the heaters DO turn on and off and temperature can be adjusted. I will check with front desk to be sure that future guests are informed properly on heater controls. We did experience a couple of ant infestations due to the unusually heavy rains in Southern California over this period but usually this is not a  problem. I hope that given the very positive comments that you had about the hotel that these couple of issues did not spoil your visit.

Summary Heading: You get what you paid for
Summary: The Peppertree was inexpensive, especially because we had enough people for 2 rooms.  The rooms were roomy and relatively clean and I suppose it was the rainstorm outside that invited all those ants to come in and visit.  The place could use a little updating.  The carpet in one of our rooms was patched and the color was sort of blue mud.  The walls could use a coat of paint, the sofa was a little stained,  and one of the sockets was not functioning.  In general, for the price, it was adequate.  The kitchen was very handy for one of our neighbors as the smell of curry was enjoyed by all.  All this only 3 miles from Disneyland!

perfect in every way,doing the disneyland deal with little ones has in the past been a ordeal,but your staff and location was perfect, I will definatly recomend your establishment to all my friends, price,location,cleanlyness,comfort.you got it all.thank you so much,my first vacation in more than 20 years and im glad we ended up with you.Really I cant thank you enough,   A special thank you to your house cleaning,the girls went beyond norms, (putting our daughters pillow pets) set up on the beds,real personall thank you, michael,vera.imogene.tyra and gracey, stewart

Summary Heading: Great place to relax between excursions and parks nearby.
Summary: We arrived tired from other excursions around LA, and found a beautiful room with southwest furnishings and a comfortable bed waiting for us. The service was prompt and friendly, the room was spacious with a lovely balcony, and there were amenities for just about everything we could need.  Only a few minutes away from the Disney parks and great food.

affordable stay in Anaheim. a bit of a drive to Disneyland, but not too bad. the rooms are very spacious. lovely gratuities welcome you on arrival - a pack of toiletries, all sorts of freebies. nice clean towels and linens. kitchen is fully equipped. don't know if this is a normal thing in US hotels but no fresh milk in the fridge??? eat breakfast somewhere else. the buffet breakfast that they offer you at front desk when you check in is rather sad. the whole hotel could do with a renovation soon. the 'old' smell of the hotel room takes a bit of getting used to. lucky we brought room spray.

I have stayed at this hotel before and had fallen in love with it. Despite the neighborhood and the low points the charm and service won me over. The last and most recent time will be my last. The girl at the front desk was so rude to me and my husband that i found it shocking! In taking up her rudeness with the manager the next day we got more of the same and he stood up for her. I am in real estate and have referred many people here much to my regret now. I have noticed the declined in this hotel since my first stay years ago but my last experience...... I don't really have words for it.
Manager Response: I am well aware of your incident with our front desk and manager but would like to comment that a certain standard of conduct is expected  of our guests and one should not confuse a confrontation with a  staff member  acting in the best interest of the hotel as being rude.

Summary: My girlfriend and I were pleased with the hotel. While there is always opportunity to criticize, this hotel was an excellent value. Spacious and furnished with some rustic wooden furniture, it has a cozier feel to it than one would expect from looking at it from the outside. The sheets were clean - which is an absolute imperative in our book. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel, as is true of most places in Anaheim has seen its share of wear and tear but the overall cleanliness of the place was above average. We were both pleased with our stay here and would recommend it to others.

My wife and I have stayed at this hotel 3 times over the past 2 years and each time our experience was worse then the one before it.  The hotel used to give you a coupon for a free glass of wine and $20 off your next stay but they no longer offer either.  The free continental breakfast is now $2 a person.  Also, the price of the room has gone up each time so needless to say we will not be returning.  This is a brief summary of our trip;  First night:  The only problem we immediately realized was that the tub did not drain properly.  We were told a maintenance man would come to fix it but he never did.  Second night:  At around 8 pm we started to hear a lot of noise coming from the upstairs room.  Because it was relatively early we did not complain.  The noise stopped but then
Manager Response: I am sorry that you are dissapointed that our promotions do not last forever.  Rates have been extremely low in the hotel industry for some time so I don not understand your references to the increasing price. As with most hotels we are not immune from the occasional noisy guest. I will look into your specific complaint.

Summary: Overall, based on many of the reviews I had read in advance of our trip I was hoping and expecting the Pepper Tree would be better.  Our room had kind of a dingy feel to it that we weren't expecting.  Kitchen was tiny and had an overused feel to it.  Service was fine/adequate.  Breakfast next door at the restaurant next door was OK and priced right.  Location was convenient, but the neighborhood was not an area you would want to walk around in.  One day there was a relatively loud party being held behind the hotel that attracted many locals.  Fortunately it was a Sunday and didn't go very late.  We enjoyed visiting the In N Out Burger close by and the location is convenient to Disneyland and near the highway - we drove to/from San Diego Zoo one day and several times back/forth

Summary Heading: Great Family Hotel If You're Going to Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed here 2 nights when we took our young son to Disneyland.  It is an older hotel that could use some updating, but it was clean, the staff was friendly, there is a pool, and breakfast was included.  This hotel is really for families.  They all come with a kitchenette so you can cook your own meals. Perfect for families on a budget.  I didn't notice the noise levels that others are talking about.  Maybe if you have small children, you get used to it... The mornings were a little loud, as that is when the families are getting ready for Disneyland and the excitement levels are at the highest. Nights were not bad, as most of the children are asleep and tuckered out from walking all day.  Don't expect a brand new hotel with all the latest decor, and you won't be disappointed.

Summary Heading: Pepper Tree is my second home
Summary: I stayed at Pepper Tree with my family for 3 months between November 2009 and February 2010. It was great. Very comfortable, affordable and close to Disneyland and shopping areas. Working people were great. I really felt safe and comfortable. I stayed again for 2 nights in November 2010. It was like a nostalgia for me.  I will stay again and I recommend to everybody to try Pepper Tree hospitality. You will NOT regret.

While not completely disappointed with our stay at this hotel, I wouldn't stay here again. The location was 10 minutes driving time to Disneyland, which suited us well. Breakfast was offered at the restaurant next door for a minimal fee. The breakfast was on par with other chain hotels. Wi-fi was available for a $5 fee for your entire stay.  We did not take advantage of the pool while we were there. The lobby was nicely decorated and inviting. The staff was mildly pleasant but not overly helpful. We were always able to find parking close to the front door.   The rooms were not what I had hoped. The carpet in our 1-bedroom apartment was ripped up. The kitchen was poorly stocked.....at least for a family of 7. I wasn't able to get any more glasses from the hotel. I wasn't

I've lived on four continents and stayed in hotels for six weeks at a time all my life, so I am well aquainted with hotels from the best to the worst.  My family loved this hotel, it was clean, spacious, quiet, and very cute.  The kitchenette was well supplied with all utensils, pots/pans, etc.  The stove and fridge saved us a ton of money not having to eat out all the time.  Closet space and drawer space was great. Our room overlooked the pool and it was lovely to sit out on the full-length balcony and converse with my husband.  Breakfast was buffet style at the adjacent restaurant (on the property) and more than ample at $6 for all persons staying in the room (up to 4), and consisted of eggs, fried potatoes, ham, pancakes, toast/muffins, yogurt, cereals (3 types) and orange

This was the first time that I've disagreed with Trip Advisor ratings. Usually they are spot on and have helped me find many great hotels, such as the one we stayed at near Disney World.  This was my third trip to Disney in Anaheim and I've stayed at better. Yes, this hotel had big rooms and cheap rates but so do most motels in Anaheim. On both previous trips I've stayed at hotels which were closer to Disney and better.  My initial impression was that the reception area looked nice. The guy at check in was really nic ( I think he may have been called Chris). On entrance to the room I was a little disappointed. It looked less like a hotel room and more like a holiday rental apartment. The place had been given a coat of paint and a lick of laquer but there were paint splashes
the pepper tree is a realy good place to stay my wife and i have stayed there on a number of times and will again the rooms are large and clean

just come back from 2 weeks staying at this hotel.  although the pool needs to be refurbished and they really could do with double glazed patio doors to cut out some of the outside noise, this is a very friendly effecient hotel to stay at, whether you have children or not.  the staff go out of their way to help you and to solve any problems you may have.   they supply everything you could possible think off needing, from shampoo, to soap, to toothpaste (in their welcome pack).  in the kitchen area again everything you could think off, i thought we would have to go out and buy washing up liquid, opened a cupboard and there it was along with a sponge and kitchen towel.  there is internet access in the lobby much to my daughters delight she could check her email each day.  i would

Summary Heading: Best hotel near Disneyland for the price !!
Summary: The girls at the front desk Gabby and Daisy  brought my daughter a bouquet of pink Disney baloons for her first birthday on the first night of our stay. Every one there is extremely polite and helpful. I would most deffinetly stay there again. But for anyone looking to stay here i would recommend staying on the bottom floor because you get a private little patio with a fountain. The breakfast at the little restaurant in the front isnt that good, but thats why theres little kitchens in all the rooms :)

Summary Heading: Really wonderful place to relax after a long day at the beach or Disneyland
Summary: I stayed here for five days while vacationing at Disneyland and visiting the beach.  The place was clean, the kitchen fully stocked with everything I needed and the staff was friendly and helpful.  I wouldn't bother with the restaurant Aztecas, as I had a bad time with them, but the hotel itself was incredible and awesome! Saved a lot  by cooking for myself.  The bed was fantastic, I loved the decor and my nonsmoking room was just that.  Next time I go to anaheim, I will choose the Pepper Tree.... It is in a convenient area as well, close to all the attractions, the beach, and a decent neighborhood.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable, and unique room at a nice, pet friendly hotel.
Summary: This hotel is perfect for the person who likes hotels that do not have that chain feel.  It is staffed, by friendly, helpful people.  We have stayed here twice and have had a positive experience each time.  It is pretty only about a 15 minute drive to Disneyland, if that is why you are in town.  There is a small kitchen with paper towels, dishes, dish soap, and other items so all you have to bring is the food.  They even had ice cube trays in the freezer!  On our last trip, we wanted a home base that we could poke around from, and this hotel was good for that too, it is maybe a half-hour drive from the ocean.  The rooms are unique, and do not have that cookie cutter feel you can get in other hotels.  The hallways are wide and well-lit.  The curtins to the balcony are good at

Summary Heading: A sweet little surprise in Anaheim
Summary: We wanted to find a nice place to stay in Anaheim where we would start our USA trip, the first stop being Disneyland. Hotel Pepper Tree provided us with a homely kitchenette suite with a sweet spanish touch that was affordable for our budget. We were pleasantly surprised and felt instantly at home there. We are from Australia, and found out the owners were 2 aussie couples so that also helped us make our decision. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and the housekeeping was impeccable, as expected. We would definitely stay at this lovely little place again if we decided to visit the USA again in future.

The service was excellent.  The hotel was under rated, I was so pleasantly surprised to see how clean and cosy this hotel was and the staff were so friendly and helpful.  The decor and rooms were so consistent with the Aztec theme and I found it to be comfortable and welcoming and so easy to access.  Even my teenage boys were impressed with the facilities, pool and computer and restaurant.

Summary Heading: Truly a fantastic hotel in the middle of it all in SoCal.
Summary: I was greeted warmly and was quickly in a beautiful, very clean suite.  The full kitchen is so nice and convenient.  Southwestern touches and furniture made it feel like an exotic locale.  balcony was very relaxing and a great bonus.  Really enjoyed the entire staff and property.  There is a quaint but beautiful pool and barbecue area for guest use w/ picnic tables and gas grill.  The grounds and common areas are well appointed w/ antiques and peaceful accents, such as the koi ponds.  Breakfast was good and inexpensive at the restaurant on site.  Excellent place to stay.

Summary Heading: Great place, great rooms, great staff, and very good price.
Summary: We stayed at this Hotel after staying at another hotel which was closer to disneyland, we spent 2 weeks on a road trip around CA. Wish we had of found this place before we booked the other place. we found place to be great, very good price. good location between Disneyland and Knotts berry farm. When we come back over in a couple of years will book this hotel.

Summary Heading: we stayed in a one bedroom apt for 5 ppl...
Summary: we stayed in a one bedroom apt for 5 ppl and it was huge! There was a queen   or king bed (can't really remember), a sofa double bed, and a single sleeper bed. There was ample space for all our luggages. There were 2 very clean bathrooms with bathtubs and complimentary body wash and shampoo. There was also a kitchen which we didnt really use.  Service was good and the receptionists were all very helpful and friendly. One helped us call to enquire about shuttle to universal studios voluntarily.  Wireless is an extra $5.  One downside is the location. There isnt anything much nearby. Taxi to disneyland cost about $20. Don't really remember the duration.   Overall it was a pleasant experience and we didn't want to leave the place because it was so comfortable.

We always look forward to our stay at the Pepper  Tree.  The staff is always helpful and friendly.  We love the feel of having our own little  studio apartment.  The kitchen makes it so convenient to come back after a long day of Disneyland or shopping and just relax and have dinner in our room or having coffee on the porch.

Got in on a buy one night, get the second night free deal! If you have a car, this place is perfectly situated near amusement parks, shopping, and restaurants. The restaurant on-site is a nice feature, especially with the $5 breakfasts for the whole room. The breakfast is typical fare: eggs, pancakes, toast, ham, cereal, etc.--a good value if you need to just get a simple fill-up in the morning without anything special. We stayed in one of the King rooms, and given the amount of people staying there, and how noisy it sounded in the halls, we couldn't hear any of it inside our room. The bed was cushy and nice, and we always had ample pillows and towels. The only downside was the crowded parking and that the housekeeping service seemed to ignore our "do not disturb" sign and

I have to say that I was genuinely surprised at both the quality and comfort of the room. We stayed for two days for a Disneyland trip in one of the king executive suites on the first floor (room 108). The room itself was very spacious and clean.   Checkin:  The lobby area is wonderfully decorated in a spanish theme. Dark woods and tiles, while the lobby also has a complementary computer that guests can use. We checked in around 9pm and the front desk clerk was both helpfull and very polite.   DECOUR:  Everything is decorated in a spanish/mexican style best described as shabby chique. While you can tell the wooden dressers and tables are a little worn, that's actually how they were painted to be and actually adds to the character and charm of the room. Most of the room is

The rooms were spacious and the kitchenette was well equiped. Beds were very comfortable and the staff helpful and friendly.  The rooms were well presented and clean.  We had a lovely patio that provided privacy.  Only a short drive to all the Anahiem attractions.  Great value for money. Negatives: walls were a bit thin and the supermarket across the road has been closed.

Summary Heading: Really good little hotel - just be aware of the traffic
Summary: I was a little reluctant about this hotel as it wasn't a big name but I wanted us to stay out of LA after our last trip but further south towards Anaheim and the beaches.  First impression was ok.  The front desk staff were very efficient and welcoming.  The room was enormous with a perfectly adequate kitchenette and small lounge area.  We queried the slowness of the sink in the bathroom and not receiving some TV channels and they were fixed within 2 hours.  It really is a little gem of a place.  It's a bit of a drive from LAX but convenient for Knotts Berry Farm, Disneyland, the Angels Stadium and the sights/beaches south of LA.  The only concern we had was the noise of the traffic.  It is on a main road and you really have to be aware of that.  We usually sleep with ear plugs

Summary Heading: Wish we had stayed here longer.
Summary: Stayed here 2 nights to do Disneyland. The people at this hotel were the friendliest people in all of the places we stayed at, always happy to assist and offer help! Rooms were very clean, large and comfortable with cooking facilities if required. Would recommend.

Summary Heading: A place to Sleep, nothing special.
Summary: We booked two nights on the hotel website, 2 for 1 special approx $59/night. If you want breakfast at the restaurant in the parking lot,. it costs $4.50 extra per day for you entire party. Breakfast included scrambled eggs, ham. pancackes,  toast, potatoes, fruit,, cereal, coffee, ,juice & milk, It was always hot and very good.  Bed was clean & comfortable. Our room on the 3rd floor had a fully equipped kitchen with Fridge, stove and sink, probably from the the 70's. Working TV with limited channels. again, nothing fancy, but everything worked. The air conditioner was extremely noisy and smelled.  Balcony door did not lock and we had a view of the pool which was nice until  the screaming kids were out there. Luckily the pool closes at 10pm.

First of all, I think the staff is very friendly and helpful and the breakfast is a good deal.  Other than that, I would ever go back.  We stayed here a few years ago and liked it, but this time was quite different.  This hotel is old and tattered.  Our room looked so beat, it made me depressed.  This place is in desperate need of a serious renovation.  First of all, I found ants in the bathroom along with a few black hairs.  Ewwww.  The bathroom faucet was so worn the chrome was off.  There were stains on the chairs and bedspread.  I grabbed a towel one morning and when I unrolled it, it was very worn with frayed edges, something I would have cut up for rags at home.  The night stand had no alarm clock and no phone and some of the finish was off down to the bare wood.  The
Manager Response: I am very surprised that your room appears not to have been up to  par. Could you please let me know which room it was so that i can investigate further. As the owner I usually check a number of rooms each week and must say that I have been very pleased with the standard but that's not to say that this one has been overlooked.

Summary Heading: Beautiful room, cute hotel, amazing deal.
Summary: My husband and I love to escape to OC once in a while, this time it was for an event @ Newport (aprox. 20 minutes from Anaheim), but we always stay @ Anaheim just because we love it there and we escape for the Happy Hour @ House of Blues @ Downtown Disney (after 10 pm)... anyway, I loved this hotel it is now my favorite in Anaheim, I got an amazing deal for a Saturday night and the place didnt dissapoint: great rooms equiped with full kitchen, great decor and it even has its own little balcony! Very nice indeed... ah yes! and the coffee they provide is not Caffeine free... Thank you LOL.

Summary Heading: I loved it i decided i wouldnt stay...
Summary: I loved it i decided i wouldnt stay anywhere else when im in that area

We have been staying at Pepper Tree for; this is the 5th time. I was expecting 'smooth' + relaxation but 5th time wasn't a charm !!...At first,the room was very nice with an extra bed. The problem was the kitchen,the sink was leaking from the faucet,every time we turned the water on...the water's leaking...and the paper towel won't help at all !!!...We told the front desk,at first, we did not want to move because we were just finished unpacking. Then,later on as we were finished cooking and washing some dishes,the water was leaking more and more...we went to the front desk,again, to ask if we could move because we scared it might be more water...but they said we have to wait for tomorrow...and we did until almost noon. They should have 2 or 3 extra rooms for any emergency !!!

Summary Heading: Smelly room, smelly room, how are they cleaning you....
Summary: We specifically reserved a non-pet room but the only room available smelled like an overwhelming combination of litter box and heavy deodorants. The front desk said that they used a lot of deodorants to mask the pet smells. Otherwise the room looked nice and roomy and like their website pictures. The hotel is a renovated bachelor apartment building and exudes a nostalgic old Hollywood/Tower of Terror ambiance but in need of an upgrade, massive cleaning, and consistent housekeeping, otherwise it could be charming.  This is not the hotel you would stay at when on holiday with children on a Disney mission. As others have mentioned - cell phone reception is weak.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Could you please contact me direct as we are unable to identify your stay with us.Front desk do not recall making comments that you have written about. The property was built as and always has been a hotel so we do not understand your reference to a renovated bachelor apartment building. Also we very rarely allow pets and are dilegent about cleanliness. We do not "mask" smells.

Summary Heading: A clean, large, well decorated, comfortable place to stay for a bargain price
Summary: A Mexican style motel that has many artifacts and is roomy, clean and charming.  Great soaps along with a free breakfast at the restaurant which is buffet of great food.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  Disneyland is just a couple of miles away and is easy to get to.  I would stay here again and much longer.

I really loved this hotel. The employees were very accommodating and friendly at check in and every other time we had an encounter with them. The manager was also very nice and helpful. The room was spacious and fit our needs perfectly. Though we were only staying for a couple of nights I could see how staying there for an extended stay would be done with ease and comfort. The rooms came with a kitchen with microwave, full fridge, large sink, and 4 range top stove/oven. It also had a nice bathroom and living room area. The bed was VERY COMFY. I slept so soundly and loved the feather pillows as well. The hotel also had a pool with a nice barbecue area. The price was amazing too for how closely it was located to all the amusement parks and restaurants. I also liked that there was

Nice clean place to stay. No bugs. Housekeeping was very clean. Comfortable and felt safe.  Stores and restaurants we needed were close i.e. Target and drugstores.  Restaurant on site could stay open later.  Would stay again and recommend to others. Staff was very pleasant and seemed concerned about our needs.

Summary Heading: Staff great but doors are made of paper
Summary: Advantages = The staff was excellent!!!! They were VERY helpful....even let me print coupons for LegoLand on their computer. Bed was comfortable. Water pressure was good. Decor was nice. Grocery store a couple of blocks away. Mexican restaurant on property. The price was right too. :)   Disadvantages = The noise!! I think the door to our room was made of paper LOL. You can hear EVERY person walking/talking/breathing down the hallway. Not the hotels fault but it might help to remind guests or replace the doors with noise reduction ones. Bring earplugs for the 1st few nights. Towards the end of a week @ Disneyland we were too exhausted to hear the noise. Otherwise only small things, nothing too major....only 2 forks/2 spoons/2 knives in room, no safe, no hot tub, no laundry on

My wife, myself and our 2 teenage kids stayed here in August 2009. We stayed for a full fortnight, using it as a base for several days in Disney, as well as the other theme parks, and various trips into LA. We had no problems throughout the 2 weeks, which must be a decent indicator of the hotel's quality. We could drive to Disney in 10 minutes, and later of an evening (with little traffic), could get back from LA in half an hour.  The rooms were spacious and the fridge was very handy. We had the larger room with the two patios and this was a nice feature. Parking was never a problem, and we made great use of the pool. The pool's not massive, but it was more than adequate, given that we pretty much had sole use of it for days (nights) on end! The staff were very friendly and

I found the Hotel Pepper Tree here on the Tripadvisor, and after a lot of research decided it was the one for me. I'm glad I did because I was very pleased with my stay.  The thing I appreciated the most was the cleanliness of the room.  It was literally spotless; not a speck of dust or cobweb to be found anywhere. I can not remember a more clean room anywhere else I've ever stayed. The room itself was quite large and comfortable. The bed was also comfortable, as were the feather pillows.  I only had one problem with the room. I am used to sleeping in total darkness (something my wife insists on).  Unfortunately that was not the case as an outdoor patio light was automatically turned on ALL night  ( I presume for security reasons), and the black out curtains, as is often the

Summary Heading: Great hotel near Disneyland, We stay every year.
Summary: Hotel is great as it has a full size kitchen with dishes.  Closets are huge and very close to disneyland.  We stay there every year, for the last 4 years.  We will always go back.

I have to say it was great. I have no complaints at all. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and the restaurant was great as well.  My husband and I have agreed that the next time we go to Anaheim, there is no question where we are staying. Thank you again for your services! Sincerely Natalie Prieto

Summary Heading: Great Value-Great Staff...would recommend for families on a budget
Summary: Our family of 4 stayed at Hotel Pepper Tree for 3 nights.  We were first impressed by the front desk clerk and equally impressed with management.  There was a discrepincy in the price and we wanted 2 queens - they went out of their way to accomodate us.  The area is average, not good or bad.  The room is dated yes, but clean, large and very comfortable.  We enjoyed having the full kitchen.  The kids loved the heated pool.  The $4.50 breakfast for the WHOLE family was great before a long day at the Disneyland theme parks.  If you dont expect luxury, but want convenience, a clean comfortable, large room and great value - this is the place for you.  We will return!!  Thank you Hotel Pepper Tree... my daughters 10th Disneyland Birthday was great, in part to you!

My fiance and I stayed one night and wish we had booked more days the room was the best! the bed was the best part it felt like I was sleeping on AIR!!!! it was so cozy and I cant wait to go back the staff were so great and had really good service

Summary Heading: A great choice and good price
Summary: Our room was a double queen with a small kitchen. The beds were very comfortable and the area was quiet. A nice perk was the bag of samples  {Advil, shampoo, body scrub, tooth paste, etc) that was in our room in addition to the standard shampoo/conditioner/soaps. We were offered the 4.50 breakfast deal but did not take advantage of it.  We did not feel the area was unsafe and our room did not smell as previous reviewers had written. I did appreciate how the management addressed the negative reviews and that was another reason why I made our reservation here.  The front desk staff were pleasant and helpful. If we return to Disneyland, we would stay at Hotel Pepper Tree again.

Stayed here July 18th, 2010 for one night. Room was clean. not too far from disney. Room was 80 usd for one night. Room was clean but decor was dated. Walls are very thin so you can here people above and next to you. Bed was very comfortable. Neihborhood was a little scary I did not venture out with the kids.  2 1/2 stars out of 5. A good reasonable place to stay

Summary Heading: Perfect way to do Disneyland without spending the earth
Summary: We had a kitchen which meant we ould cook and prepare meals for the kids, and having a car it was only a short and very easy drive to Disneyland. We also went to Legoland for the day from here. Target was just down the road and had everything we needed from groceries to clothes, pharmacy etc. The pool was great for the kids each day when we got back from Disney. Staff were really friendly and very helpful. Place was clean and quiet and great value for money.

Arrived first night, disapointed in room, looked worn down and dingy. Woke up first morning with bites on my boyfriends legs, not sure what they were...Second morning, more bites on legs and investigated the sheets to discover the bed had fleas.   We tried to move to a different hotel, but were unable to find something on such short notice. We informed the front desk, they moved us to another dingy room which had no fleas and chalked it up to the fact that they allow pets.   We spent as little time as possible in our room and had to joke that instead of our dog coming home with the fleas from the kennel we would come home with fleas from our hotel!!! We  do not recommend this hotel. Pay an extra 20.00 a night and stay somewhere nicer.
Manager Response: I am sorry that the style of our hotel was not what you  expected and topped off with some kind of insect/flea bites. I have investigated the issue and the room that you stayed in is not a room that we allow pets in,  however we do not dispute your claim.  We have since fumigated and detailed the room anyway and will monitor it closely. We have specific housekeeping and fumigation procedures that are strictly followed on the odd occasion that we do have a pet on the premises.We charge extra for pets to cove thiscost.

Summary: we have stayed at the pepper tree 2 years running and we find it to be good location to the theme parks and shopping malls but far enough away to give you the feeling of being in your own oasis,the staff are all informative and freindly and it has enough facilitys to satisfy

This was the best hotel by far that I have ever been to. I price was more then fair the staff was beyond believably the best. It was very clean we are already planning another trip down south. Can’t wait to stay there again! Can’t say enough great things about the hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice place just a little upset with hidden fee!
Summary: My family stayed at this hotel for a week. Upon my arrival I was told they had to charge me another $150 on top of the $632 we had payed 1 month earlier for our room. Usually hotels will take the Card number and put a hold on a certain ammount for damages or what not, well they actually remove the money from our account. We drove to Anaheim from Oklahoma, the money they removed from our account was our gas money home. When we checked out the attendant said teh money would be redeposited into our account the same day but it was not. I called my bank then the pepper tree and was advised that the attendant did not redeposit the money on our check out date. So after all this, my bank account is now in overdraft and I am being charged 4 different overdraft fees. The hotel itself is a

Summary Heading: Awesome stay, Awesome hotel, Awesome breakfast.
Summary: We had the pleasure to stay at this hotel for 3nights.  Awesome room, very spacious for those with children.  We also took advantage of the full-size refrigerator.  Upgrade for the breakfast at the restaurant, it will be the best bargain you get in SoCal.  Knotts berry Farm is 2mi away.  Whenever we are visiting this area we will definitely stay there again.

We stayed at the Pepper Tree for our first time in June 2010 and we will definitely go back.  It's a real treasure of a find!  It's definitely off the beaten path, but was quick and easy to find out of the Disneyland parking lot, maybe a five minute drive.  The hotel was unique, and the rooms were very spacious.  Although we didn't use the kitchen, I noticed it was fully equipped with plates, silverware, pots, etc for our next stay.  The breakfast is a real deal at the Azteca restaurant.  For $4.50 it fed our entire family of four, a fresh and hot breakfast buffet (eggs, pancakes, potatoes, cereals, yogurt, danishes, beverages).  See you next time Pepper Tree, and we will be telling all our friends about it!

I was looking for a nice affordable hotel for an extended stay April through May 2010 in the Anaheim area. I booked the Peppertree because of its excellent reviews and the pics and description on their website. Their low season online rates were unbeatable. With a very flexible service team accomodating to every guest's wish I had the most enjoyable stay.  It's different from the average Anaheim hotel, not business- or Disneylike at all. Beautiful and very welcoming from the outside with tropical plants and lush green and very cosy inside with its Mexican style interior design of the lobby and rooms. All rooms, decorated in warm colours, are very spacious with comfy beds, a small cooking area and a huge closet. Every room comes with a big balcony, overlooking the pool area and

Summary Heading: Amazing character and value among cookie cutter hotels!
