Summary: The purpose for our trip to Anaheim was to visit the Disneyland resort. We wanted to find a hotel that was clean, convenient, and affordable for such a large party. We had children, teens, twenty-somethings, forty-somethings, and eighty-somethings on this visit and we really needed a hotel that could accommodate all our needs, including a very large senior scooter. Hotel Pepper Tree did that without any complaints from anyone.  As a matter of fact my 9 year old said,"This place is awesome!"  We have been to many hotels within walking distance to the resort but because our family holds season passes that include parking in the Disneyland parking structure, we didn't mind the 10 minute drive from the hotel. We were also 30 minutes from the Seal Beach Pier, and very convenient to

We had the one bedroom accomodation for our family of 5 adults. The value was great as it included a very good hot breakfast and we could all stay together. The futon bed was not comfortable and the twin bed squeaked whenever you moved but the king bed was great! It was very clean and just a short drive to Disneyland. Very quiet. We would stay again and recommend this to anyone looking for a clean, quiet, resonably priced hotel that includes a yummy hot breakfast.

From the pictures and other reviews I was expecting a quaint and romantic setting.  I was not disappointed!  Everything about our stay was pleasant.  We chose the breakfasts for the family.  The breakfast buffet was more than adequate.  I loved the amb ience created by the large wood furniture in the lobby to the wonderful wrought iron railing and fixtures.  Our kitchenette was out of some other time with stained cabinets and tile counters.  The beds were large enough to comfortably sleep my husband and I in one bed and our two teenagers in the other.  We also received a bag of shower gel and other goodies.  I cannot say enough good things about this hotel.  It is a must experience!  It was a short, straight  trip to Disneyland.  Very convenient!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for the price so affordable and a short drive to Disneyland we will be back
Summary: We had a great stay. The pool was nice, the room was big, the place was pretty clean, the front  desk staff was nice and helpful gave us directions to Disneyland and the Hotel was pretty close to Disneyland you just drove down one street and turned right and followed it tot the parking garage only took us a few minutes every day. We will come back and stay there and would recommend it. It is so nice to have a kitchen when you have kids too.   Nice place for the money :)

Summary Heading: Cheap but it didn't make me feel cheerful because of the smell!!!
Summary: My family and I stayed in this hotel for a week in November 2009, following a Royal Caribbean Cruise. I guess having been used to the luxurious surroundings of a cruise ship nothing was really going to compare but booking this hotel had seemed like a good idea at the time ...... after all it was cheap and had excellent 5* reviews from previous guests.  When we arrived, we were allocated two rooms on the second floor but as soon as we opened the doors, our nostrils were assaulted with the most horrendous smell! We just couldn't work out what it was or where exactly it was coming from but OMG ...... it was AWFUL! Both rooms smelt exactly the same and for a nano second, my parents and I thought that perhaps something was being filted through the air conditioning system and the
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I am sorry that you had a problem with the apparent smell in the room. We do monitor issues like this closely and givien that your stay was 6 mths ago I am pleased to say that we have not had any of the same issue reported to me. I welcome you back at some stage and I am sure that we will pass the sniff test.

Summary Heading: Amazing place to take a group for an extended stay!
Summary: I took a group and booked nine rooms for three nights. Upon asking everyone if they'd like to return again next year, it was unanimous. Everyone loved the spacious living space, the unique decor and the fully functional kitchen. It felt more like we were staying at a condo than a hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful and the manager worked with our group to make our stay perfect for our needs. The only negative was some late night noise from the street and the restaurant that shares the property, but it wasn't unbearable and I'm not sure anywhere else would have been better. We'll definitely be back!

This hotel is different from your ordinary "big chain" names. This place has a real charm that makes it feel much more like a bed & breakfast than a hotel. The Spanish decor is warm and inviting, the rooms have a kitchen & couch, the beds are VERY comfortable.   The staff is extremely friendly and very helpful.  While the neighborhood itself is nothing special, the location is very close to Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm, and many other So Cal attractions.  This has become a favorite place for us to stay when visiting the area.

My mom, Sister, and nephew (5years) came in from New Mexico, I drove down from Lancaster. I was very surprised how wonderful the hotel was, and the staff was great. The room was huge and having the kitchen made it so inexpensive for our meals. We also got the meal deal on our room, which was a hot meal every day of our stay for about $1/per person for the whole stay. The pool was nice, clean, and warm we used it at least three times while we were there. The price was oustanding and the location was close to everything. We had a great time on our vaction and I would recommend this Hotel to anyone that is going to stay in Anaheim, and want to save a little bit of money without loosing the quaility of a great hotel. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Thank you Hotel Perrtree
Great value for what you get. Nobody can beat that price for all that's include in every room. I will definitely will stay there again and again.

Summary Heading: Loved our stay at this quaint hotel
Summary: We have stayed before and will stay again. Although the Peppertree is not within walking distance to Disneyland, it is an amazing place for the price.   Quiet, quaint, very clean, comfy beds and very accommodating!! We needed a later check out than usual, and the staff was great in taking care of it, and at no extra charge.   They had wireless in our room at no extra charge, no parking fee, and we could have had breakfast for a very small fee for both of us. Can't beat that.

My husband and I were trying to find something nice, close to Disneyland, and something that wouldn't be super expensive. When I found the Pepper Tree, I knew that was where we had to stay! The hotel is so charming and aesthetically pleasing. They had a special where you stayed one night and got the second one for free (exactly what we needed). I booked a normal King studio and when we arrived found we were upgraded to an executive room! My husband LOVED the bed!  Their front desk is so helpful and nice. My husband and I were flying in late to begin with and only found that our flight was delayed and wouldn't be able to make it to the hotel by the time the front desk employee would be there to check us in. I called them the second we landed and I spoke to a gentleman who
Great place to stay. Friendly staff and well cleaned rooms. My family loved it. Had a reseaonable cost.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with a family on a budget
Summary: You have a family friendly fantastic environment.   I spent hours looking for a home with a kitchen that could accommodate our family for a weekend in Anaheim.  I was surprised to find your rooms  with full kitchens at a reasonable rate and right in the area we needed to be.   Clean, Large rooms with plenty of fresh linens as needed.  The pool was fun and refreshing. The small fee we paid extra for the buffet breakfast at the nearby restaurant was well worth it for feeding our family a wholesome breakfast.   Although the bathroom was a little cramped I loved all the closet space and semi-private changing area (with older boys it is nice).  When my husband and I left the kids with a friend for the evening, while we attended a wedding, they were even able to borrow a DVD player to

We stayed there on a Thursday night layover mainly because of the price (compared to airport hotels) and the location to where my aunty lived.  The only inconvenience is that the desk hours is limited with no specifics on the website so I had to rush from the airport to check-in vs visiting first with the aunty for dinner.    Another problem I found was that our sliding glass door wouldn't lock so it caused some apprehension w/three women.  I did note it in the guest survey to the hotel so I hoped it's fixed.    Otherwise, for the price, free parking, location and room it is a great value.  The kitchen is convenient in its set-up and there's a couch in front of the TV.  The on-ramp to the freeway is nearby and you're between knott's berry farm and disneyland.  The place has

Summary Heading: Comfortable, Homely Hotel with Kitchen Ammenities. Friendly staff
Summary: We stayed at this hotel with 3 Adults and 3 children.  Our room was the 1 bdrm Unit.  We were very happy with our stay and enjoyed having the facilities in the kitchen.  The beds consisted of a Futon (slept 2 children) and a Single (King Single?) which we used to sleep a small adult and small child.  The other bed was a King Size and was lovely and comfy.  We found it also convenient as there was a Coin Laundry straight across the road and it was cheap to do your washing.  The staff were lovely and friendly and helped with direction and other information.

Summary Heading: Great spacious hotel - saving some $$ for Disney
Summary: It worked very well for us - we booked a suite for the 4 of us (for 1/4 the price of the Disney rooms!) and had LOTS of space to spread out after a long day in the car.  The entryway with fish in the ponds and fountains was cool, and the breakfast in the hotel's restaurant (across the small parking lot) cost $9 for the ENTIRE family for TWO days.  $1.10/day each! Can you beat that?  Great price. Friendly staff. Try the Thai restaurant across the street to the west - great flavors at a reasonable price.  A good break from the cookie-cutter hotels.  We will go back.

well, the best part about our stay was the check-in, the lady was very friendly and professional. The hotel's decor is also very nice. The first morning starting very early i heard a loud scratching noise in my bathroom. We went to breakfast and when we came back there was a loud construction-like sound going through the hallway. When i came to our room the sound intensified and it was so loud that it felt like my head was vibrating. I found out that they were re-finishing the bathtub in the room next door. I had to tell them twice before the sound stopped. mind you this was about 9am. We also booked a room on the ground floor with the private patio and the fountain only to find out that the relaxing sounds i was looking forward to hearing in the morning from the fountain was

The Hotel was way better in real life than in pictures. My favorite part was the area thats not even in the pictures, the small mirriored walk in area leading to the santa fe new mexico styled restroom which carries through the rest of the room. The Tiles really set a nice tone and change it from a Generic hotel room into a more comforble and intimate setting. There is a ALOT of space and a nice separation from the kitchen area to the bed, to the bathroom.   The Room was very immaculate and had plenty of lighting, The stove worked perfectly as i used it to make some tea which everything was provided for making even the tea kettle and tea bags. So anyone saying that the stove had no power might have not known how to use a gas burner. The fridge was really clean and looked brand

Summary Heading: If your going to Disney, Universal, or the Beach, you must stay at Hotel Peppertree.
Summary: The service was "Five Star". The room rate was not only affordable but very generous for the accomadations and ammenities you recieve. This was our second visit to the Hotel and it will be the only Hotel we stay at when were in the area. Love Mom. Just kidding.  Robbin McConnell - Las Vegs,NV.

This was our 3rd stay at the Hotel Pepper Tree and we love it.  This hotel is very clean quiet charming and very friendly.  Its centerally located to both Disney and Knots as well as shopping and freeways.  There is a great Resturant in the parking lot which is a bonus as you can go for a quiet drink after the days outting.  We choose the Executive suite which was on the ground floor which has a balcony with plants and a water feature... I would highly recommend this to anyone as it is not a cookie cutter hotel but a hidden gem.

Summary Heading: What a nice cheerful, cozy, suite with everything needed for an economical stay this was.
Summary: The room was pleasant and nice.  I enjoyed hearind the sound of water from the small fountain on my small veranda. The kitchen was perfect, with all dishes and utensils needed there.  The outside barBQ was an added treat.  The only 2 negatives were no hot tub, and The grocery store across the street had closed.

Summary Heading: This hotel was a great deal and the rooms were so comfy
Summary: Our budget was the whole reason we chose Pepper Tree and when we were done at disney land finding the hotel was really simple, we got in really late that night and were starving but didnt want to drive any more and they own a great mexican restaurant in the same parking lot and even let the kids eat free! the beds were amazing and the staff was really sweet and helpful. i have recommended this hotel to plenty of my friends since my stay.

Summary Heading: Great value, very nice accomodations, comfortable bed... all the things that count.
Summary: I am happy to write this recommendation for the Hotel Pepper Tree.  i have stayed here several times now and am always satisfied with my stay.  The staff is very friendly and helpful,  the beds are so comfortable and the rooms are so spacious.  I feel like I found an oasis in the desert. I almost hate to share this great secret with others,  There is also a hidden treasure in the restaurant right on the premises.  Great food, great prices. You will not be disappointed with a stay at the Hotel Pepper Tree.

I've stayed here before, and it was so good we had to do it again. Last year it was for a Disneyland vacation, this time we went to Vegas and made a trip to Disneyland again for just a couple days. We had one night to spend there so we didn't hesitate to book here again. Prices are right there with the cheapest in Anaheim but the hotel is just wonderful. Short stay since we came in at 11pm and left at 7am, but really, this place is so good I really wanted to give it another good review here.

This is actually our second stay here in this hotel, our first stay was back on April 2009. At that time there was just a slight problem, which is the toilet that wouldn't flush,but they fixed it right away so we just did not let this incident bothered us and we enjoyed the rest of our stay anyways. But the second time around I thought there wouldn't be anymore problems, but WRONG! Our room STINKS like there's a dead rat  somewhere. For 3 nights we all felt like throwing up because of this strong smell. We told them about it but they didn't even offer to move us to another room, they just keep telling us that they would check on it. But obviously no one ever did check where the smell was coming from, and not only that..the housekeeping didn't even empty the trash. Now my four
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I have spoken with front desk and we are unable to identify your stay with us? Please contact me personally so that I can find out which room you stayed in and if necessary take appropriate action.

Summary: The room (2 rooms joined together) was very spacious with a comfortable bed. Nice touch with a large fridge and well appointed self service kitchen. Outstanding value for money!

My wife, my daughter and myself did a last minute search on President's Day to search for a place to stay for the night so we could go to Disneyland the following day, We reviewed some hotels and motels, and Hotel Peppertree impressed us with their web page and their prices. I called and spoke to Rick, he was very friendly on the phone, I was set up in no time. We arrived late afternoon, we were very impressed with the service at the front desk, we were more impressed with the room, very large and clean. It had the old spanish type tile, a couch, nice entertainment area, and the beds were very comfortable. The Mexican restarurant that is located in front of the hotel was very good, hotel peppertree included a hot breakfast for the next morning for one low price, the breakfast

Summary Heading: non-expensive, clean, comfortable, great service and in great location!
Summary: The Hotel Pepper Tree in Anaheim, CA is the ideal hotel-Ive stayed at quite a few and this one made quite an impression. The prices themselves are very affordable. When arriving there is a nice lobby (not like a motel with all see through windows lol), they have a computer with access to the internet right at the entrance, also on your way in the pool is a little hidden behind some trees but once inside the gates it is very nice and CLEAN, there are ramadas and tables etc. The people at the front desk were very welcoming to the point where i even remembered there names, Deycy and Rick. Once i got to my room i immidiately felt like i had gotten more than what i expected. The bathrooms were very well kept and had space for about 3 to 4 people, the shower/bath was a good size to,
i was in the pepper tree in dec with my family we enjoyed the trip the owner and staff were  friendly  i would recomand for familys

Summary Heading: Wonderful Stay, I will be a repeat customer!
Summary: First off I have to give many thanks to Brittany at the front desk for making my pleasent stay possible. I was booked for a 2nd floor room but really wanted a 1st floor room which was entirely booked. She told me to call the morning of my stay to see if she can possibly squeeze me into a room. I pleaded with her to do this for me. When I arrived at the hotel I was so excited to see that she got my 1st floor room and it was absolutely perfect! It was a huge room and interesting decor which I loved. I felt like I was in Santa Fe New Mexico. Hotel was quiet and the staff was helpful. I was also suprised to get a phone call from the front desk asking if I was pleased with my room and if I needed anyting else which I thought was a nice gesture. The encolsed patio was awesome! The

Summary Heading: Nice little getaway with all the amenities
Summary: We loved the rustic Spanish decor. The room was clean and spacious.  They provided everything that you would need to stay for a few days--cookware, dishes, silverware, full-sized fridge, stove, even dishwashing liquid and sponge.  Just a little note...the breakfast is provided in the restaurant next door, and you have to eat there.  The set up of the breakfast was very nice--eggs, pancakes, sausage, muffins, cereal, and all your usual breakfast drinks.  However, the door is not well insulated, so you can hear noise from the hallway when someone rolls their luggage onto the tile trim.  Just a little hint--ask for a room facing toward the front of the hotel if you want to enjoy the balcony because the view is better than the back rooms.

Summary Heading: wonderful place for a cozy, private retreat
Summary: loved our stay. the room was perfect for a private cozy weekend (or any time) and has everything you'd need to just stay in and relax if you want. it was like a home away from home.... without the kids or nosey neighbors! very relaxing atmosphere. definitely will stay there again.... and hopefully soon.

I've been staying here ever since Hotel Pepper Tree opened!  Great BIG rooms with plenty of room for families.  The full kitchen & refrigerator are a bonus!  Convenient quick drive to Disneyland and other area theme parks!  I stay everytime I come to Anaheim CA!    Love it, Love it, LOVE IT!!

Summary Heading: Very nice and roomy.   We will be back.
Summary: It was very nice for the price and the staff was very friendly and helpful.   Nice kitchenette and plenty of room for our family of four.   It may have been oldish, but it has been remodeled and was actually kind of a neat place.

We usually stay at a Marriott, Hilton or even Holiday Inn. I wanted to branch out and save a few dollars and thought I would try this hotel out.  We arrived late Saturday night and although there is a sign in the lobby that guests should remain from making noise past 10:30 pm, this is not the case. We arrived right before the lobby closed for the night, about 11:30 pm or so. Upon arrival I waited for the front desk person to come because there was no one there. I kept ringing the bell and finally someone came about 10 minutes later. This made me upset, but I tried not to let it bother me.   I was then asked what the name was; I always spell my last name because a lot of people have a hard time saying it. I gave her the last name Huerta. She then looks at me and says "Who is

Overall a good experience. A small and cozy place. Hotel security is poor, but the place is complemented with a full kitchen- full size fridge, stove, microwave and other kitchen appliences. Hotel is close to local attractions and convention center.

I had reserved this hotel for the second week of December, but the rainy weather caused me to cancel a trip to Knott's. When I called to cancel the reservation, I was given the opportunity to change it to the next week. We ended up going the following week and the weather was perfect. We had three rooms on the 2nd floor and they were all close to one another. The rooms, while not perfect, were very spacious and family friendly. The kitchen, dishes and utensils were very handy. The room provided a lot of things that you miss in other hotel rooms.  The hotel manager took time to stop and greet me and ask how everything was. He was very friendly and insisted that I contact him if I needed anything. I never had to contact him as there were no problems.   The heated pool was nice,

Summary Heading: Hacienda Feel, Beautiful Hotel, Best Price Around!!!
Summary: When we arrived at the Pepper Tree, I was SHOCKED! It was so beautiful, old world hacienda/mission style, ornate porcelain and terracotta  tiles. Rooms are spacious, beautiful bedding and flooring, with cute balconies. Full kitchens, although we didnt use them. The only thing that appeared outdated was the bathrooms.   The front desk was very helpful to us, gave us the internet code, and helped us to get around town. They were great. The restaurant next to the property had a great continental breakfast one morning, the next morning it was a little less great. We had the nachos one night and that wasnt bad either- big enough for two people.   The only down side was that they spray a room fragrance/deodorizer everywhere. ALLEREGY OR ASTHMA SUFFERES BEWARE!!!!!!! I had to let is

Summary Heading: Everything in the room looks old & worn!
Summary: It is amazing this hotel is ranked as high as #10!! Absolutely lousy location with equally lousy front desk staff! Terrible bathroom. Very slow Net connection. We planned to stay 10 days but could not wait to check out after 2 nights! What a nightmare.
Manager Response: I am sorry that our Hotel did not meet your expectations . I would be greatful if you could  forward your contact details to me directly as I am  having trouble identifying your stay with us. I would like to discuss your stay further.

Summary: Hotel Pepper Tree is a nice, comfortable place to stay. The rooms are clean, spacious and well equipped. It's perfect for a home away from home. The staff is freindly, helpful and attentive to your needs. This is actually the third time we have stayed here and I know we will be back!

I stayed at Pepper Tree before and it wasnt too bad however this time around, it was a real disappointment!   On the second night, my car was broken into, thieves smashed the window and stole the navigator. There was no signage to warn guests, the alarm must have gone off for awhile but no one at the reception bothered to check what it was. As this was my first time being 'robbed', I was shocked and immediately advised the reception desk, to my astonishment, the two staff behind the counter seemed oblivious to my report, they didn't even look up! When I asked to use the phone, one staff (Sarah) was even hesitating to give me the phone fearing I would make a long distance call! These two staff acted so indifferent that it made me think this type of things happens so often here at
Manager Response: I am alarmed to hear about this incident and sorry for the upset. I must say that car break in has not been an issue that we have had to deal with at the hotel. I am surprised by your comments about front desk  and will investigate further.

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights and 5 days.  The rooms were very clean, spacious and the staff were very friendly.  We loved having the kitchen with a full size refrigerator. We will definitely be back and stay here again.

I booked the hotel on-line after reading other guests reviews. Iwas pleasantly surprized at the friendliness of the staff and the clean, queit environment of the room and surroundings. The restuarant was convenient and reasonable. I have recommended the hotel to others and will stay there again.

Summary Heading: Do it!, Do it!, Do it! Stay Here or you're not getting your money's worth!
Summary: Seeing my family is always a pleasure, but this was for major surgery on my daughter, so it could have been a very difficult time. However, every staff member, employee, restaurant worker, manager, etc...,, made this stay the best vacation I have ever had!   Staying over two weeks long, it felt like home from beginning to end! If you do not choose this hotel for your trip, long or short, you are seriously cheating yourself. The price and service is phenominal!   Thank you Hotel Pepper Tree for being there for me and my family during this trying time! May God bless you and yours richly!  Susy

Summary Heading: Excellent value for disneyland family visits
Summary: This is definitely a HIDDEN GEM.  If you are traveling to disneyland with family and in need of a hotel room with  full service kitchen at a great value, this is the place to go!  It is about 1/2 mile from disneyland.  Ample parking in the back of the hotel (there is some in the front too, but is almost always occupied).  They include free breakfast - cereals, juice, milk, coffee, bread and some kind of pastry.  It was sufficient and convenient for us.  It also has a heated pool/spa that we did not try out. There is free wifi, but was not fast.  We used it couple of times to look up things on yelp and get directions etc.  They have a pc with net connection in the lobby, may be that is faster.  We did not have any problems with hot water like one of the other reviewer posted.

This hotel has a truly Spanish feel with fountains, red-tiled floors and arches.  The ambiance is not just in the lobby, but in every room.  All downstairs rooms have patios with fountains.  The rooms are large with full kitchens and have a rustic comfortable feel.  The staff is friendly and personal, you have the feeling of a small family-run hotel.  We always stay here when we go to Disneyland, which is a few miles away, but worth it for the unique accommodations.  The hotel is reasonably priced and includes a continental breakfast at the adjoining Mexican restaurant.

This was my first time staying at this hotel and I like it a lot.  The location is easy to find.  The hotel itself is very unique and cozy with beautiful and interesting decor.  I will definitely return to this hotel if I happen to be in this area.  I had a wonderful stay.

Summary Heading: The location is in an undesirable neighborhood!
Summary: As my children and I were arriving to the hotel there was a undercover cop making an arrest. The location was nothing to what is described on their website. The rooms were very outdated, the linen looked to be very dirty, the towels had hair in them and the sheets had stuff in random places. I made my children sleep in their clothes and 1st thing in the morning we checked out! As for their continental breakfast well the restaurant served some decent fruits. The utensils, containers, cups looked like they hadn't really seen hot water in a long time. I stayed there because we went to Disneyland for the day and I didn't want to get tired driving home; however after everything i would have rather taken the chance to drive home!
Manager Response: I am sorry that "Anaheim" and the hotel did not meet your expectations. Anaheim is not as affluent as some other areas but is certainly safe. We have  very strict in house procedures for linen replacement and laundering and indeed many of our guests actually compliment us on our housekeeping. I will investigate your stay further with housekeeping.

Summary Heading: Hotel Pepper Tree Disneyland 3 Day Vacation
Summary: Very friendly staff, from greeting @ registration thru check-out. The first impression was a very "rustic" feel to the whole facility, Visiting Disneyland with adult son,daughter & son-in-law. We had no problem with driving to theme park & parking garage, but some might consider being in ART service area to avoid driving to & back from park. We all felt that room set up was ideal for us with adjoining rooms making for one unit that could be isolated for privacy. Would for sure make same destination for next trip to theme park trip.

Summary Heading: Highly recommend, super clean, really friendly, will stay again-I'm picky
Summary: Great value. Full super clean refrigerator, and kitchen.GREAT BEDS, nice patio, great private set-up to bath and make-up area. Could stay for a week or more. Front desk -all the best people you will ever meet in the hospitality industry. The area was a little questionable as a lot of the hotels surrounding Knott's and Disneyland are, but we felt very safe. Closet space was huge! Spotless! The restaurant in the front- not a part of the hotel but where you get the breakfast needs ramping up. Not very clean at all.
Great stay and Very quiet and Clean. Did not use the pool but it look very nice. Very close to Disney land and Knotts. The food was great as well

Summary Heading: Super clean / Nice staff / Cozy feel / Roomy / Affordable
Summary: I am writing this review from the free high speed internet in my room at the Pepper Tree.  I guess this is a recent policy change based on what I had read before I arrived.  Like most of you that are considering this hotel - I booked our *9* day stay based on the great reviews.  I am going to keep this short, we were looking for a CLEAN hotel at a decent price, and it does not disappoint!! The central location was just added bonus for us.  I do not usually write reviews but I loved this hotel so much that I feel I should help try and contribute to its success!  It is not a 5 star hotel so don’t expect one, it is however everything it claims to be and at a price I am happy to pay!

Made a trip down to Southern California on a spur of the moment. Now I like variety, so I always try a different hotel. The Pepper Tree got many good reviews so I thought I would give it a try. I was impressed, as the day before I was to arrived, they called to confirm my reservation, and asked about an approx. arrival time. Never had that happen before. This Hotel is one exit away from Disneyland, and about 2 miles from Knott's Berry Farm. This hotel is not on Hotel row by Disneyland which I liked, rather it is away from all of that hustle and bustle, and it is on a modertly busy street in what I though was quiet, and I felt safe there. The Hotel is nice looking on the outside, and well kept, and I never had a problem parking. There is a Mexican-American Resteraunt in front of

Summary Heading: Did not dissapoint second time around
Summary: This was our second year at the Pepper Tree. Last year we stayed for 3 weeks, but this time we stayed for 4 – in fact the whole of September actually. After the enjoyment and hospitality of last years stay, I have to admit this year we were not disappointed. We were on the top floor and had a two-room suite on the rear. We are a family of 5 adults, and there was plenty of space, making full use of both areas and the spacious balcony.  The kitchenette rooms have a large fridge-freezer, a good-sized gas cooker and a microwave. They are generously equipped with cutlery, glasses etc. Although there is no dishwasher it does not detract from the general ‘holiday feel’ you get from the overall accommodation.  As usual there are no restrictions on what you eat, drink or bring back to
I loved the uniqueness of this hotel and the staff were amazing! The Azteca Restaurant attached to it had the best food and also very friendly staff, it made my stay in Anaheim very enjoyable.
Very friendly service.  Spacious rooms with full kitchen. Great location.

Hotel Peppertree is a great place to stay.  The staff are friendly, professional and extremely helpful to make sure that your stay is as pleasant as possible.  I will be staying there again when I next travel to Orange County.  It would have been just that bit better if there were safes in the room, but that would be my only comment.  The room we had was a studio apartment type with built in robes.  The bed was comfy and the small patio had a wonderful feeling to it.

Summary Heading: Big room, Quiet hotel, Friendly service!
Summary: Although it isn't in the best part of town, and further from Disneyland than I would like -  I would ABSOLUTELY stay there again! You WILL NOT find a all around nice hotel like this for a cheaper price.  The staff had no problem with our early check in request (we needed to put the baby down for a nap in between Disneyland visits), and tried to find us a very quiet room, which they did. The room was spacious and included a kitchenette, which I didn't expect! The dressing area was quite large with a big closet and separate lavatory and shower. The beds were comfortable as well.  The cable TV was not great, and that is my only complaint.   Another thing we liked was the complimentary wine we received at the restaurant that night. We figured since we had 2 free glasses of wine

Summary Heading: Wonderful Place to stay fantastic value
Summary: We booked here based on the reviews we had read at this website and we were not disappointed. The staff were helpful and polite, the rooms were a good size, quiet (we were on the reverse side of the building away from the main road on the second floor) and well equipped. They were kept very clean and are wonderfully quaint and individual.. Certainly glad to get away from the bustle of the downtown Disney area. The pool whilst not big was great for all of us to jump into at the end (or beginning) of a hot day out. Breakfast at the restuarant was sufficient (and included) to keep us going through the day. It was also good to have the option to prepare our own food in the kitchenette in our room.  One thing to keep in mind is that you need a car to get to Disney from this hotel as

Summary Heading: Great choice for our Disneyland Trip!
Summary: I stayed here twice with my fiance over the summer. We decided to try it out after reading the good reviews, and figuring out that even though we would have to pay the $12 parking for Disneyland, the total price would STILL be cheaper than staying in another hotel within walking distance of the park. And it worked out really well! The staff at the front desk give you a map with directions to Disneyland from the hotel. It took us a couple times to get it right, but once we did, they turned out to be great directions--they take you right to the parking structure. The drive is ten minutes or so, maybe even less. On the way is a big Target, useful for things like food and sunscreen.  The hotel itself is pretty neat. It definitely shows some age, but not really in a bad way. The

Summary Heading: Charming, roomy, our favorite stay in southern CA.
Summary: The Hotel Pepper Tree is off the beaten path, but close to anything we need.  There's a grocery store across the street (great since these are kitchenette rooms), a restaurant on-site, freeway, gas, businesses a few blocks away.  Quiet rooms, charming decor, friendly staff.  We love to stay here!

Summary Heading: Best value hotel away from the hustle bustle of LA
Summary: My partner and I had two nights in LA and wanted a cheap place with a kitchen.  She found this place and got it for approx. $65US a night.  We drove up from San Diego and caught up with friends all day, then checked in around 10pm.   We didn't expect much, but this place was really lovely.  It had nice character, lovely large room and we regretted not having the time to just hang out and relax in the hotel room. Staff were really professional, friendly and accommodating - I was able to leave my 7'6" surfboard bag with them for a day too. Kitchen had a proper size fridge and all the things you needed for self-catering.  I guess being in Anaheim, its pitched at family holidays visiting fun parks. The breakfast at the Mexican restaurant sharing the carpark was reasonable and I

Summary Heading: A Hidden Gem in Orange County..
Summary: It had been 6 years since I last visited Orange County. Since I was born and raised in the area, I usually stay with family and save money.  This visit however would be my wife's first time to CA so we wanted to find a good hotel in the area. We did alot of researching and found the Hotel Pepper Tree. Read all the online reviews and we decided this would be the perfect place for our vacation.    Upon our arrival, the place has a Mexican/Southwest US motiff going that makes it seem more welcoming than some side road hotel. The staff was very personable and made our check in as easy as possible. The room was actually quite spacious. Studio/efficiency apartment with a decent size kitchen (stove, refrigerator, microwave) and all the cooking utensils one would need. The bathroom was

Summary Heading: SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA HOME AWAY FROM HOME!!!
Summary: Ok where do I start?  First let me say this was our 2nd stay at Hotel Pepper Tree and we are already looking forward to our next stay.  The rooms are spacious, the beds are super comfortable with like a million pillows (still not enough), it's like being craddled in your mother arms... Lol!!! They have mini Kitchens with everything you need to make you feel like feel at home, seriously!  A/C works awesome, not noisy like other places we stayed at in the past.  The Hotel is minutes away from Disneyland and other Major Theme Parks, you can't wrong by staying here.  We can honestly say that we will being staying at Hotel Pepper Tree from now on whenever we visit the Southern California Area.  Keep up the Good Work!!!

Summary Heading: Clean, spacious and great price for a nice room.
Summary: My husband and I loved it.  It was close to several amusement parks and short distance to nearby cities.  We were very surprised how clean, spacious the room was and the bed was so comfortable for the price.  We are planning to reserve another reservation in November this time bringing our children with us.

Summary Heading: Excellent Value and Location with Helpful Staff and stylish Entrance
Summary: We stayed here primarily for the location and the kitchenette facility. However we were impressed by the helpful and patient desk staff who answered questions which they must have heard thousands of times previously. Also the cleanliness was very good considering cooking facilities are offered in many rooms. I would recommend this for any family or couple looking for a convenient and clean short stay stopover for Disney theme parks and/or Knotts Berry park. Also useful for the beaches, provided access to a car is available.

We enjoyed our stay; the location was great for all the theme parks and attractions and the rooms were spacious. We particularly enjoyed having the full kitchen. All the staff were friendly and helpful.

I booked a five night stay with this hotel for our Disneyland trip. Upon arrival they desk clerk wanted me to pay the full amout of the stay. I refused because we had not even seen the room yet. We immediately noticed the very stong mildew smell as we walked down the hallway to our room. As we checked out the room we noticed that the bedskirt was damp and hung onto the floor which we could tell was dirty from people stepping on it. It was hard to tell if the sheets had actually been cleaned or they were just stained. Everything seemed to be damp. There were white globs on the indoor/outdoor style carpet from the cheap vacuum powder  that they use. Some of the other guests looked like convicted felons. The Mexican restaurant that is associated with the hotel is very dirty and

Hotel is very close to Disneyland.  It has a kitchenette with a a full size refrigerator and fully stocked dishes.  Makes for great convenience in cooking your own meals.   Very quiet and great sevice all around.   We stay there every year.

Summary Heading: Gem of a property ideally situated between Knotts and Disneyland.
Summary: Hotel Pepper Tree is a charming kitchen suite property that is ideally located about 3 miles from both Knotts Berry Farm and Disneyland/California Adventure theme parks. We found our room to be very clean,spacious and our bed was quite comfortable. The address of the property is 2375 West Lincoln Ave., Anaheim, CA 92801 and the nearest intersection is Gilbert St. and Lincoln Ave. There is a restaurant Azteca on site which offers breakfast specials as well as American and Mexican cuisines. Azteca is also the place to get your continental breakfast and glass of wine which is complementary. There is a computer in the lobby for guest use and free wi-fy in your room for the first hour and then a per minute charge thereafter. Iron and ironing board are provided in the rooms; however

Summary Heading: Amazing price for charm, comfort, space, ambience - WOW. My new favorite hotel!!
Summary: I was looking for a much needed getaway in southern California on a very tight budget.  To save money, I also wanted to find a place with a kitchen.  I had a friend down there look at the only places I could find online that provided a kitchen on what I could afford, and he called me after looking at them both and told me that one was dismal, cookie-cutter, in a depressing area... but that the other one was a real gem.  It sure was.  My jaw dropped when I got there -- the whole place - but especially the room - was even better than the photos led me to hope for.  What a radically different experience than the ordinary, same-ol' hotel/motel rooms you invariably find in the "budget" or even "midprice" categories.  Uniquely decorated, in vibrant, earthy colors in a New

For anyone considering a trip to Anaheim, the choice is simple. If you can book this hotel...DO IT !  Great location. Friendly/helpful staff. Clean LARGE room with full kitchen/full sized refrigerator and balcony/patio. Clean/quite and safe pool. Great breakfast. The staff was very helpful with sugestions/directions and even kept our dinner leftovers in their refrigerator after we checked out and visited Disneyland the next day. Plenty of safe/free parking and an excellant restaurant. They even have an internet connected computer in the lobby for guests free use.

The Hotel Pepper Tree a lovely place to stay in Anaheim.  The staff is friendly and personable, the rooms clean and uniquely furnished, and the atmosphere cozy and fun.  One of those rare gems that is perfect for a brief weekend getaway for a couple for a week with the family.  We will stay at the Pepper Tree on our next visit....without question.

The decor in this hotel is refreshingly different and rooms are spacious and attractive. The kitchen was ideal for us and there was a samll but nice eating area with comfortable chairs as well as a balcony. The swimming pool is also attractive. It is an ideal hotel to stay for a few days and use as a base and we stayed an extra night here so we could relax by the pool inbetween trips out. Only 10 minutes to Disneyland. The people at the desk were also very helpful and there is a launderette within walking distance of the hotel! It was our favourite hotel of our two week stay in the States.

Very poor experience. Had been impressed by the reviews I had seen online, and booked this hotel over ones closer to Disneyland. I wouldn't do it again. The first room we entered reeked of smoke, and was pretty dingy. It did not at all look like the pictures on their website. I have never refused to stay in a hotel room in my life, so we were trying to make the best of it and settle in. However, when we pulled back the bedspread, the blanket was filthy! Multiple white crusty stains. I don't even want to even think about what that was. I couldn't stay in that bed, so we went back to the front desk. They said they were surprised, that that was one of their "new rooms." The manager said he would go look. He was gone for about 20 minutes, and then came back and said he had another

From the time I checked in to the time I left, i had a great stay. I loved how close it was to everything. The staff was the BEST. I was there for 2 months working from my room, and could not say one bad thing about the place. If i ever come back to Anaheim I will make it a point to stay there again. Thanks Hotel Pepper Tree.....

The best part and the saving grace of this hotel is the staff.  Everyone was super friendly and helpful.  From making the reservation to checking out, customer service was top notch.  My main complaint of this hotel was that our room was dirty.  Not bugs in the bed kind of dirty, but more like cobwebs around the night stand and a layer of dust and funk on top of the fridge kind of dirty.   Also, my kids feet were absolutely filthy after walking around the room barefoot or with socks.  We actually had to clean their feet to put on their sandals.   When I see stuff like this at hotels, it makes me wonder what other corners are being cut.  And for the most part I'm not a neat freak, but I certainly like hotel rooms that I stay in to be clean.    When we were outside walking to our

We stayed here for a few nights while we visited LA/Anaheim.  It was great!  We had a kitchenette which we enjoyed and the pool was nice.  The room was quiet and clean, the staff was super friendly and helpful.  The location was decent.  It was reasonably quick to get to the Honda Centre (Ducks playoff game!), Disneyland, Universal Studios and the beach.  There was a grocery store across the street along with a laundry mat (but don't go there alone).  Great value and great stay!

Summary Heading: Good value, clean, nice to have your own kitchen too
Summary: Just got back from a 9 night stay at the Hotel Pepper Tree. We chose this hotel as the rooms have small kitchens in them - by the looks of things this was previously an apartment block.  The decor is unique, which I loved......quirky and different. The maids clean your room on alternate days and will not change the towels unless they are on the floor which I think is a brilliant idea and very eco friendly. There is a free PC in the lobby which we used frequently as we had slow connection on the wireless internet (but that may have been our Notebook as it had been playing up since Las Vegas).  The staff were extremely friendly, both reception and maid service. We had breakfast pretty much every morning in the adjacent Mexican restaurant and it was fairly good value.  The location

We just got back after a 4 day stay. This was the perfect location for our plans. Angels Stadium, Knott's Berry, and the beaches are all very close. We were so busy we didn't stay in our room much but when we did we very much enjoyed everything the room had to offer. We definately were able to save some $ on having our own food. The room has a nice little kitchen. You almost get the feel that you are in your own apartment only with someone else cleaning your mess!

Summary Heading: Wish we had stayed there our whole trip-still talk about it!
Summary: It was hard to find, because it was behind a Mexican resturant, but that just meant that at night, it was quiet, because it was away from the street.  Plenty of free parking.  The front of the building has class, a koi pond, plants, and lights.  Very pretty at night.  Walk in, and there is a computer in the lobby for public use, for free.  We had a general room for 4 nights, about 70 a night.  The room was huge, and had a full fridge, and all cooking/cleaning/eating supplies we would need, except for food.  The bed was nice, and everything was clean.  The location is quiet, acouple miles from the tourist area, close enough to go, but far enough to be cheaper.  The free breakfast is served in the Mexican restuarant, and they also have hotel guest rates for dining.  The breakfast

Summary Heading: You'll love this hotel if you don't mind...
Summary: Stay at The Pepper Tree hotel if you don't mind...   1. A strong musty smell. (The room doesn't just look old, it smells old and unpleasant too.) 2. Tons of dust mites that literally bite you and keep you awake all night. 3. Over 20 year old tube TV. (For your information, a brand new 40" 1080P LCD HDTV retails for under $500 at Costco, so is The Pepper Tree owner cheap? You be the judge.) 4. Truly dated and ugly funiture. 5. Maids who hate their job. (When we checked in, the coffee table and headboards were very dusty and not cleaned. Maids often don't replace toilet paper and boxed tissue paper, you will have to inform the front desk.) 6. Unhelpful and unfriendly front desk staff, Manny. 7. Old and very noisy refrigerator, even noisier AC. Worse of all, a horribly loud exhaust
Manager Response: I am sorry that our hotel was not a good fit for your expectations. FYI The 27" Tvs were all purchased new in 2005. Could you please email me direct at mark@hotelaaa.com as we are having trouble identifying your stay with us.

Summary: Beautiful room with balcony over the pool, with furnished kitchen, plenty of room with teenage girl! Did Disneyland, beach, Hollywood, with easy access to fwy, bus lines, and shopping. We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: This was so better than expected
Summary: We found hotel pepper tree from reviews on trip advisor, and thought it might be a gamble because you just never know but we were SO GLAD we did call. From the first call we made to get reservations until the moment we left, it was a great experience. They have a an excellent deal on a wonderful room. The room had everything a traveler needs to make them feel pretty much right at home. A kitchenette that was very clean, a comfortable bed with very cleaning bedding, to a spacious bathroom. We even had a private patio with a running water fountain, that we left our slider open so we could fall to sleep to the sound of it.  It's a mere 10 minute drive to disneyland. One of the great things is you don't even have to pay for parking, which nearly every hotel makes you pay for.  If

I have stayed here twice before because it's good value for Anaheim. The check-in experience was good and I had a King suite for two nights and cooked some meals in the room (there's a Ralphs supermarket across the street). There are also lots of eating choices nearby. This hotel has a boutique atmosphere to it.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel... Good for a longer stay... NOT for one night.. Need to utilize the accomatations to appreciate the VALUE
Summary: Clean bath tubs... DO NOT LIKE MOLD.... Did not care for the "wood" smell in the room. Not a good choice for a "ONE NIGHT STAY"  Would LOVE it if I was staying a FEW nights.  :-) Would have stayed across the street from Disneyland for $55.00. If I had seen it first...  Was not a "BAD" hotel... but  the PICTURES and the discussion I had with the nice woman on the phone led me to believe the hotel was MUCH more ... Shall I say, "posh" then it was.    I would recommend this to friends who were staying for a few days... I could have saved $12.00  for Sat. & Sun. if I satyed at a $55.00 hotel across the strett. ALSO... the continenental breakfast was o.k. Nothing spectacular...
Bottom line is. Next time I rather pay $20 more a night minus the noise, smell and faded sheets.  Pets allowed? Not sure But from the smell I'll say YES!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am sorry that you were dissapointed. Please email me direct with your name and the room number in which you stayed as I cannot identify your stay. We replace linen on a reguI ar basis and pride ouselves on cleanliness.I would like to take a look at the room in which you stayed.

Summary: The service was superb. The rooms are amazing and quiet, not to mention very comfortable. I like the location too, because your not to far from anything. The amenities are a nice touch to the room. I love the relaxing, soothing, worry free atmosphere the hotel has.

Summary Heading: great time at hotel peper tree
Summary: great location if going to disneyland or huntington beach.  service at front desk was great.  Loved having full kitchen but it took one hour to cook frozen pizza in oven, appliances might need updating.  overall experience was wonderful.  would absolutely stay again.  price was great

Summary Heading: perfect room for a larger family
Summary: great room for a larger family.  We have stayed here 3x in the last yr and will continue to say at this hotel when we go to Disneyland

Summary Heading: Considering the cost, it was great value!!! : )
Summary: Let me begin by saying that when I found The Pepper Tree Hotel online, I was really looking for a small, more personalized hotel chain, something cozy with a unique  appeal and with great value, for a 3 night stay.  On the other hand, my fiance was looking at the bigger, more well known and luxurious hotel chains that offered a special rate at that time.  After we narrowed down our options to two, my choice won, my fiance was "reluctantly" convinced by the hotel's website, which was successful in giving it a very charming and appealing look, specially the picture of the executive suite on the ground floor.    Booking over the phone, Manny, was polite and friendly, gave the hotel staff in general a wonderful first impression, he promised to take note of our request for a quiet

My family and I were very impressed with Hotel Peppertree. We went to Disneyland and was not aware of the birthday promotion at Disney where you get in free on your birthday until we arrived. We had already purchased two day tickets but the manager gave us a refund  for one day because of my wifes birthday after I inquired about it. The rooms were spacious, clean,and quiet. We spent three nights there--the beds were excellent.

Staying there was a wonderful experience and I will definitely be making it my regular place to stay when I am up in Anaheim/Buena Park.  After spending the day visiting the Getty Villa and enjoying their fountains and garden the patio and fountain off the room made us feel like we were still at the Villa

Summary Heading: So much nicer than you'd think!
Summary: Clean, super comfy and plenty of room to spread out in. This hotel is off the Disney path, and that is just what we wanted. There's a huge Ralph's right across the street so you can stock your little kitchenette with everything you need. Unlike many kitchenette suites, this place thoughtfully supplies you with dish soap, sponges, paper towels, nice bath amenities, and a really fun little gift package.  Hotel staff is very friendly, check in quick and easy, and there's always someone there to help you if you need it.   The pool is sparkling clean and open til 10 PM. There's plenty of tables and chairs, even a gas grill that is free to use for any guest. Eat at poolside, or take it to your room and eat outside on your private deck or patio....every room has one.   This is not a 5

Summary Heading: Nice and relaxing spanish style hotel
Summary: This was the first time to the Pepper Tree.  The staff was very helpful and nice.  Manny at the front desk brought up a DVD player which was nice for my son.  Our room has  frig, stove, oven and microwave.  It was a great, roomy place which a spanish style decor.  The only two things that were not so great....no hot tub and if you are facing the busy street it is noisy with cars and the Karoke signers LATE into the night at the mexican restaurant.  I am a light sleeper and I woke up many times to the music and singing.  Next time I would request a room on the back side of the hotel.  As far as location, it was very easy to get to and fro from Disneyland.

Summary Heading: A great Choice of Hotel When You are On The Theme Park Circuit
Summary: If you are after a five star, silver service Hyatt type hotel, then this property will not suit you - however if you are looking for a middle of the road good value hotel, with clean rooms, friendly service and a good location for DIsneyland, then I would recommend the Peppertree to you.  We stayed for 7 nights in April 2009 (2AD,2CH).  We found the hotel very convenient for our purposes.  The Mexican restaurant on the property serves a complimentary light breakfast, the pool is good, the rooms are clean and it is within a 10 minute drive to Disneyland. Shops including a large supermarket are directly across the road.  The hotel is showing its age a bit, despite some refits of the rooms (which is why I have only marked the rooms at 3 stars).  Some major refittings of bathrooms,

Summary Heading: Plan to be returning to this oasis...
Summary: From the minute we checked in, to the time we left the hotel, we had a great stay.  It was nice to have a place that is centrally located to the theme parks, attractions, etc. Having been familiar with the area, I would say that this is an excellent location. We stayed here twice during our recent trip. The first stay had us on the front side, facing the pool and Lincoln Avenue. There is some road noise, but nothing unusual, and the balconies get good sun. The second room that we had was on the back side, which faces a residential area. The sun was not quite as good on the back, but it was quiet and peaceful. Both rooms looked over a portion of the parking lot, which means you can see your car if you are concerned about that. Definitely liked the "Old Mexico" feel to the hotel.

Summary Heading: We came from Canada for Disneyland, and at the end of our busy days we very much enjoyed your hotel!
Summary: The Peppertree Hotel, with its charming south-western decor,  was clean and comfortable with all the amenities close by.  The staff were courteous and helpful, the pool was sparkling, and coffee on the flowered balcony in the morning was delightful.   When we got home our kids didn't say they missed Disneyland, but they did say they missed the Peppertree.

We (2ad, 2 ch) had here a three nights stay during our california trip and Disney visit. The hotel was very comfortable – WiFi working in my wm6 mobile, full equipped kitchen, hairdryer given upon request, big room, private balcony, interior corridors, nice decoration, clean (also the floor tiles). We had a 2QueenBeds room on 3d floor. Parking is not a problem and you can view the car by the room. The main street (Lincoln ave) has a lot of markets (fast foods, super markets, laundries, garages, …) and just behind the hotel there are some residential blocks. During our stay we felt very safe in contrast to other reviews. Complimentary breakfast is not bad, but we used it only once since we preferred the convenience of our kitchen. It’s a very good hotel in a very good price.
you get great service for the affordable cost. Staffs are friendly and attend to your need in a timely fashion.  It is conveniently located with supermarket and restaurant in walking distance.

Summary Heading: Relaxing, home, clean, helpful staff, and a safe place to stay.
Summary: The staff was always very helpful. Everyday we were given maps to our destinations which made it much easier to get there. everyone is friendly and always has a smile on. The rooms were very clean and I had a great view from my balcony.  The location is great!  It is in the middle of all my destinations.  Thank you Pepper Tree!

Summary Heading: Decent Family Hotel great for LA holiday
Summary: We stayed here for five nights, the rooms were a good size with a kitchen.  The location was great, 10 mins from Disneyland and easy to get to from the airport in a rental car using the freeway.  The receprion staff were excellent in assisting us with organising outings and were helpful and attentive to all our queries.  The rooms are tidy, but not that new.  The cleaning of the rooms daily was not that thorough, our beds were made and rubbish cleared, and towels changed, but would have like the shower and toilet to be cleaned daily. \Also convinient was the free use of the lobby computer and internet, even theough the speed was a little slow! Overall a pleasant stay and value for money.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a Disney vaca on a budget
Summary: This was our first time staying at this hotel. We booked through Orbitz and the price was very reasonable. The building is an older building but nice. It has a Spanish sort of decor and Very large room. We had a King bed with a sofa sleeper and a kitchenette. There was a big closet and the bathroom is ok...not huge but fine. We really weren't in our room much any way because we were at Disneyland...lol. The staff was supper helpful and nice. The heated pool was a definete bonus. :-)

Summary Heading: Nice place for price, good location for attractions!
Summary: I thought the price was great for this cute hotel.  I loved the fact that it had the kitchenette with a full size fridge!  Also, the restaurant associated with the hotel was good with great deals for being a hotel guest.
We enjoyed our stay very much. Walking distance to our tournament venue. But could use Washer and Dryer facilities and vending machines.

Summary Heading: Wonderful experience - those beds are to die for!!
Summary: We arrived in LAX from Australia after 16 hours of travel with our 2 teenage daughters, only to spend a further 3 hours with a customs officer before we picked up our hire car and braved the LA freeways to drive to Anahiem. By the time we got to the hotel, our patience was frayed and sense of humour short. The staff who greeted us were wonderful, very organised and it took next to no time to get into our room. Our first impression was how much larger the room was than we expected and then we tried the beds - wow!!  After travelling from Australia that day, a comfortable bed and pillows were sooooo welcome!  Over the next 6 days, our room became home. The kitchen facilities were great and there is a grocery store right across the road which was very handy. We had a problem with

A few weeks before our scheduled vacation, I decided to check out the web browser for the Pepper tree Hotel.  They were offering a managers special.  We took advantage of that and saved $300.00 that we would have spent at an economy hotel.  Took advantage of the full kitchenette in our suite...  Highly recommend to those with a family looking to save a few dollars...

This hotel is a boutique hotel designed in a Mexican motif.  It was clean, the price was right, and the accommodations were good.  The tile floor is a little bit awkward as when going from tile to carpet, there's about a half inch drop off.  In the middle of the night, you could be thrown off balance.  The balcony was nice; however, the sliding glass door did not lock and the pin they have provided to secure to door could have been shaken out by an intruder.  The sliding glass doors need replacement as significant road-noise can be heard from the road.  We stayed in a one bedroom apartment.  The comfort of the beds was OK.  The apartment contained one king-size bed, one twin, and one full-size futon.  There were two bathrooms and a kitchen.  There is no vending machines located

Summary Heading: Best stay for a Family - Price Unbeatable
Summary: What it is: This place has charm.  It has a style and theme that you will not find anywhere else.  The room sizes are grand and the kitchens are invaluable if you have kids.  The location is perfect for Disney and Knotts as well as any other attractions in the LA area.  The building is a converted and updated appartment complex which is why the rooms are large sized.  What Its Not: The Pepper Tree is not a Marriot or Double Tree which is not a bad thing.  If you are looking for a hotel that has the same decor and flavor as the next hotel then this is not your place.  This is a great place for families.  The Fitness Center is very basic with a couple of aerobic machines.

Summary Heading: The Pepper Tree goes that extra mile!
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at the Pepper Tree so much. The decor and ambiance was wonderful. We loved the highly polished floors; our own little kitchen with everything we needed to make great food just like at home; the beautifully decorated hallways; the lush tropical plantings and the soothing sound of the water fountains; having morning tea on the patio with the bougainvillea growing up the black wrought iron railings; and the friendly, helpful staff. The beds were so comfortable that I had to buy a new one when I got home to get the same degree of comfort I had at the Pepper Tree! We will very definitely go again.

Summary Heading: We are telling our friends & we will be back!
Summary: After staying at numerous not-so-quality and/or expensive places on our trip, it was a delight to be here.  The staff did everything they could to make our stay pleasant and even shipped home forgotten items for the cost of UPS only.  The pool was wonderful.  The theme, flavor and ambiance was very comforting.  The balcony patio with blooming bougavilla (?) was a great place for my grandson to play.  Some people may expect more as far as space and amenities, but we were only there half time and we had all that we needed.  Loved the little full kitchen that was nicely supplied.  Full size frig! Yes!  Free parking.  Elevator made it easy to get luggage to our 2nd floor room.  Good complimentary breakfast in the nice restaurant across the way.  Easy to get to Ontario Airport,

We stayed here for 4 nights and used the hotel as a base for our trips back and forth to Disney and Universal Studios. Hotel is 10mins drive to Disney, so VERY convenient yet quiet and peaceful after " full on" days at Disney. We booked the 1 bed apartment  for us and our 5 year old daughter, it was more than adequate in size for us three. We had 2 bathrooms a kitchenette table and chairs and 2 balconies, which unfortunately we did not use, only because the weather was too cold (same with the pool). The room was so well cleaned throughout our stay with an abudance of fresh towels, so a BIG THANK YOU to house keeping. The front desk staff were helpful too, I think it was Rick who advised us on the best place to buy a Sat Nav TOM TOM from (he did a web search for us), which in our

Summary Heading: A place where I can sleep comfortably...
Summary: This was my second time here because I loved it the first time... It comes with a kitchen which really saved me a lot in regards to food. The beds are so comfortable that the minute I lay on it I fell asleep. The place is very clean and spacey which I love in every hotel. It's easy to find and it's in the same street where I visit family. Your stay includes light complimentary breakfast but you can order whatever you like at a restaurant in front of the hotel. My only wish that it would be less expensive to rent because I'm always coming for a visit in that area. Also, there are some people who hates their job and really show it... and so this is one of my pet peeves while I stayed there. I will come again because I really love this place.

What a great set up.  We have 2 boys, ages 11 & 8 and the 1 bedroom apt. suite was a great set-up.  The boys had their space & we had ours.  The facility had a full kitchen, so we were able to prepare meals as needed and store food for snacks & picnics at the beach.  The hotel was central to all of our destinations in the LA area.  I will stay here again.  It was a quaint hotel with great amenities & the boys thoroughly enjoyed the heated pool.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Impressed and will be visiting the Pepper Tree on our next LA trip!

Summary Heading: Best place to stay with an athletic team!
Summary: I just stayed at Hotel Pepper Tree for a girls' Volleyball team trip.  It was WONDERFUL!  The staff was helpful, friendly, and made the stay terrific.  The rooms were clean and the full kitchen allowed us to cook for the volleyball team which saved money -- so that we could spend it on a trip to the beach and to Downtown Disney.  The room price was exceptionally reasonable (especially for the Anaheim area) and with the breakfast included really helped us make the trip budget.  The Anaheim Convention Center and Disneyland were 15 minutes away and even the beach was only a 30 minute drive.  The girls on the team all voted to stay at Hotel Pepper Tree again next year!  They loved NOT staying at a chain.  THANKS for contributing to their best trip ever.

Summary Heading: Best Family hotel we've ever been to...
Summary: We went to California knowing the area having previously lived in OC.  We chose this hotel for the advertised large rooms and kitchenettes.  We were really pleased with our choice!  We had a suite.  Our teenage daughter slept in one room while we had another.  The kitchenette was very convenient and saved us lots of money in eating out.  Also one $5 fee for internet for the whole time we were there!  The adjacent restaurant had good mexican food and a nice continental breakfast and the staff was really friendly.  The cleaning staff was very thorough.  We were able to use the barbeque by the pool which was nice.  We will definitely stay there again when we head west!  Only a couple of minutes from Knott's Berry Farm which is much less expensive and way shorter line ups for rides

My gf and I stayed here for 4 nights, the first night in one of the Executive king rooms on fhe first floor. Pros: huge room, kitchen, clean bathroom. Cons: king bed could have used a turnover, carpet was dirty as it left the sole of my feet black, thin walls-we could hear all the racket from the second floor the next morning.  The rest of the time we were on the third floor. The room had two queen beds. Pros: Again, huge room, kitcken, clean bathroom. Cons: both sink and bathtub drains were clogged. Maintenance manage to clear up the bathtub drain, but the sink was still clogged when we left. And the carpet could definitely use a cleaning.  Overall, it was a good stay. We learned to wear sandals in the room due to the dirty carpet, but overall for the price, it was a good place
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. We have met with housekeeping and maintenance and have certainly made your issues a priority. It is during these busy months that we need to take extra care with our procedures.

Summary Heading: Noisiest Hotel Ever, Carpet Turns Your Feet Black
Summary: We stayed at the hotel Pepper Tree for one night recently, as this was all we could stand of it. The lobby is quaint and the girl at the front desk is wonderful. The hallways are decorated like a fancy boutique hotel...........then there are the rooms. Our room was on the third floor overlooking the pool. We unpacked and got ready to retire for the night. I have a normal habit of checking the mattress, sheets, and so forth before I slip into them for the night. I found dust behind the beds (obvious proof that they are rarely moved for cleaning). I also found a live red ant under the sheets. The rest of the room appeared to be bug free, but even one bug is one too many for me. The carpet is also filthy. Not just dirty, but filthy. So filthy in fact that our feet and shoes stuck
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I am disappointed that our hotel did not live up to your expectations. As you mentioned your family members stayed for 8 nights and do plan on returning. Generally speaking our feedback is more positive but   I will certainly address your concerns with housekeeping.  I too have stayed in some great hotels where guests in adjoining rooms have been an annoyance: we do monitor these situations but are not immune to the occurrences.

Summary: We were originally booked at Lemon Tree but because they were overbooked, were asked to move over to Pepper Tree.  I said sure, no problem and am so glad we did!  Wow, what a wonderful find.  My boyfriend does a lot of travel and stays a lot of places and said it was probably the nicest room he's ever stayed in.  So much character and charm!   From the moment you walk through the doors, you know you're not in some boring chain hotel.  The front desk staff are wonderful and just walking down the hall to the room brings you to a new world.  Lovely architecture and decor abound.  I stopped several times as I was walking down the hall to check what was on the tables.  It was almost a mini museum stop.    Then walking through the door to my room - WOW!  So quaint.  We were in an

Summary Heading: Okay place to stay if on a budget
Summary: Our family of four stayed here two nights while on a short Disneyland trip. The hotel feels as if it was actually an old apartment complex they "flipped" into a hotel (and maybe it was.) The rooms are good sized for two adults and two small children, however the in-room appliances and fixtures appear to be from the 70's.   The good: A short 5 to 10 minute drive to Disneyland; too far to walk. Grocery store across the street and restaurant in the same parking lot as the hotel. Very helpful staff.  Free parking. Beds were comfortable and linens were clean. The morning breakfast buffet at the Mexican restaurant across the parking lot was decent. Budget price for those trying to save money.  The bad: Not the cleanest. The rooms have tiled entryways, kitchen areas and bathroom floors

Spent a week at the Pepper Tree with a friend for business meetings in the So Cal area.  This was our first trip to CA and despite being there to work, we had a great time!  The hotel made it easy to at least pretend we were on vacation.  Booked online with a great rate.  The staff was friendly & helpful from check-in to check-out.  Even gave us each a coupon for a free glass of wine at the restaurant.  The room was clean and spacious.  Loved the small kitchen & balcony.  Great free samples in the bathroom!  We had a beautiful view over the pool and of the sunset at night.  Downtown Disney is not far at all and free parking for up to three hours (which was plenty of time for us to realize it was a little pricey to eat & shop there).  Walked to Ralph's across the street for

We recently spent 11 nights at Hotel Pepper Tree. We booked online directly through the hotel. We were very happy with the rates. Our online customer service was great & this was continued through our stay. On arrival our room was ready even though we were a bit early. We had a ground floor room with a courtyard & fountain. The room was lovely & clean.  The room had a full size refridgerator, oven, microwave & all the other bits & pieces you need to make a stay comfortable. Some people mentioned no alarm clock or hairdryer in the room but we generally travel with these things anyway. Also, anything we needed the front desk were either happy to provide or let us know where we could find it. The best thing about this hotel is it's great location to the Disneyland theme park. It's

Summary Heading: Best Value in Anaheim for families
Summary: we had two rooms, one for us (w/ 2 young kids), one for our in-laws.  I love the decor. and the kitchen in each room.  The location is excellent for Disney and surroundings. I don't think the neighborhood is in a bad area like some other viewers had suggested.  It's definitely not the glory neighborhood like next to Disney but we felt safe walking to the grocery store across from the hotel in the evening.  One of our room is facing the main street and was noisy at night with some crazy motorcyclists, the other room is facing the back so it's much quieter. I wish the glass door to the balcony has better sound insulation.  And if you have young kids (<2yrs old) DO NOT let them stay at the balcony by themselves, the fence bars have very wide gap, if they can stick their head out,

My wife and I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights while visitng with family.  The best feature was the price and location.  We paid  $125 per night including all taxes.  The room was worn, but clean.  The is about the best one can say of the whole hotel.  Our room was spacious and the kitchen is definitely a plus.  Two hugh detractions were the quality of the continental breakfast and internet service.  The breakfast was of extremely poor quality - bitter coffee, sweetened water for juice, cheap bread, and fruit you would never select if you had a choice. Thankfully, we had our own in-room kitchen. The wireless internet service was extremely slow and often did not work at all.  We would not stay at the hotel again.

Summary Heading: A great value with personal service for a fun family visit
Summary: I spent a long weekend at the Pepper Tree with my sister and 2 kids (3 and 1).  The rooms are spacious and fully equipped for a family with a kitchen.  The kids loved having room to run and play in the room.  It was great to have a kitchen for a few meals during our visit.  The place has a mom and pop feel with some cool design elements throughout the hotel.  The neighborhood felt a little dodgy.

The best kept secret, my family and I went to Disney and stayed here. The place was easy to find, when we were there there was a room that was making a lot of noise and they made it a point to correct the issue right away. Staff very friendly. I really recomend this hotel if you go to Disney, its away from the crowds. We went to the continental breakfast at the restaurant downstairs and I guess it ends at 10:00am we got there at 10:45 and they made it a point to bring some stuff out even though they had put everything away already. Great place!

We loved our stay here. The location was great, near everything we needed but still quiet and comfortable.  The staff was very welcoming and made sure our needs were taken care of.  It was more like staying at the home of a friend than a hotel - clean and comfortable, with charming decor and well equipped kitchenette.  A terrific value, too.  Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Anaheim area.

The first thing you will notice is the incredible front desk staff. Brittany (hope I spelled her name correctly) was a stand out! She made herself available to answer any question or help us with any request ,she sets an incredible standard  in excellent customer care.  Our one bedroom apartment was  spacious and well equipped.  It was very comfortable and was perfect for our trip.  From other reviews I was concerned about the neighborhood but was pleasantly suprised that it was a pretty normal mixed residental/commercial neighborhood.
