Very convenient to Disneyland as well as the beach.  We will definetly be back!

My boyfriend and I are Disneyland nuts; even though we live up in San Francisco we are annual passholders and come down a few times a year to meet local friends in the park.  We used to stay at motels across the street from Disneyland, but they are really not that great and very expensive.  Once we discovered the Pepper Tree, there was no turning back--just 2 exits up the freeway, nice people, and OMG beautiful, especially for the price!  I'm a sucker for a pretty hotel and I have never, I mean never, in my life been in such a nice place for so little money.  The rooms are cushy and spacious, with nice little kitchenettes that are so convenient.  The only downside we experienced was that we didn't think much of the restaurant, especially the free breakfast.  But hey, we prefer

Summary Heading: OK but service could have been better
Summary: We stayed at the Hotel Pepper Tree for a week in October.  We had a late flight, so we arrived at the hotel around 10:30 p.m.  This was not a problem, but there is no one at the front desk past midnight. Our group consisted of my husband and myself, my daughter and her husband and our two grandchildren.  We had a two room suite, with two bathrooms, a kitchenette, a queen size bed in one room, a futon for two and twin day bed in the other.  The size of the suite was fine, and it came equipped with kitchen utensils and dishes.  The rooms were comfortable and colorfully decorated, but needed updating.  The lobby and pool area is attractive.  We had a patio off of each room, but there wasn't much of a view as they overlooked the parking lot.  There was little or no housekeeping

The room was nice and spacious, the kitchen saved us quite a bit on eating out. Service was fantastic!  Complaints: Fitness facility consisted of a very outdated treadmill, a broken bike and an eliptical (not sure if working) and NOT a single weight. My advice is to upgrade this room or else turn it into a laundry room. In no way could this be called a 'fitness facility' Laundry facilities across the street... we went during the day and there were drug dealers and guys drinking out of liquor bottles hanging out front. Went back at night and only stayed because there were quite a few people inside which made us feel a bit safer. Longest 1.5hrs of our lives. Peppertree is NOT 6 blocks from Disneyland. A 10 minute drive to parkade, however to get into the gates you have to go all

Summary Heading: Found it comfortable and reasonably priced
Summary: We stayed here on our honeymoon, which consisted of five nights (three days at Disneyland and two days poking around So Cal.).  We arrived late, but where relieved that a helpful person was at the desk to assist us.  The room was clean and comfortable.  Bring slippers as the tile floor is a bit cold on bare feet.  The kitchen was clean and had service for two.  The grocery store and ATM across the street was handy.  It only took about 10 minutes to drive to Disneyland.  We thought the bed and pillows were very comfortable.  Everything worked:  coffee maker (bring a few filters if you bring your own coffee to brew), iron, fridge, freezer, etc.  The big balcony was nice to sit out on.  We had no problems with the housekeeping; Towels were provided, bed was made, dishes washed, and

Summary Heading: Wonderful Hotel to stay, more like a home
Summary: This hotel is awesome. Very clean and neat. A perfect place to stay if planning for a vacation to disney. It is just 2 miles away from Disney and commute is very short.

My husband and I stayed at the Pepper Tree for 6 nights. From the moment we walked in, the staff were helpful, friendly and accommodating. Manny was excellent at making us feel comfortable and gave us excellent suggestions on the surrounding areas. (as well as complimentary wine at the restaurant :))  Our room was clean and huge! Although room service was a bit inconsistent with the daily cleaning; sometimes didn't wash the dishes, sometimes didn't clean a couple of counters. The air conditioner was a bit loud at times, but other than that the room was fantastic.  We are confident in suggesting Pepper Tree to families or young couples.Great stay!

Summary Heading: The Pepper Tree is my new favorite!!
Summary: We were joyously surprised with this hotel....It was beautiful.... gorgeous landscaping and architecture. The rooms were bright and spacious and the kitchens come complete with everything except the food and for that, there's Ralphs, which is right across the street....       Sarah and Leah were both the best front desk clerks we have ever encountered. We had a couple of issues, affecting our check in and Sarah was there with us, the whole time...being supportive and trying to help us figure it out!! Leah helped us with a completely different issue and was kind and considerate and very helpful. I cannot say enough good things about these two young ladies. They even offered to help me carry the bags up from the car to the room..Now that's what I call service...It was above and

Summary Heading: Cant beat the location and good value
Summary: This is a very cheap hotel by world standards - like many of the options in Anaheim. So as far as value goes it very good. Room was sizable with kitchen facilities and only 10 minutes drive from Disneyland. Plus across road from Supermarket and laundry. Beds were comfy too. Good simple breakfast in onsite restaurant. (not cooked)  Only downside is some noise from the road (Locals yelling out at 1am) and noisy air con that needed to stay on all night.

Summary Heading: loved it and will recommend to everyone
Summary: we got treated better here then the 5 star we stayed at previously the staff were unbelievably helpful kind considerate and accommodating they made our family feel right at home.  When we go back to anaheim we will for sure stay here again and we have already started recommending it to everyone we know.  Thank you to all that helped make our family vacation the best EVER

We are backpackers on our first stop in the States. This wasnt a backpackers joint and wasnt good for meeting people, but it was perfect for us to stay and go to Disneyland.  We arrived early, and they found a room which was ready for us to move in as we were both heavily jetlagged from our flight to Australia.  The room was heaven - clean and spacious. The staff where so friendly and went out of their way to help us always giving us good advice on what buses to take etc.  We had problems getting back to LA to get the Greyhound - and the receptionist waited over an hour on hold to get through to the Greyhound office.  We really didnt want to leave - this was the luxary we needed on our first days away!  I cant recommend it highly enough.

I am always nervous about staying in new hotels, but I was very pleased with this one.  The staff was friendly and it was quiet and relaxing.  The room was clean and very spacious.  I would stay again without hesitation.  : )  JGRMS Wilkerson

We are annual pass holders for Disneyland and our family has been traveling to Anaheim from Portland, OR 4 or 5 times a year for the past 4 years. You could say that we are seasoned Disneyland travelers. Our 10 and 8 year old children have seen to good the bad and the ugly hotels that surround the Disneyland resort.  Last year I read several glowing reviews from Tripadvisor for the Hotel Pepper Tree. We took a giant leap of faith and booked 5 nights at the Pepper Tree.  Our family will never stay at another property again.   First and for most, the staff. The front desk staff has and continued to go above and beyond what would be expected. Helpful, professional and always personable and accommodating. Special  kudos to Many. He has proven to be a constant wealth of information

This was our second stay at the Pepper Tree - both times we stayed about 3 weeks, and both times we stayed in room 306! The hotel is in an awesome location -- close to theme parks such as Disneyland/California Adventure, Knott's Berry Farm, and Soak City. There is a Ralph's grocery store right across the street along with a laundromat -- very convenient.  There are also some fast food restaurants like KFC nearby. I do not have any complaints about rowdiness from the hotel's restaurant late at night during our 3 weeks stay... actually, we didn't even notice the traffic noise that others have complained about (and our room faced Lincoln Avenue and the hotel/restaurant's parking lot.) Our room had an excellent view of the pool and it is awesome to have a place to sit outside on the

We found this hotel online (www.hotel-peppertree.com) and booked it at $82 a night including taxes (manager's special).  Pretty good price for a week-long stay.  This place is meant for families with young kids and teenagers.  The complimentary breakfast includes cereal, toast, milk, juice, coffee, fruits and donuts.  You can't bring food out.  Everything must be eaten in but some people did pack some snacks to go.  This is helpful especially with a one year old and out the whole day.  Front desk were very nice people but they're not there 24 hours.  The front desk is closed from midnight until 7a or 8a.  The room we asked for is a King Studio.  It's spacious enough for our walking one year old.  But the kitchen, walking closet and the bathroom are tiled.  This is slippery when

This hotel was rated as one of the top 5 hotels in Anaheim by some rating services( and 4 stars). My wife and I strongly disagree with the high rating for this hotel.  The hotel is no where near the Disney complex and is located in an iffy neighborhood. It is surely not a 4 star neighborhood. The hotel has a spanish theme and is a clean hotel. We stayed in a  king bed suite with a small kitchen, small bathroom and small sofa (no pull out). The bathroom was not very modern and the bed had on old and uncomfortable mattress.  The hotel required that I pick up a hair dryer and an alarm clock from the desk. The front desk does not answer their phones from midnight to 6 am. There is no room service available but they do offer a very basic continental breakfast across the parking lot

Summary Heading: Nice hotel. Beatiful rooms. Close to DIsneyland
Summary: We were 4 nights at Pepper Tree. Excellent experience. Wide and clean room. More a suite than a room with an excellent kitchen.  6 km far away from Disneylands.  Small but nice pool.  Close to a Target market.  If  I should plan to go back in that area, I'll choose it again.

We stayed at the Pepper Tree two nights (Friday and Saturday). For the price this was an excellent hotel. We stayed at a Best Western on Thursday night for 20.00 more and it was a much worse hotel. The Pepper Tree is an older hotel, so you will have to expect all the same problems hotels 20 years ago had. The floors and walls are not well insulated so you here people above and outside, the air conditioner worked, but it was an old wall mounted style that was noisier than new ones. The decor of the rooms is Mexican style, but the carpeting and bathroom are definately showing there age. Overall I would say this is a great hotel for the price and I would definately stay here again.

Stayed 6 nights and the toilet backed up 3 mornings-the whole toilet suite moved -the shower was put together with a childs building kit and the floor was so dirty that your wet feet left black marks on the bath mat we had to wash all utensills in kitchen before we could use them
Manager Response: We are unable to locate your reservation at the hotel or any similar comments made to the front desk.  Please contact manager@peppertree.biz to further discuss this situation.

Summary: The hotel was no more than adequate for the price.  I stayed with my family for three nights and used it as a base for visits to theme parks.  It was well located for Disneyland.  The neighbourhood was a bit down at heel, although the supermarket across the road was convenient.  The breakfast was 'continental'  and disappointing to say the least.  We experienced one major problem when the neighbouring restaurant (at which breakfast was served) hosted a very noisy Mexican cantina from midnight to 3am on a Monday night.  We could not get hold of anyone at the hotel to report the problem and had a sleepless night as a consequence.  The response from hotel management the next day was less than adequate.  Although the neighbouring restuarant was owned by the hotel, it was claimed
Manager Response: We do apologize for this isolated event at our neighboring restaurant.  We immediately spoke to the restaurant management to ensure that this would not happen again.  The issue has since been resolved.

Summary Heading: Not as great as the photos.
Summary: The pictures on the web site are very nice, but the rooms aren't that great.  If you looking for a place to sleep and not spend too much money on food this is the place.  The free breakfast in the morning was pretty sad, not many choices.  The rooms are pretty old and the surrounding neighborhood wasn't too great.  They do not have a place to do laundry, but there is across the street.  Also there is a grocery store right across the street.  The pool is pretty little and not a lot of room for people to be out in the sun.  The staff was nice and helpful.

We just finished our stay from July 12-July 17.  We were pleased with the size of the room, comfort of the beds, big fridge and utensils available in the kitchen, large closet space.  It is a 10 minute drive to Disneyland.  The breakfast was more than satisfactory with toast, cereal, fresh fruit, yogurt, juices and coffee/tea.  We also did our laundry opposite the hotel.  Even though we were there 5 nights, we never found time to cook, after coming back from the parks so late in the evening, but we did freeze our water bottles the night before and brought in our own soda for the parks.

Summary Heading: Good value with a short drive to Disneyland
Summary: Overall, a great experience. While not really close to Disneyland, it was only about a 10 minute drive max. Do make sure you get directions BACK TO the hotel - we managed to get lost around Disneyland. The room was very large, with a kitchenette and separate dressing/bath area. Nice little patio outside. Only complaint was some very loud people above us; I believe they may have been elephants given the sound they made moving around. The desk did call them after I complained and it got somewhat better. The price was right, the room was clean, and the staff helpful and friendly. The pool looked nice (we did not use it). I did not see a jacuzzi out there but that's a nit.

Summary Heading: Easy Drive to Disneyland - Good Value for the Money
Summary: A few miles down Lincoln then a right turn and a couple more miles and you are right in the Disneyland parking garage. We spent 2 nights at Hotel Pepper Tree--somewhat apprehensive due to some negative reviews, but for the money, it was better than I expected. Buffet continental breakfast is served at the Mexican restaurant across the parking lot and that was perfectly adequate except for the 2nd morning when it was packed and the lone waitress was having trouble keeping the coffee urns filled, etc. Pool looked clean and the rooms were clean if somewhat worn. The king bed sagged a bit in the middle but after a day chasing Mickey Mouse, I was too tired to be picky! Bathroom was very clean and nice amount of towels but shower head was low even for my 5'2" self and not as strong a

An Aussie winner – As Aussies ourselves we may be biased, but this Aussie owned hotel really comes thru. We just got back from 2 weeks in California. We were traveling with our 3 children ages 6 – 12 and normally found it difficult to get adequately sized rooms, but at hotel Pepper Tree we were really comfortable. The rooms are really big with sitting area and a big balcony where we could enjoy an evening drink and watch the kids in a very nice (heated) pool below. Supermarket over the road, big refrigerator and lots of robe area, AND A DRESSING ROOM off the bathroom. Really great. Don’t miss this one.  Elle H  Melbourne Australia
Great location.  Rooms are big and clean.  Nice - but small - pool area.  The pool temp was perfect!  Staff was very friendly, helpful, and available!

We stayed at the Hotel Peppertree for 2 weeks and loved it, the staff are exceptional no matter what you are looking for weather it be directions to local attractions, extra towels or even printing boarding passes(Thank you Becky, you were a delight todeal with) The hotel is very clean and close to Disneyland and Knott's. The free breakfast we had only once and that was enough for our liking but what do you expect for free. We will definatly be back to California and will stay at this hotel again without hesitation.
Manager Response: Thank you taking your time to write a review!  I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your two week stay with us in Anaheim.  We are currently reviewing the free continental breakfast at Azteca's restaurant and will continue to work with them to improve their daily breakfast service.  Again, thank you for your kind words, and we hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Guess my expectations were too high...
Summary: I booked a room for our two families based on reviews on Trip Advisor.  We had no car, which was a problem since the hotel is in the middle of nowhere and cabs were scarce.  The rooms were very large but I wasn't thrilled with comfort of beds.  One shower head didn't work and the other tub drain got clogged during our stay.   I found the hotel staff young and they acted a bit put out by questions.  I'm going to try another hotel if we go back to the Anaheim area.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I apologize that we did live up to your expectations.  We always do suggest renting a car because Hotel Pepper Tree is located 3 miles from Disneyland and 2 miles from Knott's Berry Farm.  I will look into the issues you experienced with maintenance and front desk immediately.

Summary: My second stay at this boutique hotel was incredibly disappointing. I loved it so much when I'd stayed here last year that I booked my room then and I told a dozen librarians about it, and they all booked stays.   Checkin wasn't until 2 pm, so when I showed up at 1:20 I was unable to get a room; I find it hard to believe all the rooms were occupied by 3 PM, when I returned.  I requested twice by email that our rooms be near one another. One friend told me that when HE checked in at 2, they'd noted there was a request. When I mentioned it when I checked the person at the desk told me the hotel was full. The VACANCY sign remained lit all weekend. To make matters worse, the room was half the size of the one I'd had last year, and the bed was harder.  There was no desk or couch.

We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Pepper Tree and greatly enjoyed our time there. The room was a good size with bed, living area, Kitchen and bathroom. We paid a little extra and had a room on the ground level with a small courtyard complete with water feature. We had no problems with noise and found the hotel and our room to be clean and comfortable. The bed and pillows in particular were a pleasure to sleep on after two hectic days walking around Disneyland and the California Adventure Park. There is a supermarket directly across the road which was also conveinent. I cannot comment on public transport to Disneyland as we had a car but travel to there via car from Hotel Pepper Tree was quick and easy (about 10 minutes). Sometimes I don't know what people expect from a free
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words and taking the time to review Hotel Pepper Tree.   We work hard to make sure each guest room is comfortable and clean.  We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Hidden treasure at a reasonable price
Summary: The Hotel Pepper Tree is a hidden treasure in the Disneyland area. The rooms are HUGE and the price is more than reasonable.  Our room had a king bed, writing desk, couch, chair and coffee table with plenty of room to spare. The small kitchen area was well equiped with what ever we needed. The bathroom was next to a dressing area with a dresser and full size closet with full length mirrors.  The front desk staff could have been more friendly but they checked us in without a problem and were very professional.  The cleaning staff was great. Our room was vacuumed daily, dirty linens replaced and dishes washed.  It's a relaxing small hotel for people who want to get away from the Mouse for a while.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time to review Hotel Pepper Tree.  We are encouraged about your comments regarding our housekeeping staff and will let them know of your kind words.  We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: This is really a slightly updated motel.  The room was very large with two queen beds.  We checked in and went straight to Disney after unloading all the luggage.  I was a bit taken aback at the sketchy neighborhood and the hotel itself after reading the glowing reviews on tripadvisor and other websites.  It was very reasonably priced and had a kitchenette, so I was willing to overlook that the place was a bit tired.  My one year old was quite dirty after crawling around the room for about 10 minutes.  The two year old stuck her hand in the wall heater and got a little burn.  Oh well, remember it's cheap.  We got back to the room about 1 am and as I was making a bottle for the baby in the kitchen I saw a cockroach.  That was it.  After a sleepless night filled with dreams of
Manager Response: I do apologize for your poor experience on your recent stay.  We are looking into the issues you mentioned very seriously including the poor response from the front desk.  Please contact us regarding your stay at manager@peppertree.biz to reconcile this situation.

Summary: Our family of 5 stayed at the Hotel Pepper Tree recently and I must say that it lived up to the good reviews I had read on Trip Advisor. The property is well priced and this was a big consideration for us as we had 5 people to feed and entertain. The room(s) were huge, we had a family room that comfortably slept 3 adults and 2 teenagers. The family room was actually 2 adjoining rooms so we had a kitchenette and 2 bathrooms and 2 verandahs. We liked the fact that there was a restaurant right at the front door and just over the road there was a well stocked supermarket and a laundrette open until late. Staff at reception were terrific, helpful with everything from advice on theme parks to the best way to get to Las Vegas. Manny is a legend, a great person to have at reception,

This is an old hotel, but most hotels near and around Disneyland are older.  It was fairly clean, but the cleaning staff is seriously lacking.   Upon arrival we found dirty linens on the floor of our closet.  When they were not removed the next day, I notified the front desk.  Our room was not vacuumed at all during our 5 day stay, although I did request vacuuming after noticing it had not been done for 2 days.  On the 2nd day they didn't even bother to clean the tub.  The toilet was in need of bowl cleaner, as it was developing some mold.  We had 3 rooms for our family group and one of the rooms smelled of cigarette smoke upon our return from Disneyland one evening.   The breakfast at the adjoining restaurant was minimal as to selection.  We only ate there one morning.  I

If you're doing Disney, stay here -- you can't beat it.  We paid $80/weekdays and around $109/weekend night and we were far happier than we'd have been in a hotel "next to Disneyland."  It was clean, stylish, close to the parks, and the staff was tremendously friendly all around.  This place is just a tiny bit (2 exits?) up I-5 from DL/CA, and you can get in and out of the parks far more quickly than people staying on the strip without having to walk 1-2 miles around DL's fence in the hot sun.  The kitchenette was very helpful to have, the pool and lobby computer were readily available, and with Ralph's and Target nearby, you need little else.  Comments about the noise and cleanliness were noted prior to the trip, but I saw nothing that was a real problem with either.  Thank

Summary Heading: Going back to the Pepper Tree soon!
Summary: Just stayed at the Pepper Tree about a week ago, and I really enjoyed our stay here. I have tried about 10 different hotels in the Disneyland area, and this is probably my favorite overall.  The room was attractive and very well set up. While we didn't really use the full features of the kitchen, it was very well set up. This is also the most comfortable place I've stayed in the area: the BEST bed, great pillows...just a really good night's sleep. I've paid much more for rooms that had beds so hard that I could not sleep there, so this is the best quality for the money, in my opinion.  I really liked the large balcony we had (complete with table and chairs) with a nice view over the pool. Plus, being able to open up to fresh air instead of relying on the AC is a bonus. I do have

we were a little hesitant to stay at the hotel peppertree at first but was very pleased when we arrived. the hotel was very quite and our rooms were clean. we loved the fully equipped kitchen and it's only a 10 minute drive to disneyland. the bathroom is a little small and shower curtain doesn't keep the water from soaking the bathroom floor at all. but those are very minor details. we will definitely stay again.

We stayed at the Pepper Tree for 3 nights and loved it.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The bathroom was clean and well maintained.  We really loved having the little kitchen in the room.  It was so nice being able to have some Cokes and bottled water in the refrigerator.  The only problem we had was the A/C didn't work well.  The first night I thought maybe it needed some time to cool down.  The second and third night I was too exhausted.  I mentioned it upon check-out and they seemed genuinely concerned and appologized.  I think had I actually complained about it earlier in my stay, they would have taken care of it.  Also, there is a Mexican restaurant in the parking lot, but it was never open when we tried go there.  The Pepper Tree provides complimentary continental

We stayed for four days and were extremely pleased.  We had requested a quiet room away from the pool area and street and that's exactly what we got.  The room was clean, spacious and very comfortable.  We will be staying there again.

We just returned from a stay at the Pepper Tree. After reading all the positive reviews, we were very excited about a stay here. I must say we were a little bit dissappointed when we arrived/entered the room. The room had a very strange odor when we opened the door (kind of moldy) so we opened the sliding glass door immediately. The rooms looked old and there was a lot of patched up spots on the walls and patched up carpet. This place has great potential and with some nice paint and carpet it would look like a four star property. I don't know what they did witht the kitchen cabinets, but they decided to sand off some of the paint; to make it look more rustic, I guess. It doesn't work for me.   Check-in was flawless and the clerk was very friendly. The pool was clean, as was the

We have stayed at the Pepper Tree before.  However, when we checked in to our room, we found that the bathroom garbage had not been dumped and was full of used sanitary napkins!  Then we went to use the fridge and there was rotting fruit in it.  We contacted the hotel clerks who were very apologetic and took care of the trash.     They said that the manager would be contacting us in the morning to see how they could compensate us, and took our number.  We were there for 4 nights and the manager NEVER called us, nothing was even mentioned at checkout.  We won't be staying there again.

Our family of five stayed here for two nights.  We had two large rooms which were adjoining, two bathrooms and two tvs and one room had full kitchen facilites, including large table and chairs.  Supermarket directly across the road, which if you wanted to cook could provide you with all that you needed.    Our rooms backed onto the pool and this did not really provide that much of a problem with noise, when you sat out on your own private patio with small fountain in the evening . One word of advice, if you are a light sleeper, ask for the fountain to be turned off, as during the night it will sound as if you are sleepng in the bathroom with a full on dripping tap.  After the first night when I was kept awake (all the others slept through it) the staff were happy to turn off

We booked this after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were a little worried when we first found it, but were pleasantly surprised. We had originally booked a 1-bedroom, but there was a problem and ended up with 2 rooms with 2 queen beds and kitchens. They rooms were large with a table and chairs in front of the TV. Our rooms were very quiet and we had a balcony with chairs on it. The location is a little out of the way, but it is a nice hotel and we would definitely stay there again.    We especially want to thank Manny for being so helpful with everything, ie directions, etc.  We will look into staying there again the next time we are in Anaheim.

I cannot believe that this hotel was ranked #5 by Trip Advisor members for the Anaheim area.  I have stayed in some bad hotels, and this is one of them.  Here are the problems that this place has:  First, the internet connection is horrible, about the same speed as dial up.  The fridge, needs some serious cleaning.  The toilet isn't bolted to the floor and eventually there will be a very, very serious problem with the fecus that will leak from the toilet.  Instead of replacing bad/dirty tile they have decided to paint over the tile, which is now peeling up.  Electrical outlets don't work.  There isn't a seperation between the toilet/tub and sink (pretty standard these days) so someone can shower, and others can do their hair/brush teeth.  The 3 spiders that I killed last night

My wife, daughter,  and myself recently stayed at the Hotel Peppertree  this last week. The kitchenette provides all the kitchenware needed to make a meal and save some money from eating out every night. There is a Ralph's directly across the street. A little further down the street is a Food 4 Less and other shopping centers. Any issues that we had in the hotel were taken care of IMMEDIATELY by the helpful staff. We'd like to give a special thanks to Jill, Alejandro, and the maintenance staff. Our room was cleaned daily. There was always fresh towels and toiletries. It is an older neighborhood, but not a bad neighborhood. I felt safe leaving the car in the parking area. The pool area is very clean. Cleanliness is a theme throughout the hotel. Never was the hotel too loud. A DVD

Found Pepper Tree by searching "southwest decor".  Was not disappointed in this department!  It was even more beautiful than I expected.  The reviews and customer service when inquiring about reservations confirmed my decision on choosing Pepper Tree for our week long Disneyland trip.  Was pleasantly surprised at how close Disney was, 5-10 mins.  A Ralphs grocery store across the street (Target about 2 blocks), made it very convenient to stock up our nice sized kitchen.   The beds had to be the most comfy beds I've ever slept on in a hotel.  In fact, they were better than my bed at home!  Lots of very large comfy pillows too.  We stayed three nights in a King Suite which was HUGE, and was great to be separated a little from the kids.  We then spent 3 nights in a twin Queen room

Not quite what I had hoped for.  Hotel was very noisy.  Needed to leave room air conditioner on because there is no screen for sliding glass doors and no other windows.   When we turned it off to try to sleep, all you heard was the fountain outside the sliding doors.    Heard everyone who walked up and down the hallway.  Not as clean as I would have liked.  Light from hallway came through under the door.    On the plus side, the staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Would not stay there again.

We have now stayed at the Hotel Peppertree four times.  We will not stay anywhere else in the Disney area.  The rooms are larger than most hotels, the kitchenettes are wonderful, and the staff is always so eager to help out!!!  Plus, the beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept on at a hotel.   You get a continental breakfast and the restaurant that is on the property.  The swimming pool is heated and clean.    I have tried MANY hotels around the Disnleyland area.  This one is the absolute best by far!!!!

Summary Heading: Very comfortable and the price is right
Summary: I read other reviews on Trip Advisor and this led me to make a reservation here.  Pleasantly greeted with friendly staff, our room was in a quiet area of the hotel (which was requested) .  The room was clean with a very comfortable bed.  The room also had a kitchenette which saved us from eating all our meals out.  The continental breakfast at the restaurant next door was sufficient.  We would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends.

I would highly recommend staying at the Hotel Pepper Tree.  It was beautifully decorated, comfortable, clean and spacious.  The front desk employees (Manny in particular) could not have been more helpful with directions and suggestions on things to do in the area.  The room's kitchen was well-equipped, and there's a grocery store conveniently across the street.  If we ever return to Anaheim we will definitely stay here again.

My first trip to the U.S. in March 2008 was made all the more enjoyable by the wonderful stay at Hotel Pepper Tree in Anaheim, CA. The hotel is centrally located in Lincoln Ave, far enough away from the Disney mayhem, yet close to all the major freeways to take you north to LA or south to the beaches.  The self-contained apartment was extremely clean with everything I needed to cook my own meals, read a book or listen to Smooth Jazz 94.7FM and relax with the sound of the water feature on my patio....gorgeous!!  The highlight though was the service of the excellent Pepper Tree staff. Manny at the front desk was super helpful in helping me book my room from my home back in Australia. Once I got here, another super nice man named Rick made sure all my needs were catered for. He

The hotel location is excellent - Not too close to Disney so nice and quiet but very easy to get to Disney and the interstate for LA.  The rooms were very big and the kitchen facilities an added bonus.  The rooms were very clean and well serviced each day.  The staff were extremely friendly and knowledgeable and were very willing to help with directions, suggestions etc.  There is a supermarket across the street (Ralphs) which provides an excellent supply for your kitchen although with the complimentary breakfast at the nearby restaurant you won't really need it!  Great for families and couples who don't want the immediate chaos of Disney.  The hotel is on a busy main road but we didn't hear it through our whole stay.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone wanting an

Before I ever checked in, the staff was extremely helpful and courteous over the phone. After I arrived, they were sure to go above and beyond to make sure I had the best trip possible. I did a lot of sight seeing in Los Angeles, and the staff helped me get directions, avoid traffic, and printed maps for me (I only asked  them what street the Chinese theatre was on, and they went above and beyond to help me plan a great trip to Hollywood). The room was great too! It was very spacious and well organized with a full kitchen including microwave, refridgerator, oven, and stove top. The rooms have a south western appearance which I really enjoyed. If you are planning a trip to California, I would highly recommend Hotel Pepper Tree and would encourage you to call the hotel because the

Customer service at this place is awesome!  Our room was clean and comfortable.  Very nice place with spanish decor and convenient drive to Disneyland.  Will definitely go back and recommend to family and friends!

we have just returned from a four week  family trip to the US and stayed at the hotel pepper tree for 6 nights in early February this year.  Although it wasn't in the heart of the Disney hotel district (not such a bad thing) it was perfect for us.  The room was large and clean.   Breakfast each morning was fantastic and more than adequate for us.  Even though it was February my kids enjoyed using the pool on more than one occasion.  Most of the staff at the reception desk were fantastic and eager to help with our enquiries, giving us maps and directions for Disneyland and the local shopping centres and restaurants.  My only gripes, and there are only 2, were: 1. the lack of chairs and table in the rooms to eat at after cooking in the well equipped kitchen and;  2. the high speed

We just returned from a 4-night stay at the Hotel Pepper Tree and loved it.   After long days at Disneyland we came back to a place that felt more like a home than a hotel room - it was very relaxing!  The room was clean (in fact, the entire property including the pool was very clean) and the maid service refreshed everything including soap and shampoo every day.  The decor and furniture were such a nice touch - not your typical hotel decor.  The beds were very comfortable and we loved having a choice of soft or hard pillows or both!  The huge closet and dressing area was great.  We loved the balcony and did have a room that overlooked the pool and that is the best view.    The continental breakfast was fine (cereal, toast, muffins, fruit, yogurt, milk, juice, coffee, tea) and

I had 2 days to stay there with the family and after checking all the reviews on the hotels in anahiem area I desided to choose pepper tree hotel and it was the best decision because when I arrived there I liked the hotel styl the clean rooms the  full kitchen in  the room and beside that the barbique on the pool and ralph store across the street where you can buy everything especially stakes for the barbique and over all that it is in quiet neighbourhood  and couple miles from disney land and over all you will see the most friendly staff in there . IT will my staying place every time Iam going there

We booked this hotel to spend the night for a Disney trip. We liked the fact that it was a few miles away from Disney and the traffic. The room we stayed in had two queen beds that were very comfortable. It also had a refrigerator, stove, cooking utensils, cutlery, eating utensils, a coffee maker, ironing board and iron, cable tv, a couple of chairs with a coffee table, and a balcony with two chairs and a table. The room was clean and smelled like a hotel room. We didn't use the swimming pool or the exercise equipment, so we can't comment on them.   For travelers staying more than a night, this should be the place to stay with all of the kitchen extras. There is a grocery store directly across the street, and several popular retail stores nearby. The only drawback we had for our

Summary Heading: A fine location for a great price
Summary: I found the Hotel Pepper Tree on Trip Advisor and found the advice to be helpful.  It is a very affordable and nice family hotel with great amenities. Our unit was very clean and we appreciated the welcome kit.  The staff was incredibly helpful.  We received a phone call as soon as we placed our reservation.  All our questions were dealt with professionally and courteously and all information was correct.  We were a late arrival.  The staff prepared for our late arrival.  Through our own exhaustion we had difficulty opening the locked front door (!).  With one phone call the staff came to help us, got the door open and made sure we found our room.  The location was perfect for us.  We liked the kitchenette facilities, they were better than expected.  The breakfast at the

We found this gem through tripadvisor.  So much nicer than hotel row.  The front desk provided a great map to get to Disneyland very quickly and to find dinner the night we arrived.  We were taking our daughter to Disneyland for her 2nd birthday so the kitchenette was great benefit.  We were there two nights so we only used the refigerator and microwave.  We watched the Disney fireworks from a 3rd floor room facing the road.    Nicely decorated and very clean.  Next time I'll request a room on the backside...the road noise coming through the a/c vent was a bit much.

Well, all I can say is that although this is only a small 3 stars hotel, but I think its 100% better than any of those 5 stars hotels services. I was almost screw up with my plans during the Valentine Day, but luckily the manager, Manny from the hotel helps me very much for all the arrangements and me and partners have a great night staying at the Pepper Tree. It was fantastic, and everything is perfect. The services, the room..everything is great and we will definitely stay there again. Last but not least, Thank you so much for all the help Manny! we will definitely see you again =)

My husband and I stayed at The Pepper Tree in Anaheim, California from Dec. 15/2007 to Jan.19/2008. We rented a one bedroom, two bathroom suite on the floor just down from the lobby. We really enjoyed the suite as it gave us lots of room to spread out. The bed was king size and very comfortable. Lots of closet and cupbboard space. The kitchen was well equipped and adequate. The dining area and living area were combined and were very roomy. We had two patios. One off the kitchen/living room and one off the bedroom. We preferred to use the one off the kitchen. We also had two T.V. sets. One in the living area and one in the bedroom . The suite was very clean and we were provided with lots of towels.   Staff at the Pepper Tree were very professional and friendly. We had problems

We stayed at the Hotel Peppertree for about a week for on three different occasions this year.  It is a roomy hotel.  The king bed is very comfortable, but the futon bed and twin bed aren't quite so comfortable.   The rooms are quite large compared to many other hotels.   We like having two rooms with a kitchenette to do some cooking in.  We'll probably stay there again despite some inconveniences on our most recent trip.   The swimming pool is very nice and clean and doesn't have much of a chlorine smell.  The location is out of the way of the strip of hotels along the Disney property.  I find this refreshing, but it means you have to drive to Disneyland and pay for parking as no free shuttles are available from this hotel.  The hotel is generally very clean.  We had a couple

This hotel is wonderful!!!! The staff was very friendly, and more than helpful. We wanted to get our plane boarding passes printed off before we checked out, and they did it for us! The rooms were very clean, the kitchen was fully stocked with everything we needed. The beds were fantastic! I don't sleep well in hotels, but the beds were so comfortable that sleeping was no problem! I loved the king sized feather pillows. The area the hotel is in isn't top notch, but it isn't as bad as some have said. We have stayed in much worse areas of LA. The price of the hotel rooms couldn't be beat. Even though we visited in the off season, I think that the price of their executive suite in the busy season would be a deal! We loved the idea of having 2 bathrooms, we didn't have to share with

We were travelling with four  teenagers so were pretty stressed when we arrived after a 12 hour flight. The staff were extremely helpful and went out of their way to help us during our stay.  The room was very secure and it was lovely to sit on the balcony overlooking the pool. The kitchen was very well equipped so we were able to economise on meals which was great. There was a restaurant in the carpark which provided the very substantial continental breakfast. ... huge choice and able to satisfy teenage boys!!!  Disneyland was only 10 mins away and the taxi driver they found for us was excellent ( Richard) There was also a supermarket accross the road. We can't recommend this hotel highly enough for service, convenience, friendliness and very comfortable beds!!!
The Hotel Pepper Tree can be described in one sentence. "The best kept secret in Anaheim!" We will definitely stay there again.

We would absolutely stay at this place again; we really enjoyed our stay of 5 nights. We had two rooms and a total of seven in our party. The kitchenettes were great although we did not utilize them the way we had wanted to, but that was because we just didn’t have time to cook. We did use the full sized coffee pots daily. We also used the nice BBQ grill at poolside and enjoyed a nice steak dinner one day. The pool and grounds were nice and clean. The rooms were clean and very comfortable and it was so nice to come back from a day at Disneyland to a clean room everyday. The maids do a wonderful job cleaning, even around a messy bunch like us! The staff were friendly and professional and the Aztec restaurant was also nice.  Disneyland was terribly crowded during this time and

A good example of why this site is useful. I never would have found such good value for money so close to Disney. A far cry above the Harbor Blvd. properties for less money. The lobby area is really warm and welcoming and Rick on the front desk, who lives on property, is a great guy.   I had only one complaint - housekeeping needs to be more diligent. I found a couple stains and a hair that was definitely not mine on the bed spread on my second night.   Next time I will check before accepting the room - others in my party reported perfectly acceptable cleanliness level, linen-wise, so it may have just been a slip up.  The neighborhood is typical Anaheim - many people don't realize just how down market the city is. Most of northwestern Orange County is about the same. (The first

Not a 4-star hotel but absolutely perfect for a quick trip to Disneyland, which is only about 10 minutes away. The hotel was nicely decorated and the staff couldn't be nicer. We had 2 adults and a teenager in a double queen room and there was plenty of space. It was also nice to have a frig and kitchenette available as well. The rooms do come with a continental breakfast but you have to go outside to the restaurant next door.  If you're looking for a hotel close to Disney without paying the Disney prices, this is the hotel for you. A perfect family hotel, clean and fairly inexpensive.

After reading the reviews, we decided to give this place a try, but we won't be back. First ,the good: We were able to check in early, the room was clean, and the bed was super comfy.  Now, the bad: Very noisy, no tissues, burnt out light bulbs that weren't replaced, a mediocre continental breakfast in a freezing restaurant, awful coffee in the room, kitchen cabinets and drawers that were in need of repair, and a tub that no longer had any non-skid and was lacking a safety bar. The first day we were there, workmen were outside our room with saws. The manager actually called and asked if we would mind if a worker came through our room to work on the balcony. No, we were having our Thanksgiving dinner at the time, but they did put up a ladder and we had to close the drapes or have

Our purpose for staying at Pepper Tree was our planned trip to Disneyland with our young sons.  While the neighborhood was not the greatest, the hotel itself was very clean and I liked the overall Spanish decor.  Plenty of room for the four of us.  The hotel felt safe and secure to me.  We noticed how incredibly quiet the hotel was!  While we didn't spend a lot of time in the room other than to sleep, we really did enjoy our stay there.  Very convenient to Disneyland, it only took us about fifteen minutes to get there.  We thought the restaurant was nice enough, and even though the breakfast was "light", all of us still appreciated that we could fill our bellies with fruit, yogurt, cereal, pastry, bagels, juice, and coffee!  It was enough to see us through a morning on the rides

We were evacuated from our home in San Diego county during the recent fire storms.  As we joined the exodus of vehicles heading north, our son in NY was trying to find us a pet-friendly hotel.  Most of the ones near us were full.  We arrived at the Hotel Peppertree expecting the worst, but were very pleasantly surprised.  The room was large and clean with a kitchen with a full-sized refrigerator, with plates, pans and utensils.  Every room is a non-smoking room with an outside patio.  The swimming pool was kept clean, even with ash in the air from the fires.  Even though the hotel is in a busy, working-class part of Anaheim, and we had a large family next door to us, the rooms are quiet at night.  The staff, Manny, Karen and Rick, were friendly and went out of their way to

The cleaninest, most comfortable place we have stayed in southern california.  The service was better than other 4star hotels.  It is central to several amusment parks, and the beach is a 15 minute drive on I5.  We will return again to Hotel Pepper Tree and not bother to shop around.

To: The Hotel Pepper Tree Management  & Staff  We thank you all for the stay at your excellent establishment. You should all be well proud of what your hard work has delivered to us as guests, we wanted for nothing and it is probably one of the best experiences that I and my wife have enjoyed in all the places around the globe we have been. I have travelled to and lived in 35 countries on this planet. Also I have been a professional musician In Australia for 45 years and have traveled extensivelly, staying in all sorts of places in that career Australia wide.  I thank you for your follow up phone call re: the plaid blouse that my wife left in the room. This was left for the cleaning lady or someone there  who could use it as a gift.  It was brand new, but the wrong size for my

The hotel ran a September - October special where a night was about $65.  Considering the room had a stove, settings for 2, a refrigerator and a microwave, it was a great deal.  The neighborhood isn't exactly in the best part of town, but that's really not something the hotel can control.  What they *could* control, they did pretty well.  There was a little "welcome" bag in our bathroom that had various samples of different toiletry items, which came in handy.  We came back to a nice, clean room after we spent the day in  Disneyland.  It's across the street from a Ralph's grocery store, which helps if you want to save money by buying TV dinners for dinner/lunch.  The Azteca restaurant is in a separate building in front of the hotel.  Continental breakfast included toast,
My first look to the Hotel was a nice Style, nice look and the rooms are very confortable, well equipted and the staff are very kind. Nice place to be.  Ramiro Chavez La Paz - Bolivia

This hotel is located in the right place to visit all the entertainment places in Anahaim. Excellent breakfast… great service.   Overall I would say this is a great option for stay and enjoy a nice vacation with your family.  In Anahaim there are many things to do and this nice hotel is a wonderful place to stay at night, feeling like in home. Great price... nice place.

Summary Heading: Hotel Pepper Tree a Small Gem in a Disney Land
Summary: Bottom line to the place -- an eclectic (in a good way), personal hotel with what you need for a great price, in an area with cookie-cutter hotels and tourist prices. Do not expect perfection: We had a bum bathroom light at check-in, and there was no dishwasher in our executive suite (just odd). What you can expect is a very friendly staff that will deal with the problem somehow, even if it means coming down and fixing the light themselves on a Sunday afternoon, as Manny and Erica at the front desk did with whatever tools were lying around. Also expect clean and a lot of space with charming, southwest-style decor. For $129 per night, our family of four landed a two-bedroom, two-bath suite with comfy beds and a kitchen (okay, no dishwasher, but we really didn't care), 10 minutes

This hotel was very good. It had recently been renovated the owners could not do enough for the guests. Excellent standard of accomodatiod. It was inexpensive to stay here and after traveling along the west coast, was one of the best hotels we stayed in.

Summary Heading: Overall a good hotel, but didn't live up to my expectations...
Summary: I booked Hotel Pepper Tree due to its overwhelmingly positive TripAdvisor reviews and its proximity to Disneyland (about 15 minutes driving distance).  I was not disappointed, but I wasn't impressed either!  My first indication of its mediocrity was its service.  When my parents arrived at the hotel, they found out our refrigerator was broken.  We took our issue to the front desk and two employees came to our room to check it out.  One of the men, whose name I think is Rick, implied that my folks were the ones who had broken it!  Considering the fact that we had only been there for a few hours, and had not adjusted the temperature knobs at all, I think that accusation was a little unfair.  He also implied that our refigerator was in good working condition and that we were only

Upon entering Hotel Pepper Tree we were appaled at the location.  The area of the town was low class and I would not go out after 8 pm.  We were welcomed and put in a room that had a strong smell of gas.  We called front desk and after a little bit of arguing we recieved another room.  They later called back and apologized for the inconvinience and said that they were lucky we found the smell because the oven had been left on!  As we tryed going to sleep we were appaled that they left the hallway music blaring all throughout the night.  The next morning I complained and it was shut off for only one of the 5 nights we stayed there.  The next day after a long trip to disneyland we came home to an uncleaned room.  After I called, they told me "to keep our rates low we only clean

Summary Heading: Great Hotel with great rooms and service
Summary: We have just return from a 14 night stay in California and we stayed at the Pepper Tree. The hotel and rooms all have a mexican feel and it makes a great atmosphere. The rooms were very large, we had two queen size beds, nice balcony over looking the pool, kitchen with a large  fridge which can come in handy if you are travelling with kids, microwave,toaster,oven etc, plenty of wardrobe space  and tv. The staff there are lovely,( Manny especially), they were always very helpful printing us off maps/directions of where we wanted to go, giving us local info and always smiling. Room service was amazing, and as per some other reviews which we read before visiting the Pepper Tree there were no quirks and we are quite capable of doing our own washing up!!! This hotel is close to

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with a nice price.
Summary: We needed a hotel for our trip to Disneyland. I wanted to have some spending money for souvenirs, ect.  We decided to stay at Hotel Pepper Tree because of the room price  and not too bad reviews. My husband and I were impressed with the ample room and nice decor. The rooms were clean and the service we recieved was above average. The free continental breakfast served at the Azteca restaurant was very good. Fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, muffins, toast, donuts, danishes, coffee, tea, milk, apple and orange juice. (A nice variety of free foods) My husband and I had the breakfast special which was offered for $3.99. (pancakes, 2eggs, 2sausage and 2 bacon strips).  The Ralphs supermarket across the street is very convienent to stock the fridge.  Finding our way to Disneyland was very

Summary Heading: wish we had gotton there sooner !
Summary: We stayed here 2 nights while visiting Disney.  We really wished we had arrived a night sooner  !  I think the website shows the hotel very fairly.....infact, I expected a smaller space for the 2 room suite.  We were thrilled with the size !!!  The kids could have the room with the kitchen....we just took the coffee pot to our side for the morning !  Lovely balcony with flowering vines.  Very short, easy drive to Disneyland.  We were in Californina for 10 days, our last 2 nights were spent here, The PepperTree was our best value and most comfortable stay ! Thank you !

Summary Heading: Nice Clean Roomy Suite - Great for Families with Kids
Summary: This is a great place to stay for families with children.  It's not the fanciest, nor the most luxurious, but it is clean and it sure has a lot of room.  I have a family of 5, and my wife demanded that we stay in a suite where the children could have their own room for our CA vacation.  That cuts down dramatically on selection and good deals available.  That said, I really felt like this one was worth the effort of my searching.    When we first arrived, we were so amazed at how much room there was that we thought they had made a mistake by giving us two rooms.  Actually, the suite is made up of two adjoining hotel rooms, each with their own bathroom, kitchen, tv, etc.  Our room had a comfortable king bed, and the kid's room had a twin with a futon (kid's room sleeps 3 total if

Summary Heading: Not bad but could be better
Summary: Our main reason for staying in Anaheim was Disneyland. We stayed in this hotel as it was a fair bit cheaper then hotels closer to the park. We used the public buses to get to the park which tended to take about 30 minutes each way. This worked out ok but it would have been easier with a car. The room was a nice size and the kitchen area was very convienient. The people cleaning the rooms did a good job and one day they even did some dishes for me I left in the sink. The free continental breakfast was pretty good with a nice selection of food (unlike some other hotels). The shop and laudromat across the road were very handy and there is a fair bit of shopping close by or easily accessable by bus. The free internet was a nice bonus as well. If you get the Greyline bus to go to

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and the excellent service from desk staff (thanks Rick!!). The rooms were huge!! Self-contained with everything you could possibly want - including a wide variety of shops and supermarket just across the street! Great pool view with our balcony overlooking the pool. The restaurant was fantastic for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Internet service was fantastic also. Had a great time here and fantastic hotel for young families.

Summary Heading: Don't Expect What You See In The Pics
Summary: Before you read this consider that I went here for part of my honeymoon with my wife, thinking it was a very nice hotel with Spanish style theming as is implied by the picture of the hotel online.  To our disappointment this is not the case.  The decor was Spanish themed, but aside from some nice fountains, there really wasn't anything special about it.  Overall the architecture was looking run down and old.  Perhaps they have improved it in the last year.  According to the web page for this hotel they had a restaurant on site.  This is misleading.  First the said restaurant was still under construction and not open when we were there.  Second, when you hear "on site" you think it is in the hotel, this is not the case.  The restaurant is located in the hotel's parking lot.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  Since your stay with us a year ago, there have been many updates to the property and the restaurant has been opened.  During your stay with us in July 2006, we were still finishing the remodel and renovation of our Hotel and apologize for your inconveniences.

Summary: The hotel staff was not very helpful.  They don't even have an ice machine. Their continental breakfast was through a restaurant across the way.  The rooms appeared shabby and very unattractive.  Their check-out time is 10:00AM.  That is unheard of.   My boyfriend and I stayed for just one night.  I would think twice before using this hotel again.

The Pepper Tree is very comfortable. It has many amenities you won't find elsewhere at this price. There was an error in the reservation but we had brought our paperwork with us and the error was corrected immediately. Would we stay here again? Yes. We ate twice at the Azteca restaurant on the grounds, again great food, very friendly service, and at good prices.  If this is your price range, you won't be dissappointed.

This hotel was a pleasant surprise for my friend and I and our two children (ages 1 and 3).  The price was great for this large room with a full  kitchen and private balcony.  The location is very close to Disneyland and Knotts, and close to the freeway.  Across the street is a drugstore  and supermarket.  The room had a very large closet and  plenty of storage.  The pool area was clean and had BBQ grills to use.  Plus the pool was heated to the perfect temperature.  The refrigerator is big and the room has  a couch and coffee table.  The hotel is decorated in a charming Spanish style.  It feels very homely.  The  beds are comfortable too. The few bad things were that the bathroom is  quite small. There is no alarm clock or tissues provided.  No ice machines and the balcony

my family and i came to the pepper tree for basically a place to crash after the draining theme park madness- what we got was so much more! The staff addressed our every want- from extra towels (3x a day), to hairdryers, to a DVD player. They printed out dozens of directions for us and were the nicest people(especially the night staff) The beds were THE most comfortable we have ever slept in our entire lives and the rooms were very quiet- we never heard any neighbors the whole time. Our only wish is they had a hot tub to soak our worn out selves in. The pool was nice but goes from 3 feet to 8 feet so we had to go up the road to target to get our 6 year old some arm floaties, but he loved every minute of it. It is in a great location, really close to disney and only minutes away

We go to Disneyland several times a year – this was our first stay at the Pepper Tree, and I have mixed feelings about the hotel. This was a spur-of-the-moment trip for us – which found (our first preference) the Disney hotels, as well as our second choice (the Candy Cane Inn) sold out.  Let me start with the reason I will probably not come back to the Pepper tree, and that is the proximity to the Disney parks, combined with no shuttle service. From the Pepper Tree, it is a good 15 minute drive to reach the queue for parking at Disney, then paying and finding parking, then walking and waiting in the line for the tram…all of this sets you back a good hour from even entering the parks. We have a toddler – so one of the huge perks of staying at a Disney hotel is the convenience of

We stayed here a couple nights while we went to Dinseyland.  It was a nice sized room with the kitchen.  Had we been there longer we would have used the kitchen.  The bed was comfortable.  I know the rooms have the tile in them and I guess I just prefer carpet.  The shower went hot/cold on me.  I still liked the room overall.  One night we did have some woman standing out in the hall talking on her cell phone for over an hour.  You could not hear anyone in other rooms but you could hear EVERYTHING in the hallway.  My husband finally got up and told her to go in her room.  The breakfast is in the restaurant in the parking lot.  It was perfect for me.  Cereal, banana, yogurt and juice is all I need.  With the price around $100 a night I would definitely stay there again.

This hotel is a converted apartment building. It shows the wear and tear that you would expect from such a place. It also has very cheap and mismatched appliances. It just seems like everything was thrown together on the cheap.  It's fine if you are looking for a budget hotel in a bad neighborhood that's about 10 minutes from Disneyland.  But if I were to stay for more than one day, I would choose something a little nicer that I could use as a base to visit Disneyland.  This place is no more than a place to sleep as I wouldn't want to spend much time here.  Keep looking, unless you're on a tight budget.

Summary Heading: I wish I could have stayed a bit longer...
Summary: I stayed at Pepper Tree last week and it was very very pleasant. I chose the hotel because I wanted a rather worm and familiar experience, something a bit personal. They did not have a small room so I had to stay at one of the suites. It did not disappoint me at all. Rick made sure that everything was ready for my arrival destipe I got there after midnight. My room had a gigantic Spanish bed and a lovely red couch. However the most pleasant feature of the room was the sound of running water. They have a little fountain at each room´s terrace and you can hear it in the morning.  Bkfast is very simple (cereal, juice, coffee and muffins) but you can order special Mexican bkfst for few extra dollars.  I stayed for a very short period of time so I cannot say much about other areas of

Our family of 5, including 3 kids 18-23 years old, as well as our neighbors, who traveled with a 2 year old and a 4 month old were able to make reservations within a month of our desired travel dates.  There were a lot of conventions in town and most hotels were booked solid.  What a pleasant surprise!  The two bedroom/two bath suite we had was enormous and an excellent price!  We were surprised by the 2 full bathrooms, well equipped kitchen and t.v.'s in both rooms. Our neighbors had a 2 queen room and were pleased with the convenience of the kitchen for preparing their babies food & bottles.We were able to save money on dining out due to the Ralphs grocery store across the street-very convenient with so many mouths to feed.  The continental breakfast was served in a dining

We booked to stay at the hotel due to the gym and the closeness to Disneyland.  The hotel was great and is Spanish looking inside and the rooms are tastefully decorated. There was plenty of room for my partner and I to relax and having a kitchen for a couple of days was great. There is also a supermarket and pharmacy across the road which are both open late. There is a Target 2 minutes down the road too. The hotel offers free Internet access to hotel guests, which is great for people from overseas that haven't bought a laptop with them! The breakfast in the morning is basic cereal, muffins, some fresh fruit etc The gym at the hotel is a real let down - we booked the hotel for the gym but the machines are clunky and there are no free weights. As the hotel is not in the main strip

Summary Heading: Still great, but housekeeping services could be improved
Summary: I've stayed at the Pepper Tree several times in the past year & while each stay there is very pleasant, I've noticed some things that have gotten a bit worse.    Rick is still as accommodating as ever and really does go out of his way to make sure the guests are well taken care of.  The hotel itself is still unique and as comfortable as it has always been.    I have noticed that the housekeeping services have slowly been getting worse, each time I stay there.  I don't expect much when it comes to housekeeping, especially if I'm only staying a night or two, but I do expect the staff to do more than simply flop the bedsheets over so that the bed looks half-made.    I've gotten used to having to ask for coffee & creamer/sugar replacements, as I don't think I've ever had my coffee

We stayed at the Pepper Tree from January 25th- February 1st 2007 and found the entire property to be clean and well kept.  Our king room on the ground floor was spacious and far larger than any other hotel room I've staying at while in California.    The following is a list of features I enjoyed most at the Pepper Tree (and are not typical of most other hotels):  1.  FREE parking lot close to the room.  After walking around Disneyland for 10 hours, the last thing you want to do at night is have a 15 minute walk from the hotel parking lot to your room!  2.  FREE wireless Internet.  It's fast, easy to hook up, and we never once encountered a connection problem.  Most hotels charge $10/24 hour period so this was a HUGE savings!  3.  In the bathroom area was a welcome gift bag

Summary Heading: It's a fine holel in a so so neighborhood
Summary: Was there during the MLK day weekend this year. It's a good and somewhat isolated place - family hideout friendly.  Pro: Big room,  clean setup,  full kitchen with all the basic utensils,  charming and unique deco and layout, friendly staff quiet  Con: So so neighborhood Night light on balcony too bright and can't be turned off

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here at the Hotel Pepper Tree. My mom, sister, and I stayed for four nights and five days. I really love the fact that it wasn't a chain, cookie cutter type of hotel room.  The ambiance of the rooms was very nice. I love having a full size refridgerator to use. An employee, Rick, was very helpful in finding a wonderful seafood restaurant. He even printed out directions for us. We had no problems with the room being cleaned. We had goodies bags filled with travel items that were very surprising.  I had a DVD player requested before the trip and they installed it in the room before we arrived. The hotel is only a short trip to both parks.  It's nice and quiet with a grocery right across the street for convenience. My only complaint is that there were

Our stay was wonderful. Don't be fooled by the exterior of the hotel, it's quite lovely inside. Very warm and inviting.  The rooms are cute and the kitchen is really useful. The hotel is across the street from a Ralphs grocery store, so if you plan on using the kitchen, it's very convienent. The staff was so incredibly kind and accomodating. There is a computer downstairs in the lobby that has free internet access (with a honor system time limit so that other guests can use the computer as well). The beds are comfy, it was very clean, and the kitchen was stocked with bowls, plates, silverware, and pots and pans. The breakfast was what we expected, mini-bagels, doughnuts, fruit, juice, cereal, toast. If you're looking for a comfy place to stay with a kind staff, reasonable free

I usually book all of my hotel stays based on the TripAdvisor reviews, and this one did not disappoint!  We went to Anaheim this past weekend for the Monster Jam at Angel Stadium, and the hotel was a great value for me, my husband & son (4 yrs.).  Yes, the exterior is a little deceiving, but once you step into the lobby, you see the difference!  The units are like apartments - a lot more space than most studio apts in LA!  The decor is really charming - unique touches everywhere like Spanish tiles and the great turtle fountains by the pool (my son loved those!).  The sitting area on the balcony was great!  We would have used the heated pool if we had more time!  My only minor neg. comments would be:  toilet plumbing and scratchy comforters (but comfy beds).  Fridge motor was a

We had a horrible experience - they cleaned our room the second day and lost our kids little pillows that they sleep with. We mentioned that morning on the way to breakfast and they said they would ask housekeeping if they saw them or if they got caught up in the laundry. By 6pm they still hadn't looked. We went to dinner that night and at 9pm I asked again - that guy actually took the time away from the front desk to search the laundry room, the maids carts and the lost and found. Then he even searched the storage rooms on the other floors. He was the only one who attempted to help us find them. Needless to say after all that - we still have no pillows or any contact from the hotel. I loved the room with the kitchen in it but next time I will find another hotel with better

We just returned from a 4-night stay at the Hotel Pepper Tree and we really enjoyed it.  Everyone we met was very friendly, the  prices were great and the accomodations were very nice.  I especially loved the lobby area and stairways.  Our granddaughter (4 yrs) loved the fish in the small elevated pools outside the lobby!  The room was very comfortable, clean and practical, as well as attractive.  The kitchenette made eating in very easy.  And it was convenient to DisneyLand, the purpose of our trip.  Also, we enjoyed dinner at Azteca when we arrived Friday night - the people were friendly and pleasant, the prices were excellent and so was the food.  We are from Phoenix so we are familiar with Mexican food and I can honestly say it was some of the best I've had. Our

Anaheim Ca.:  The Hotel Pepper Tree in Anaheim Ca.  "Not so clean"!.  Rented two rooms, Dec. 26 thru Dec. 29, 2006. for our annual Christmas trip with six grandkids.  The reason behind selecting the Pepper Tree was because it has kitchenettes in each room which is a plus with so many kids of all ages.  First day out, we returned to one of the rooms not receiving any housekeeping services at all.  Nothing was cleaned, the beds were not made, trash cans not emptied and the towels were not replaced.  When bringing this matter to the attention of the desk clerk, a quick check of their cleaning list indicated that the room had been cleaned.  The clerk assured me that the towels would be replaced within the next 10 min. or so.  It was 55 min. before the towels were replaced.  For this
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments, We take housekeeping issues very seriously and in fact usually receive positive comments about the cleanliness of the hotel. I have investigated your housekeeping issue and confirm that we did have a problem with the scheduling of your room during this busy period. I will be reviewing the scheduling system with our staff to ensure that we do not encounter the problem again. We provide convenient kitchens in all of our rooms but do not wash guests dishes as part of daily service. I will make sure that our front desk associates make a point of explaining this to future guests on check in. I would be more than happy for you to call me direct at the hotel if you would like to discuss your experience further.  Mark Talbot

Summary Heading: The Pepper Tree was a good stay!
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Pepper Tree for a week in November. The decision was based on the reviews on this web site. After a slight delay getting from the airport with an over confident shuttle driver being dismissive about my original query as to whether he knew where the hotel was located, we arrived on a warm afternoon into this quite nice, small hotel where people are friendly and helpful, and the standard of accomodation was, I believe, very good value. Comfortable beds, a couch, table and chairs, kitchenette with full size cooking facilities and fridge. The bathroom was small but quite adequate. The desk staff were more then helpful and this place maintains an intimacy that is sometimes lacking in the larger establishments. We had a street facing studio on the third

Summary Heading: A bit of a quirky hotel with big rooms and a very friendly staff
Summary: We booked a suite of rooms.  We had two adjoining rooms, side-by-side - rooms 202 and 203 to be exact.  One had a small but functional kitchen, the other room didn't.  The main area of each of the two rooms was very large.  It was tastefully decorated in a sort of Spanish colonial style with big tiles on the floor and big blocky pieces of wood - the rooms looked nice, but there was a strange sort of decor to our room which generally looked nice.    The hotel itself is pleasant inside and in the entry way, with large Spanish tile, and an odd collection of fountains out front which looked like tall ornate horsetroughs but were filed with goldfish.  The gardener seems to be talented because the bushes were blooming and there were flowers everywhere (in Nov.), the grounds - such as

The Peppertree is a great little hotel that is in a quaint neighborhood near the famous Keno's Family Restaurant and a short drive away from Disneyland. We stayed in a Queen room, which featured a comfortable lounge area, full service kitchen and adorable private patio with fountain. The decor had a Southwest flavor and we found it to be charming and homey. The hotel was clean, quiet and the staff were very helpful. I can't recommend it enough to those looking to stay away from the noisy family crowds and seeking a great place to unwind after a long day at the various Anaheim attractions. I would definitely return to this hotel anytime!

Summary Heading: An old motel fixed up nice....
Summary: I was expecting a spectacular hotel looking at the pictures and reading some reviews...when I got there I was kind of disappointed.  It is bascially an old dumpy motel that has been really fixed up nice.  They did a great  job fixing it up....but I  just had high expectations.  I could'nt believe it had been rated so high.  The service was great and it was clean.  It is NOT close to Disneyland.  Yes, you can drive there but it would take you a while.  Also, it is not located in the classy area surrounding Disneyland.  It is in your regular ghetto-ish Anaheim.  You would know what I mean if you have been to Anaheim and have ventured outside of the Disneyland Area.  Anaheim looks pretty rough in most places and this hotel is located in one of those areas.

We stayed here to fo to a couple different theme parks and like another person who reviewed the hotel, it is not that close to the theme parks.  It was a nice cab ride that the staff was not that helpful with.  I guess we go by the previous reviews next time.

I found this hotel on the internet and travelled from Australia for a week of study and work in Anaheim. I am very pleased that i stayed here as the studio room with my kitchen and access to the pool was very convenient and relaxing to my long days. The staff were very busy, but always able to help me with any questions and assistance when i needed them. It was a busy, hot June and they were always so pleasant each morning as i left and each night when i returned. My room was cool, clean and i liked being able to get a take away meal and relax by the pool or in my room watching the TV. I have told my company about the wonderful hotel and we are planning a conference there next year.

We staed at the Peppertree hotel this July and found it to be fabulous for our family of 5 as they gave us a 2 bedroom with a kitchen. We ended up having breakfast by the pool and making our lunches before we headed off to Disneyland as i thought Disneyland food very expensive and not very healthy. This worked really well as the supermarket was across the road from out hotel and then after a long and busy day we relaxed by the pool at night and went out for dinner nearby. I found the staff to be very helpful, rooms very clean and the whole stay was extremely easy. I am not sure if i will be going to Disneyland again soon, but i will definately be staying at the Peppertree hotel when we visit Anaheim again.

I Stayed at this really romantic hotel with my husband. We were visiting from Australia and never been to America before and the staff made us feel at home. The rooms are rustic and charming with a very comfortable king size bed. It was really clean, had a dressing area and a sweet little courtyard with a wall fountain. By the end of the trip, after staying in many brand name hotels, we realized how lucky we were to find the Pepper Tree. We loved it.
