I found this hotel while rearching the net and wondered if the photos matched the actual hotel and was pleasantly surprised that the hotel exceeded the photos. I travel a lot and as i have a small businees, costs are very important as is my comfort and both were met at this fine hotel.

FROM THEIR WEBSITE: 'Hotel Pepper Tree is centrally located in Anaheim California with easy access to the Convention Center, Disneyland, Knott's Berry Farm, The Dad Miller Golf Course and other Anaheim CA attractions.'  WHAT THIS REALLY MEANS: You are no where near anything.  They tell you on the front desk the buses are not safe to travel on. Want to go somewhere?  Book a cab right?  Well yes, if you want the MINIMUM 30 minute wait, (and I mean MINIUMUM). So the easy access to Disneyland means book your cab 2 hours before you want to go, and then pay the US$20 one way trip to get there!! So add an extra US$40 onto the day... HEY, that's enough to get a decent hotel! (near Disneyland)  THEY ARE FULL OF IT, this hotel is not near anything as advertised. As for the free breakfast

Summary Heading: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Pepper Tree
Summary: We arrived from Australia to Pepper Tree Hotel late in the afternoon.  We were warmly greeted by Ashley by name and were made to feel we were at home straight away.    The hotel and room was very comfortable,  and quite frankly the bed is truly he best bed I have ever slept on in a hotel anywhere in the many countries I have visited.   The kitchen in the room was very functional and complete and having a supermarket directly across the road very convenient.  Over the first few days of our stay,  the friendly nature of the staff never ceased to amaze me,  they even accomodated changes in our vacation plans without further cost.  We returned to Pepper Tree three days later,  and they remembered us , they were interested in our trip and the warm friendly nature continued.  The

We returned home at the end of August after a one week stay at the Hotel Pepper Tree.  Our reservations were booked online through the hotel's website. Confirmation was received by email the next day.  Two days prior to leaving, we received a phone call from the staff to confirm our booking.  We were travelling with an  adult daughter, teen-aged son and younger son. Our "executive suite" consisted of two rooms; one had a bedroom with a king size bed, sitting area, private enclosed patio, TV and bathroom.  In the adjoining bedroom, there was a futon and a twin bed.  Given the ages of our children, they were all reluctant to share a bed, so we requested another cot, which was quickly brought in and set up. There was also a fully equipped kitchen which was very convenient for

Our family spent 3 weeks in August at the Hotel Pepper Tree and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We arrived to a clean, cool room (air conditioner was on and set at 72F) with 2 queen beds and a fully equipped kitchen that included a sink, fridge, stove, microwave, toaster and kettle and all the utensils and cups, bowls, plates, etc. that one needs. The beds were very comfortable and each came with 4 pillows to give you a choice. Our room also had a denim covered couch in front of the 27 inch TV. There were enough ESPN and HBO channels to keep my son and daughter happy, plus CNN and all those other channels.  Outside of the bathroom is a large "dressing area" with a vanity and a mirror (great for the ladies makeup, hair dryers, etc.) that includes a large closet with sliding

Maybe after reading all of the glowing reviews my expectations were too high, but from experience during my visit in August I can't rate this Hotel any higher than "average", and if the cost had been as high as it is now I would only rate it  2 out of 5 or "okay". The things I liked were that the desk staff always had a smile, the beds were comfortable and the choice of pillows was nice, and that the kitchen appliances all looked new and were very clean and that the kitchen was well equipped, and that at the time the Hotel was good value for the money.  The things I wasn't happy about included the advertised gym being closed (that gym was one of the reasons we chose the Hotel); the badly stained/dirty looking pool deck;  the not too appealing area surrounding the Hotel -

I spent 4 nights at the Pepper tree in the beginning of August with my husband and 2 year old son. We had been traveling for 2 weeks and had stayed at some very lousy hotels during that time. To come home to a very comfy bed and cool spacious room after a long day at Disney Land (10mins away by the way) I could not of been happier. My toddler had his first swim lessons in the warm pool and loved the turtle fountains squirting into the pool! Everything was clean, plenty of towels, great to have the kitchen available (saved alot of $) Decor was great, felt like something I would live in! Home away from home definately. staff were wonderful and the FREE internet allowed my husband to get in touch with work for the first time on our trip!!!would recomend to anyone who wants save

Summary Heading: Loved it! Would stay there again if ever in the area!
Summary: We arrived at the Pepper Tree (4 of us)on Saturday afternoon August 12, this is after a long drive from Hearst Castle. We were greeted by Maya, and she escorted us to our room. Our room was clean, and had PLENTY of soft pillows. The beds were so soft-we also had a cot(as we have 2 teenage boys), that they let us use at no charge.  I don't know about that other review, it seems to me like that person was looking for the Ritz Carlton, and wants to be waited on.  The restaurant just opened last Wednesday/Thursday August 16/17, unfortunately we didn't get the chance to use it.  The previous reviews are correct, there were many times where we went out for a day, and to our suprise the dishes were done!   We were on the third floor with a view of the pool and the restaurant, we had NO

This hotel is located 15 minutes from Disney and 45 minutes from LAX ($80 taxi ride). The staff are friendly and helpful. After booking online a staff member telephoned me to confirm my booking. The studio apt. was adequate for my family of four. We stayed two nights. The beds were soft and uncomfortable. The stove and refrigerator are new, the kitchen cabinets and benchtop are old but painted in faux finish, it is the first time I've seen a painted countertop. The bathroom also had a old cabinet in faux finish and the tiles were also painted. The airconditioner was noisy and switched on and off every five minutes. The gym was closed. The pool was clean and inviting. It is a querky hotel, we liked it, but would prefer better beds to sleep in.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Style and Value for money!
Summary: Loved our king room and had such a good night's sleep. The beds are so so comfortable and the decorating was wonderful. Disneyland was easy to get to(about 4 miles) and having Ralphs across the road was convenient for preparing packed lunches . This hotel is the best that we have stayed at in terms of style and value for money. The front desk people were just lovely! We will definately be back soon.

My group of four adults stayed at the Hotel Pepper Tree from July 31st to August 5th, 2006. I agree with many of the postings but have a few things to add.  Pros: - We had a twin queen room and it was large enough for four adults. Very spacious rooms with a sitting area infront of the T.V. - Kitchenette was very handy. We usually made breakfast, packed lunches for days at Disneyland or beach and ate out for supper. This saved us a lot of money over the course of a week. -Good location. It is less than a 10 minute drive to Disneyland (even at peak traffic times) and a Ralph's grocery store is across the street. -Beds are quite comfortable and we had no problems with street noise. -Front desk was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. They even provided four Canadians

The Hotel Pepper Tree is a delight. We were a bit concerned after reading some of the reviews but decided to give it a try. We are truly glad we did. We stayed for 6 days and felt like we were at home. The customer service, friendly staff and comfortable suite were awesome. The room was cool and ready when we arrived. We entered our two room suite on the third floor and were impressed. The kitchen has all that you could ask for and more. The refrigerator was big enough to shop just once and have everything on hand for the week.   The beds were comfortable and pillows soft. Bathrooms come complete with plenty of towels. Hair and lotion products are also provided.  Hair dryers and alarm clocks are not so if you are in need of these bring them along as other reviews have indicated.

Summary Heading: Great Friendly Hotel! Nice Stay!  We will be back!
Summary: We stayed at the Hotel Pepper Tree July 22nd thru July 29th. The girl's at the front desk greeted us,and welcomed us with a plesant smile. That was nice after the long drive. The people that work at the front desk, are the best. Mayra is the person that I booked the reservation's from, and she has been the greatest. She went out of her way to make everything perfect. Also, Ric went out of his way too. Whenever you have a problem ,they fix it right away. Unlike other places that we have stayed in. We have season passes, and have been in  a lot of hotels. This hotel is close to Disneyland, unlike what others might have said. It took us 8 min from the hotel to Disneyland Parking garage. Also,  the parking is ten dollars a day. Save your ticket you can come back. We did do that;

When you go to the website is says $79.00 for a kitchen studio all over the website but when you want to make a reservation, they always says that the actual price is $159.00... this is so crazy how can you stay in a hotel that is false adverstising........
Manager Response: I am sorry but we do have king rooms from $79 nightly which go up to $99 in high season. Yes we do have 2 room suites  that can be as high as $159 but then we only have 5 of them? Please contact me personally at the hotel so that  we can further explore your issue.

Summary: We read the reviews and thought we would give it a shot.  Our first obstacle was arriving at 11:00pm at night.  I guess we were the only people who thought it was an obstacle.  The night clerk was waiting with a smile and addressed me as I walked in the door.  I apologized for getting in so late, but she wouldn't hear of it.  She was just happy we made it and that the following nights room change (to a suite) would be ready for us when we returned.  They moved our luggage and fridge items with out a bit of hesitation.  The following night we arrived to our suite at midnight (again a late night arrival).  We opened the door with all of our luggage moved and the fridge full of our items.  I didn't know could get customer service like this in the big city (there service is that of

We stayed at the Hotel Pepper Tree for two days, because it offered a lot of ammenities for travelers and a higher level of luxury for it's moderate price.  The property is well maintained and landscaped, the interior was absolutely stunning. We were amazed that the owners thought of every comfort, even down to the inner hallways that feature a padded carpet delightful to enjoy after a day of heavy walking around Disneyland.  The rooms were spacious and full of small comforts.  From the padded mattresses, to feather pillows and the chairs in front of the television armoire. The room features a full kitchen with all utensils, that allowed us to cook meals in our room.  We also enjoyed the private balcony.  I would definitely stay there again and recommend it for anyone who wants

Summary Heading: Friendly people, adequate hotel, not fancy but comfortable
Summary: As stated in other reviews, you couldn't beat the staff for attentiveness.  Everything we asked for they were able to accomodate.  When we had problems with the air conditioner they were down to fix it.  When we had lights burnt out on the patio, they were there to fix it.  We appreciated their attentiveness very much. The hotel was really adequate for our families as we had two families with 18-22 year old children.  We rented two of the 2 bedroom suites and found that there was more than enough room for privacy and comfort.  We did get a portable extra bed for $10.00 extra per day for our 5th person in one room. The hotel is not fancy.  If you are looking for a 4-5 star place, this is not for you.  They are working hard to upgrade.  But I am not sure why this hotel would be

a great stay at a great hotel.....only complaint i could see was only cleaned rooms every other day.....but when you wanted anything ....soap, towels etc....they had em right there........ when we got ready to leave we couldnt find a couple of my daughters things which she had left rolled up in the bedding, when i went to check out they had them right there at the counter smooooth.....check in was easy too....a weekly rate and a clean hotel...this was a perfect place to stay....across from grocery store to boot 5 minutes from d-land and knottsberry farm     many thanx to rick and staff...........thanx again

Very clean hotel. Super friendly staff. Always helpful with directions to anywhere my family wanted to go. Hotel Pepper Tree has an awesome location. Everything we needed was within a few blocks (Supermarket, Fuel Station, Drug Store, Fast Food, and of course Disneyland is just minutes away, as well as Knotts Berry Farm). Even the Hotel guests were very friendly. We were treated like Royalty. Again the Staff deserves two thumbs up. We will be staying there again very soon. Oh,  I forgot to mention the rates were one of the best in Anaheim. Very affordable for our family of four.

I nearly cancelled my reservation after reading the review posted by one person who was unhappy with the hotel. Thankfully, there was no resemblence between that review and the actual hotel.  We had a studio suite which has two queen beds. It was large, and very comfortable - perfect for a long stay. The decor was Mexican themed and very charming.  Rick at the front desk is an added benefit. He lives on property and is available 24/7 for anything that is needed.   To address some of the things mentioned in the previous scary review: This is not a hotel, per se, which just means that the rooms are not set up like a typical hotel. That does not mean you lack for service. Rick and all of the other staff bend over backwards to make sure you are pleased. I've never had anyone try

Summary Heading: A pleasant surprise - best anaheim deal around
Summary: Basic review: My recent stay at the Peppertree, June 4 - 7 was outstanding. I was a little leery because I had never seen the hotel and I am accustomed to staying directly across the street from Disneyland. First off we came a day earlier than we had planned and stayed in a king bed room on the first floor with a private patio AND a FULL kitchen!!! (This means plates, silverware, stove, cooking utensils, microwave, full sized refrigerator... kit and caboodle!!) There was also an area to sit with comfortable chairs and a small coffee table. It was much more than we had expected and extremely affordable. This room was very comfortable, was quiet (even though it is next to the pool) and was completely clean.  The next day the rest of the family joined us and we moved into a suite.

Hotel Pepper Tree was a great place to stay.  In research for our vacation to California, I tried to read the customer satisfaction reports on all the hotels.  Hotel Pepper Tree was the only one that I could find that was 3 star, moderate rates, and had a 4.8 customer satisfaction report.    Hotel Pepper Tree is located in an older section of Anaheim so some of the buildings/businesses are not as modern as those around the Disney area. Do not let this fact change your mind about staying in Hotel Pepper Tree.  This is just a FYI so that you can expect it.  We was not aware and was a little concerned at first but it was just a short time after arriving that we realized that looks does not mean everything.  The Hotel itself is much nicer on the inside than the outside.  They are in

I booked a week for King Bed studio at this hotel based on the comments of the other reviewers on TripAdvisor, the weekly cost for accommodations, and after thorough review of the website compared to other budget hotels in the area. I was very satisfied in my research and cost comparisons. However upon arrival on the property, I felt like I was deeply mislead and regretted my decision to stay.   -Upon arriving I saw the sign that stated "Furnished Apartments". I thought this was a hotel and felt deceived by the classification on the website. I asked if I could leave early and not be penalized but I was already within the unrefundable timeframe of the cancellation policy. At one point, I was willing to make the sacrifice and check out to stay at another hotel but I didn't go with

We had a group of several families in Anaheim for a youth basketball tournament.  We wanted to stay at a place with lots of room but still affordable.  I had noticed that this was the #2 rated hotel in Anaheim, and now I see why.  Great mix of room, comfort, affordablity, and location.   Upon arrival, the staff was very accomodating and friendly.  We had some people arriving late, and they allowed us to check in for them with a confirming phone call.  He then showed us to our HUGE king double suite.  Did I mention it was HUGE?  Very spacious, with two separate bathrooms.  You have heard the room descriptions from other reviewers, so I won't go into that.  The staff was available when needed, but not intrusive or hovering.   We were able to have a couple of family barbeques

We stayed her for 6 nights recently and I am afraid that it did not live up to the hype on this site.  The hotel looked like a 60's motel that had been given a makeover.  Whilst the rooms are very large they are also quite noisy.  The staff however were excellent, we needed driving instructions to Universal and the Alamo drop off at LAX and they downloaded these for me very quickly off the internet.

Hotel Pepper Tree, Anaheim, CA June 1, 2006 The staff at Hotel Pepper Tree went above and beyond their duty to make my family feel comfortable both before we arrived and while we were there. Going to a big city, where you don't exactly know how to get around in the city, can be scarey, but the caring staff--Mayra and Rick, helped to make us feel like we knew how to navigate in the "big city". The accomodations were wonderful and located conveniently to area businesses.  Thanks, Hotel Pepper Tree, we'll be coming back soon!!  Reviewer: Wisconsinite moving to the "big city"

Summary Heading: What I liked about the Hotel Pepper Tree
Summary: I spent one night at the Pepper Tree Hotel in an Executive King Suite on ground level. There were quite a few things that I really liked about the room I stayed in such as  the attached enclosed patio with fountain and the built-in kitchen area. I also liked the southwest style feel of the room that I stayed in.  Overall, I had a great time at the Pepper Tree Hotel and would definitely consider staying there again.

Summary Heading: Does not meet expectations; over rated
Summary: We spent five nights at Hotel Pepper Tree in early June 06.   We stayed in a two room king suite for a total rate of $123 including taxes.  The rate was comparable to other properties we were considering but we decided on the Pepper Tree because they offered larger rooms and were getting great reviews from other travelers. The two room suite is about 800 square feet according to the hotel and appears to be that large.  The rooms are identical, each having a kitchenette, small bathroom and dressing area.  Inside corriders lead to the room.  Lots of closets and cabinets to store your belongings. We started having problems before we even arrived.  They required a deposit of over $200 to hold the room which I agreed to but they charged the entire amount of $615 to my card instead.

We, meaning 5 adults and 2 small children, stayed at the Hotel Pepper Tree over the Memorial Day weekend. There rates were excellent. Ithought for sure the rate would be extra high because of the holiday weekend. We stayed in a King/Queen sofa bed/Twin room. It was very clean and spacious for the kids to run around. I am a annual passholder at Disneyland and consider this a hidden treasure hotel that offers so much for the small price.  The kitchen was awesome to have. Especially with a Ralph's accross the street. It only took us 5 minutes to get to Disneyland. Go to there website directly to book your stay its cheaper than the other supposedly cheaper sites.

Honesty, I chose this hotel because it was cheap and so highly recommended by other TripAdvisor reviewers. I didn't care about the 5 minute drive to Disneyland or Knott's because I was going to both. We were there for three nights so the kitchen part was a plus.  I loved the fact that Rick called me to confirm my arrival and gave me his personal cell phone number to call him if there were any problems (due to check-in after lobby hours). When we arrived, we ended up having to call him and probably wake him (around 11:30 PM) because our key worked for the front door but not our room. Then he reprogrammed the key and it then worked only for the room and not the front door. No problem, I spoke to the owner when we left for Disneyland  the next morning and he reassured me that he

This hotel actually is best for extended stays for people either vacationing at Disneyland or attending conferences at the convention center who like to take care of themselves, no extra frills. Families proably would need a suite that provides a separate room for the kids and these were all "studios". However, there were serveral families staying there with 1-2 small children and they all looked very happy to me, when I saw them in the small lobby, coming and going. The kitchen facilities were VERY good, with full sized refridgerator and a real stove, sink, and small appliances that allowed me to actually cook meals, not just heat up food. The staff was helpful and friendly and were accomodating each time I made a request.  That said, there is no one at the desk after 9 PM at

We stayed two nights at this hotel while traveling from Las Vegas to San Diego.  The front desk staff were very nice - happy to give directions and check-in was speedy.  The room was a King Suite - with small kitchen, large closet, and private patio with fountain.  We only stayed two nights, so the kitchen wasn't used - but would probably be great for a longer trip.  The bed was very comfy - we found it much more comfortable than the "Sleep Number" bed we had at a Radisson later in the trip.  The room was clean and comfortable - not fancy, but comfy at the end of of a long "Disney" day.  The bathroom was clean, but a little small (towel bar was outside the bathroom in a closet area, single sink area was small).  For two days not a big deal, but I would have been cramped if the

Folks, my boyfriend and I decided to get married spur of the moment and were planning on staying at this hotel anyway since we had a character birthday breakfast to attend at Disneyland. This place is great since they are literally only a hop skip and a jump from the major theme parks. We got married at the Old Santa Ana Court House which is gorgeous by the way. It's easier to marry here than it is in Los Angeles (you can even fill out your marriage license on line and they will married within minutes!). We literally honeymooned here at the hotel and it was wonderful. The staff were great and super friendly, Joey at the front desk was nice enough to help knot my fiance's tie and Rick congratulated us with a bottle of wine. Our room was always clean and extremely confortable.

I think this would be a wonderful place for anyone to stay, and the long term business traveller won't find any better.  I've been here since early January, and it's now May and I can't desribe how "at home" I feel.  Whether I'm enjoying my morning coffee or a cocktail after work, the balcony overlooking the pool is a tranquil place to be.  My room is spacious, and I don't know how I could do without the modern kitchen.  All the essentials are provided from the coffee maker to kitchen sponges.  Rick, the manager, Mark and John the owners, and all the staff help me feel at home.  When you ask any of them for local advice, its not like asking a concierge, but more like asking a family member.    Perhaps the real charm of this place is that if offers wonderful space, without the

WHAT A GREAT PLACE!  The staff is super accomodating and eager to please.  The gentleman that checked us in helped us up to our room with luggage and would not allow us to give him a tip!  The room was perfect - lovely decor and very clean.  Their beds are SOOOO comfy!!  A definite find!

We stayed 5 days at the Pepper Tree Apartments in Anaheim and were very pleased right off the bat.  Whoever is managing the property knows their business.  The staff were friendly and attentive, the rooms clean and everything in working order.   The atmosphere was very relaxing, done in rustic Spanish/Mexican motif of earth tones. Our King room had a  small patios with water fountain and was draped in bouganvilla where the birds sang to us each day.  across the street is a supermarket so getting supplies was easy.  The property is well maintained and the price can't be beat.  Only a hop skip and jump the the major theme parks. I will definitely stay at the Pepper Tree next time I am in the area.

Hotel Pepper Tree is like an oasis in the desert. My mom and I stayed at this hotel last month and were thoroughly impressed with the level of service. The rooms have delightful Spanish-style appointments and the overall decor was quite attractive. The staff members-especially the host named Rick-were very helpful with finding suitable activities for me (and my elderly mother) along with recommending some excellent area restaurants that were their personal favorites. The staff succeeded in making Hotel Pepper Tree "a home away from home" for me. I believe that this hotel would be a wonderful place for all persons- families, business people, couples to come to.

Summary Heading: The Pepper Tree -A Great Place to Stay
Summary: I stayed at the Hotel Pepper Tree while working as a Field Interviewer in the Anaheim and surrounding areas. I can honestly say it is one of the best hotels I have ever had the pleasure to stay in. The Pepper Tree is decorated in beautiful Mexican tile with lovely woodwork throughout the interior. It is accented with quaint Mexican pottery as well as authentic paintings. The rustic light fixtures & wooden antique furniture topped off the Spanish influenced decor which made me feel like I was actually in Mexico. The staff was very courteous and friendly. They helped me find my way in totally unknown neighborhoods through Internet searches. The rooms are very nice with beautiful decor and lovely tile floors. The kitchen is especially accomodating with a standard size refrigerator

Summary Heading: Pleasant place to stay for our Disneyland vacation
Summary: We spent 4 nights in a spacious suite at the Hotel Pepper Tree in February.  (ok so I’m a procrastinator, but at least I'm finally writing the review).  There were some problems due to being newly reopened, but they were dealt with quickly and professionally.  Pros – Inexpensive spacious suite, 2 bathrooms, 2 large closets, comfortable beds, 4 pillows on bed - 2 regular/2 feather, fully-stocked kitchen (medium sized fridge, oven/stove, microwave, coffee maker, pots, pans, silverware and flat ware) was great with grocery across street – saved money not having to eat out every meal, free wireless internet, very friendly helpful staff – printing maps as needed, etc.,  short drive to Disneyland.  Cons – Chilly heated pool (was even too cold for the kids in February).  Thin walls –

Summary Heading: Nice place, reasonable rates, close to Disney
Summary: My wife and I just spent 5 nights at Hotel Pepper Tree in Anaheim.  Nice place and a very short drive to Disney.  We booked our room the old-fashioned way by calling the hotel directly, and I think we got a better deal than what was advertised on Expedia at the time.  The other reviews are accurate, it can get a bit noisy especially if you are on the side of Lincoln Ave, although we had no problems getting a good night's sleep.  The room itself was very spacious, clean, and the appliances were all new.  Having a Ralph's grocery store across the street was great, we saved a lot on money on food and drinks on this trip!  There is not a whole lot else going on in the area, it is mainly residential and small businesses, so you definately want to have a car (no problem with parking

Just got home from sunny California and wanted to write a quick review of our stay at The Hotel Pepper Tree.  What a nice surprise to find such a quaint and charming hotel tucked away in a residential neighborhood.  This hotel has all the conveniences and is very large.  With a full service kitchen, my family and I were able to eat some meals in  which helped our budget considerably.  The rooms were very spacious, clean and comfortable.  The beds almost feel like sleeping on a cloud. The environment was quiet and peaceful, no loud noises and the the staff at the hotel are an exceptional bunch of people....very professional, caring and always willing to help out with any issues.  They are a wealth of information about the local attractions such as Disneyland and Knott's Berry

we just got back from a trip to Disneyland and we stayed at the recommended Peppertree Hotel. This was a terrific choice for our family of four. We stayed in a suite and had swims in the heated pool and used the gym each day after the long walking around Disneyland. We were also able to make our lunch to take with us as they have kitchens in each room. My children loved the staff and the hotel was new, very clean and very close to everything. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting value for their American dollar.

we had a great stay at the Peppertree hotel in Anaheim and would be staying there again if we ever get back to Disneyland from Australia. The staff were so helpful and the room was spacious and decorated in a Spanish theme. A kitchen with full size stove was a great help and my wife loved to make lunch for us all each day from the supermarket across the road. I loved the pool for a swim each afternoon as it seemed to get the sun all day. a Definate A plus for this new hotel.

Summary Heading: Fairly decent hotel for the money.
Summary: Our family stayed at this hotel for 4 days, the first part of April this year.  It is located just a short drive to Disneyland parks.  It is not really by any other hotels.  This 1970s hotel looks to have been remodeled in a Mexican style.  They really did a nice job.    They restaurant in the parking lot is closed, don't know why.  They pool is pretty decent.  The parking lot is unsecure, but has lighting.  We had no problem at all with the parking.  They representatives were very helpful and knowledgeable for the area.  I guess you would call this a boutique hotel in a small way.    The only issues were the bathroom floors were dirty and unswept.  We had to let our children step on them from a bath.  The large slider doors to the balconeys are original.  In fact, ours didn't
